kbs.name: Lucien Lachance
kbs.description: an assassin, giving quest via "Dead Drop Orders #6"

kbs.name: a small campsite, on the summit of Gnoll Mountain
kbs.description: a small campsite, on the summit of Gnoll Mountain

kbs.name: Alval Uvani
relations: a small campsite, on the summit of Gnoll Mountain

kbs.name: Havilstein Hoar-Blood
kbs.description: a male Nord barbarian, lives alone and exposed
relations: a small campsite, on the summit of Gnoll Mountain

plots: "Dead Drop Orders #6" is addressed toward Silencer
Silencer assassinated Alval Uvani like all the others
Havilstein Hoar-Blood savagely butchered the chieftain of a mead hall on Solstheim
in the flooded section of Nornal, Silencer will find a chest submerged in the water: the chest contains contains Silencer's reward for killing Havilstein Hoar-Blood, and Silencer's next contract

quest.title: The Coldest Sleep
quest.objective: receive Silencer's next contract after killing Havilstein Hoar-Blood
tasks: Make your way to a small campsite, on the summit of Gnoll Mountain.
assassinate Havilstein Hoar-Blood
receive Silencer's next contract after killing Havilstein Hoar-Blood
quest.description:
Dead Drop Orders #6
by Lucien Lachance

Alval Uvani is dead, just like all the others. You continue to impress me, Silencer, and I am only too eager to indulge your homicidal instincts.
Your next target is a savage Nord barbarian, living alone and exposed at a small campsite on the summit of Gnoll Mountain. This barbarian, Havilstein Hoar-Blood by name, savagely butchered the chieftain of a mead hall on the island of Solstheim. The chieftain's sister has forgone the Nord custom of extracting the monetary retribution of wergild, and instead wants Hoar-Blood to pay with his life. You, dear Silencer, will help put her family at peace.
You are to go to Gnoll Mountain, locate Havilstein Hoar-Blood, and send his soul to the great beyond.
When Hoar-Blood has been executed, journey to the ancient ruin of Nornal. In the flooded section of that ruin you will find a chest, submerged in the water. As you may have guessed, the chest contains your reward for killing Havilstein Hoar-Blood, 500 gold, and your next contract.

plots: the player told Shum gro-Yarug that they want to buy a house
Rosethorn Hall is currently occupied by Vandorallen Trebatius
Shum gro-Yarug will have Vandorallen Trebatius evicted from Rosethorn Hall

quest.title: Buying a House in Skingrad
quest.objective: purchase Rosethorn Hall
tasks: give 25,000 septims to Shum gro-Yarug
purchase Rosethorn Hall
quest.description:
I'm Shum gro-Yarug, the Count's butler.
So you want to buy a house? I can speak for the Count. Rosethorn Hall is a stately manor currently occupied by Vandorallen Trebatius. You won't find a better property for sale in Skingrad. It's just inside the main gate, near the bridge to the chapel.
The house costs 25,000 septims. Give me the septims, and I will order the deed to the house drawn up.
Don't worry about Vandorallen Trebatius. I'll have him evicted. I'm sure he'll find another home easily.

kbs.name: Countess Valga
kbs.description: a female noble ruling over Chorrol

plots: the last tenant of Arborwatch has cleaned the place of furniture
Seed-Neeus should have furniture for sale

quest.title: Buying a house in Chorrol
quest.objective: purchase Arborwatch
tasks: give 20,000 gold to Countess Valga
purchase Arborwatch
quest.description:
It is a pleasure to meet you. I am Countess Valga of Chorrol.
Are you looking for a house to buy? There is a positively gorgeous home for sale right on the main plaza. You'll be hard pressed to find a nicer home for sale in Chorrol.
The house is called Arborwatch, and it costs 20,000 gold to buy the house from me. It would be a pleasure to have you become a citizen of Chorrol.
The last tenant of Arborwatch has cleaned the place of furniture. I'd recommend stopping by Northern Goods and Trade. The owner, Seed-Neeus, should have everything you need.

kbs.name: Falcar
kbs.description: a rude mage from the mages' guild

plots: the player is an Associate of the mages' guild
another Associate tossed the Ring of Burden down the locked well behind the guild hall

quest.title: Falcar's Recommendation
quest.objective: retrieve the Ring of Burden for Falcar
tasks: get the key to the locked well from Deetsan
retrieve the Ring of Burden for Falcar
quest.description:
What is it, Associate? Don't tell me you're here for a recommendation from me.
There was a particular Ring of Burden I was testing some time ago. Another stupid Associate somehow got his hands on it, and managed to misplace it. If I didn't know better, I'd say he purposely tossed it down the well behind the guild hall. Why he would do such a thing is beyond me.
You will retrieve this ring for me. Should you manage to do so, I shall consider sending a recommendation to the Arcane University.
The well is locked, so you'll need the key. Deetsan should have a copy of it. Now get moving.

kbs.name: Aleron Loche
kbs.description: Ursanne's missing husband who developed a gambling addiction

plots: Aleron Loche wasted Ursanne and his hard earned money on bets: Aleron Loche wanted to move him and Ursanne to the Imperial City
Aleron Loche borrowed money from Kurdan gro-Dragol: Aleron Loche owes Kurdan gro-Dragol 500 gold
Aleron Loche did not return home after meeting Kurdan gro-Dragol at the Lonely Suitor Lodge yesterday

quest.title: Caught in the Hunt
quest.objective: find Aleron Loche
tasks: Reach Lonely Suitor Lodge.
speak with Kurdan gro-Dragol
find Aleron Loche
quest.description:
I'm Ursanne. I'm sorry to impose upon you like this, but I'm in need of assistance, and I don't know what to do. My husband, Aleron, is missing.
It all started when Aleron became foolish, and started gambling. He'd visit the arena every week and spend our hard earned money on bets. I told him to stop, but he didn't listen. He was certain he could win us a fortune and move us somewhere nicer, like the Imperial City. It didn't take long for Aleron to begin losing. He resorted to borrowing money from a usurer to cover his losses and place new bets. As you can imagine, it didn't pay off. He ended up owing around 500 gold. We could never have that kind of money to pay back the usurer.
Yesterday, the usurer, Kurdan gro-Dragol, sent for my husband to meet him at the Lonely Suitor Lodge. He hasn't returned since. I fear for his life. Kurdan isn't known for his patience. Please, I'm not wealthy, but I'd give anything to see Aleron again. Please, find Aleron.
Farewell, and be careful, Kurdan is not to be trusted.

kbs.name: a painting
kbs.description: a stolen painting depicting Count Valga

plots: someone stole a painting from Countess Arriana Valga's bedchamber: do not accuse the wrong person
Countess Arriana Valga gives the player some keys that allow the player access to many of the restricted areas in Castle Chorrol

quest.title: Canvas the Castle
quest.objective: recover a painting, and bring the culprit to justice
tasks: gather clues about the identity of the culprit
recover a painting, and bring the culprit to justice
quest.description:
I am Countess Arriana Valga of Chorrol. I wish I had time to chat, but I'm afraid I am in the middle of an investigation.
You seem the trusting type. Perhaps you can assist me? It seems someone has taken away an heirloom that is quite dear to me. I want you to help me recover a stolen painting. The painting was of my lost love, the Count Valga, and it has been stolen from my bedchamber. If you find the painting, and bring the culprit to justice, you shall be justly rewarded.
I suggest you begin to gather clues. And I warn you: do not accuse the wrong person, or I shall be quite cross with you. Here are some keys. They should allow you access to many of the restricted areas in Castle Chorrol.

plots: the player told Regulus Terentius that they are looking to buy a house in Bravil
Nilawen sells furnishings

quest.title: Buying a house in Bravil
quest.objective: purchase the house in Bravil
tasks: pay 4,000 gold to Regulus Terentius
purchase the house in Bravil
quest.description:
Regulus Terentius, Count of Bravil. So you're looking for a house to buy here in Bravil? Really?
It just so happens there is a modest shack overlooking the canal. It's not much to look at, but the smell will soon make you forget how ugly it is. Pay me 4,000 gold, and it's all yours.
I'll have my steward register the deed of ownership. It's squalid little shack, I'm sorry to say. Oh, and the place is fairly bare. If I were you, I'd head on over to Nilawen at The Fair Deal and get some furnishings. Or you could always eat off the floor... doesn't matter to me.

kbs.name: Clavicus Vile
kbs.description: the prince of trickery and bargains, one of Daedric Princes

kbs.name: Umbra the Hero
kbs.description: a hero who had dealings with Clavicus Vile

plots: Umbra the Sword contains the soul of Umbra the Hero

quest.title: Clavicus Vile's Lost Sword
quest.objective: retrieve Umbra the Sword for Clavicus Vile
tasks: Find your way to Pell's Gate.
begin your search for Umbra the Sword
retrieve Umbra the Sword for Clavicus Vile
quest.description:
A mortal! Wonderful. Always a pleasure. I'm Clavicus Vile, the Prince of Trickery and Bargains.
Perhaps you'll do a service for me, mortal. And I'll reward you. A fair bargain, don't you think? You will retrieve for me a sword, a very special sword. It contains the soul of Umbra the Hero, a hero I have had dealings with in the past.
Bring the sword to me, and I'll reward you with my Masque. You'll not find a better bargain, mortal. Begin your search in Pell's Gate.

kbs.name: Three Brothers Trade Goods
kbs.description: a store in the Market District

plots: the player told Vinicia Melissaeia that they want to buy a house in the Imperial City
Sergius Verus can sell the player some furnishings for the house

quest.title: Shack for Sale
quest.objective: purchase the house in the Imperial City
tasks: give Vinicia Melissaeia 2,000 septims
purchase the house in the Imperial City
quest.description:
Vinicia Melissaeia, Office of Imperial Commerce. You desire a house in the Imperial City?
Why? I mean... of course. All I have available right now is a hovel on the Waterfront. It's yours for mere 2,000 septims. You may give those septims to me.
You'll find the house in the Waterfront District. It's not much to look at. You may want to spruce it up a bit with some furnishings. I'd suggest talking to Sergius Verus at Three Brothers Trade Goods in the Market District.

plots: Suurootan can acquire furnishings for the house

quest.title: Bruma House for Sale
quest.objective: purchase the house in Bruma
tasks: give Lady Narina Carvain 10,000 gold
purchase the house in Bruma
quest.description:
Lady Narina Carvain, Countess of Bruma. Welcome.
I've been looking for just the right owner for a special home I have. It's a quaint little house conveniently located just off the main gate. I'll sell it to you for 10,000 gold.
I've had a look at the place myself, and it could use some furnishings inside. Quite barren in there I'm afraid. I'm fairly certain that Suurootan at Novaroma here in Bruma can acquire the things you'll need to make it look like home.

kbs.name: Bhisha the Khajiit
kbs.description: a male beggar, and a humanoid cat

plots: Bhisha the Khajiit follows Ushnar gro-Shadborgob everywhere

quest.title: Ushnar's Terror
quest.objective: stop Bhisha the Khajiit from tailing Ushnar gro-Shadborgob
tasks: make Bhisha the Khajiit go away for good
stop Bhisha the Khajiit from tailing Ushnar gro-Shadborgob
quest.description:
That cat beggar Bhisha the Khajiit is following me! He's going to eat me, I just know it. Don't look! He's standing right over there.
You haven't seen that filthy cat beggar have you? He's still around. I've seen him skulking like the filthy cat he is.
Isn't he scary? I wish someone would just make him disappear. I would do just about anything for you if you make him go away. Permanently. For good. Never to be seen again.
You need a dog. I happen to have one of my old ones still lying around. I'll send it to you after you get rid of the filthy cat man.

kbs.name: Sheogorath
kbs.description: the prince of madness, one of the Daedric Princes

kbs.name: New Sheoth
kbs.description: the capital city of Sheogorath's realm

kbs.name: Haskill
kbs.description: Sheogorath's Chamberlain who knows a lot

plots: Sheogorath gives the player summon Haskill spell for their previous services
the Duke of Mania and the Duchess of Dementia show the player what New Sheoth truly is
once the player understands what Sheogorath's Realm is, the player might understand why it's important to keep it intact

quest.title: Understanding Madness
quest.objective: meet the Duke of Mania and the Duchess of Dementia, and join their courts
tasks: Reach Sheogorath's Palace.
seek out the Duke of Mania and the Duchess of Dementia
meet the Duke of Mania and the Duchess of Dementia, and join their courts
quest.description:
I'm Sheogorath, Prince of Madness. And other things. I'm not talking about them. As you should know by now.
You've run a maze like a good little rat, but no cheese for you yet. Well, maybe a little. I've granted you a new spell - the ability to summon Haskill, my Chamberlain, to aid you in your travels. He knows a lot. More than he knows.
Now we're going to give you a taste of where you have found yourself. You're going to learn. Two halves, two rulers, two places within my palace. Meet and greet. Do what they will, so you know what they're about.
The Duke of Mania and the Duchess of Dementia. Seek them out, and let them show you what New Sheoth is. You might be surprised. Once you understand what My Realm is, you might understand why it's important to keep it intact. And maybe you'll make some friends along the way. That's always nice!

kbs.name: Graman gro-Marad
kbs.description: the Bloated Float's bouncer and helmsman

kbs.name: Bloated Float
kbs.description: a ship turned into an inn

kbs.name: Ormil
kbs.description: the man who owns the Bloated Float

plots: the player freed Graman gro-Marad from a storage room
not long ago, the Blackwater Brigands stormed the Bloated Float: the Blackwater Brigands took Graman gro-Marad and Ormil hostage and and put the Bloated Float to the sea

quest.title: An Unexpected Voyage
quest.objective: clear a safe path to the top deck for Graman gro-Marad
tasks: kill the Blackwater Brigands
clear a safe path to the top deck for Graman gro-Marad
quest.description:
About time someone showed up. Thank you for freeing me. I'm Graman gro-Marad, the Bloated Float's bouncer and helmsman.
I've been locked in that storage room for hours. I don't know exactly what's going on, but not long ago, a gang of thieves calling themselves The Blackwater Brigands stormed the ship. They took myself and Ormil, the Bloated Float's owner, hostage and put the ship to sea. I have no idea what they're after. If you can get me safely to the top deck, I can steer the Float home. But I'm not budging until the coast is clear. I'm used to dealing with drunken louts, not a gang of well-armed thieves.
Good luck... you'll need it.

kbs.name: Pyke
kbs.description: a polite former Knight of the Thorn from Cyrodiil

kbs.name: gold medallion
kbs.description: a small, round gold medallion, with an inscription "To Pyke, from Farwil" on the back

plots: Pyke made his way to the Shivering Isles as soon as he heard the gates to the Shivering Isles open
Pyke will mark the Fetid Grove on the player's map

quest.title: To Help A Hero
quest.objective: bring Pyke's gold medallion back to him
tasks: Make your way to Fetid Grove.
retrieve Pyke's gold medallion from Grummites
bring Pyke's gold medallion back to him
quest.description:
It's good to meet you. The name's Pyke, and I welcome you to my humble home. Please, make yourself comfortable.
Since you're here, I was wondering... do you think you could assist me? I'm having a bit of a crisis.
I was a Knight of the Thorn from Cyrodiil. As soon as I heard the gates to the Shivering Isles opened, I knew a threat was lurking inside. I made my way here and began exploring this strange place. As I was passing Fetid Grove, I was waylaid. Some dastardly Grummites stole my most prized possession... my medallion that signified my membership in the Knights. It's a small, round, gold medallion. On the back is the inscription "To Pyke, from Farwil".
Could you bring back my medallion from the Grummites at Fetid Grove? I will mark Fetid Grove on your map. You could have Thorn Shield as a reward. Good luck to you, friend!

kbs.name: Underpall Cave
kbs.description: not a cave - a buried keep hosting Sir Berich's tomb

plots: the player is a holy knight
Sir Roderic is dead: he was questing for the holy Relics at the Prophet's call with Lathon

Sir Roderic prayed at all the shrines, and received a disturbing vision featuring Sir Berich: Sir Berich had found the Greaves of the Crusader and the Sword of the Crusader, but had then turned to evil
Sir Roderic found the Relics and the wraith of Sir Berich within Sir Berich's tomb: Sir Roderic shouted for Lathon to take the Greaves of the Crusader
Lathon gives the player the Greaves of the Crusader
the wraith of Sir Berich attacked Sir Roderic with the Sword of the Crusader

quest.title: The Sword of the Crusader
quest.objective: avenge Sir Roderic, and recover the Sword of the Crusader for yourself
tasks: Make your way to Underpall Cave.
find the the wraith of Sir Berich
avenge Sir Roderic, and recover the Sword of the Crusader for yourself
quest.description:
Sir knight! I have terrible news. Sir Roderic... I think he's dead.
Sir Roderic was a holy knight, like you, questing for the Relics at the Prophet's call. I, Lathon, was his squire. I believed he was chosen by the gods to reclaim the Relics. At first things were going well. He prayed at all the shrines, and received a vision. A disturbing vision. "The shade of Sir Berich spoke to me," was all he said. "We must put him to rest." He said that Sir Berich's tomb was in Underpall Cave -- which is no cave, but some kind of buried keep.
He had learned that Sir Berich had once been a questing knight, like us. He had found the Greaves and Sword of the Crusader, but then turned to evil. Sir Roderic hoped to find the Relics within Sir Berich's tomb. And he did. But we also found a terrible guardian -- the wraith of Sir Berich.
I brought you... Sir Roderic shouted for me to take them... the Greaves of the Crusader. The holy Relic. They're yours. The wraith used the Sword of the Crusader against Sir Roderic. I don't know how that evil thing could use the holy weapon, but it did.
You must avenge Sir Roderic by killing the foul wraith and get yourself the Sword of the Crusader!

kbs.name: Pelinal Whitestrake
kbs.description: the ghost of a legendary knight

kbs.name: Vanua
kbs.description: the site of Pelinal Whitestrake's death, where the Ayleid tormented him in a final act of revenge

kbs.name: Umaril the Accursed
kbs.description: an old enemy of Pelinal Whitestrake, and a male Ayleid elf

plots: the player is a knight
the player's prayers have woken Pelinal Whitestrake from death
Umaril the Accursed found a way back to life
Pelinal Whitestrake's friends built a shrine upon Vanua: Pelinal Whitestrake can show the player where Vanua once stood

quest.title: The Shrine of the Crusader
quest.objective: seek Pelinal Whitestrake's Relics, and destroy Umaril the Accursed
tasks: Go to Vanua.
visit the shrine of Pelinal Whitestrake
seek Pelinal Whitestrake's Relics, and destroy Umaril the Accursed
quest.description:
Hail knight! I am Pelinal Whitestrake, whose Relics you seek with a worthy heart!
Your prayers have woken me from my endless dream. Or perhaps you have entered my dream, and I still sleep. I think others have sometimes spoken to me, others like you, but my memory is doubtful. Perhaps the others came after you. Your need must be great for the gods to allow us to speak. Has Umaril the Accursed found a way back? The foulest of a foul race. A thousand curses upon his unholy name!
I thought I'd won. But I should have known. The Slavemasters are a cunning breed. Umaril found a way to cheat death, as I could not. If you would seek for my Relics, I know little that can help you. All that has passed since my death is like mist that my mind cannot take hold of. My friends built a shrine upon the site of my death, Vanua, where the Ayleid Elves tormented me in a final act of revenge. I can show you where it once stood. Perhaps it is there still.
Fare thee well, sir knight. May the gods grant you to destroy Umaril utterly, as I failed to do.

kbs.name: Pelinal Whitestrake
kbs.description: the legendary male knight who killed Umaril the Unfeathered once before

plots: the player is an embodiment of Pelinal Whitestrake
Umaril the Unfeathered's Daedric nature allows his spirit to escape into Oblivion after death

quest.title: Umaril the Unfeathered
quest.objective: defeat Umaril the Unfeathered and kill him for good, in both the physical and spiritual planes
tasks: Arrive at Garlas Malatar.
find Umaril the Unfeathered
defeat Umaril the Unfeathered and kill him for good, in both the physical and spiritual planes
quest.description:
Hear my final passings of praise and wisdom!
You have stepped from the humble shadows of obscurity and into legend. No feat you have accomplished in your life compares to what you have become. You are an embodiment of Pelinal Whitestrake, the bane of Umaril the Unfeathered.
The time has come for you to fulfill your destiny. Umaril lies hid in the ancient fane of Garlas Malatar. You must go there and destroy him. Umaril's Daedric nature allows his spirit to escape into Oblivion after death. This is what Pelinal learned upon defeating Umaril the first time. You must first kill his living body. While beyond the power of most mortals, this is only the lesser of your two tasks. It will allow you to follow Umaril into the spirit realm upon his death. It will allow you to destroy him, body and soul, utterly and for all time.

plots: Mirili Ulven gives the player a list of plants she needs

quest.title: Taxonomy of Obsession
quest.objective: help Mirili Ulven finish her research
tasks: find plants for Mirili Ulven
help Mirili Ulven finish her research
quest.description:
I am Mirili Ulven, a botanist.
You're offering to help me with my research? Well... I suppose I could find a use for you, despite your lack of training. Collect some plants for me, will you?
Here's the list of things I need. Get me everything on it. Try to remember where you found it so you can tell me. It's important.
I will pay you 10 gold coins for each sample.

kbs.name: Sheogorath
kbs.description: the Prince of Madness and the Lord of the Never-There, one of the Daedric Princes

kbs.name: Gatekeeper
kbs.description: a creature that guards the Gates of Madness

plots: the Shivering Isles lie through the door behind Haskill
Sheogorath seeks a mortal to act as his Champion
the Gatekeeper dislikes strangers to the Shivering Isles

quest.title: Through the Fringe of Madness
quest.objective: become Sheogorath's champion
tasks: get past the Gates of Madness
become Sheogorath's champion
quest.description:
I am Haskill, Chamberlain to the Lord Sheogorath.
You approach the Shivering Isles. Through the door behind me lies the realm of Sheogorath, Prince of Madness, Lord of the Never-There.
My Lord seeks a mortal to act as His Champion. Perhaps the Lord Sheogorath will find a use for you. You'll want to pass through the Gates of Madness. Oh, and mind the Gatekeeper. He dislikes strangers to the Realm.

kbs.name: Fort Bulwark
kbs.description: a fort in the southeast of Cyrodiil, near the Black Marsh border

plots: the knight Order Sir Henrik belonged to crumbled: Sir Henrik found the Shield of the Crusader on his own and brought it to Fort Bulwark
Sir Henrik and his trusted friends began work to keep the Shield of the Crusader safe forever
Sir Henrik died defending the Shield of the Crusader at Fort Bulwark

quest.title: Wisdom of the Ages
quest.objective: get the Shield of the Crusader for yourself
tasks: Head to Fort Bulwark.
find the Shield of the Crusader
get the Shield of the Crusader for yourself
quest.description:
In life, I was known as Sir Henrik.
If you are true to the teachings of Julianos, it may be possible for you to find the Shield of the Crusader.
When the Order crumbled, I set out on my own. After years of searching, I found the Shield and brought it to Fort Bulwark for safe keeping. With the help of a few trusted friends, I began work to keep the Shield safe for all eternity. I never saw my work finished. I died defending the fort from those who would take and misuse the Shield. I never saw our work finished; I trust that the others carried on without me.
The fort lies in the southeast of Cyrodiil, near the Black Marsh border. If all went according to plan, it should be very well guarded now.

kbs.name: Rythe
kbs.description: Tivela Lythandas' husband, and one of the best painters in all Cyrodiil

plots: Rythe makes lifelike paintings about the Great Forest
Rythe keeps his studio locked: he did not come out of his studio for a full day
Tivela Lythandas unlocked the studio with the key Rythe said to use only in emergencies: Rythe was not inside his studio
Tivela Lythandas gives the player the key to Rythe's studio
Tivela Lythandas will be around the house should the player need her

quest.title: A Brush with Death
quest.objective: help Tivela Lythandas find her husband who has gone missing
tasks: Proceed to Rythe's painting studio.
find clues about Rythe's whereabouts
help Tivela Lythandas find her husband who has gone missing
quest.description:
I'm Tivela Lythandas. I apologize that I can't give you the respect a guest in my home would normally receive, but I am at my wit's end. I am sorry to be so forward, but I desperately need your help. It seems that my husband, Rythe, has gone missing, and I just don't know what to do.
Rythe is known far and wide as one of the best painters in all Cyrodiil. His specialty is setting the Great Forest to canvas. The paintings look so amazingly real that some say they can see the trees sway in the breeze. That's a silly notion of course, but it just goes to show the attention to detail Rythe uses when he paints.
Rythe likes to work in his studio with the door locked, so no one can disturb him. He usually comes out to eat dinner and sleep, but two days ago, he didn't come out at all. At first, I wasn't worried. He does that occasionally. But when he didn't come out for a full day, I unlocked the studio with the key he said to use only in emergencies. It turned out he wasn't inside! I'm sure he never left that room. So I have no idea where he's gone.
Please. Help me find Rythe. I love him dearly, and I am so worried. Here's the key to Rythe's studio. You may come and go as you please. If you need me, I'll be around the house.

kbs.name: Shrine of Kynareth
kbs.description: west of the Imperial City, on the edge of the Great Forest

plots: Sir Juncan died while seeking out the Boots of the Crusader

quest.title: Nature's Fury
quest.objective: retrieve the Boots of the Crusader for yourself
tasks: Arrive at Shrine of Kynareth.
talk to the priests of Kynareth
retrieve the Boots of the Crusader for yourself
quest.description:
My name was Sir Juncan.
I wish to see you succeed where I failed. I was on the path to the Boots of the Crusader, but died before I reached them.
I cannot tell you exactly how to find the Boots, for that will be up to Kynareth. I can tell you to seek out her Priests, though. West of the Imperial City, on the edge of the Great Forest, is a shrine. You will find them there, and they will tell you what you need to know.

kbs.name: Sir Ralvas
relations: a shrine to Saint Kaladas, below the Chapel of Zenithar in Leyawiin

kbs.name: a shrine to Saint Kaladas, below the Chapel of Zenithar in Leyawiin
kbs.description: a shrine to Saint Kaladas, below the Chapel of Zenithar in Leyawiin

kbs.name: Zenithar
kbs.description: the god of work and commerce, one of the Nine
relations: a shrine to Saint Kaladas, below the Chapel of Zenithar in Leyawiin

kbs.name: Saint Kaladas
relations: a shrine to Saint Kaladas, below the Chapel of Zenithar in Leyawiin

plots: the player has passed the gauntlet unlike others in three hundred years: the player can redeem the souls of the ghost knights and restore their order
Sir Ralvas placed his own will and lust for fame over the will of the Nine
Sir Ralvas failed the challenge of Zenithar: the inscription for the challenge says to "walk in the faith"
the player must pray at the shrine of Saint Kaladas to receive a vision: the player will see the Mace of Zenithar, separated from them by a great chasm
Sir Ralvas fell from the platform each time he tried to cross the chasm

quest.title: The Path of the Righteous
quest.objective: retrieve the Mace of Zenithar for yourself
tasks: Travel to a shrine to Saint Kaladas, below the Chapel of Zenithar in Leyawiin.
complete the challenge of Zenithar
retrieve the Mace of Zenithar for yourself
quest.description:
You have my, Sir Ralvas', tribute, sir knight. In three hundred years, none have passed the gauntlet. In three hundred years, we have never known hope. But for the first time, it seems that someone may succeed where we have failed. I see in you the chance to redeem our souls and restore the order. And now, I must ask you to press forward where I could not. I must ask you to face the challenge of Zenithar.
I was arrogant and foolhardy. I sought personal glory. I placed my own will and my own lust for fame over the will of the Nine. In facing the challenge of Zenithar, I failed. I tried dozens -- no, hundreds of times to reach the Mace. I fell each time. And each time I awoke in the chapel, I leaped again. I tried to enlist the help of the other knights, but none would come to my aid. The inscription says to "walk in the faith" but even now, I do not know what this means.
Below the Chapel of Zenithar in Leyawiin there is a shrine to the great craftsman, Saint Kaladas. Those seeking the Mace must pray before the shrine. When you bow, you will receive a vision -- or perhaps not. It is unclear. The priests saw that my body never moved, but it felt so real. You will see the Mace of Zenithar, separated from you by a great chasm. The chasm represents your doubt. Your faith must be your guide across it.
This is what I know. As I said, my faith was weak. I did not understand the test and I fell from the platform each time I tried to cross. I have told you all that I know. All that is left is for you to prove yourself more worthy than I. If you seek the Mace, travel to Leyawiin's chapel, kneel at the shrine in the undercroft, and let your faith in the Nine be the salvation of us all.

kbs.name: Knights of the Nine
kbs.description: ghost knights, followers of the Nine

plots: the Knights of the Nine failed to uphold their knightly vows in life: they uphold them in death and do not let unworthy souls take the Cuirass of the Crusader

quest.title: Priory of the Nine
quest.objective: retrieve the Cuirass of the Crusader for yourself
tasks: defeat the ghosts of the Knights of the Nine in honorable combat
retrieve the Cuirass of the Crusader for yourself
quest.description:
By the strength and guidance of the Nine, who comes before us upon this sacred ground seeking the Cuirass of the Divine Crusader?
Step forward, adventurer, and face us, the Knights of the Nine, each in honorable combat. For the vows we failed to revere in life, we shall uphold in death. No unworthy soul shall lay hands upon this sacred artifact without the leave of the Knights of the Nine.

kbs.name: ruins of Fort Caractacus
kbs.description: just to the southeast of Aleswell, the path down the hill

plots: all citizens of Aleswell became invisible several weeks ago: the citizens of Aleswell think that Ancotar is behind their invisibility
there are invisible monsters in the ruins of Fort Caractacus

quest.title: Zero Visibility
quest.objective: help the citizens of Aleswell become visible again
tasks: Proceed to ruins of Fort Caractacus.
find Ancotar and make him remove the invisibility
help the citizens of Aleswell become visible again
quest.description:
Excuse me. I'm innkeeper Diram Serethi. We have a small problem that we hope you can help us with.
You may be wondering why you can't see me. We are all wondering the same thing. Everyone in Aleswell suddenly became invisible several weeks ago. It was sort of fun at first, but the novelty has definitely worn off now. You can imagine how difficult it is to run an inn while invisible. Once you get a reputation as a haunted inn, you can just forget about it. So we've all been keeping quiet, hoping the spell will wear off. But we're running out of patience. We're sure it was Ancotar's doing, but we can't find him. If you can help us, we will be extremely grateful.
Ancotar's a wizard who took up residence in the ruins of Fort Caractacus a couple of years ago. He's caused us no end of trouble with his magical experiments, but nothing as bad as this. We've tried to find him, but had no luck. If he's still living in the fort, he's hiding from us, and no wonder. If you could find him and get him to remove this cursed invisibility, we will all be in your debt. The ruined fort is just to the southeast of here. Follow the path down the hill. But watch out for the invisible monsters that infest the ruins!
If you make us visible again, you'd be welcome at the Aleswell Inn anytime. Free of charge.

kbs.name: Pelinal Whitestrake
kbs.description: a legendary male knight of old

plots: knights who wished to quest for the holy relics of Pelinal Whitestrake would walk the Pilgrim's Way: the player should pray to each of the gods in turn, and ask their favor upon the player's quest

quest.title: Pilgrimage
quest.objective: show that you are a worthy knight to seek out the holy relics of Pelinal Whitestrake
tasks: Find your way to Wayshrines of the Nine Divines.
complete the Pilgrimage of the Nine Divines
show that you are a worthy knight to seek out the holy relics of Pelinal Whitestrake
quest.description:
Oh my. To what do I owe this honor? I am but a humble prophet. What business do you have with me?
You would quest for the holy panoply of Pelinal Whitestrake? The legendary Relics that have been sought by mighty warriors throughout the ages? Are you a worthy knight?
The gods grant insight to those they deem worthy. Why and how they act is not predictable. What I can tell you is that traditionally, knights who wished to quest for the Relics would walk the Pilgrim's Way.
Travel to the Wayshrines of the Nine Divines. Pray to each of the gods in turn, and ask their favor upon your quest.

kbs.name: Rosentia Gallenus
kbs.description: a collector of arcane artifacts, who carries a Daedric Staff

plots: Rosentia Gallenus bought a cheap Daedric Staff: four scamps appeared after Rosentia Gallenus spoke the runic word carved on the Daedric Staff while holding it
the four scamps follow Rosentia Gallenus everywhere
Rosentia Gallenus can't compel herself to let go of the Daedric Staff

quest.title: Whom Gods Annoy
quest.objective: make the scamps go away from Rosentia Gallenus' home
tasks: Go to Darkfathom Cave.
dispose of the Daedric Staff
make the scamps go away from Rosentia Gallenus' home
quest.description:
These stupid scamps are driving me crazy! I'm at my wit's end! I, Rosentia Gallenus, beg you to help me!
The beastly little creatures are nasty, smelly, noisy and wrecking my beautiful house! I must be rid of them! I can't let people know I have scamps in here, or they'll think I've taken to Daedra worship. Try explaining that to the town guard.
I had a feeling buying that Daedric Staff would be trouble. Now I'm paying for it with more than just some gold. A few weeks ago, a spellsword was passing through Leyawiin and heard that I like to buy curiosities. He wanted to sell the staff you see me carrying. I eagerly bought it, knowing the value of Daedric relics. In fact, I was a bit suspicious when he sold it so cheap. His loss, my gain I figured. After examining it for a bit I noticed a small word carved on it in runes. Using a book from my library, I translated it. The word was nonsense. However, when I spoke it and held the staff, four scamps suddenly appeared! I thought I was done for! Strangely, they all just stood there. It didn't take long before I realized they were following me! I couldn't be seen in town with scamps following, so I decided to discard the staff. I can't explain it, but somehow I can't compel myself to actually let it go. This staff is obviously cursed! Now I'm stuck with it.
Oh please, I beg you! Take this staff to Darkfathom Cave and get rid of it and the scamps forever! I can't fight, and who knows what's guarding the shrine? Plus, do you know how dirty caves are? It'll ruin anything I wear!
Do this for me, and I'll reward you with another one of my curios I picked up a few years ago... a valuable ring. Ring of Eidolon's Edge.

plots: Benirus Manor belonged to Velwyn's grandfather: Velwyn is selling Benirus Manor because he has pressing matters elsewhere
the player gets the key to the front door and the deed of ownership after buying Benirus Manor

quest.title: Where Spirits Have Lease
quest.objective: purchase Benirus Manor
tasks: give 5,000 gold to Velwyn
purchase Benirus Manor
quest.description:
I'm Velwyn. You wouldn't happen to be in the market for a home would you? If you are, I just happen to be selling a manor located right here in Anvil.
I'm selling my grandfather's house, Benirus Manor. If you're interested, I could let you have it for a modest sum, 5,000 gold. I have to sell it soon, as I have pressing matters elsewhere. You're welcome to take a look at it. It is located across the street from the Chapel.
Once you buy, you get the key to the front door and the deed of ownership. That's the deal.

kbs.name: Ocheeva
kbs.description: the player's superior in the Dark Brotherhood

kbs.name: Summitmist Manor
kbs.description: a large manor house in Skingrad

plots: the guests falsely believe that they cannot leave Summitmist Manor before finding a chest containing gold and the key to Summitmist Manor
the door to Summitmist Manor will be locked behind the player until the other guests are dead: the doorman will explain the rest

quest.title: Whodunit?
quest.objective: assassinate the other five guests at the party
tasks: Head to Summitmist Manor.
talk to the doorman
assassinate the other five guests at the party
quest.description:
Do you like parties? Because you've been invited to one. Of course you'll be killing all the other guests. Each guest, at some point in the past, wronged their mysterious host. Now he's hired us to exact his revenge. Are you ready to attend?
You need to go to the city of Skingrad, to the large house known as Summitmist Manor. There you will meet up with five very unlucky guests. In order to receive your bonus, you must kill each guest secretly, one by one. If anyone sees you committing murder, the bonus is forfeit. The guests believe there is a chest of gold hidden in the house, and have agreed to be locked inside until one of them finds it. In fact, the guests believe the key to the manor is inside the chest, and only by satisfying their greed will they be allowed to leave. Poor fools. There is, of course, no chest of gold. The guests will find no key. After you arrive, the doors will be locked behind you, as everyone expects. When all the guests lie dead, you will be free to leave.
Now go, see the doorman at Summitmist Manor. He will explain the rest. Have fun.

kbs.name: Vicente Valtieri
kbs.description: the player's superior in the Dark Brotherhood

kbs.name: Marie Elena
relations: Waterfront District of the Imperial City

kbs.name: Waterfront District of the Imperial City
kbs.description: Waterfront District of the Imperial City

kbs.name: Gaston Tussaud
relations: Waterfront District of the Imperial City

plots: this is the player's first assignment
the pirates have been moving cargo: the player may be able to smuggle themselves onboard the Marie Elena in one of the packing crates
the player's fellow assassins provide insight about any current contract

quest.title: A Watery Grave
quest.objective: assassinate Gaston Tussaud
tasks: Reach Waterfront District of the Imperial City.
board the Marie Elena
assassinate Gaston Tussaud
quest.description:
Warmest greetings to you. I am Vicente Valtieri. I'm eager to see how you fare on your first assignment.
Go to the Waterfront District of the Imperial City. There you will find a ship named the Marie Elena. Board the ship and find its captain, Gaston Tussaud. He'll be in his cabin. Eliminate Tussaud in any manner you see fit. As a pirate, Gaston Tussaud has certainly spilled his share of blood. Someone wants revenge, and they've hired us to extract it.
The pirates have been moving a lot of cargo onboard lately. You may be able to smuggle yourself onboard in one of the packing crates. Oh, and one more thing. Get into the habit of asking your fellow assassins about any current contract. Their insight may prove invaluable.

kbs.name: Rockshatter
kbs.description: a mace, and Maeva the Buxom's family heirloom

plots: Bjalfi the Contemptible snatched Rockshatter, and took off to join a local marauder gang at Fort Strand

quest.title: When the Vow Breaks
quest.objective: recover the Rockshatter for Maeva the Buxom
tasks: Proceed to Fort Strand.
find Bjalfi the Contemptible
recover the Rockshatter for Maeva the Buxom
quest.description:
Perhaps you can help me. I'm Maeva the Buxom. My husband's name is Bjalfi the Contemptible. My father said I was a fool to marry him, but I didn't listen. At our wedding, my father gave us a family heirloom as a gift; Rockshatter, a mace that's been in my family for many generations.
Bjalfi snatched Rockshatter from our mantle and took off to "find his fortune" with the local Marauder gang at Fort Strand. I want that mace back. Please, I don't think he's ever coming back, and I'd hate to lose such a precious heirloom to a gang of thugs.

kbs.name: Farwil
kbs.description: Count Indarys' son, and a brash young man

plots: Farwil entered the Oblivion Gate with six other Knights of Thorn: Count Indarys posted guards around the Oblivion Gate
Farwil formed the Knights of the Thorn two years ago

quest.title: The Wayward Knight
quest.objective: save Farwil from Oblivion, and close the Oblivion Gate
tasks: enter the Oblivion Gate
save Farwil from Oblivion, and close the Oblivion Gate
quest.description:
About two days ago, Count Indarys's son, Farwil, entered the Oblivion Gate with six other men. We haven't heard from them since then. The Count fears the worst, and has posted guards here so we can watch and see if anyone comes back out. So far, nothing.
At this point, Count Indarys is offering a reward for the recovery of his son from inside the gate... or confirmed news of his demise. If you find him or the rest of the Knights of the Thorn, get them out of there. I'm sure that the Count would also be pleased if the gate was closed.
The Knights of the Thorn are a bunch of rabble who fancy themselves true knights. Farwil formed the group around two years ago. They make grand boasts, and talk a good talk, but that's all they are. The real work goes to us, the City Guard. I hate to speak ill of them, as something horrible may have happened, but their own bravado got them into this mess.

kbs.name: Raminus Polus
kbs.description: the player's superior at the Mages Guild

kbs.name: Vahtacen
kbs.description: one of the Ayleid ruin sites on the eastern side of the province

plots: there are no Necromancers involved in this task

quest.title: Vahtacen's Secret
quest.objective: help with Irlav Jarol's research project at Vahtacen
tasks: Find your way to Arch Mage's Tower.
talk to Irlav Jarol
help with Irlav Jarol's research project at Vahtacen
quest.description:
I, Raminus Polus, have a new task for you, and I assure you there are no Necromancers involved.
There's a research project going on at Vahtacen, one of the Ayleid ruin sites on the eastern side of the province. Irlav Jarol is in charge of the project, and is apparently in need of some help.
I thought you might need a break, after the things you've been exposed to lately. You can find Irlav here in the Arch Mage's Tower.

kbs.name: Vaermina
kbs.description: the lady of nightmares, one of the Daedric Princes

plots: Arkved stole the Orb from the the dreams of Vaermina's followers: in the Orb, Arkved has found more than he bargained for

quest.title: Vaermina's Orb of Nightmares
quest.objective: retrieve the Orb
tasks: Travel to Arkved's tower.
find the Orb
retrieve the Orb
quest.description:
We meet again, mortal, for we have met before, whether you know it or not.
When you mutter in your sleep, you speak to me. When you waken wet with sweat, you've just left my house. I dwell in your dreams; I savor your nightmares. Now, you will serve me.
The wizard Arkved has the Orb of Vaermina... snatched from the dreams of my followers and dragged into the waking world. Travel to his tower and retrieve my Orb. Take care, though, mortal. In the Orb, Arkved has found more than he bargained for.
After proving yourself, mortal, you shall bear my token, the Skull of Corruption.

kbs.name: Armand Christophe
kbs.description: the player's superior in the Thieves Guild

kbs.name: Hieronymus Lex
kbs.description: male captain of the city watch

plots: the player is the newest member of the Thieves Guild
Hieronymus Lex collected taxes from the Waterfront: the city usually doesn't bother collecting taxes from the Waterfront District, because it costs more money than its worth
the Gray Fox has always protected the poor of the Waterfront

quest.title: Untaxing the Poor
quest.objective: steal back the taxes of the poor Waterfront citizens
tasks: find out where Hieronymus Lex is keeping the taxes and tax records
steal back the taxes of the poor Waterfront citizens
quest.description:
Ah! Our newest member. I'm glad you stopped by. I have a... situation that you might be able to help with.
The Gray Fox has asked me to take care of a problem, and I'm putting you on it. Hieronymus Lex actually collected taxes from everyone living here on the Waterfront! Your job is to recover those taxes.
The people of the waterfront are very poor. Traditionally the city has not collected taxes from them, even though by law they could. The money the city would collect would barely cover the cost of collecting. The Gray Fox has always guaranteed protection to the poor of the waterfront. He doesn't want to let this injustice stand. It's a matter of principle.
Find out where Hieronymus Lex is keeping the taxes and bring them to me. I'll also need the tax records of what each citizen paid so we can return it.

kbs.name: Azzan
kbs.description: the player's superior in the Fighters Guild

plots: the player has worked for Azzan before

quest.title: The Unfortunate Shopkeeper
quest.objective: stop the break-ins to Quality Merchandise
tasks: Reach Quality Merchandise.
talk to Norbert Lelles
stop the break-ins to Quality Merchandise
quest.description:
Looking for more work, eh? Good. I have got a contract for you. I'd like you to go talk to Norbert Lelles, here in Anvil.
He runs Quality Merchandise here in Anvil. He's been having problems with break-ins, though, and he's hired us to put a stop to it. Sounds like he wants your help stopping the theft at his store.
Take care of Lelles. He needs the help.

kbs.name: Jensine
kbs.description: a merchant, and the chairperson for the Society of Concerned Merchants

plots: trouble began when Thoronir opened his store selling all kinds of merchandise undercutting the competition: Thoronir refuses to join the Society of Concerned Merchants or discuss the matter

quest.title: Unfriendly Competition
quest.objective: find proof about Thoronir's wrongdoing
tasks: investigate Thoronir's store to find out where he gets his inventory
find proof about Thoronir's wrongdoing
quest.description:
I think you may be just the kind of person we're looking for. Perhaps you can assist us with a problem we're having here in the Market District.
I'm the chairperson for the Society of Concerned Merchants. We formed this group a while back to keep a nice fair economic balance in town. Not every store is a member, but we're slowly trying to convince them to join. Everything was fine until Thoronir opened his shop nearby.
Selling all sorts of merchandise, Thoronir undercuts prices like you wouldn't believe. He doesn't always sell what we sell, but it is still a problem. People who buy tend to want to spend their money there. That leaves none for us. It's getting so bad, a few of us may have to close up shop. He outright refuses to join the Society or even discuss the matter. We are convinced he is up to no good.
What we need is for you to case his establishment, and figure out where he gets his inventory. Find some proof of his wrongdoing, and let us know. We cannot do it ourselves, as he recognizes all of us. The job pays a fair bounty in gold when he is brought to justice.

kbs.name: Corbolo
relations: along the Corbolo, east of the Imperial City and south of Cheydinhal

kbs.name: Cyrodiil
relations: along the Corbolo, east of the Imperial City and south of Cheydinhal

kbs.name: along the Corbolo, east of the Imperial City and south of Cheydinhal
kbs.description: along the Corbolo, east of the Imperial City and south of Cheydinhal

plots: the player has not met Janus Hassildor before: the player and Janus Hassildor are both looking for a cure for vampirism
over 50 years ago Rona and Janus Hassildor were turned into vampires: Janus Hassildor embraced the vampirism, Rona did not
Rona slipped into coma from refusing to feed herself: Janus Hassildor wants to cure Rona's vampirism
Janus Hassildor cannot risk drawing too much attention on himself by searching for a cure to vampirism by himself: he found out that witches of Glenmoril have made a cure for vampirism before

quest.title: Vampire Cure
quest.objective: report to Janus Hassildor's steward after finding a cure for vampirism
tasks: Travel to along the Corbolo, east of the Imperial City and south of Cheydinhal.
find the witch of Glenmoril
report to Janus Hassildor's steward after finding a cure for vampirism
quest.description:
I'm sorry. We've not met. I'm Janus Hassildor, Count of Skingrad. I understand you're looking for a cure for vampirism. This is fortunate, as I also seek the cure.
I wish to tell you a story so that you might understand why I would trust you with my secrets. More than 50 years ago, my wife Rona and I were both turned into vampires. While I came to embrace the changes in myself, she did not. She hated what she had become, and refused to feed to keep herself healthy. She eventually slipped into a coma from which she has not awoken. My trusted servants have cared for her all this time, but I wish for her to at last find peace. The cure is for her. I have researched what I can, but acquiring the cure is beyond my grasp. I cannot risk drawing too much attention to myself. So I would ask that you took up the search on my behalf. If you are successful, I will reward you in whatever small way I can. Will you aid me?
What little I have discovered points to the witches of Glenmoril. In the past, they have been capable of creating a cure. I have searched for these witches throughout Cyrodiil, but no covens still exist within its borders. There may be one left. I have unconfirmed reports of a woman seen near the Corbolo river, who fits the description of these witches. Seek her out, and learn whether she can help. She lives somewhere along the river, east of the Imperial City and south of Cheydinhal. If you are successful in finding a cure, report to my steward. You have my thanks.

kbs.name: Maglir
kbs.description: a new male member of the Fighters Guild

plots: the player is a new member of the Fighters Guild

quest.title: Unfinished Business
quest.objective: find out why Maglir has defaulted on a contract
tasks: Find your way to Skingrad.
find Maglir
find out why Maglir has defaulted on a contract
quest.description:
I'm the Fighters Guild Champion, Modryn Oreyn, as you should know. What do you want? I suppose you've come looking for duties?
I want you to contact Maglir. He's one of your Fighters Guild brothers, but he's defaulted on a contract. We can't allow that. Makes us all look bad. He didn't finish out a contract in Skingrad. Suppose I shouldn't be surprised. He's raw, like you. Go and find out what's wrong with him.

kbs.name: Thadon
kbs.description: a man who betrayed the player by joining Jyggalag

kbs.name: Jyggalag
kbs.description: a man who wants the player's Realm

plots: the player has come back to the Palace
The Font of Madness in the middle of the throne room in the Palace has been tainted with Order: as goes the Font of Madness, so goes the Realm
soon we will all be serving a new master, Jyggalag: the forces of Order have poisoned the Pools of Mania and Dementia that feed the Font of Madness
the traitor Thadon is probably behind the poisoning instead of Jyggalag himself

quest.title: The Roots of Madness
quest.objective: cleanse the Pools of Madness and the Font of Madness from the taint of Order
tasks: Arrive at Fountainhead.
find the source of the taint of Order
cleanse the Pools of Madness and the Font of Madness from the taint of Order
quest.description:
Ah, you're back. You may have noticed that we have a... bit of a problem.
My Liege of course noticed the Font when you arrived in the Palace. The Font of Madness, in the middle of the throne room.
The taint of Order appeared only a short time ago, but it has spread quickly. As goes the Font of Madness, so goes the Realm. Soon we will all be serving a new master, Jyggalag.
Somehow the forces of Order have poisoned the Pools of Mania and Dementia that feed the Font. I suspect the traitor Thadon. Jyggalag has never had an original thought in his existence. Be that as it may. You will have to enter the Fountainhead beneath the Tree and find the source of the poison.

kbs.name: Sir Berich
kbs.description: one of Sir Casimir's fellow knights at the Order

kbs.name: Stendarr
kbs.description: the god of mercy, and one of the Nine

plots: Sir Casimir followed Sir Berich into a war after the Order fractured
the war changed Sir Casimir: he no longer had sympathy for the weak, or pity for the suffering
after the war, Sir Casimir tried to serve the Nine at the Chapel of Stendarr in Chorrol
Sir Casimir was cursed after killing a beggar at the Chapel of Stendarr: he was weak, constantly weary, and lacked the energy to do almost anything
the Gauntlets of the Crusader slipped from Sir Casimir's hands after killing the beggar: they are still in the Chapel of Stendarr, too heavy to move

quest.title: Stendarr's Mercy
quest.objective: retrieve the Gauntlets of the Crusader for yourself
tasks: Head to Chorrol.
talk to the priests of Stendarr
retrieve the Gauntlets of the Crusader for yourself
quest.description:
I, Sir Casimir, know where you may find the Gauntlets of the Crusader, for I was the one who lost them when I was still alive. Though many know where they are, they are still lost. I believe there is something you must do in order to retrieve them.
When the Order fractured, I followed Sir Berich into war, taking the Gauntlets with me. When it was over, I returned to this land. I attempted to return to the service of the Nine, but the war had changed me. I no longer had sympathy for the weak, or pity for the suffering. In the brief time I was there, I did more to hurt the Chapel of Stendarr than help it. It was there that I was cursed.
A beggar who came to the Chapel each day for help tried my patience one too many times. I lost my temper, and struck him. My blow landed harder than I had intended, and he fell to the floor, dead. Killed in the very Chapel of the God of Mercy. I left the Chapel at once, of course, but the damage was done. I was weak, constantly weary, and lacked the energy to do almost anything.
As proof of the deed, when I struck the poor man the Gauntlets slipped right off my hands and fell to the floor. Heavy as stone, they would not move. None could lift them. I suspect they lie there still, in Chorrol's Chapel. You must prove to Stendarr you are worthy to lift the Gauntlets once more. Seek out the priests of Stendarr in Chorrol. Perhaps they can help you.

kbs.name: Sheogorath
kbs.description: the prince of madness, one of the Daedric Princes

kbs.name: Jyggalag
kbs.description: the prince of order, one of the Daedric Princes

plots: Sheogorath is gone: Jyggalag will win, if the throne of Madness remains empty
the Staff of Sheogorath faded with Sheogorath
Haskill gives the player a crystal that opens the sealed door at Knifepoint Hollow: the library is a thing of Order, and it will still serve that end

quest.title: Symbols of Office
quest.objective: remake the Staff of Sheogorath and fill the throne of Madness after Sheogorath's passing
tasks: Arrive at Knifepoint Hollow.
find the being who can help you to remake the Staff of Sheogorath
remake the Staff of Sheogorath and fill the throne of Madness after Sheogorath's passing
quest.description:
Sheogorath is gone, but hope is not lost. We have a rare opportunity here, but I hesitate to do what must be done. If the Throne of Madness remains empty when Jyggalag storms the palace, he will prevail. But there is a chance that the throne may not be empty. The only way to protect the Realm from Jyggalag is to place you in the Throne of Madness.
Unfortunately, when Sheogorath faded, the power of the Staff of Sheogorath faded with him. It must now be remade. The Staff is the symbol of power in this Realm. He who rightfully holds the Staff may hold the throne of the Shivering Isles. However, the secrets of its construction are lost.
That which is lost can be found again. There is one being in the Shivering Isles who may be able to assist you in the construction of a new Staff. The ruins of Knifepoint Hollow once served as a great library. There, you will find a door. Behind that door, you will find the answer you seek.
Take this crystal. It contains the power to open the sealed door. Inside, you will find the final remnants of the library. Be mindful of what you find there. The library is a thing of Order, and it will still serve that end.

kbs.name: Sheogorath
kbs.description: the prince of madness, one of the Daedric Princes

kbs.name: Jyggalag
kbs.description: the prince of order, one of the Daedric Princes

plots: Sheogorath does not know how much time he has left: Sheogorath wants the Gatekeeper to guard the Gates and be ready for Jyggalag's forces
the player should tell Relmyna that they are working for Sheogorath: Relmyna would do anything for Sheogorath

quest.title: Rebuilding the Gatekeeper
quest.objective: rebuild the Gatekeeper
tasks: Make your way to Xaselm.
talk to Relmyna
rebuild the Gatekeeper
quest.description:
Things are getting a bit thin. Get that Gatekeeper in place, and do it quickly. I'm not sure how much time I have left.
It's essential. Simply essential! If only it were essentially simple... but it's not. I want him there guarding those Gates. If any of Jyggalag's forces show up, he should be ready for them.
It wouldn't do to just let them in if more show up. And more always show up. Still and all, I think things are going well, considering! Go talk to Relmyna in Xaselm. Tell her you're working for me. She'd do anything for me, that little minx.

kbs.name: Unknown
kbs.description: a paranoid resident of Crucible, giving quest via "Faded Note"
relations: the sewage near the back of Bernice's inn, in Crucible

kbs.name: Crucible
kbs.description: a district of a great city
relations: the sewage near the back of Bernice's inn, in Crucible

kbs.name: the sewage near the back of Bernice's inn, in Crucible
kbs.description: the sewage near the back of Bernice's inn, in Crucible

plots: Unknown is dying
Unknown is a drunk
the house of Unknown was stolen by Brithaur
Unknown thinks that Bernice, Caldana, Earil, and Cutter are plotting against him

quest.title: The Paranoid Roof Watcher
quest.objective: find the hidden stash of Unknown
tasks: Reach the sewage near the back of Bernice's inn, in Crucible.
find the sunken urn
find the hidden stash of Unknown
quest.description:
Faded Note
The last thoughts of one of Crucible's residents

I don't think I'll live much longer. My wine supply is thinning, only one bottle left. Bernice's wine is worthless! I would have lasted longer on bark. I'd go back home to resupply, but Brithaur, that maggot, has stolen my house. It's not just him, though, it's also the others. I can't leave the safety of the roof. They have a plan for me, I see it in their eyes. Caldana, Earil, Cutter, ALL OF THEM!
They don't know I'm up here, watching. Not much longer, though. At least they won't find me or my stash. I've put all my favorite things in an urn, and sunken it in the sewage near the back of Bernice's dive.
I think I'll drink that last bottle to celebrate.

kbs.name: Sheogorath
kbs.description: the prince of madness, one of the Daedric Princes

kbs.name: Malacath
kbs.description: the lord of monsters, one of the Daedric Princes

plots: Sheogorath's citizens need a new ruler when he is gone: the player has to replace a current Duke or Duchess of Madness
Malacath's realm is a nasty place

quest.title: Ritual of Accession
quest.objective: become a ruler in the Court of Madness
tasks: Travel to Sacellum Arden-Sul.
speak to Arctus and Dervenin
become a ruler in the Court of Madness
quest.description:
Once I am gone, things usually get bad quickly.
You'll need the respect of My citizens. They'll need a leader, someone to look up to when I'm gone. They're the backbone of any great land. Except where the backbone is an actual backbone. Ever been to Malacath's realm...? Nasty stuff. But, back to the business at hand.
You'll need to control one of the Courts of Madness. Replace a current Duke. Or Duchess. Whichever. That will command respect! The people will rally around you. You'll have their love, their admiration, their complaints! Whatever. As long as it keeps them on Our side.
Speak to Arctus and Dervenin, the High Priests at the Sacellum Arden-Sul. They can explain what needs to be done.

kbs.name: Sheogorath
kbs.description: the prince of madness, one of the Daedric Princes

plots: the Greymarch has swept the Fringe

quest.title: Retaking the Fringe
quest.objective: defend the Fringe
tasks: Reach Fringe.
help Sheogorath's armies to retake the Fringe from the forces of Order
defend the Fringe
quest.description:
The Greymarch has swept the Fringe. Order gathers its forces there as we speak. And I hate when people gather forces in My Fringe. You'll need to put an end to that. Stop them.
My armies should already be there, but I want you to see what you can do to help. If they continue to marshal their forces there, we won't be able to contain them. Make sure they can't.

kbs.name: Syl
kbs.description: the Duchess of Dementia, an incredibly paranoid woman

plots: the player was sent by the Madgod
the player will be Syl's Grand Inquisitor

quest.title: The Lady of Paranoia
quest.objective: find the people who conspire against Syl
tasks: talk to Herdir for help
find the people who conspire against Syl
quest.description:
Why do you approach Syl, the Duchess of Dementia? Do you seek death?
You're the one the Madgod sent, aren't you? Then you're safe for now. Speak to no one unless I instruct you to. None of them can be trusted. Do you hear me? None! Surrounded by traitors and spies, I am. Always, always. They watch and wait, eager to slip a knife into my spine when I'm not looking.
Could be all of them. Every last one. None can be trusted. But they'll never take me down. Never! I'll see them all rotting in shallow graves before I let my guard down! You... you will help me. Yes, yes. You will be most useful.
You're going to find out who knows. You're going to learn who keeps secrets, who conspires against me. You will be my Grand Inquisitor. Expose the conspirators, and they will be punished, I assure you. Find out who keeps secrets, and what they are. Speak with Herdir. He will help you. Do you understand what is required of you? If no one is found, you will be held responsible.

kbs.name: Sickly Bernice
kbs.description: a sickly woman, and the proprietor

kbs.name: Aquanostrum
kbs.description: a liquid cure that bubbles up from around an old statue

plots: Sickly Bernice thinks these may be her last days in the Shivering Isles
on the lowest level of the Knotty Bramble, there is a pool containing Aquanostrum: Sickly Bernice gives the player a special flask to collect the Aquanostrum

quest.title: A Liquid Solution
quest.objective: bring Aquanostrum to Sickly Bernice
tasks: Proceed to Knotty Bramble.
find Aquanostrum to cure Sickly Bernice's illness
bring Aquanostrum to Sickly Bernice
quest.description:
Oh... hello. Sickly Bernice, proprietor. Don't get too close now. You might catch what I have.
Well... it seems I am dying. Yes, these may be my last days in the Shivering Isles. That is, unless someone like yourself could help me find the cure. But no one has taken me up on my offer, even with the promise of a reward. Ah well, it's been a good life I suppose....
There's only one place in all the Isles to get the cure for what I have... Knotty Bramble. I'll mark it on your map. There, on the lowest level of the place, is a pool containing the cure: Aquanostrum. Legend has it that it bubbles up from around an old statue. Bring me back the remedy, and I will reward you well with a Circlet of Verdure. Here, take this special flask to collect the Aquanostrum.

plots: the player is Sheogorath's newest and only noble in the realm
a messenger told Sheogorath that Order has attacked Brellach and routed his soldiers

quest.title: The Helpless Army
quest.objective: free Brellach from Order
tasks: talk to the messenger
free Brellach from Order
quest.description:
There's a perfect job for you, my newest and only Noble in the realm!
A messenger told me that Order has attacked my army's stronghold at Brellach and routed my soldiers! If Order has truly entered my army's stronghold, things have taken a disturbing turn. It means Order has tried subterfuge... not its strong suit. Amazing! Perhaps things aren't going as poorly as I'd imagined.
You'll want to get all the details from the messenger. Unless you already have. You haven't, have you?

kbs.name: Hill of Suicides
kbs.description: a nasty place where people who have committed suicide end up

plots: a wizard split all citizens of Split into two people: one demented and other manic
Horkvir Bear-Arm cannot resolve the issue himself: there are rules and he does not want to end up on the Hill of Suicides

quest.title: The Great Divide
quest.objective: resolve the trouble of doubles
tasks: kill the demented citizens of Split
resolve the trouble of doubles
quest.description:
Yes, I, Horkvir Bear-Arm, can take a moment to talk with you.
I'd get more work done if it weren't for my layabout double living in town. Terrible drain on productivity. Never know who's who. It's been a problem for too long.
A wizard did it. Stupid layabout mage. Had a theory about each of us having a Manic and Demented side. He decided to test the theory. Cast a spell. Split us all in two. Do we get twice the work done? No! Ridiculous. We're not allowed to take care of it either. There are rules. And I don't want to end up on the Hill of Suicides. You, on the other hand....
Get rid of that Demented bunch. Useless, anyway. Don't get a lick of work done around Split. If you get rid of them, I'll make it worth your while.

kbs.name: Hill of Suicides
kbs.description: a nasty place where people who have committed suicide end up

plots: a wizard split all citizens of Split into two people: one Demented and other Manic
Horkvir Bear-Arm cannot resolve the issue himself: there is a law about that and the Hill of Suicides is not a nice place

quest.title: A Serious Split
quest.objective: resolve the issue with duplicate citizens
tasks: kill the manic citizens of Split
resolve the issue with duplicate citizens
quest.description:
Talking wears me, Horkvir Bear-Arm, out.
My double is always working. It takes all my energy just watching him work. It's got to stop. It's a problem, all these doubles walking around. And it's tiresome. Didn't used to be like this.
Some blasted mage. Had a theory. They've always got theories. He thought there was a Manic and a Demented in each of us. So, what does he do? What else? Casts a spell. You can see how well that went. Two of each of us walking around this place. Nothing we can do about it, either. There's a law about that here. Been to the Hill of Suicides? Not a nice place. But you might be able to help.
Only one group can stick around. Either we Demented or those blasted Manics. It's the only way we'll find any peace. You get rid of those Manics. All of them. If you can take care of that for me, I'd make it worth your while..

plots: Big Head will give the player his charm so that the player can speak with Bolwing

quest.title: The Fork of Horripilation
quest.objective: find the Fork of Horripilation for Big Head
tasks: talk to Bolwing to hear his secret
find the Fork of Horripilation for Big Head
quest.description:
Sing for Big Head.
The Fork for Big Head. Oh, where has Master put the Fork? It sings alone. Far from home. Sad, sad Fork. Sad, sad Big Head.
The Fork! The precious, precious fork! Hear how it sings to Big Head! Beautiful, perfect Fork of Horripilation! But it is gone. Gone, gone, gone. No more singing. No more ringing. Taken from Big Head, never returned. That is when Big Head came here. Master brought me! Whispered shouts into my ear! Songs of Madgods! Songs of bad gods! Softly, Master. Softly.
It went away. But it will come back! It always comes back! It is close. Big Head can hear it! The Fork of Horripilation! Hear it singing! Songs of home! It comes again. It brings presents! It is not present. Soon it will be! You will find it! Bring the Fork! Hear the music. Music of toads. Music of roads! Sing to yourself, so all can hear!
Talk to the beggar! Talk to Bolwing! He knows secrets, but no one can hear them. No one but Big Head. Take Big Head's charm! Listen to Bolwing! His tongue is tied, but his mind is unraveled! He'll tell you the secret. Who has the Fork?

kbs.name: Hirrus Clutumnus
kbs.description: a man who desperately wants to die

plots: Hirrus Clutumnus is  going to go about his daily life

quest.title: Final Resting
quest.objective: help Hirrus Clutumnus end his life
tasks: kill Hirrus Clutumnus when he is unaware
help Hirrus Clutumnus end his life
quest.description:
Won't someone end me? Take my life, please!
I, Hirrus Clutumnus, am in desperate need of a champion, a hero. Are you brave and fearless? There's a... a simple task. Yes, a simple task that you must perform.
This life, it's... well, it's too painful. Everywhere I look, I see death, dying, and decay. When I dream, I see a world without sunshine. I'm constantly on the verge of retching up, or falling asleep, or screaming at someone who doesn't deserve it. I'm just so fed up with it all.
I need your help. I need you to send my soul away from this world! You must... you must kill me. I don't necessarily want to see it coming. And I want to die here in the city so all these people finally believe me. They'll wish they were nicer. You probably want to do it without spectators though, so you don't get in trouble. Best to make it look like an accident. But remember, I don't want to see it coming. Take me unaware!
I'm going to go about my daily life, such as it is, as if nothing has changed. Make your move when you wish. But, please, do it soon. When you kill me, take the key to my house. Nothing really worth taking, except what's locked up in the jewelry box. You can have that.

plots: Ranarr-Jo thinks that Cindanwe can control minds

quest.title: Everything In Its Place
quest.objective: liberate Ranarr-Jo and others from mind control
tasks: gain Kishashi's trust
liberate Ranarr-Jo and others from mind control
quest.description:
I'm Ranarr-Jo.
Perhaps you could help us? But why should I trust you? You might be, you know... one of Them.
Our situation is desperate, she controls our minds... but wait, I've said too much.
Talk to my Kishashi. If she will trust you, I will trust you.

kbs.name: Count Cirion
kbs.description: the ghost of the nobleman who ruled over Vitharn

plots: Vitharn was overrun by Fanatics centuries ago: Count Cirion and his people failed to defend Vitharn
Sheogorath cursed the shades of Count Cirion's people to repeat the final moments of their failures
within Vitharn, no one will attack the player

quest.title: Ghosts of Vitharn
quest.objective: break the cycle of torment for the ghosts of Vitharn
tasks: Arrive at Vitharn.
correct the mistakes of the four people who failed to protect the gate lever
break the cycle of torment for the ghosts of Vitharn
quest.description:
I am Count Cirion, and you have violated the inner sanctum of Vitharn Keep.
However, my people and I are in need. Maybe you can help us. Centuries ago, Vitharn was overrun by Fanatics. We were soft and failed to defend ourselves. I was the weakest of all. Now, the shades of my people are cursed by Sheogorath to repeat the final moments of their failures, over and over again. You must help us break the cycle of torment.
Help my people overcome their weakness and defend Vitharn from the Fanatics. Walk among them. There were four who failed to protect the gate lever. Find out what they did wrong and help them correct it. You can put away your sword in these halls. Unlike the defending spirits, within these walls, none will war with you. Not even the Fanatics.
My people long to be laid to rest. Please help them.

kbs.name: Jyggalag
kbs.description: a man who wants the player's Realm

plots: the Captain's guards are engaging the Knights

quest.title: The End of Order
quest.objective: fight the last battle against Jyggalag and his forces of Order
tasks: Reach Palace courtyard.
deactivate the Obelisk of Order
fight the last battle against Jyggalag and his forces of Order
quest.description:
My Liege. I'm glad to see you. We have a developing situation that requires your attention.
An Obelisk of Order has activated in the Palace courtyard. My guards are engaging the Knights as we speak. We will defend the Palace to the end of our strength, and will cast ourselves in the path of cursed Jyggalag himself should he come here.
You must deactivate the Obelisk to be rid of the Knights! This will be our final battle against Jyggalag and his forces of Order!

kbs.name: Sheogorath
kbs.description: the prince of madness, one of the Daedric Princes

kbs.name: Xedilian
kbs.description: a maze dungeon in Shivering Isles

kbs.name: Haskill
kbs.description: a detail-oriented man, and a snappy dresser

kbs.name: small book, tells the player how to activate Xedilian
kbs.description: small book, tells the player how to activate Xedilian

plots: Sheogorath gives the player the Attenuator of Judgement and a small book: the player can get more information from Haskill

quest.title: A Better Mousetrap
quest.objective: activate Xedilian to make unwanted guests to stay away from Sheogorath's realm
tasks: Make your way to Xedilian.
use the Attenuator of Judgement and the small book to activate Xedilian
activate Xedilian to make unwanted guests to stay away from Sheogorath's realm
quest.description:
I'm Sheogorath, the Daedric Prince of Madness. I've been waiting for you, or someone like you, or someone other than you, for some time.
Now? You run an errand for me. An important one. Of course, anything I tell you to do is important. My Realm, my rules. You're going to Xedilian, one of my favorite spots in the Shivering Isles. It's a little place I use to take care of unwanted visitors. And some are more unwanted than others.
There are those that have other ways into my Realm, and they're on the move. We don't want them here. Trust me. So, you're going to get Xedilian up and running. Here's a little book to tell you how, and the Attenuator of Judgement. You'll need that, too. Of course, you can always get more details from Haskill. He's a detail-oriented type of person. A big help. And a snappy dresser.
Now, get going. Before I change my mind. Or my mind changes me.

kbs.name: Crucible
kbs.description: a district of a big city

plots: Ahjazda is the only one who sees the approaching storm

quest.title: The Coming Storm
quest.objective: help Ahjazda prepare for the coming storm
tasks: bring the Amulet of Disintegration, the Ring of Desiccation, and the Calming Pants to Ahjazda
help Ahjazda prepare for the coming storm
quest.description:
So much to gather, so little time. Perhaps you can help? You might help against the coming storm.
It's coming. I, Ahjazda, think I'm the only one who sees it, though. And I'm going to be ready. Oh, yes. I'll be ready. I've been stockpiling supplies. Things I'll need to ride it out... or survive when they come for me.
I've been gathering things for quite a while, but there are still a few I'm missing. Perhaps you'd bring them to me? I still need the Amulet of Disintegration, the Ring of Desiccation, and, of course, the Calming Pants. Must have the Calming Pants. Bring these to me, and I will reward you well. Ahjazda has many, many things.
Let me teach you a special spell, Ahjazda's Paranoia, after you return with the items. It will affect all those around you. You might find it handy to cause confusion in your enemies. You know... when the time comes.

kbs.name: Sheogorath
kbs.description: the god of madness, one of the Daedric Princes

kbs.name: New Sheoth
kbs.description: the capital city of Sheogorath's realm

plots: the Flame of Agnon is at Cylarne: Sheogorath's minions are fighting over Cylarne in their eternal quest to please him

quest.title: The Cold Flame of Agnon
quest.objective: get the Flame of Agnon to relight the great torch over New Sheoth
tasks: Arrive at Cylarne.
take care of Sheogorath's minions
get the Flame of Agnon to relight the great torch over New Sheoth
quest.description:
You've seen the Great Torch that burns brightly over New Sheoth? No? Because it doesn't. It should. But it doesn't. You'll fix that. You'll go to Cylarne and bring back the Flame of Agnon to relight the torch.
Oh... and take care with my minions at Cylarne. In their eternal quest to please me, they're constantly fighting over Cylarne. It can be tiresome. But, really, it's divine. Divinely tiresome. Well. That's your problem now.
Off with you. I don't want to see you again until the Great Torch is lit. I wouldn't want to have to hurt you.

kbs.name: Xedilian
kbs.description: a looping dungeon that is used to get rid of unwanted people

kbs.name: Sheogorath
kbs.description: a man who employs Kiliban Nyrandil

kbs.name: the Manual
kbs.description: a manual that tells the player how Xedilian works, given to the player by Sheogorath

plots: Xedilian would normally have sent the player back to the entrance when they stepped on the pad in the Resonator Chamber: the player mus deal with the adventurers who are entering Xedilian before the player can leave Xedilian
the player should consult Kiliban Nyrandil or the Manual

quest.title: Baiting the Trap
quest.objective: get out of Xedilian
tasks: deal with the adventurers
get out of Xedilian
quest.description:
