Welcome to Xedilian, I'm the dungeon caretaker, Kiliban Nyrandil.
Xedilian would normally have sent you back to the entrance when you stepped on the pad in the Resonator Chamber. Since you're up here, I can only surmise that adventurers are already entering the dungeon as we speak.
I'm afraid until the adventurers are dealt with, Xedilian will keep you here. Even I can't will its doors to open. To put it bluntly, you're stuck here for the moment. No disrespect intended.
The only thing we can do is let the adventurers complete a cycle through here. I'll be glad to help. I assume Sheogorath gave you the Manual. You can consult it for more information, or I can provide instructions.

kbs.name: Raminus Polus
kbs.description: the player's superior at the Mages Guild

kbs.name: Skingrad
kbs.description: an unusual city southwest of the Imperial City

plots: the Council of Mages is investigating what happened at Wellspring Cave, leaving the ranks of Mages Guild spread thin
Skingrad is an unusual place

quest.title: Ulterior Motives
quest.objective: retrieve a book from Janus Hassildor
tasks: Go to Skingrad.
travel to Skingrad
retrieve a book from Janus Hassildor
quest.description:
I, Raminus Polus, have a new task for you.
The Council is investigating what happened at Wellspring Cave. Many of our resources are devoted to the task, leaving our ranks spread thin. There is a related book that needs to be recovered. It was recently loaned to Janus Hassildor, the Count of Skingrad. I'd like you to retrieve it.
I understand this may not seem the most important of tasks, but still... it needs doing, and you are one of the few available to do it. A note of caution: Skingrad is an... unusual place. Be prepared for the unexpected.
The city of Skingrad lies southwest of the Imperial City. You should have no trouble finding it.
You have your task. Perform it as well as you would any other.

kbs.name: Gray Fox
kbs.description: a legendary thief, and the player's guildmaster at the Thieves Guild

kbs.name: Temple of the Ancestor Moths
kbs.description: an extensive, well-guarded monastery, in the far northeast of Cyrodiil, beyond Cheydinhal

kbs.name: Savilla's Stone
kbs.description: a large crystal with special properties

plots: retired, blind Moth priests go to die in the Temple of the Ancestor Moths
the Gray Fox will mark the location of the Temple of the Ancestor Moths on the player's map
the player must not kill innocents: however, there is no bloodprice for slaying the stone's guardians

quest.title: Turning a Blind Eye
quest.objective: return to the Gray Fox with Savilla's Stone
tasks: Find your way to Temple of the Ancestor Moths.
steal Savilla's Stone
return to the Gray Fox with Savilla's Stone
quest.description:
I have need of your special gifts. There is an item, hidden away in a remote monastery. I need you to go get it for me.
The monastery is extensive and well guarded, so you should make sure to be well prepared. Should you succeed, I will pay you well for your services.
The monastery is called the Temple of the Ancestor Moths. It is where retired, blind Moth priests go to wait out the rest of their days. I will mark the location on your map. Look for it in the far northeast of Cyrodiil, beyond Cheydinhal.
I need you to acquire Savilla's Stone. It is a large crystal with special properties that I need to gain... advantage. Remember, do not shed innocent blood. However, there is no bloodprice for slaying the stone's guardians, human or inhuman. When I receive word that Savilla's Stone is missing, I will be here waiting for you.

kbs.name: Jorundr
kbs.description: a male thief, and Arnora Auria's ex-boyfriend

plots: Jorundr and Arnora Auria have had a rocky relationship: Jorundr and Arnora Auria committed petty crimes all over Cyrodiil
Jorundr started to take risks and began robbing more dangerous targets
Arnora Auria got afraid of Jorundr

Jorundr and Arnora Auria's last score was a tax shipment being delivered to the Imperial City: Jorundr killed a guard and he was captured by the Bruma guard two days later at Jorundr and Arnora Auria's makeshift campsite
Jorundr had moved the stolen gold away from the campsite

quest.title: Two Sides of the Coin
quest.objective: find out where Jorundr and Arnora Auria's stolen gold is hidden
tasks: Make your way to Bruma Castle Dungeons.
speak to Jorundr
find out where Jorundr and Arnora Auria's stolen gold is hidden
quest.description:
Here's the deal. Jorundr and I have had a rocky relationship at best.
Against my will, I've been dragged all over Cyrodiil helping him commit petty crimes. I wouldn't say we're thieves. I mean, we've stolen things... sure. But we've never stolen that much at one time. Just enough to keep us going. That is, until last year.
Jorundr started to take risks and began robbing more dangerous targets. Not just lone merchants, mind you. I'm talking about the bigger scores. Like estates and tax shipments. I begged him to stop, as I knew that his capers would one day lead to violence. He just threatened to... hurt me if I got in his way. I think the gold changed him. I really do. He wasn't the man I met seven years ago. The few times I tried to say something, he'd strike me or push me away. I began to become frightened of him.
Our last score was a tax shipment being delivered to the Imperial City. We robbed it, and in the midst of the chaos, Jorundr killed a guard. I was mortified. We snatched up the gold and holed up in the mountains. He said if I breathed a word of the murder to anyone, he'd kill me. I was terrified of him at this point. Two days later, the Bruma City Guard traced us to our makeshift campsite. I was off gathering food, but Jorundr was captured. Served him right. When I went back to the site later, the gold was gone! He'd moved it! What I need you to do is go to the Bruma Castle Dungeons and speak to him for me. Convince him to tell you where the gold is and then we split it.

kbs.name: Modryn Oreyn
kbs.description: the player's superior in the Fighters Guild

kbs.name: Viranus Donton
kbs.description: the son of the guildleader of the Fighters Guild

plots: Modryn Oreyn sent Viranus Donton and some other Fighters Guild members on a troll killing mission to Forsaken Mine: Modryn Oreyn felt that they were up to the task

quest.title: Trolls of Forsaken Mine
quest.objective: find out what happened at Forsaken Mine and report back to Modryn Oreyn
tasks: Arrive at Forsaken Mine.
find Viranus Donton and other Fighters Guild members who went missing
find out what happened at Forsaken Mine and report back to Modryn Oreyn
quest.description:
I have got another job for you. It's a sensitive one. I need you to find Viranus Donton.
I sent him on a mission to Forsaken Mine. He and some others were supposed to clear the place of trolls. Haven't heard back from them in days. I want you to go check it out. I don't need to tell you how sensitive a matter this is.
We'd been contracted to clear the place of trolls. It was a tough job, but I felt the men I sent were up to it. I want to know what happened.
Get moving, and report back to me as soon as possible.

kbs.name: Gray Fox
kbs.description: a legendary thief, and the player's guildmaster at the Thieves Guild

kbs.name: Old Way
kbs.description: an old escape route of Imperial Emperors

kbs.name: Elder Scrolls
kbs.description: mystical scrolls that simultaneously archive both past and future events, the Gray Fox needs one

kbs.name: Savilla's Stone
kbs.description: a stone that reveals secrets to its fielder

kbs.name: Boots of Springheel Jak
kbs.description: boots that allow the player to leap to unreachable places, they also protect the player from long falls

kbs.name: Arrow of Extrication
kbs.description: an item needed to unlock the final door

plots: the Gray Fox has worked for eleven years planning this final heist: Savilla's Stone provided the last bit of information he needed
the Elder Scrolls are kept in the Imperial Palace behind a door that cannot be breached: the player will take the Old Way instead
the Gray Fox gives the player the key for the gate to the section of the sewers housing the Old Way
the Gray Fox gives the player the Boots of Springheel Jak, and the Arrow of Extrication: the player needs them to overcome the obstacles in the Old Way
in the reading room, the blind priests will deliver a scroll to the player thinking that the player is Celia Camoran if the player does not speak to them
the Gray Fox will pay the bloodprice for anyone the player kills during this heist, but he cannot stop the Watch from putting a price on the player's head
the Gray Fox has written the player a book with instructions

quest.title: The Ultimate Heist
quest.objective: steal one of the Elder Scrolls from the Imperial Palace
tasks: Reach Imperial Sewers.
Travel to Imperial Palace.
locate the Old Way and use it to travel to the Imperial Palace
find the reading room
steal one of the Elder Scrolls from the Imperial Palace
quest.description:
This is the big one. This is the heist that will be written about and talked about for decades to come. We are going to steal one of the Elder Scrolls from the Imperial Palace. Are you ready for this challenge?
There is no buyer. This is for glory, not for money. Our names will become legend. I also have a personal need for this particular scroll. As for your compensation, I ask you to trust me. If my plan works, you will get a reward worth far more than mere money.
I have worked for eleven years planning this heist. Savilla's Stone provided the last bit of information I needed. The Elder Scrolls are kept in the Imperial Palace behind a door that cannot be breached. Savilla's Stone has revealed a path around this door. You will have to travel the Old Way. Once used as an escape route for Imperial Emperors, it has been forgotten for centuries.
The Old Way can be found in the Imperial Sewers. Here is the key for the gate to that section of the sewers. My scrying with Savilla's Stone has provided clues, but not the details. I know the tools you will need there, but not the obstacles themselves. The Boots of Springheel Jak will allow you to leap to an unreachable place. They will also protect you from a long fall. The Arrow of Extrication is the only way to unlock the final door. Take them both.
Once you are inside the Palace itself, you need to find the reading room. The blind priests will deliver a scroll to you there. I arranged for the notable Celia Camoran to want to read a particular Elder Scroll. Don't ask how. However, she will be... unavoidably detained. You will take her place. Do not speak to the priests. They are blindfolded and will not realize it isn't her unless you speak. As the guildmaster, I am waiving bloodprice for anyone you kill during this heist. However, I can't stop the Watch from putting a price on your head.
I have written it all down for you in this book. I've chosen you because you are the best. Good luck.

kbs.name: S'Krivva
kbs.description: the player's superior in the Thieves Guild

kbs.name: Gray Fox
kbs.description: the guildmaster of the Thieves Guild

kbs.name: Hieronymus Lex
kbs.description: a guard who has made things difficult for the Thieves Guild

kbs.name: Lady Umbranox
kbs.description: a noblewoman ruling over Anvil, an Umbranox

plots: the Gray Fox has asked that the player does this personally, as this is a delicate matter
Lady Umbranox is looking for a new guard captain: the Legion Commander of the Imperial Watch sent her a list of guard captain candidates
Dairihill lied to Lady Umbranox, telling her that the list has yet to arrive
the Gray Fox has extended his protection to the Umbranox family and Lady Umbranox in particular: Hieronymus Lex's unwavering loyalty and resolve make him the perfect protector for Lady Umbranox

quest.title: Taking Care of Lex
quest.objective: get Hieronymus Lex reassigned as the captain of the guard in Anvil
tasks: Reach Anvil.
Make your way to Imperial City Prison.
steal the list of guard captain candidates from Dairihill's desk
find a forger to make a forgery of the candidate list
sneak into the Legion Commander's office and seal the forged letter with his seal
deliver the letter to Lady Umbranox in person
get Hieronymus Lex reassigned as the captain of the guard in Anvil
quest.description:
S'Krivva gives you greeting. Hieronymus Lex must be eliminated once and for all. The Gray Fox has asked that you do this personally. It is a most delicate matter.
Lady Umbranox of Anvil, is hunting for a new captain of her guard. The Legion Commander of the Imperial Watch sent her a list of candidates. The Gray Fox wants this list replaced with one that highly recommends Hieronymus Lex. From Anvil he can do little harm to the guild. The letter carrying the list is currently in steward Dairihill's desk. She has lied to Lady Umbranox, telling her that the letter has yet to arrive.
For reasons unknown to this one, the Gray Fox has extended his protection to the Umbranox family and Lady Umbranox in particular. While Lex is a problem for the guild, his unwavering loyalty and resolve make him the perfect protector for Lady Umbranox.
You will have to track down a forger on your own. I don't know of any in Bravil. With the forged letter in hand, sneak into the Legion Commander's office in the Imperial City Prison and seal it with his seal. Dairihill cannot be trusted. You must deliver the letter to Lady Umbranox in person.
Remember, this is a mission of stealth, not blood. Your payment will be higher than normal to cover the expense of the forgery.

kbs.name: Slythe Seringi
kbs.description: a worried man, giving quest via "Slythe's Journal"

kbs.name: Sandstone Cavern
kbs.description: the offering place of the Sunken One

kbs.name: Sunken One, He Who Shakes The Ground

plots: Kvatch was destroyed because they did not heed Slythe Seringi's warning about the Sunken One
Slythe Seringi has gone to give an offering to the Sunken One so that he does not sack any other cities: Anvil, Chorrol, the Imperial City

quest.title: The Sunken One
quest.objective: investigate the Sunken One
tasks: Make your way to Sandstone Cavern.
find Slythe Seringi
investigate the Sunken One
quest.description:
Slythe's Journal
by Slythe Seringi

As midnight approaches, I still watch the fires burn. The great city of man, Kvatch, lay in ruins. They didn't heed my words. They didn't listen to my voice. Now, they are all paying the cost of ignorance. The Sunken One strikes swift and hard. He swats those who oppose Him as if they did not exist at all. The excuses of man fall upon deaf ears. The Sunken One has no pity; He has no mercy, He only sits below and passes sentence. And now, with a mighty stroke, He's toppled one of man's pitiful blights on His land. And yet, He still hungers. His appetite is voracious. Kvatch will not be the last city to fall by His hand. The world of man grows more and more corrupt, and it angers Him. Man's lies and deceit will be his undoing as The Sunken One grows impatient and no longer waits for or accepts the proper offering.
The burden is mine to shoulder. I am the last who knows of He Who Shakes The Ground. If I do not bring him the Offering, who knows what city may fall prey to his whim? Anvil? Chorrol? Or perhaps He will turn his eyes on the greatest boil of all, the great Imperial City itself. No, I must not let that happen. I must get the Offering to him like my father did before me. Man may be fallen in His eyes, but they must have time to learn The Sunken One's teachings. Destroying man now would be a waste, when I am certain that given the chance, they will come to see His ways. Yes, I will do this thing. I will brave the depths of Sandstone Cavern to see Him. My weapons will be my will and my word. The Sunken One will watch over me and guide me. I must depart soon, before it is too late. If anyone finds this journal, let them know that I, Slythe Seringi, do this for the good of all man.

kbs.name: Vicente Valtieri
kbs.description: the player's superior at the Dark Brotherhood

kbs.name: Languorwine
kbs.description: a rare poison, one drop in bloodstream will mimic the effects of death immediately

plots: Francois Motierre is waiting for the player inside his house: the player should not kill him
Francois Motierre's debtors have sent an enforcer to kill him
Vicente Valtieri gives the player a knife: the blade has been coated with Languorwine, and there's only enough Languorwine for slicing Francois Motierre
Vicente Valtieri will give the player a vial of antidote, which will be used to revive Francois Motierre after the player successfully stages his death

quest.title: The Assassinated Man
quest.objective: help Francois Motierre fake his death to escape his debts
tasks: Make your way to Chorrol.
break into Francois Motierre's house
help Francois Motierre fake his death to escape his debts
quest.description:
I, Vicente Valtieri, have a special contract that needs fulfillment. In truth. I don't wish to offer it to any other guild member. I've come to rely on your abilities.
We're usually called upon to take a life, but not this time. This contract requires us to stage the assassination of a marked man.
You must go to the city of Chorrol and break into the house of Francois Motierre. Inside you will find Motierre waiting for you. Do not kill him! You see, Francois Motierre is a marked man. He owes a considerable sum to the wrong kind of people. So, they have sent an enforcer to kill him. This is an unusual contract, Motierre had to make a special arrangement with us before it was approved. I trust in your professionalism.
Here, take this knife. The blade has been coated with a rare poison called Languorwine. One drop in a normal human bloodstream will mimic the effects of death immediately. I will provide you with a vial of antidote, which will be used to revive Francois Motierre after you successfully stage his death. You should also know that there's only enough Languorwine on the blade for this one contract. After Motierre is sliced, the knife will be useless.
As payment, I'll be pleased to award you this amulet, Cruelty's Heart.

kbs.name: Azzan
kbs.description: the player's superior at the Fighters Guild

plots: Azzan only has one more contract for the player

quest.title: The Stone of St. Alessia
quest.objective: return the stolen Stone of St. Alessia to the Bruma Chapel
tasks: Travel to Bruma.
talk to Cirroc
return the stolen Stone of St. Alessia to the Bruma Chapel
quest.description:
I've only got one more thing on my plate for you, but it's an important one. The Stone of St. Alessia has been stolen from the Bruma Chapel.
I don't know if you're religious, but a lot of folks are, and the Stone is important. Talk to Cirroc in Bruma. He'll fill you in on the details.

plots: Henantier and Kud-Ei were study-mates at the Arcane University
Henantier gets into trouble because of his careless experiments: Kud-Ei fears that Henantier has done this again
Henantier is trapped and there is no way Kud-Ei can free him

quest.title: Through A Nightmare, Darkly
quest.objective: help Kud-Ei save her friend Henantier
tasks: follow Kud-Ei to Henantier
help Kud-Ei save her friend Henantier
quest.description:
Kud-Ei. I don't suppose you could help me locate my friend Henantier could you? If you find him, I'll be glad to offer you a sizable reward.
I miss Henantier so. We were study-mates at the Arcane University and we've come to grow fond of each other over the years. He's always getting himself into jams with the careless ways he performs his experiments, and well, I'm afraid he's done it again.
I'm going to level with you, as you seem like you wish to help. Henantier isn't missing. On the contrary, I know exactly where he is. The problem is he's trapped and there's no way I can free him.
Follow me. We aren't going far, so no need to prepare for a long journey. In fact, Henantier's still in town. More I can't say aloud without risk of others hearing.

kbs.name: S'Drassa
kbs.description: an evoker and alchemist, and a member of the Mages Guild

kbs.name: Arcane University
kbs.description: an university for mages in the Imperial City

kbs.name: Julienne Fanis
kbs.description: the female head of the Alchemy Headquarters

kbs.name: Garridan's Tears
kbs.description: magical crystals called Tears, frozen tears of Garridan Stalrous

plots: Julienne Fanis can tell the player more about Garridan's Tears

quest.title: Tears of the Savior
quest.objective: find as many Garridan's Tears for S'Drassa as possible
tasks: Reach Arcane University.
talk to Julienne Fanis
find as many Garridan's Tears for S'Drassa as possible
quest.description:
S'Drassa of the Mages Guild. Evoker and Alchemist. Could you assist me in acquiring something for my crystal collection?
I'm searching for some specific crystals known as Garridan's Tears. I want you to bring me as many of Garridan's Tears as you can find. If you do, I will pay you a fair bounty in gold for each one. I confess I have a weakness for crystals of a magical nature, and I must add these to my collection. This is a personal errand, you must understand. Just between you and I. The Mages Guild has nothing to do with it.
The Tears are not just a namesake. They're literally the frozen tears of a knight named Garridan Stalrous who lived many years ago. I'm not certain what happened to the knight, or why the tears were frozen, but I do know someone you could ask. Seek out Julienne Fanis at the Arcane University in the Imperial City. She oversees the Alchemy Headquarters there. If anyone can help you get more information on about these crystals, she can.

plots: the player told Gruiand Garrana that they want to better themselves

quest.title: Speechcraft Training
quest.objective: do a task for Gruiand Garrana and return to her afterwards
tasks: Travel to all cities in Cyrodiil.
speak to all beggars
do a task for Gruiand Garrana and return to her afterwards
quest.description:
I am Gruiand Garrana. You would seek to better yourself?
First, I would ask that you look to the poor and the suffering around Cyrodiil. Travel to all of our cities, and speak with the unfortunate souls forced to beg for change. Look into their hearts, and then look into your own.
Return to me when you have spoken with all of them. Then we shall talk of training.

kbs.name: Steffan
kbs.description: a male gate guard who has seen the spies

kbs.name: Captain Burd
kbs.description: a male captain of the guard

plots: the gate guards have reported seeing strangers on the road for the past several nights: Jauffre cannot leave Cloud Ruler undefended while his men search the whole mountainside
Jauffre has asked the Countess of Bruma to have the guard keep an eye out for strangers

quest.title: Spies
quest.objective: track down the spies, kill them and find out what they know
tasks: Proceed to Bruma.
talk to Steffan
talk to Captain Burd
track down the spies, kill them and find out what they know
quest.description:
I hope you can help. The gate guards have reported seeing strangers on the road for the past several nights.
I cannot leave Cloud Ruler undefended while my men search the whole mountainside, but these spies must be eliminated. Talk to Steffan. He can tell you where he has seen them. Captain Burd in Bruma may also be able to help. I've asked the authorities of Bruma to have the guard keep an eye out for strangers.
Track down the spies and kill them. Find out what they know, and what they're planning, if possible.

plots: the player told Marana Rian that they want training

quest.title: Sneak Training
quest.objective: get training from Marana Rian
tasks: steal a coin from Marana Rian
get training from Marana Rian
quest.description:
You seek training? From me? A few too many loose lips, it seems. It's not something I want to be public knowledge, if you understand my meaning. Very well.
Simple task for you. I just dropped a favorite coin of mine into my pocket. If you can steal it from me, I'll train you.

kbs.name: Flowing Bowl
kbs.description: a seedy tavern in Anvil, located outside the city walls near the waterfront

plots: Gogan was robbed by the all-female gang: Maelona's family heirloom was among the things that the gang took from him
the city guard have not done much about the all-female gang: the men they rob are too embarrassed to report the gang

quest.title: The Siren's Deception
quest.objective: get Maelona's family heirloom back from an all-female gang of thieves that prey on the married men of Anvil
tasks: Find your way to Flowing Bowl.
find leads about the all-female gang
get Maelona's family heirloom back from an all-female gang of thieves that prey on the married men of Anvil
quest.description:
I'm Maelona. How would you like to get my husband, Gogan, out of hot water?
Believe me, he'll need all the help he can get to worm his way out of this one. To think he'd fall for the gang's scheme... agh! I could kill him! I'm sorry... I'm rambling and got you confused. Let me explain.
The women in the gang use their wiles to lure men out to some remote location and rob them blind. It's been going on for some time now. The city guard hasn't done very much about it, because frankly, the men who are robbed are so embarrassed, they don't want to report it. Take for example that good-for-nothing husband of mine, Gogan. He cared more about their charms than my own.
When Gogan was, uh... with the women, they took something quite valuable from him. No... it's not what you're thinking. He was carrying a precious family heirloom with him when he was lured out to their lair. It was a small ring given to him on our wedding day. The ring belonged to my mother, and has been in the family for generations. I'm willing to give you all the money I have to get it back. 100 gold. Can you help us?
All I can tell you is that the best place to start is at The Flowing Bowl. It's a tavern located outside the city walls near the waterfront. The Flowing Bowl attracts the worst Anvil has to offer. Always be on your guard.

kbs.name: Weatherleah
kbs.description: a farmhouse built by Albert Jemane, in the middle of nowhere

kbs.name: Albert Jemane
kbs.description: the dead father of the Jemane brothers, and a former professional thief employed by Fathis Ules' organization

plots: the player has recently escorted the two Jemane brothers back to Weatherleah
Albert Jemane was supposed to obtain a valuable item for Fathis Ules, but he kept it for himself
Albert Jemane fled from Chorrol with his family to wilderness, and was never heard from again: only his small son Reynald was found
Albert Jemane kept the item in Weatherleah, but Weatherleah was ransacked by ogres: they took the item

quest.title: Sins of the Father
quest.objective: recover an item stolen by Albert Jemane from ogres
tasks: Reach Redguard Valley.
find the item in a troll lair
recover an item stolen by Albert Jemane from ogres
quest.description:
Fathis Ules. I may have a bit of a proposition for you involving the Jemane family you so recently assisted.
It was kind of you to escort the Jemanes back to Weatherleah. However, their father, the original owner of Weatherleah left them an even greater legacy.
My tale actually begins with the father, Albert Jemane. He was once in my employ, or should I say the employ of my organization. He was very good at obtaining things from people who did not want to part with. A professional thief, to put it bluntly. He was assigned to obtain a very valuable item for me. He succeeded, but decided to keep this item for himself. An unfortunate decision.
Albert Jemane fled from Chorrol with his family, and was never heard from again. Only his small son Reynald was found, wandering alone in the wilderness. Naturally, my associates and I believed he had perished. The wilderness is, after all, a dangerous place. No place to take your family. Then, these many years later, voila! The brother reappears. It seems the rest of the family did not die in the wilderness after all.
What is the point of my tale? Albert Jemane builds Weatherleah way out in the middle of nowhere. He was a thief, not a farmer. The only reason to establish such a place would be to stay out of the Chorrol Guard's sight. I believe that the item Albert stole, which rightly belongs to me, was hidden at Weatherleah. Unfortunately, the notorious Redguard Valley Ogres ransacked the place and probably took all of the loot back with them.
If you were to obtain this item, somehow, and bring it to me, I would pay you very well for it.

kbs.name: Reynald Jemane
kbs.description: an annoyed man, drinking his sorrows away

plots: Reynald Jemane has never been to Cheydinhal

quest.title: Separated at Birth
quest.objective: investigate the rumors about another Reynald Jemane in Cheydinhal
tasks: Proceed to Cheydinhal.
find the person whose impersonating Reynald Jemane and tell him to stop
investigate the rumors about another Reynald Jemane in Cheydinhal
quest.description:
If I've told you once, I've told you a thousand times. I've NEVER been to Cheydinhal! I... oh, hang on. You're someone else. Apologies, my good friend, I mistook you for someone else. Always being asked about it, I am. 'Didn't I see you in Cheydinhal?', they say. Well I'm sick of it. Sick and tired, tired and sick. And perhaps a little drunk. But never mind. You look like the honest sort, so I've a job for you.
You're going to travel to Cheydinhal, and find out what sort of impostor is trying to besmirch my good name. And you're going to tell him... *hic*... You're going to tell him I am quite capable of besmirching my good name on my own. He should cease and desist immediately. There's fifty gold pieces in it for you, friend...

kbs.name: Sheogorath
kbs.description: the prince of madness, one of the Daedric Princes

plots: the player summoned Sheogorath
Sheogorath wants to make Border Watch an interesting place
the people of Border Watch are superstitious

quest.title: Entertaining Sheogorath
quest.objective: find a way to make the first two parts of the K'Sharra come true
tasks: Go to Border Watch.
ask about the K'Sharra from the shaman
find a way to make the first two parts of the K'Sharra come true
quest.description:
Another mortal dares to summon me, Sheogorath, and already I am bored. But enough about me. Let's talk about you.
I could turn you into a goat. Or a puddle. Or a bad idea. I could make you eat your own fingers. Or fall in love with a cloud. Perhaps I could make you into something useful. Let's find out.
There's a little settlement called Border Watch. It's a nice, peaceful place... and dull, dull, dull. You're going to make their lives interesting. They're a superstitious bunch. Everything is an omen or a portent. Let's make one come true. Find their shaman and ask about the K'Sharra prophecy. You are to find a way to make the first two parts of the prophecy come true. I'll take care of the rest, because it's the most fun. Now, run along.

kbs.name: Herminia Cinna's home, in the Imperial City, the Elven Gardens district
kbs.description: Herminia Cinna's home, in the Imperial City, the Elven Gardens district

kbs.name: Herminia Cinna
kbs.description: a female collector of Ayleid artifacts, and a rival to Umbacano
relations: Herminia Cinna's home, in the Imperial City, the Elven Gardens district

plots: the player has obtained Ayleid artifacts for Umbacano before
Herminia Cinna refuses to sell the Crown of Nenalata to Umbacano
Umbacano needs to go to Nenalata in order to bring his research on the last king of the Ayleids to its final stage

quest.title: Secrets of the Ayleids
quest.objective: escort Umbacano to the Throne Room of Nenalata
tasks: Go to Herminia Cinna's home, in the Imperial City, the Elven Gardens district.
try to buy the Crown of Nenalata from Herminia Cinna
escort Umbacano to the Throne Room of Nenalata
quest.description:
I have another job for you. This is not quite in your usual line of work, but I hope you can help me just the same.
A rival collector has an item, the Crown of Nenalata, which I very much want to add to my collection. But she stubbornly refuses to consider any of my offers. She and I have had our differences over the years, I admit. Now she is taking this opportunity to get her revenge. I believe that you may be able to persuade her to part with the item, where I cannot due to her prejudice against me. Her name is Herminia Cinna. She lives here in the Imperial City, in the Elven Gardens district.
I hope you will succeed where I have so far failed. Afterwards, in order to bring my research on the last king of the Ayleids to its final stage, I need to go to the Throne Room of Nenalata. While I am not without means of defending myself, I believe you would be an invaluable companion on such an expedition. Your reward will be whatever plunder you wish to carry off from Nenalata. Since the Throne Room has been sealed since the time of the Ayleids, it should provide rich pickings.

plots: the player asked J'baana to train them in lockpicking

quest.title: Lockpicking Training
quest.objective: get the message to J'baana from S'Krivva
tasks: Proceed to Bravil.
speak with S'Krivva
get the message to J'baana from S'Krivva
quest.description:
Do you have business with me, J'baana?
You ask me to train you in lockpicking? How very arrogant of you. To think that I would aid you out of the kindness of my heart?
Since you are here, and since you want something, you are useful to me. Travel to Bravil, and speak with S'Krivva. She should have a message for me.
Until you have the message from S'Krivva, we have nothing further to say to one another.

kbs.name: Vicente Valtieri
kbs.description: the player's superior at the guild of assassins

kbs.name: Imperial Prison
kbs.description: a prison where the player was imprisoned in the past

kbs.name: Valen Dreth
kbs.description: a male Dark Elf, and a frail prisoner of many years

plots: just outside of the Imperial Prison is a grating that leads to the sewers: it has recently been tightly locked, but Vicente Valtieri will provide a key

quest.title: Scheduled for Execution
quest.objective: assassinate Valen Dreth in the Imperial Prison
tasks: Reach Imperial City's sewers.
infiltrate the Imperial Prison via a set of secret tunnels
assassinate Valen Dreth in the Imperial Prison
quest.description:
Back for more? It just so happens I have another contract available, one that requires an expert in infiltration.
Ever broken out of jail? How do you feel about breaking into one? The Imperial Prison, to be exact. We need a prisoner... silenced. Can you do it?
Your target is a Dark Elf named Valen Dreth. He thinks he's safe in prison. He is tragically mistaken. A prisoner recently escaped from the prison, using a set of secret tunnels connecting to the Imperial City's sewer system. It's a perfect way inside. Just outside of the Imperial Prison is a grating that leads to the sewers. It has recently been tightly locked, but I will provide a key. It should be easy enough to locate Dreth in his small cell. Besides, I think you know the way, hmmm. He he he he he.
Valen Dreth has been imprisoned for many years. His tongue is sharp, but his body is limp and frail. He will prove an easy, pleasurable kill. You will receive a bonus if you fulfill the contract without killing any of the prison guards. Now go, and may the Night Mother go with you.

kbs.name: Seed-Neeus
kbs.description: a worried mother, and a trader

kbs.name: Hackdirt
kbs.description: an isolated village, south of Chorrol

kbs.name: Blossom
kbs.description: Dar-Ma's beloved female horse, whom Dar-Ma would never abandon

plots: Dar-Ma was supposed to make a delivery to Etira Moslin, because Seed-Neeus was not feeling well
Dar-Ma went with Blossom

quest.title: A Shadow Over Hackdirt
quest.objective: find Dar-Ma
tasks: Make your way to Hackdirt.
find clues about Dar-Ma's whereabouts from Etira Moslin
find Dar-Ma
quest.description:
I'm Seed-Neeus. I don't mean to impose, but I'm hoping you can help me. My daughter, Dar-Ma is missing and I don't know what to do.
Dar-Ma never came back from Hackdirt. I'm dreadfully worried something may have happened to her. Can you help?
Dar-Ma was supposed to make a delivery to Etira Moslin in Hackdirt, so I would start there. Hackdirt is a rather isolated village, south of Chorrol. We do some business with the trader there. Small volume, but she pays well. Normally I make the deliveries, but I wasn't feeling well so Dar-Ma insisted on going this time. In case it may be useful, she was with Blossom -- her horse, I mean. Dar-Ma loves that animal, and would never willingly abandon her.
If you find my daughter, you have my friendship and gratitude to the end of my days!

kbs.name: Sanguine
kbs.description: the lord of revelry, one of the Daedric Princes

kbs.name: Countess
kbs.description: the somber noblewoman who rules over Castle Leyawiin

plots: the player has summoned Sanguine
the Countess is hosting a dinner party
Sanguine gives the player a spell: the player should use it on the Countess and her guests to liven up the dinner party
the dinner party is invitation only

quest.title: Sanguine, the Party Prince
quest.objective: crash a dinner party at Castle Leyawiin and play a prank on the guests
tasks: Head to Castle Leyawiin.
find a way in to the dinner party
crash a dinner party at Castle Leyawiin and play a prank on the guests
quest.description:
Ah... another mortal come to beg Sanguine to add a bit of spice to an otherwise drab existence. I would have you perform a service for me.
The Castle Leyawiin is a dull, dreary place. The mistress is an especially somber soul, and tomorrow she will hold another excruciating dinner party. I want you to liven it up. Use this spell on the Countess and her guests. I think it will make the party much more interesting. You should probably try to be inconspicuous. Or they might kill you. Oh, and the party is by invitation only. You'll have to find a way in.
Have fun!

kbs.name: Daravyn the Gray
kbs.description: a thief hiding from the guards, giving quest via "Long Forgotten Note"

kbs.name: Delgariun
kbs.description: a man who betrayed Daravyn the Gray

kbs.name: riddle, "Two bodies have I, though both joined in one. The more I stand still, the quicker I run."
kbs.description: riddle, "Two bodies have I, though both joined in one. The more I stand still, the quicker I run."

plots: "Long Forgotten Note" is addressed to Daravyn the Gray's fiancée
Daravyn the Gray escaped from the prison in the Imperial City

quest.title: The Rosethorn Cache
quest.objective: find Daravyn the Gray's hidden treasure
tasks: Go to Rosethorn Hall.
solve the riddle that takes you to the treasure
find Daravyn the Gray's hidden treasure
quest.description:
Long Forgotten Note
by Daravyn the Gray

My love,
I write this with trembling hands. The guards are after me, and I have nowhere else to turn. Soon they will be at the doors to Rosethorn Hall, and nothing will keep them from taking me away back to that horrible prison. I don't know how they found me; perhaps it was that traitor, Delgariun. Whoever told them I was hiding in your home must have known both of us very well. I know Delgariun has eyes for you, I know he's the one that framed me in the first place and had me sent to that dank hole in the Imperial City. He has to be the one. Beware of him, my love. He's treacherous and only wants you to get to the treasure. I didn't give it up to the guards, and I won't give it up to Delgariun. I've hidden the treasure within the walls of Rosethorn Hall. Remember the toy we played with as we ran through this place as children?
Remember the riddle we had for it? It was our secret code: "Two bodies have I, though both joined in one. The more I stand still, the quicker I run."
The key to the treasure lies with the answer. Take care of it, my love. It is your ticket far from Delgariun. Do not fret, I've escaped once, I shall do so again. Soon we will be together, and the sun will shine upon us.
Daravyn the Gray

kbs.name: Shadeleaf Copse
kbs.description: a part of the Great Forest northeast of here

kbs.name: Elixir of Exploration
kbs.description: a multi-purpose potion for dungeon explorers

plots: the player has brought Sinderion a sample of Nirnroot for examination
the Elixir of Exploration requires Nirnroot
the formula for the Elixir of Exploration describes many magnitudes of the brew: Sinderion wrote a short missive about it for the Imperial Alchemy Symposium

quest.title: Seeking Your Roots
quest.objective: collect more Nirnroot
tasks: Head to Shadeleaf Copse.
collect 10 samples of Nirnroot for Sinderion
collect more Nirnroot
quest.description:
So, you've brought something for me to examine?
Yes, this is a genuine Nirnroot sample. Very nice quality in fact. Hmmm... that gives me an idea. Since you already know what they look like, do you feel up to a bit of a collecting expedition?
A few years ago, an adventurer not unlike yourself sold me a musty old tome containing alchemical formulas. Most of them were worthless. But one of the moldy pages contained the recipe for a potion known as an Elixir of Exploration, a sort of "ultimate dungeon delver's" brew. The formula looked sound, except it required an extremely rare ingredient. Yes, you guessed it, the Nirnroot. I put the book aside, because frankly, I had so many other delicate experiments going on that I just didn't have the time to go plant hunting. Now that you're here, that changes things.
The Elixir of Exploration is a multi-purpose potion that was obviously created with the dungeon explorer in mind. The formula describes many magnitudes of the brew. If you're interested, I wrote a short missive about it for the Imperial Alchemy Symposium. You bring me 10 samples of Nirnroot, and I'll make the Elixir of Exploration available to you at a huge discount as well as give you one for free.
The best place for you to start would be Shadeleaf Copse, which is a part of the Great Forest northeast of here. Good luck, and hurry back with more of the Nirnroot!

plots: goblins killed Kayleen while Corrick Northwode was away on business

quest.title: Revenge Served Cold
quest.objective: find Kayleen's jade amulet that was stolen by goblins, and bring it back to Corrick Northwode
tasks: Proceed to Exhausted Mine.
avenge Kayleen by killing the goblins that killed her
find Kayleen's jade amulet that was stolen by goblins, and bring it back to Corrick Northwode
quest.description:
Please... I implore you, help me, Corrick Northwode, avenge my wife's death!
Barely a week ago, I left Harm's Folly to go buy supplies as I usually do once a month. What a fool I was to leave my wife alone. The goblins must have been watching me, as they knew right when to strike. I could hear her screams from far away. Those wretched beasts killed her! Filthy animals! Had I only been there to stop them!
I'll tell you how you can help. Go to Exhausted Mine. Kill those goblins. Every last one of them! They destroyed everything I hold dear! In their greed, the creatures grabbed a jade amulet off of Kayleen's... body. Bring me back that amulet, so I may use it to remember her by.
Please, I'll give you six gems as a token of my gratitude. They're all I have left of value, but you must have them if you do the deed.

kbs.name: Teinaava
kbs.description: a fellow member of the Dark Brotherhood, and a Shadowscale

kbs.name: Bogwater
kbs.description: a swamp far south of here, on the southern end of Cyrodiil

kbs.name: Ocheeva
kbs.description: Teinaava's sister, a fellow member of the Dark Brotherhood, and a Shadowscale

kbs.name: Scar-Tail
kbs.description: an Argonian Shadowscale, Ocheeva and Teinaava's childhood friend, and a royal assassin of Black Marsh who escaped his duties

plots: Teinaava needs help with a personal matter
just as a member of the Dark Brotherhood cannot kill a fellow family member, a Shadowscale is forbidden from slaying another Shadowscale

quest.title: The Renegade Shadowscale
quest.objective: bring back Scar-Tail's heart as proof for Teinaava
tasks: Make your way to Bogwater.
assassinate Scar-Tail
bring back Scar-Tail's heart as proof for Teinaava
quest.description:
Ah, dear friend, may I steal a moment of your time? I have a rather delicate situation I was hoping you could help me with. This is a personal matter, and will have no bearing on your standing within the Dark Brotherhood. Would you like to hear more?
Now, the details. Far south of here, on the southern end of Cyrodiil, lies a swamp called Bogwater. Hiding in that swamp you will find an Argonian Shadowscale named Scar-Tail. Kill this renegade. and bring me his heart as proof of the deed.
I have some history with Scar-Tail. When Ocheeva and I trained with the Dark Brotherhood as children, we befriended another initiate, a Shadowscale by the name of Scar-Tail. The three of us were inseparable. When our training was completed, we reluctantly parted ways. But now... Now, the unthinkable has happened! Scar-Tail has fled Black Marsh and refuses to fulfill his duties as royal assassin! This is an act of treason! This treachery must be punished! Just as a member of the Dark Brotherhood cannot kill a fellow family member, a Shadowscale is forbidden from slaying another Shadowscale. That is why you must go to Bogwater and eliminate that treacherous snake!
Please kill Scar-Tail, so Ocheeva and I can put this matter behind us.

plots: the player seeks restoration training from Oleta

quest.title: Restoration Training
quest.objective: receive restoration training from Oleta
tasks: save Kvatch from Daedra
receive restoration training from Oleta
quest.description:
Greetings, traveler. You would seek restoration training from me?
Your courage is admirable, but now is not the time. Once Kvatch is safe from these attackers, then we might speak of training.
While Daedra still roam free in Kvatch, I can think of nothing else. When my city is safe, then I will train you.

kbs.name: Azzan
kbs.description: the player's superior in the Fighters Guild

plots: the player has requested their first contract from Azzan

quest.title: A Rat Problem
quest.objective: take care of the rat problem, and return to Azzan
tasks: talk to Arvena Thelas about the rat problem in her house
take care of the rat problem, and return to Azzan
quest.description:
A contract for you? I, Azzan, think I've got something that suits your experience. Arvena Thelas has some problem with rats in her house.
As I said, rats. I'm sure she can explain it to you better than I. She lives here in Anvil. Go and talk to her.
Go take care of the rats. Then talk to me. Good luck!

kbs.name: Thadon
kbs.description: Duke of Mania, a Felldew addict

kbs.name: Chalice of Reversal
kbs.description: a chalice that makes the world a much brighter and happier place after eating Felldew

plots: Thadon is inebriated from withdrawal effects of Felldew

quest.title: Addiction
quest.objective: return the Chalice of Reversal to Thadon
tasks: find the Chalice of Reversal
return the Chalice of Reversal to Thadon
quest.description:
Ahh yes, THERE you are! You couldn't imagine how long I, Thadon, the Duke of Mania, have been waiting for you. So little to do, and so much time. Hmm, could you, in fact, imagine just how long I've been waiting? I don't think you could, but I might be wrong.
It felt like rather a long time, but then long times get longer when you're standing around thinking about them. A curious thing, that. Long roads get longer too, if you're thinking about them, but what about long words? They don't change nearly as much. Long, short -- it all ends up the same. Dust and tears. Usually tears first, then the dust. Dust can't cry, you see. That would be... well, amusing. You know what's NOT amusing? I don't have my Chalice of Reversal. It makes me sad. When I get sad, I don't care to do much of anything. I certainly don't care to help people who show up on my doorstep wanting something. Are we getting the picture here?
The Chalice of Reversal is one of my favorite toys. Does wonders for creativity. Well, not by itself, but it helps. Is this making sense? Look, you eat the Felldew, then use the chalice, and find the world a much brighter and happier place. Honest. But I don't have it. So I can't eat Felldew, because that would just be bad. I mean, really bad. Find my chalice!

kbs.name: Peryite
kbs.description: the lord of natural order, one of the Daedric Princes

plots: the player has found Peryite's shrine that is filled with Peryite's paralyzed followers: Peryite's worshipers cast a spell in the hopes of summoning Peryite and got trapped between worlds
Peryite will transport the player to the plane of Oblivion in which his worshipers are trapped: when the player has collected the worshipers' souls, Peryite will return the player here

quest.title: Peryite's Foolish Followers
quest.objective: rescue the souls of Peryite's worshipers from Oblivion
tasks: Proceed to Realm of Peryite.
enter the plane of Oblivion where Peryite's worshipers' souls are trapped
rescue the souls of Peryite's worshipers from Oblivion
quest.description:
This one moves! A welcome change. So, mortal, you have found my shrine, and you have seen my followers. They are an embarrassment to me, Peryite.
The fools cast a spell in the hopes of summoning me to them. It was prideful and foolish, and it has had its consequences. My followers are trapped between worlds; their bodies here on this plane, their souls in Oblivion. I would have you reunite the bodies and the souls.
I will transport you to the plane of Oblivion in which they are trapped. Find their souls. When all are collected, I will return you here.
You shall have Spell Breaker, with my blessing. May it bring you order.

kbs.name: Ocheeva
kbs.description: the player's superior at the Dark Brotherhood

kbs.name: Adamus Phillida
kbs.description: a recently retired Imperial Legion officer who spent his entire career investigating the Dark Brotherhood, and a powerful man
relations: Leyawiin, in the City Watch barracks

kbs.name: Leyawiin, in the City Watch barracks
kbs.description: Leyawiin, in the City Watch barracks

kbs.name: Rose of Sithis
kbs.description: a magic arrow specifically enchanted to kill its target, cannot pierce armor

plots: the Black Hand has sanctioned the Rose of Sithis against Adamus Phillida

quest.title: Permanent Retirement
quest.objective: assassinate Adamus Phillida when he is out of his Legion armor with or without the Rose of Sithis
tasks: Proceed to Leyawiin.
find Adamus Phillida
assassinate Adamus Phillida when he is out of his Legion armor with or without the Rose of Sithis
quest.description:
I have another assassination contract for you.
Do you recall the name Adamus Phillida? The Imperial Legion pest? It's time he joined Death in the Void. Think you're up to the task?
Adamus Phillida has spent his entire career investigating the Dark Brotherhood, interrupting our contracts, killing our family members! We tried to eliminate Phillida, of course, but failed on three separate occasions. He's a powerful man, and was surrounded by powerful associates. Now the Legion's pig's years of service have come to an end. He has retired. Phillida must not be allowed such a victory! His destiny is... darker. Phillida now resides in Leyawiin, in the City Watch barracks, an honored guest of the soldiers there. He is, in fact, more vulnerable than ever.
The Black Hand has sanctioned the Rose of Sithis. It is a magic arrow specifically enchanted to kill its target. In this case, Phillida. As long as the arrow hits Phillida, he will die. But it cannot pierce armor! Shoot while Phillida is armored, and the Rose will be wasted. Travel to Leyawiin. Track Phillida. Learn his schedule. Observe when he removes that blasted Legion armor! And then, let fly the Rose of Sithis! Kill Phillida in any way, Rose or not, and the contract is complete. But to receive a bonus, you must go beyond murder. You must send a message! Once Phillida is dead, take the very finger from his corpse, the one that bears an Imperial Legion signet ring! Deposit this finger in the desk of Phillida's successor, in his office in the Prison Barracks, in the Imperial City! Do this, and the bonus is yours.

kbs.name: Lucien Lachance
kbs.description: the Speaker for the Black Hand, and the player's superior in the Dark Brotherhood, giving quest via "Orders"

kbs.name: Fort Farragut
kbs.description: Lucien Lachance's private refuge, a ruined fort located in the forest northeast of the Cheydinhal Sanctuary

kbs.name: Cheydinhal Sanctuary
kbs.description: one of the guildhalls of the Dark Brotherhood

kbs.name: Ocheeva
kbs.description: the leader of the Cheydinhal Sanctuary

plots: "Orders" is addressed toward the player: the player is an Eliminator
the player should not share the contents of this message with anyone at the Cheydinhal Sanctuary, including Ocheeva, and make no mention of their journey to Fort Farragut
Fort Farragut is guarded by rotting sentinels who will attack any interlopers on sight

quest.title: A Prelude to the End
quest.objective: put a stop to the unseen powers that are unraveling the very fabric of the Dark Brotherhood
tasks: discuss your special assignment with Lucien Lachance
put a stop to the unseen powers that are unraveling the very fabric of the Dark Brotherhood
quest.description:
Orders
by Lucien Lachance

Eliminator,
You have served the Dark Brotherhood well in the short time you have been with us. Indeed, the rate of your advancement has been rather remarkable. Now the Black Hand itself is in need of your abilities.
You must proceed with all haste to my private refuge in the ruins of Fort Farragut, located in the forest northeast of the Cheydinhal Sanctuary. When you arrive, we will discuss the nature of your special assignment.
I cannot stress to you enough the importance of your swift arrival at Fort Farragut. There are unseen powers working to unravel the very fabric of the Dark Brotherhood. The Black Hand is counting on you to prevent this disaster.
Do not share the contents of this message with anyone at the Cheydinhal Sanctuary, including Ocheeva, and make no mention of your journey to Fort Farragut! Also, be warned -- my refuge within Fort Farragut is guarded by denizens who will attack any interloper on sight. Get through these rotting sentinels and you will surely have earned the right to visit my private sanctum.
Lucien Lachance

kbs.name: Mankar Camoran
kbs.description: a dangerous man, and the player's enemy

plots: Martin has everything in place for the Mysterium Xarxes: Martin will open the portal whenever the player is ready
the portal Martin creates through the Mysterium Xarxes will close behind the player: the player will have to find another way back
Mankar Camoran acts as the "anchor" for Paradise, just as a sigil stone anchors an Oblivion Gate in place

quest.title: Paradise
quest.objective: kill Mankar Camoran to unmake his Paradise, and retrieve the Amulet of Kings
tasks: travel through Martin's portal to Mankar Camoran's Paradise
kill Mankar Camoran to unmake his Paradise, and retrieve the Amulet of Kings
quest.description:
I have everything in place for the ritual. I'll open the portal whenever you're ready. I don't know what you'll find in Camoran's Paradise. I do know the portal I create through the Mysterium Xarxes ritual will close behind you. You'll have to find another way back.
I believe that Mankar Camoran acts as the "anchor" for Paradise, just as a sigil stone anchors an Oblivion Gate in place. Kill Mankar Camoran, and you will unmake his Paradise.
Farewell, my friend. Our fate is in your hands. Bring back the Amulet of Kings. Brace yourself.

kbs.name: Crowhaven
kbs.description: a ruined fort far to the west of the Imperial City, and Agronak gro-Malog's birthplace

kbs.name: Lord Lovidicus
kbs.description: a nobleman, and Agronak gro-Malog's father

kbs.name: Lady Lovidicus
kbs.description: a noblewoman, the wife of Lord Lovidicus

plots: Agronak gro-Malog's mother fled with Agronak gro-Malog from the wrath of Lady Lovidicus
Agronak gro-Malog's mother gave Agronak gro-Malog a key to Crowhaven to "unlock the truth" before dying

quest.title: Origin of the Gray Prince
quest.objective: find proof of Agronak gro-Malog's noble birthright
tasks: Make your way to Crowhaven.
travel to the place of Agronak gro-Malog's birth
find proof of Agronak gro-Malog's noble birthright
quest.description:
Hail, friend. I don't believe I've ever seen you down here in the Bloodworks before. Allow me to introduce myself. My name is Agronak gro-Malog.
I grew up here in the Imperial City, but I was born elsewhere. My mother was a servant in the employ of Lord Lovidicus, and resided at his fortress. Lady Lovidicus was a shrew of a woman. The Lord and my mother grew close, and ultimately fell in love. I was the result of their union. When the Lady learned of my birth she was furious, and threatened to kill both my mother and me. So we fled, leaving my claim to nobility behind.
My mother died recently. Before she passed, she gave me this key, and told me it would "unlock the truth," at the place of my birth, Crowhaven. Crowhaven is a ruined fort far to the west of here. I'd go myself, but my training regiment doesn't allow for the luxury of such an excursion.
My friend, you must travel to Crowhaven and use the key to unlock whatever it is that holds the proof of my birthright! Find this proof and return it to me, and I'll share with you some of my finest combat techniques. Trust me, you can't learn these moves in a book!

kbs.name: Lucien Lachance
kbs.description: the player's superior in the Dark Brotherhood

kbs.name: Cheydinhal Sanctuary
kbs.description: a hideout belonging to the Dark Brotherhood

kbs.name: Ocheeva, Vicente Valtieri, Antoinetta Marie, Gogron gro-Bolmog, Telaendril, M'raaj-Dar, Teinaava
kbs.description: fellow members of the Dark Brotherhood

kbs.name: Sithis
kbs.description: the dark god of the Dark Brotherhood

plots: the player is an assassin of the Dark Brotherhood: Lucien Lachance has not spoken to the player in a while
the Black Hand has learned that the Dark Brotherhood has been infiltrated: the player is not suspected, because they joined the Dark Brotherhood after the traitor became active
from this point forward, the player is no longer bound by the Five Tenets: Sithis will forgive any murder, any theft, so long as the player serves the Black Hand
Lucien Lachance gives the player a poisoned apple and a unique scroll of summoning

quest.title: The Purification
quest.objective: perform the ancient rite known as Purification by killing everyone at the Cheydinhal Sanctuary, and return to Lucien Lachance
tasks: Head to Cheydinhal Sanctuary.
assassinate Ocheeva, Vicente Valtieri, Antoinetta Marie, Gogron gro-Bolmog, Telaendril, M'raaj-Dar and Teinaava
perform the ancient rite known as Purification by killing everyone at the Cheydinhal Sanctuary, and return to Lucien Lachance
quest.description:
I have been waiting for you, assassin. We have not spoken in some time, but I am well aware of your accomplishments within the Dark Brotherhood. That is why I have sent for you. I'm afraid there is a... situation.
The time has come to test both your skill and your loyalty to Sithis. The Black Hand has learned that the Dark Brotherhood has been infiltrated. By whom, and for what purpose, we do not yet know. What we do know is that there is some link between the traitor and the Cheydinhal Sanctuary. The traitor has tainted that place beyond repair. It was learned that the traitor has been active for quite some time, since before you joined the Brotherhood. That absolves you of any suspicion.
The Black Hand has chosen you to perform the ancient rite known as Purification. Everyone inside the Sanctuary must die! You must break one of the Tenets you have sworn to uphold. I know this is an unexpected turn of events, but drastic measures must be taken. Ocheeva, Vicente Valtieri, Antoinetta Marie, Gogron gro-Bolmog, Telaendril, M'raaj-Dar and Teinaava. All of these family members must die! From this point forward, you are no longer bound by the Five Tenets! Sithis will forgive any murder, any theft, so long as you serve the Black Hand!
When the rite of Purification has been completed, return to me here at Fort Farragut, and we will discuss your future. Now, take these special gifts. They will help you greatly. One is a poisoned apple. The other, a unique scroll of summoning. Good luck... assassin.

kbs.name: Seridur
kbs.description: an elderly vampire hunter, and the leader of the Order of the Virtuous Blood
relations: the sanctuary of the Order of the Virtuous Blood in the Imperial City

kbs.name: the sanctuary of the Order of the Virtuous Blood in the Imperial City
kbs.description: the sanctuary of the Order of the Virtuous Blood in the Imperial City
relations: Roland Jenseric's house in the Temple District of the Imperial City

kbs.name: Roland Jenseric's house in the Temple District of the Imperial City
kbs.description: Roland Jenseric's house in the Temple District of the Imperial City

kbs.name: Roland Jenseric
relations: Roland Jenseric's house in the Temple District of the Imperial City

plots: the player is a famous hero: the player has not met Seridur before
Seridur and his fellow vampire hunters are only 3 old men lacking the strength to defeat vampires in battle
Roland killed his girlfriend in the back garden of his house by sucking her blood out of her neck
the player should return to the sanctuary of the Order of the Virtuous Blood if they have questions: the Order of the Virtuous Blood meet at night

quest.title: Order of the Virtuous Blood
quest.objective: kill Roland Jenseric
tasks: Travel to Roland Jenseric's house in the Temple District of the Imperial City.
search for clues about Roland Jenseric's whereabouts
kill Roland Jenseric
quest.description:
It's an honor to finally meet you. When I heard you were in town, I just had to send for your help. Your reputation precedes you. Oh, allow me to introduce myself. I am Seridur.
Welcome. You're now in the sanctuary of the Order of the Virtuous Blood. Few outside our circle have ever set foot in our hallowed hall. We are, for lack of a better word, defenders. We guard this city from an infestation that plagues it. We are vampire hunters. I'm sure you are familiar with those despicable beings. Feeding on the innocent as if they were cattle. Well, this group was formed to combat them. Alas, we are but 3 old men, not able to match the fighting prowess of the vampire. We lack the strength to defeat them in battle.
Our goal is to root out the vampires that live in our fair city. So far, we've been unsuccessful finding one until now. It's come to the Order's attention that Temple District resident Roland Jenseric is a vampire, and has already claimed one victim. That's where you come in. We want you to slay this vampire and cleanse the city of his filth before he can feed or kill again.
A few nights ago, I was roaming the city as I often do, looking for any signs of a vampire. As I headed past Roland's house I heard a cry. I rushed into the back garden to find Roland struggling with a woman he'd been courting. I tried to intervene, but he was too strong. He threw his lover to the ground and turned his attention on me. Luckily, I managed to run back into the street and escape his grasp. I hid for a while and then returned to the garden. Roland was gone and the woman was dead. She had two puncture marks on the nape of her neck. That's when I realized he was a vampire. The Order needs you to track him and destroy him.
I would start by searching his home. He hasn't been there for days, so it should be safe. Return to us here if you have questions. We meet at night.

kbs.name: Great Chapel of Julianos
relations: outside Glarthir's house in Skingrad at 6 am

kbs.name: outside Glarthir's house in Skingrad at 6 am
kbs.description: outside Glarthir's house in Skingrad at 6 am

kbs.name: Bernadette Peneles
kbs.description: a woman who has been kind to Glarthir

plots: the player came to meet with Glarthir
Glarthir thinks that everyone in Skingrad is watching him
the player should not contact Glarthir in public

quest.title: Paranoia
quest.objective: check out some people for Glarthir
tasks: Travel to outside Glarthir's house in Skingrad at 6 am.
see where Bernadette Peneles goes and what she does
meet Glarthir again tomorrow night
check out some people for Glarthir
quest.description:
Ah, you came. You're sure you weren't followed? Good, I thought I could trust you. Nobody else in town.
They're all in on it ... all watching me. Well. Yes. I need you to do something for me. I'll pay you -- gold. You like gold, don't you? Lots of gold.
Here's my problem. I'm being followed. Watched. Marukhati Selectives, maybe. Not sure. I'm a threat, you see? To their plans. I know too much. I need you to check out some people for me, the ones that are following me. Watch them, see where they go, who they report to. Will you help me?
Today I caught Bernadette Peneles watching me. I have very little doubt now that she is one of them. This saddens me. I had thought her one of the few to show me kindness in this nest of treachery. But now it seems that it was all a lie.
Be outside my house at 6 am, you'll see her watching me. See where she goes and who she reports to. We'll meet here again tomorrow night. Oh, and NEVER contact me in public. They're watching. They can't know you're helping me.

kbs.name: High Fane
kbs.description: an ancient Ayleid settlement known by a different name today

plots: the player has obtained artifacts for Umbacano before
Umbacano gives the player a sketch depicting the High Fane: the High Fane dates from the Late Ayleid Period, following the fall of White Gold Tower
the drawing on the bottom of the page Umbacano gave the player depicts a carved panel from the central chamber of the High Fane
Umbacano gives the player the key to the inner chamber of the High Fane

quest.title: Nothing You Can Possess
quest.objective: retrieve a decorative carving from the High Fane for Umbacano
tasks: locate the ruins of the High Fane
retrieve a decorative carving from the High Fane for Umbacano
quest.description:
You have proven yourself more than a simple grave robber. I believe you can handle a more complicated assignment. Are you interested?
Here, take a look at this sketch. The ancient texts refer to this site only as the "High Fane." Do you know it? Your first task is to locate the ruins of the High Fane. I believe it must now be known by a different name.
The High Fane dates from the Late Ayleid Period, following the fall of White Gold Tower, a very troubled time for that ancient people. A time I find most fascinating. The drawing on the bottom of the page I gave you depicts a carved panel from the central chamber of the High Fane. I believe this carving will shed new light on Ayleid history, if I am able to examine it closely. I would like you to retrieve it for me.
You will need this as well. It is the key to the inner chamber of the High Fane. I part with it reluctantly, so guard it well. It is what began my search for the High Fane, many years ago.

kbs.name: Nocturnal
kbs.description: the mistress of shadows, one of the Daedric Princes

plots: the Eye was stolen from its shrine and hid in dark waters

quest.title: Nocturnal's Missing Eye
quest.objective: bring Nocturnal's Eye back to Nocturnal
tasks: Head to Leyawiin.
recover Nocturnal's Eye from Argonians
bring Nocturnal's Eye back to Nocturnal
quest.description:
Night among strangers. Secrets in the dark. Nocturnal is here.
But my Eye is blind and drowned, stolen from its shrine, and hid in dark waters. To steal from a god is most unwise. In Leyawiin, two Argonians think themselves secret, but the Eye has seen them.
Find these thieves in the city that spans the waters. Learn where they hide my Eye. Retrieve the Eye of Nocturnal, mortal, and return it to me, and I shall look favorably upon you.
You, mortal, may take this Skeleton Key upon your return. It shall open the secrets of dark places for you.

kbs.name: Welkynd Stones
kbs.description: aquamarine colored crystals native to Ayleid ruins

plots: Lithnilian is the first to discover Welkynd Stones growing in a natural cave

quest.title: No Stone Unturned
quest.objective: help Lithnilian recover his research notes
tasks: Make your way to Bramblepoint Cave.
find Lithnilian's research notes
help Lithnilian recover his research notes
quest.description:
Ten years of research down the drain!
I've been studying the Welkynd Stones. Yes, the aquamarine colored crystals usually native to Ayleid ruins. It seems I'm the first to discover them growing in a natural cave. That's about all I can say about it.
I don't suppose I could convince you to help me recover my research notes? I was doing some research in Bramblepoint Cave, and suddenly I was attacked. I grabbed everything I could and ran, but I fear I dropped my notes. Those notes are very important to me and represent ten years of my life. If you could recover them, I'd be sure to reward you appropriately with some potent potions.

kbs.name: Arch-Mage Traven
kbs.description: the player's guildleader in the Mages Guild

kbs.name: Arcane University
kbs.description: a school of mages in the Imperial City

kbs.name: Caranya
kbs.description: a female mage, eager to explore the powers of the Necromancer's Amulet

kbs.name: King of Worms
kbs.description: the male leader of the Necromancers

kbs.name: Necromancer's Amulet
kbs.description: a dangerous amulet, one of the relics of Necromancers

plots: Caranya removed the Necromancer's Amulet from the Arcane University
Caranya is not safe from the minions of the King of Worms

quest.title: The Necromancer's Amulet
quest.objective: return the Necromancer's Amulet to the Arcane University
tasks: Go to Fort Ontus.
get the Necromancer's Amulet from Caranya
return the Necromancer's Amulet to the Arcane University
quest.description:
Caranya insisted on removing the Necromancer's Amulet from the Arcane University. She said it posed a threat to the safety of the Imperial City.
While I do not doubt that Caranya was right, I question whether her motives were genuine. She seemed all too eager to explore its power. I fear she is not safe from the minions of the King of Worms.
Caranya is at Fort Ontus; please, go there and return with the Amulet. Help her to see that she should not use the weapons of the enemy, especially out of fear.

kbs.name: Lucien Lachance
kbs.description: a fellow assassin, giving quest via "Dead Drop Orders #2"

kbs.name: Matthias Draconis, Andreas Draconis, Sibylla Draconis, Caelia Draconis
kbs.description: the rest of the Draconis, the children of Perennia Draconis

plots: "Dead Drop Orders #2" is addressed toward the player: the player is a Silencer
the player killed Celedaen in the player's previous assignment

quest.title: Next of Kin
quest.objective: assassinate all five members of the Draconis
tasks: Travel to Applewatch.
get the locations of other Draconis from Perennia Draconis, and assassinate her
assassinate all five members of the Draconis
quest.description:
Dead Drop Orders #2
by Lucien Lachance

The Necromancer Celedaen is dead, and you are not. That is quite an accomplishment. But your work as a Silencer has just begun.
Your next assignment requires you to eliminate not just one target, but five. An entire family, in fact. The unlucky kin are Perennia Draconis, Matthias Draconis, Andreas Draconis, Sibylla Draconis and Caelia Draconis. The locations of most of the family members are unknown, so you should begin your search with the family matron, Perennia, who resides at the farm called Applewatch.
You must discern the locations of all the Draconis family members and then systematically eliminate them. I suggest you first speak with the mother and find out if she has any valuable information on the whereabouts of her children, before ending her life.
When every member of the Draconis family lies dead, journey to the city of Skingrad. In the castle courtyard you will find a well containing your reward for the Draconis contract, as well any further assignment I might have.

kbs.name: Azzan
kbs.description: the player's superior in the Fighters Guild

kbs.name: Maglir
kbs.description: a fellow new recruit in the Fighters Guild

plots: the player has caught thieves for Azzan before
the player has met Maglir

quest.title: Den of Thieves
quest.objective: get rid of the gang of thieves that has thieved around Anvil
tasks: Find your way to near Anvil.
track down the gang of thieves with Maglir
get rid of the gang of thieves that has thieved around Anvil
quest.description:
Greetings! Looking for some more work, are you?
Good to see you're working hard. I've got some more thieves for you to deal with in Anvil. There have been a number of thefts in the area, and witnesses believe the thieves are holed up nearby. Check around, and see what you can learn. I'm not sure the numbers you'll be dealing with, so I'm sending you with another new recruit. Maglir. I believe you two have already met.
Get moving. You need to get rid of those thieves.

kbs.name: Namira
kbs.description: the lady of decay, one of the Daedric Princes

kbs.name: Arkay
kbs.description: the god of the cycle of birth and death

plots: the player has approached Namira's shrine
Forgotten have lived in peace for many years worshiping Namira from the dark, basking in their misery and filth: priests of Arkay seek to bring light to the Forgotten's darkness

quest.title: Namira Versus the Priests of Arkay
quest.objective: assist Forgotten in eliminating some priests of Arkay
tasks: Go to Anga.
cast a spell Namira gives you upon the priests of Arkay, and let Forgotten kill the priests
assist Forgotten in eliminating some priests of Arkay
quest.description:
You dare approach Namira's shrine, Child of the Light? You, who walk this plane basking in the light of the warm, cruel sun?
Prove to me that you deserve my favor. In Anga, my Forgotten have lived in peace for many years. They worship me from the dark, basking in their misery and filth. Now, though, some would seek to bring light to their darkness.
Priests of Arkay have intruded upon their squalor. I want you to help my Forgotten kill these priests of the Light. Cast this spell upon the priests. Allow my beloved Forgotten to kill the interlopers. When this is done, I shall reward you for your efforts.
You shall have my ring. Let it bring pain to others who would wish it upon you.

plots: the player asked mysticism training from Dagail

quest.title: Mysticism Training
quest.objective: strengthen the barriers between the worlds
tasks: seal the portals to Oblivion
strengthen the barriers between the worlds
quest.description:
Training, child? You would know more about the mystic energies of the world around us?
The barriers between planes are weak. Do more to strengthen them; seal the portals to Oblivion. Then we shall speak of training.

kbs.name: Burz gro-Khash
kbs.description: the player's rude superior in the Fighters Guild

plots: Burz gro-Khash has one more contract for the player

quest.title: Mystery at Harlun's Watch
quest.objective: investigate the disappearances at Harlun's Watch
tasks: Travel to Harlun's Watch.
talk to Drarana Thelis for the details about the missing people
investigate the disappearances at Harlun's Watch
quest.description:
I've got one more contract for you, meat. I assume you can handle it. I need you to investigate some disappearances at Harlun's Watch.
We've been contracted to find out what's happened. Speak to Drarana Thelis for all the details.
Get going.

kbs.name: Raminus Polus
kbs.description: the player's superior in the Mages Guild

kbs.name: Tar-Meena
kbs.description: the Mages Guild's female specialist on magicka arcana

kbs.name: Arch-Mage
kbs.description: the guildleader of the Mages Guild

plots: Tar-Meena is reading about Necromancy, only stopping to sleep, at the Arch-Mage's request

quest.title: Necromancer's Moon
quest.objective: find information on Black Soul Gems, especially about their powers and creation
tasks: Proceed to Mystic Archives.
speak to Tar-Meena about Black Soul Gems
find information on Black Soul Gems, especially about their powers and creation
quest.description:
I'd like you to speak with Tar-Meena at the Mystic Archives. She is our specialist on magicka arcana, and has been helping gather information.
I believe we have been asking her the wrong questions, taxing her too much with vague attempts to make sense of all that we know. Speak with her specifically about these Black Soul Gems. If she knows anything about their powers or creation.
Her expertise in arcane knowledge and lore could be invaluable to us, if we can make proper use of it. She can likely be found in the Archives now, poring through materials on Necromancy. She stops only to sleep, at the Arch-Mage's request.

kbs.name: Ocheeva
kbs.description: the player's superior in the Dark Brotherhood

kbs.name: Imperial City
kbs.description: a large city with many districts

kbs.name: Faelian
kbs.description: a male high Elf, who fancies long walks, living somewhere in the Imperial City

kbs.name: Adamus Phillida
kbs.description: a male Imperial Legion captain, who has dedicated his life to eradicating the Dark Brotherhood

plots: finding Faelian will be challenging: the player should speak to their fellow Dark Brotherhood members for advice
Adamus Phillida does not tolerate Dark Brotherhood operations within the Imperial City

quest.title: The Lonely Wanderer
quest.objective: assassinate Faelian without attraction the attention of Adamus Phillida
tasks: Arrive at Imperial City.
find Faelian
assassinate Faelian without attraction the attention of Adamus Phillida
quest.description:
In the Imperial City there lives a High Elf who must be removed from existence. Finding this person may prove... challenging. Are you interested?
Your target is a High Elf named Faelian. He lives somewhere in the Imperial City, and fancies long walks. Unfortunately, that's all we know. We don't know which district he calls home, which establishments he frequents, or anything about his schedule.
This contract will require a bit of detective work. I suggest you to speak to your fellow Brothers and Sisters and see if they can offer any advice. Ah yes, there is one more thing. The Imperial City is also home to an Imperial Legion captain named Adamus Phillida. Phillida has dedicated his life to eradicating the Dark Brotherhood. He will not tolerate our operations within the Imperial City.
When that happens, he tends to make our lives uncomfortable. Let's not give the good captain any reason to go poking around in our affairs, hmm? If possible, do away with Faelian someplace out of the way. Definitely indoors, with no other people around. A secure location, with no witnesses. This will make it look like a simple murder. Phillida will be none the wiser, and you'll receive a nice bonus.
Now go, and may the Reaper of Souls go with you.

kbs.name: Modryn Oreyn
kbs.description: the player's superior in the Fighters Guild

kbs.name: Maglir
kbs.description: a man, and a fellow Fighters Guild member

plots: the player had to find Maglir before
Maglir had an easy contract for a local mage in Bravil: he has not reported to the client at all

quest.title: More Unfinished Business
quest.objective: make sure that Maglir's contract gets done, and send Maglir to Modryn Oreyn
tasks: Go to Bravil.
find Maglir, and find out why he has defaulted on yet another contract
make sure that Maglir's contract gets done, and send Maglir to Modryn Oreyn
quest.description:
I'm going to need you to find Maglir again. The little fetcher.
