The little vermin has defaulted on another contract. I need you to go babysit him again.
Wish I knew what happened. He had a contract for a local mage in Bravil. Didn't seem like a particularly difficult assignment. He hasn't reported to the client at all. Get yourself down to Bravil and find Maglir.
Make sure that contract of his gets done. And send him to me.

kbs.name: Molag Bal
kbs.description: the tormentor of men, one of the Daedric Princes

plots: the player has summoned Molag Bal
Melus Petilius has sworn an oath to never to raise a weapon against another man again: Molag Bal wants Melus Petilius to break his oath
Molag Bal will save the player's life when Melus Petilius kills the player

quest.title: Molag Bal's Dark Bidding
quest.objective: goad Melus Petilius into killing you with the Cursed Mace
tasks: Find your way to near Brindle Home.
find Melus Petilius
goad Melus Petilius into killing you with the Cursed Mace
quest.description:
Another mortal come to do my bidding. I, Molag Bal, only wish suffering and death. You will bring me both. I want to see a man brought to the edge. And pushed.
Near Brindle Home you will find Melus Petilius. A good man. An honorable man. He disgusts me. He has sworn an oath: never to raise a weapon against another man again. I want him to break that oath, and damn himself forever.
You will let him kill you with this: the Cursed Mace. As you are doing this for me, I'll save your miserable life. Probably. Get out of my sight.

kbs.name: Miscarcand
kbs.description: the dangerous ruins of an Ayleid city

kbs.name: Great Welkynd Stone
kbs.description: the third item the player needs for the Mysterium Xarxes ritual, and a rare larger variant of Welkynd Stones valued by mages and occultists

plots: Martin has made some progress in deciphering the Mysterium Xarxes ritual while the player was gone
the player may have seen lesser Welkynd Stones: they are common in Ayleid ruins

quest.title: Miscarcand
quest.objective: recover a Great Welkynd Stone for Martin
tasks: Head to Miscarcand.
find a Great Welkynd Stone
recover a Great Welkynd Stone for Martin
quest.description:
While you were gone, I've made some progress in deciphering the Mysterium Xarxes ritual.
The third item we need is a Great Welkynd Stone. You may have run across lesser Welkynd Stones; they are fairly common in Ayleid ruins. But a Great Welkynd Stone will not be easy to come by. They have been plundered one by one over the years, due to their great value to mages and occultists.
There is only one place that is rumored to still contain one: the ruins of the Ayleid city of Miscarcand. A place where many have perished seeking its Great Welkynd Stone. But nothing else will do, so you must succeed where all others have failed.

kbs.name: S'Krivva
kbs.description: the player's superior in the Thieves Guild

kbs.name: Imperial City Waterfront
kbs.description: a poor district in the Imperial City

kbs.name: Methredhel
kbs.description: a fellow member of the Thieves Guild, a woman

kbs.name: Hieronymus Lex
kbs.description: the male captain of the Imperial Watch

kbs.name: Gray Fox
kbs.description: a legendary thief and defender of the poor, and the guildleader of the Thieves Guild

plots: Hieronymus Lex and the Imperial Watch have invaded the Imperial City Waterfront: Hieronymus Lex has vowed not to leave until the Gray Fox is in custody

quest.title: Misdirection
quest.objective: help the Thieves Guild get the Imperial City Waterfront back to normal
tasks: Proceed to Imperial City.
find Methredhel, who is co-ordinating the Thieves Guild's response
help the Thieves Guild get the Imperial City Waterfront back to normal
quest.description:
I have a small problem that you may be able to help with. The guild will even pay a reward.
That buffoon, Hieronymus Lex, has invaded the Imperial City Waterfront. Imperial Watch guards from all over the city prowl the streets. Hieronymus Lex has vowed not to leave until the Gray Fox is in custody. The Fox is safe, but the Thieves Guild cannot do business like this. The poor of the Waterfront are kindred to the Gray Fox, and will not betray him. However, cubs soon get hungry. Soon someone will break. Many guild members could be jailed.
Find Methredhel in the Imperial City. She is co-ordinating the guild's response. Shadow hide the hunter.

kbs.name: Meridia
kbs.description: the lady of light, one of the Daedric Princes

plots: the player has summoned Meridia by the detritus of the profane
Meridia hates the undead and necromancers

quest.title: Meridia Smites Necromancers
quest.objective: wipe out a band of necromancers
tasks: Reach Howling Cave.
find the necromancers
wipe out a band of necromancers
quest.description:
By the detritus of the profane, I am brought forth. And by your offering, you have made the profane your interest, mortal.
The undead are foul, unnatural things. Some of my rivals take pleasure in these abominations. Not Meridia. I wish these creatures destroyed. Hidden behind a door, deep in Howling Cave, are necromancers. They rob graves for the materials to raise their undead armies.
Find these necromancers. Destroy them and their abominations. Do this, and earn the gratitude of Meridia. You shall have the Ring of Khajiiti and go with my blessing.

plots: the player asked mercantile training from Palonirya

quest.title: Mercantile Training
quest.objective: prove to Palonirya that you have enough capital to receive her expertise
tasks: collect 10,000 Septims
prove to Palonirya that you have enough capital to receive her expertise
quest.description:
Training? Well, my dear, good business sense is just something that comes naturally to me. You've got to have the know-how, or else I can't teach you anything at all.
Do you have what it takes? Do you even know what it takes? Gold, that's what! Septims, and lots of them! Show me that you've got the starting capital, at least ten thousand in liquid assets.
Afterwards, I'll help you learn how to put it to good use.

kbs.name: Mazoga
kbs.description: an Orc woman who claims to be a knight

plots: the player does not know Marius Caro

quest.title: Mazoga the Orc
quest.objective: report to Marius Caro the reason Mazoga the Orc is in Leyawiin
tasks: find out why Mazoga the Orc is in Leyawiin
report to Marius Caro the reason Mazoga the Orc is in Leyawiin
quest.description:
Marius Caro, by grace of the Gods, Count of Leyawiin. You are a stranger to me, but well-met. Perhaps you would like to do a service for Leyawiin?
I need your help. An Orc named Mazoga here claims to be a knight, but will not reveal her business. Find out why she is here, and report to me, and you will earn a reward suitable for those who serve Leyawiin.

kbs.name: Lucien Lachance
kbs.description: the player's superior in the Dark Brotherhood, giving quest via "Dead Drop Orders #5"

kbs.name: Morrowind
kbs.description: a province far away from Cyrodiil

kbs.name: Stonewall Shields
kbs.description: a shop in the Market District of the Imperial City

kbs.name: Alval Uvani
kbs.description: a traveling male Dunmer merchant skilled in Destruction spells, a native of Morrowind

plots: the note is addressed toward the player: the player is the Silence of the Dark Brotherhood
the player assassinated Shaleez for Lucien Lachance
Alval Uvani is renting a house in Leyawiin
Alval Uvani's wife hired the Dark Brotherhood to kill her husband: the Morag Tong of Morrowind can't reach Alval Uvani in Cyrodiil
Alval Uvani suffers from a rare Dunmer condition, a serious allergy to honey: he would suffer from complete paralyzation after drinking honey-based mead

quest.title: A Matter of Honor
quest.objective: assassinate Alval Uvani
tasks: locate Alval Uvani with a schedule included in this dead drop
assassinate Alval Uvani
quest.description:
Dead Drop Orders #5
by Lucien Lachance

If you're reading this note, Shaleez is dead. You've done the world a great service, Silencer. It's time to continue the good work.
Your next target is a traveling Dark Elf merchant by the name of Alval Uvani, who is currently renting a house in the city of Leyawiin. Uvani is a well-respected tradesman back in his native Morrowind, but his business often takes him very far from home. Therein lies the problem. Alval Uvani's wife has become disillusioned with her husband's repeated, extended absences and wishes to dissolve their marriage, and has sought the Dark Brotherhood's assistance. Lucky for us Cyrodiil is a bit beyond the reach of Morrowind's Morag Tong.
Alval Uvani is currently traveling around Cyrodiil, and is never in one place for more than a couple of days. In this dead drop you will also find a schedule detailing the Dark Elf's whereabouts; use it to locate him and plan your elimination. Be aware, however, that because he is forced to travel alone to the farthest reaches of the Empire, Uvani has learned to defend himself. He is a master of the Destruction school of Magicka, and is no stranger to killing.
When Alval Uvani lies rotting, journey to the Market District of the Imperial City. There you will find a shop called Stonewall Shields. Your dead drop is located behind that building, in a hollowed-out tree stump. As usual, you will find your reward for the previous contract, as well as information on your next.
Ah yes, I must mention one last detail. Apparently Alval Uvani suffers from a rare Dark Elf condition, a serious allergy to honey. If you could somehow get Uvani to drink the honey-based mead, perhaps by replacing his food, he would suffer from complete paralyzation. This would certainly make the Dark Elf a bit easier to deal with.

kbs.name: Modryn Oreyn
kbs.description: the player's superior in the Fighters Guild

kbs.name: Galtus Previa
kbs.description: a fellow member of the Fighters Guild, a missing man

kbs.name: Viranus Donton
kbs.description: a fellow member of the Fighters Guild, Vilena Donton's son

kbs.name: Vilena Donton
kbs.description: the female guildmaster of the Fighters Guild, protective of Viranus Donton

kbs.name: Vitellus Donton
kbs.description: a fellow member of the Fighters Guild, Viranus Donton's older brother, Vilena Donton's eldest son

plots: Vitellus Donton was killed in action recently: the player may have seen the other wounded around

quest.title: The Master's Son
quest.objective: bolster Viranus Donton's confidence by find Galtus Previa in Nonwyll Cavern with Viranus Donton
tasks: Make your way to Donton house.
take Viranus Donton on a mission with you
bolster Viranus Donton's confidence by find Galtus Previa in Nonwyll Cavern with Viranus Donton
quest.description:
I've got another job for you, slightly off the record. You'll be going on a mission with Viranus Donton. Yes -- the guildmaster's son.
You're to accompany him, and make sure he succeeds. He needs some time in the field, to get his confidence up, or he'll never become a good warrior. Vilena coddles the boy too much. Doesn't want him in the line of fire. Suppose it's no surprise after Vitellus.
Vitellus was Vilena Donton's eldest son. Good man. We lost him on a botched mission recently. You've probably seen the other wounded around. If you're smart, you'll steer clear of the subject around the guildmaster. Perhaps you and I will have time to discuss it more later.
Viranus' mother's been holding him back, protecting him. You'll go to Nonwyll Cavern with him. Galtus Previa was lost there, and you're to find him. And not a word of this to the guildmaster! Go find him. He'll be in the Donton house, most likely. And bring him back in one piece!

kbs.name: Malacath
kbs.description: the lord of monsters, one of the Daedric Princes

plots: Lord Drad took Malacath's ogres: ogres are Malacath's little brothers
Lord Drad put Malacath's ogres in chains, working in the mines

quest.title: Malacath's Family of Monsters
quest.objective: rescue ogres from slavery under Lord Drad
tasks: Find your way to Lord Drad's estate.
let Malacath's ogres loose and get them out of Lord Drad's mines
rescue ogres from slavery under Lord Drad
quest.description:
You want something from Malacath? Then, if you're smart, you do what I tell you.
Lord Drad took my ogres. Says he owns them. Lying maggot! They're MY ogres! Lord Drad put my little brothers in chains, working in the mines. I don't like that.
Get over to Lord Drad's estate. Let my ogres loose, and get them out! Okay? Get going!
You get a present, Volendrung. Be nice to my little brothers!

plots: the player told Alawen that they want marksman training from her

quest.title: Marksman Training
quest.objective: receive training from Alawen
tasks: get an Elven Bow
receive training from Alawen
quest.description:
Why do you bother me, stranger? You make far too much noise.
You wish to learn? Hmm. You have potential, I see, but your equipment! A true marksman is only as good as his bow. When you have a good, solid Elven bow, then I shall teach you what you need to know.

kbs.name: Raminus Polus
kbs.description: the player's superior in the Mages Guild

plots: the player is an Associate of the Mages Guild
the player has been found guilty of theft: the player's Mages Guild privileges have been suspended

quest.title: Mages Guild Suspension
quest.objective: collect alchemy samples to regain your Mages Guild membership
tasks: deliver 20 Dragon's Tongue and 20 Redwort to Raminus Polus
collect alchemy samples to regain your Mages Guild membership
quest.description:
It is unfortunate that we should meet under these circumstances, Associate. You have been found guilty of theft. As such, your guild privileges have been suspended. If you wish to be reinstated, you must perform a service for the guild. Are you willing to do so?
Make no mistake: this task is simple, but has a purpose. In selflessly serving the guild, at risk to yourself, while putting your own feelings aside, you prove your devotion to the cause. You will help replenish alchemical supplies for the guild.
Deliver 20 Dragon's Tongue flowers, and 20 Redwort flowers to me. Surprised? Annoyed? It is not unexpected. Nevertheless, that is your path to re-acceptance in the guild.

kbs.name: Mephala, 'Webspinner'
kbs.description: the queen of lies, one of the Daedric Princes

plots: in Bleaker's Way, two families, Nord and Dunmer, live in perfect harmony
don't get caught or killed while starting the feud

quest.title: Mephala's Web of Lies
quest.objective: Start a feud between two prominent families
tasks: Head to Bleaker's Way.
kill the leaders of the two families and plant evidence to implicate the other family as the killer
Start a feud between two prominent families
quest.description:
I'm Mephala. Call me 'Webspinner'. Pluck but a single thread, and the weave unravels.
In Bleaker's Way, two families, Nord and Dunmer, live in perfect harmony. But beneath the surface lurks the secret seed of strife. Kill the leaders of the two families. Plant evidence to implicate the other family as the killer. And don't get caught. Be cunning. Don't spoil my scheme. And don't die... that would spoil everything. Ha-ha-ha-hah!
And there'll be a little needle to help you stitch your own tangled tapestries: the Ebony Blade.

kbs.name: Armand Christophe
kbs.description: a member of the Thieves Guild, and the Doyen of the Gray Fox

kbs.name: Gray Fox
kbs.description: the legendary guildleader of the Thieves Guild

plots: Armand Christophe is addressing the player, Methredhel, and Amusei
members of the Thieves Guild are followers of the Gray Fox: the one who wins the contest is allowed to join the Thieves Guild
the beggars will help the player locate Amantius Allectus's diary, for a price
Armand Christophe can sell the player lockpicks

quest.title: May the Best Thief Win
quest.objective: win the contest against Methredhel and Amusei
tasks: Head to Imperial City.
steal Amantius Allectus's diary without killing him, Methredhel, or Amusei
win the contest against Methredhel and Amusei
quest.description:
Everyone is here, let's begin.
Each of you is seeking membership in the Thieves Guild. The Thieves Guild is not a myth. We are followers of the Gray Fox, and I am his Doyen.
Merely by finding me, you have passed the first test. It's unusual for us to have three potential recruits at the same time. Rather than the normal test of skill, I'm going to make this a contest. Methredhel, you know the rules. However, for Amusei and the newcomer, let me state them clearly.
Whoever brings me the diary of Amantius Allectus, without killing him, will be invited into the guild. It's somewhere in the Imperial City. The beggars will help you locate it, for a price. I can sell you lockpicks if you need them.
One more thing. You cannot kill each other during this trial. We may be thieves, but we're not murderers.

kbs.name: Raminus Polus
kbs.description: the player's superior in the Mages Guild
relations: the grove, to the northeast of the Imperial City, near Wellspring Cave

kbs.name: the grove, to the northeast of the Imperial City, near Wellspring Cave
kbs.description: the grove, to the northeast of the Imperial City, near Wellspring Cave

kbs.name: Zahrasha
relations: the grove, to the northeast of the Imperial City, near Wellspring Cave

kbs.name: Eletta
relations: the grove, to the northeast of the Imperial City, near Wellspring Cave

plots: several mages tend the grove

quest.title: A Mage's Staff
quest.objective: complete your induction into the Mages Guild by creating your own staff
tasks: Arrive at the grove, to the northeast of the Imperial City, near Wellspring Cave.
speak to Zahrasha or Eletta, and choose wisely
complete your induction into the Mages Guild by creating your own staff
quest.description:
Before you can begin work for the guild, you'll need to do something for yourself. Every mage carries a staff. It is crafted and enchanted by the guild, and is a symbol of status. You need such a staff.
The wood used for staves comes from a grove to the northeast of the Imperial City, near Wellspring Cave. Several mages tend to the grove, and should be able to assist you. Speak with either Zahrasha or Eletta when you arrive.
And choose wisely.

kbs.name: J'bari
kbs.description: a master trainer in light armor

plots: the player told J'bari that they want light armor training from him

quest.title: Light Armor Training
quest.objective: give an unenchanted Elven cuirass to J'bari
tasks: get an unenchanted Elven cuirass
give an unenchanted Elven cuirass to J'bari
quest.description:
If you want training from me, you're going to have to get something for me first.
I need a new Elven cuirass. Nothing fancy, nothing enchanted. Just a decent piece of armor. You get that for me, and I'll train you. That's the deal.

kbs.name: Martin
kbs.description: the player's friend, and the future Emperor

kbs.name: Mankar Camoran
kbs.description: an evil man serving Mehrunes Dagon

kbs.name: High Chancellor Ocato
kbs.description: the head of the Elder Council

plots: Martin sent a messenger to High Chancellor Ocato while the player was killing Mankar Camoran
the Elder Council rules in the Emperor's absence: they should not object to crowning Martin the Emperor

quest.title: Light the Dragonfires
quest.objective: light the Dragonfires with Martin to close the Gates of Oblivion and stop Mehrunes Dagon's invasion
tasks: Reach Imperial City.
escort Martin to High Chancellor Ocato, who is waiting for you both
light the Dragonfires with Martin to close the Gates of Oblivion and stop Mehrunes Dagon's invasion
quest.description:
While you were gone, I sent a messenger to High Chancellor Ocato. He waits for us in the Imperial City.
Chancellor Ocato is the head of the Elder Council. The Council rules in the Emperor's absence. I don't expect any objections from the Elder Council, but we should defer to their authority.
Let's go to the Imperial City at once, before the enemy can recover from Mankar Camoran's death. Until we light the Dragonfires, the Gates are open, and Mehrunes Dagon's invasion continues.

kbs.name: Vangaril
kbs.description: an exiled mage, giving quest via "Weathered Journal"

kbs.name: Erandur
kbs.description: a male necromancer, Vangaril's friend who become a lich

plots: Erandur's necromantic studies got Erandur and Vangaril expelled from the Guild of Mages
Vangaril tried to get from the Guild of Mages after Erandur became a lich, but Vangaril was turned away: Vangaril went to face Erandur alone

quest.title: Lich of Lost Boy Caverns
quest.objective: follow the story of Vangaril trying to save Erandur from lichdom
tasks: explore the Lost Boy Caverns for more clues about the fate of Vangaril and Erandur
follow the story of Vangaril trying to save Erandur from lichdom
quest.description:
Weathered Journal
by Vangaril

Long have I sought to purge the evils haunting Erandur. Even when his necromantic studies resulted in our mutual expulsion from the Guild of Mages, I persisted in guiding him towards good with a gentle hand. Alas, in our exile, my old friend has mired himself in the foul practice, and in shocking discovery I learned he had become a miserly disciple of the Worm King, a cunning wraith. A Lich.
Frail memory strengthened by dogmatic resolve, the Archmages turned me away when I came to them with my discovery. My pleas for a detachment of battlemages ignored, only my long-past expulsion remembered. And thus, the grave duty falls only to me. I must bear the burden of purging the Lich that was once a friend.
I wander now into the foreboding maw of these catacombs known as the Lost Boy Caverns, far from the climes of common elves and men. With pure spirit and rites of cleansing, I hope to strike down the fearsome Lich and set free the soul of Erandur, but I leave this testament behind, lest I may never return from these depths; as a warning to those who may follow my path.
Faithful, even in Exile,
Vangaril

kbs.name: Agata
kbs.description: a young woman, whose heart is old and wise

plots: Dagail hears voices without her amulet

quest.title: Voices Without Bodies
quest.objective: help Dagail to find her amulet
tasks: seek Agata
help Dagail to find her amulet
quest.description:
You seek wisdom from me, child? Ah, no. You seek words of recommendation. Words are... difficult. They come and go. The voices, though. So loud they are, they drown out the words. Without my amulet, my stone to lock the voices away, the words will never come and stay. Would you lift your hands to help another, to help me find the words?
Seek Agata, child. She will see the path, and set you on it. She may be young, but her heart is old and wise. It guides her well through these troubled times.
I must rest.

kbs.name: Brugo
kbs.description: a male Orc who leads the Black Bow Bandits

plots: Mazoga might have had contacts with outlaws in her shadowy past

quest.title: Knights of the White Stallion
quest.objective: kill Black Brugo with Mazoga
tasks: ask Mazoga about locating Black Brugo
kill Black Brugo with Mazoga
quest.description:
You and Mazoga are to find and kill the leader of the Black Bow Bandits, the Orc named Brugo.
In her shadowy past, your friend Mazoga might have had contacts with outlaws. Ask her about locating Brugo and his Black Bow Bandits.
I have created a chivalric Order of the White Stallion. If you succeed, I will bestow on both you and Mazoga the titles of Knights-Errant of the White Stallion for your service to Leyawiin.

kbs.name: S'Krivva
kbs.description: the player's superior in the Thieves Guild

kbs.name: Theranis
kbs.description: a male cat burglar, and a fellow member of the Thieves Guild

kbs.name: Gray Fox
kbs.description: the leader of the Thieves Guild

plots: the Gray Fox himself hunts for the "Lost Histories of Tamriel"

quest.title: Lost Histories
quest.objective: help Theranis bring back the "Lost Histories of Tamriel", or bring it yourself if Theranis is unwilling or unable
tasks: Find your way to Skingrad.
find Theranis who was sent to find "Lost Histories of Tamriel"
help Theranis bring back the "Lost Histories of Tamriel", or bring it yourself if Theranis is unwilling or unable
quest.description:
We meet again. I have need of a very special book, the "Lost Histories of Tamriel".
The cat burglar Theranis was sent hunting in Skingrad for this book. However, Theranis has not been seen since. The Gray Fox himself hunts for this book.
I need you to find Theranis. Help Theranis bring back this book. If Theranis is unwilling or unable, bring back the book yourself.
Go to Skingrad. The trail starts there.

kbs.name: Weatherleah
kbs.description: the childhood home of Guilbert Jemane and Reynald Jemane, where no human has lived for years

kbs.name: Chorrol
relations: somewhere south of Chorrol, but southwest of Fort Carmala

kbs.name: somewhere south of Chorrol, but southwest of Fort Carmala
kbs.description: somewhere south of Chorrol, but southwest of Fort Carmala

plots: the player reunited Guilbert Jemane and Reynald Jemane
ogres attacked Weatherleah when Guilbert Jemane and Reynald Jemane were little children: Guilbert Jemane and Reynald Jemane's parents fled from Weatherleah
Guilbert Jemane and Reynald Jemane's father carried Guilbert Jemane to safety and later returned to Weatherleah believing Reynald Jemane and the boys' mother had perished
Guilbert Jemane and Reynald Jemane's mother carried Reynald to safety: their mother did not survive

quest.title: Legacy Lost
quest.objective: help Guilbert Jemane and Reynald Jemane recover Weatherleah
tasks: Head to somewhere south of Chorrol, but southwest of Fort Carmala.
find Weatherleah, and see if it is still inhabited by ogres
help Guilbert Jemane and Reynald Jemane recover Weatherleah
quest.description:
I can't thank you enough for helping to reunite me with Reynald. I never would have guessed he was still alive. We have much to discuss, but if you have time, I'd beg you stay a moment longer and hear about our home, Weatherleah.
Weatherleah was our family's home for generations. Our parents fled it when ogres attacked; they became separated. My father carried me to safety. He later returned and believed Reynald and my mother had perished. Since ogres are cannibals, he didn't expect to find their bodies. Thankfully, however, it seems that my mother managed to carry Reynald to safety. While my mother didn't survive, Reynald did, and for that I'm grateful.
But we both want more - we want our home back. We're not fighters; you appear to have more skill than either of us. Would you go to Weatherleah, and see if it's still inhabited by ogres?
Now, we're not quite sure where the estate is located. We'll offer up what we know, however. We believe it's somewhere south of Chorrol, but southwest of Fort Carmala. It may be difficult to find. Since no one's lived there for many years, it may be quite overgrown by now.
If you find Weatherleah, let us know. We'll be waiting anxiously.

kbs.name: Draconian Madstone
kbs.description: an Akaviri artifact, an amulet that protects its wearer from poisons of any type, looks like a snake coiled around and encircling itself: the eyes of the snake are precious gems

plots: the player has seen Akaviri relics displayed by Countess Narina Carvain
Countess Narina Carvain gives the player a translation of an Akaviri messenger's translated diary, a rough map and a unique key that may help the player in the ruins in Pale Pass

quest.title: Lifting the Vale
quest.objective: bring the Draconian Madstone to Countess Narina Carvain
tasks: Proceed to the ruins in Pale Pass.
find the Draconian Madstone
bring the Draconian Madstone to Countess Narina Carvain
quest.description:
Allow me to formally introduce myself. I'm Countess Narina Carvain. I assume you've noticed all of the Akaviri relics I'm displaying.
Well, it's safe to say I'm a collector of sorts. I've invested a great deal of time and money acquiring these bits of ancient history. In fact, I'd be so bold as to proclaim my collection the most complete in all Cyrodiil; perhaps even beyond. Except for one thing.
A particular relic has eluded me for many years. Possessing this piece of Akaviri antiquity would make my collection complete. I'm of course referring to The Draconian Madstone. The stone is a fine bit of Akaviri craftsmanship. Worn like an amulet, this talisman is said to protect the wearer from poisons of any type. The talisman appears as a snake coiled around and encircling itself. The eyes of the snake are supposed to be precious gems or some such. Through my sources, I've learned that the last reported location of the Draconian Madstone was the ruins at Pale Pass.
If you retrieve the Draconian Madstone for me, I'll be happy to compensate you by rewarding you with another Akaviri artifact. Are you in the game?
Let me tell you how you're going to find the talisman. I've come into the possession of a diary written by an Akaviri messenger. I suspect that the text within can lead you to the ruins. Here's a translation of the passages we could still read. It was quite damaged. I've also included a rough map that was drawn in the diary as well. I'm also providing you with a unique key that was supposedly found with the diary. I'm assuming it will prove useful when you arrive at the site.

kbs.name: Arch-Mage Traven
kbs.description: the player's guild leader in the Mages Guild

kbs.name: Nenyond Twyll
kbs.description: a Necromancer lair in ancient ruins, south of the Imperial City, south of the White Rose River, nearly halfway to the border of Elsweyr

kbs.name: Mucianus Allias
kbs.description: a male mage who infiltrated the Necromancers

kbs.name: Raminus
kbs.description: a male mage, the player's superior in the Mages Guild

plots: the player is meeting Arch-Mage Traven face-to-face for the first time
Raminus has told Arch-Mage Traven good things about the player: the player has advanced quickly, and shows great promise

the Council of Mages has been aware of the increased Necromancer activity in Cyrodiil for some time: Mucianus Allias was sent to infiltrate the ranks of the necromancers, but he stopped sending reports to the Council of Mages
the Council of Mages distrusts Mucianus Allias, unlike Arch-Mage Traven

quest.title: Liberation or Apprehension?
quest.objective: locate Mucianus Allias, and return him safely to the Arcane University
tasks: Make your way to Nenyond Twyll.
find Mucianus Allias before the battlemages of the Mages Guild apprehend him
locate Mucianus Allias, and return him safely to the Arcane University
quest.description:
Greetings. It is high time that we met face to face, don't you think? Raminus has told me good things about you. You have advanced quickly, and show great promise. I now intend to put your talents to a more direct test.
I have a difficult task that you can, perhaps, assist with. Let me explain what is at stake. The Council of Mages has been aware of the increased Necromancer activity in Cyrodiil for some time. It had been our position to sit back and watch what unfolded, but that time has clearly passed. We cannot tolerate these attacks on the guild. Most of our information on Necromancers has come from an informant inside the cult itself, a guild member who offered to infiltrate their ranks.
Though the information he has provided is limited, it has given us a sense of their scope and power. The Council was initially reluctant to believe the information was reliable, but with recent events, they have little choice but to trust it. I fear that our informant is in danger, and that is why I have called you here.
The informant is a mage called Mucianus Allias. He is not a Council member, but has long served the guild here at the Arcane University. Aware in the growing interest in the guild after the band of Necromancy was put into place, he offered to help the Council track the cult's actions. With my blessing, he infiltrated the group, and has fed us information for quite some time, until recently. I have not heard from him, and I fear for his safety.
The lack of reports from Mucianus has disturbed the Council, and they are now concerned about the legitimacy of his information. A group of Battlemages were dispatched to Mucianus's last know location, with the intent on bringing him in for questioning. I argued against it, but eventually agreed to maintain order in the Council. I regret that decision, and that is why I wish to send you there. I fear the Battlemages may mistreat Mucianus, if they do not mistake him for one of the many Necromancers no doubt present in the ruins.
I wish for you to find Mucianus, and ensure his safe return to the Arcane University. I do not want anything to go wrong. Please, hurry. The Battlemages will arrive there soon, if they have not already, and time is of the essence. If for any reason they are unsuccessful, Mucianus' life will be forfeit. You must make sure he is safe. Go now, and bring word to me as soon as he has been escorted to safety. Mucianus last reported being sent to the ruins of Nenyond Twyll, south of the Imperial City. That is where the Battlemages went. South of the White Rose River, nearly halfway to the border of Elsweyr. I'm afraid I know nothing more about the location, or what you may expect to find once you arrive.

kbs.name: Lucien Lachance
kbs.description: a Speaker for the Dark Brotherhood

kbs.name: Inn of Ill Omen
kbs.description: an inn on the Green Road to the north of Bravil

kbs.name: Rufio
kbs.description: an old and frail man who sleeps his days away

kbs.name: Night Mother
kbs.description: the spiritual leader of the Dark Brotherhood, a woman

plots: Lucien Lachance has awoken the player from their sleep: the player is a murderer whose work pleases the Night Mother
Lucien Lachance gives the player a new blade

quest.title: A Knife in the Dark
quest.objective: complete your initiation to the Dark Brotherhood
tasks: Travel to Inn of Ill Omen.
assassinate Rufio
complete your initiation to the Dark Brotherhood
quest.description:
You sleep rather soundly for a murderer. That's good. You'll need a clear conscience for what I'm about to propose.
I am Lucien Lachance, a Speaker for the Dark Brotherhood. And you, you are a killer. A taker of life. A harvester of souls. Your work, your deathcraft, pleases the Night Mother. And so, I come to you with an offering. An opportunity... to join our rather unique family.
On the Green Road to the north of Bravil lies the Inn of Ill Omen. There you will find a man named Rufio. Kill him, and your initiation into the Dark Brotherhood will be complete. Know that Rufio is old and weak, and sleeps his days away. You could kill him before he even has a chance to wake. If you so choose. Do this, and the next time you sleep in a location I deem secure, I will reveal myself once more, bearing the love of your new family.
Please accept this token from the Dark Brotherhood. It is a virgin blade, and thirsts for blood. May it serve you well, as does your silence.

kbs.name: Lucien Lachance
kbs.description: the player's superior in the Dark Brotherhood, giving quest via "Dead Drop Orders #7"

kbs.name: Ungolim
kbs.description: a male Wood Elf Archer, loves a married woman

kbs.name: Lucky Old Lady
kbs.description: an ancient statue in Bravil, a symbol of good luck and prosperity

plots: the player killed Havilstein Hoar-Blood for Lucien Lachance
Ungolim spends his days securely locked inside his house

quest.title: A Kiss Before Dying
quest.objective: assassinate Ungolim
tasks: Reach Bravil.
eliminate Ungolim when he visits the Lucky Old Lady at night between 6:00 PM and 1:00 AM
assassinate Ungolim
quest.description:
Dead Drop Orders #7
by Lucien Lachance

My compliments on another job well done! Havilstein Hoar-Blood was more swine than man, and deserved to die quivering like an animal! You must not stop! You must kill again!
Your next target is a Wood Elf named Ungolim, who resides in the city of Bravil. Bravil is also home to an ancient statue known as the Lucky Old Lady. It is seen as a symbol of good luck and prosperity, and the fools of Bravil often speak to the statue and wish for good tidings. Every night, poor lovestruck Ungolim visits the statue and pleads desperately for the heart of a young maiden. This maiden is married, and her husband has learned of Ungolim's affection for his bride. He fears the competition, it would seem, and has commissioned the Dark Brotherhood to help in the matter.
You must go to Bravil, locate Ungolim, and kill him. The Wood Elf owns a house in the city, but he spends his days securely locked inside. I recommend you lie in wait at the Lucky Old Lady statue, and then eliminate Ungolim when he arrives for his nightly visit. He's generally there between the hours of 6:00 PM and 1:00 AM.
By all accounts, Ungolim is a deadly archer and a fearless opponent. I also have reason to believe he is expecting trouble, so if Ungolim senses danger, he may attack you on sight. Be vigilant, and bring the Wood Elf down! You must not fail!
When Ungolim's body lies broken at the foot of his dear statue, you must journey to the city of Anvil. Your dead drop is in a barrel located behind the statue in the pond. As is standard, your reward and next contract will be waiting.

kbs.name: Carahil
kbs.description: one of the guild hall leaders of the Mages Guild
relations: each local guild hall in Cyrodiil

kbs.name: Arcane University
relations: each local guild hall in Cyrodiil

kbs.name: each local guild hall in Cyrodiil
kbs.description: each local guild hall in Cyrodiil

plots: the player wants to join the Mages Guild: Carahil makes the player an Associate of the Mages Guild
all recommendations must be sent to the Council of Mages before the player can enter the Arcane University

quest.title: Join the Mages Guild
quest.objective: advance in the Mages Guild
tasks: Proceed to each local guild hall in Cyrodiil.
receive a recommendation
advance in the Mages Guild
quest.description:
Hello there. Is there something with which I can assist you? Perhaps you're curious about joining the Mages Guild?
All right, then. You're now an Associate of the Mages Guild. Congratulations! You'll need to receive a recommendation from each local guild hall in Cyrodiil to advance in the guild, and be given any sort of responsibility. They can be done in any order, but they all must be sent in to the Council before you can enter the Arcane University.

kbs.name: Valus Odiil
kbs.description: an old warrior turned farmer, and a worried father

kbs.name: Odiil Farm
kbs.description: Valus Odiil, Rallus and Antus' farm, not far from Chorrol

plots: Rallus may know more about the creatures that attacked the Odiil Farm

quest.title: The Killing Field
quest.objective: reclaim the Odiil Farm from the creatures of the Great Forest with Rallus and Antus
tasks: Reach Weynon Priory.
meet up with Rallus and Antus
reclaim the Odiil Farm from the creatures of the Great Forest with Rallus and Antus
quest.description:
My sons! Have you seen my sons Rallus and Antus? They're going to fight off the creatures at our farm, but I fear for their safety.
For the last few days, we've suffered attacks from these creatures at our farm not far from Chorrol. They're coming from someplace in the Great Forest. I don't know where, but Rallus may know more by now. My boys will take up the fight even if the guards won't. Doesn't matter if it's outside the town walls - it still affects us all. They expect me to go with them, but... I fear in my old age, I'm not the warrior I once was. Would you... would you go in my place?
I'm supposed to meet them at Weynon Priory. You'd best get whatever supplies you need now, so you can get there in time.
I... I need a drink to calm my nerves. Please, excuse me.

kbs.name: Modryn Oreyn
kbs.description: the player's superior in the Fighters Guild

kbs.name: Glademist Cave
kbs.description: a cave where the Blackwood Company has set up a camp

kbs.name: Ajum-Kajin
kbs.description: one of the leaders of the Blackwood Company

kbs.name: Vilena Donton
kbs.description: the female leader of the Fighters Guild

plots: Modryn Oreyn has been expelled from the Fighters Guild: Vilena Donton would expel the player from the guild too if she knew they were here
Modryn Oreyn wants to take down the Blackwood Company: he needs more information about them
the Blackwood Company is trying to expand

quest.title: Information Gathering
quest.objective: bring Ajum-Kajin to Modryn Oreyn so that Modryn Oreyn can "persuade" Ajum-Kajin to talk
tasks: Arrive at Glademist Cave.
capture Ajum-Kajin
bring Ajum-Kajin to Modryn Oreyn so that Modryn Oreyn can "persuade" Ajum-Kajin to talk
quest.description:
These certainly won't be official duties. Fact is, you'll likely be expelled from the Guild if Vilena gets wind of the fact that you're here. And I've already been expelled. Doesn't mean I'm done, though.
I'm taking down the Blackwood Company, and I want your help doing it. To bring them down, I need more information. My sources tell me they're trying to expand, and they've set up camp in Glademist Cave. I want you to go there and capture Ajum-Kajin, one of their leaders. Bring him back to me. I'd like to spend some time... talking to him.

kbs.name: Arch-Mage Traven
kbs.description: the player's guildmaster in the Mages Guild

kbs.name: Count Hassildor
kbs.description: a nobleman who rules over Skingrad

plots: Count Hassildor of Skingrad contacted the Council of Mages: he has important information
Count Hassildor has asked for the player, specifically

quest.title: Information at a Price
quest.objective: receive vital information from Count Hassildor
tasks: Travel to Skingrad.
visit Count Hassildor
receive vital information from Count Hassildor
quest.description:
There is an urgent matter which requires your personal attention. This task falls to you, and only you.
Count Hassildor of Skingrad has contacted the Council. He claims to have information that is vital to us. He has requested that you personally travel to Skingrad to obtain this information. I cannot stress how important it is that our relationship with Hassildor be preserved. I expect you to visit him immediately.
I am unsure as to why he has requested that you, of all people, should be the one to visit him. I have no wish to put you in harm's way.
Please, travel there as soon as possible. The Count is waiting for you.

kbs.name: Modryn Oreyn
kbs.description: the player's superior in the Fighters Guild

kbs.name: Argonian
kbs.description: a member of the Blackwood Company who was interrogated by Modryn Oreyn

plots: the information Modryn Oreyn got from the Argonian was valuable
the player will be on their own: they should steer clear of their fellow Fighters Guild members

quest.title: Infiltration
quest.objective: infiltrate the Blackwood Company, and find the secret of their success
tasks: Find your way to Leyawiin.
join the Blackwood Company
infiltrate the Blackwood Company, and find the secret of their success
quest.description:
While the information we got from the Argonian was valuable, we need more. I want you to infiltrate them. See how they work from the inside.
I want you to get to Leyawiin and join the Blackwood Company. Find the secret of their success. You'll be on your own. Steer clear of me and all of your Fighters Guild brothers. It'll be rough going, but you can do it.
Good luck.

plots: the corrupt watchman took Ruslan's last septim
Luronk and Ruslan were shopping at Jensine's when the corrupt watchman accused them of stealing: the corrupt watchman fined Luronk and Ruslan even though Jensine said that they were innocent
the corrupt watchman has shaken down most of the shopkeepers in the Market District

quest.title: Imperial Corruption
quest.objective: do something about the corrupt watchman
tasks: Go to Market District.
ask around about the corrupt watchman
do something about the corrupt watchman
quest.description:
Hey stranger, can you spare a few coins? I've just been shaken down by that bastard watchman and he took my last septim. I don't know his name, but I'd recognize him if I saw him again.
Luronk and I were shopping at Jensine's when he accused us of stealing. Even Jensine said we were innocent, but he didn't care. We had to pay his "fine" or go to jail.
He's shaken down most of the shopkeepers in the Market District. They're all too afraid of him to do anything. Jensine wouldn't even talk about it.
Someone ought to do something about him.

kbs.name: Martina Floria
kbs.description: Master Enchanter for the Mages Guild

plots: the player asked illusion training from Martina Floria

quest.title: Illusion Training
quest.objective: bring 10 Welkynd Stones to Martina Floria
tasks: find 10 Welkynd Stones
bring 10 Welkynd Stones to Martina Floria
quest.description:
Martina Floria, Master Enchanter for the Mages Guild.
You wish to learn illusion spells? Hmm. A trade is in order, don't you think? My services in exchange for... oh, let's say ten Welkynd Stones. I'd say that's fair.
Let me know when you have them.

kbs.name: Lucien Lachance
kbs.description: a male Speaker of the Black Hand, who betrayed the Dark Brotherhood for some reason

kbs.name: Night Mother
kbs.description: an immortal female spirit who is revered and worshiped by the Dark Brotherhood

plots: the player is a Silencer of the Dark Brotherhood
as the player can see, the Black Hand have dealt with Lucien Lachance
Lucien Lachance tricked the player to kill the Black Hand off: the player killed the Listener and the Listener's successor
Arquen promotes the player to Speaker from Silencer: the player becomes a member of the Black Hand
there are only five members of the Black Hand, including the player

quest.title: Honor Thy Mother
quest.objective: perform an ancient ritual to wake the Night Mother from her slumber, and seek her guidance
tasks: Arrive at Bravil.
ask about the Night Mother from Arquen between 12.00 PM and 3:00 AM
go to the Night Mother's home with Arquen
perform an ancient ritual to wake the Night Mother from her slumber, and seek her guidance
quest.description:
Silencer! At last you've arrived! Fear not, for the crisis that has threatened the Dark Brotherhood has finally come to an end. I am Arquen, Speaker for the Black Hand.
As you can see, we have dealt with the betrayer, Lucien Lachance! No longer will you serve as his puppet! It seems Lachance wanted revenge against the Dark Brotherhood for some reason, and used you to do his dirty work. But now, we can begin anew!
I bestow upon you the title of Speaker. You will take Lucien Lachance's place on the Black Hand! Welcome! As you know, the Black Hand is now in a state of disarray. Lachance ordered you to kill us off! We five, including you, are now all that remain. Even worse, you killed the Listener! The Black Hand without a Listener is like a hand with no thumb. Even the Listener's successor is dead!
So, we have no choice but to invoke an ancient ritual. We must wake the Night Mother from her slumber, and seek her guidance! Between the hours of midnight and 3:00 AM, ask me about the Night Mother, and we will away to our Lady's home in Bravil. Only then will the ritual begin.
May the Night Mother hold you in her cold embrace.

kbs.name: Hircine
kbs.description: the lord of the hunt, one of the Daedric Princes

plots: the player summoned Hircine

quest.title: Hircine's Unicorn Hunt
quest.objective: bring an unicorn horn to Hircine
tasks: Reach Harcane Grove.
hunt the unicorn
bring an unicorn horn to Hircine
quest.description:
Summoned by prey. The hare crouches before the fox's muzzle. Perhaps I, Hircine, shall task you, mortal. Set you to hunt for my amusement.
In Harcane Grove is a quarry worthy of the chase. First named, last tamed, the unicorn runs wild there. Bring me this creature's horn, mortal. If you dare. Do taste its flesh and drink its blood. Never waste the spoils of a kill.
Please me, hunter, and you shall have my token, Saviour's Hide, and wear it well. Hereafter, take your prey, and whisper my name.

kbs.name: Modryn Oreyn
kbs.description: the player's superior in the Fighters Guild

kbs.name: Blackwood Company hall
kbs.description: the headquarters of the Blackwood Company

kbs.name: Ri'Zakar
kbs.description: the leader of the Blackwood Company, and a battle-hardened mercenary who's spent time all over Tamriel

kbs.name: Hist Tree
kbs.description: an abominable tree, and the source of the Fighters Guild's problems

plots: Modryn Oreyn has one final duty for the player to perform
everyone is in danger, as long as the Blackwood Company has access to the sap from the Hist Tree
Ri'Zakar will have the Hist Tree well guarded

quest.title: The Hist
quest.objective: return to the Blackwood Company hall to destroy the Hist Tree and anyone that stands in your way
tasks: Find your way to Blackwood Company hall.
find Ri'Zakar's key that opens the door to the Hist tree
return to the Blackwood Company hall to destroy the Hist Tree and anyone that stands in your way
quest.description:
It is time for decisive action. I have one more duty for you to perform. It is clear to me what must be done. The Hist Tree must be destroyed. This tree is the source of our problems. It is an abomination of nature, and it must be destroyed. As long as the Blackwood Company has access to the sap, we are all in danger. I fear they no longer know what they do.
You must find a way to destroy the Hist, though I can imagine Ri'Zakar will have it well guarded. He's a warrior, a battle-hardened mercenary who's spent time all over Tamriel. He'll keep his prize tree locked away. You'll need to find his key.
Expect an unfriendly welcome at their hall. Finish it.

kbs.name: Pranal
kbs.description: an old man who used to be a warrior

plots: the player asked Pranal to give them heavy armor training
Pranal wants to get a gift to Malene: Pranal gives the player 50 gold to cover the costs of the gift

quest.title: Heavy Armor Training
quest.objective: get some useful items to Pranal, and talk to him
tasks: get a silver pitcher, and a set of four glasses
get some useful items to Pranal, and talk to him
quest.description:
You desire heavy armor training from me? Goodness me, I'm retired! I'm afraid combat doesn't interest me any more.
All that matters to me now is Malene. I'm no fool. I know she'd never be interested in an old man like me. It's enough just to be around her, to be in her company.
Well, if you're dead set on learning something from me, then how about you do a little something for me, first? Something for her, to be honest.
I'd like to get her a gift of a sort. Nothing terribly fancy, and something useful... How about a nice silver pitcher, and a set of four glasses. Here's 50 gold to cover the costs, that should be more than enough. Come see me when you've got everything, and we'll talk more.

plots: the player purchased the Servants Quarters for Rosethorn Hall

quest.title: Helping Hands
quest.objective: hire a housekeeper for Rosethorn Hall
tasks: pay Eyja 150 gold to hire her as your housekeeper
hire a housekeeper for Rosethorn Hall
quest.description:
Hello, I heard you purchased the Servants Quarters for Rosethorn Hall, and I was wondering if you had anyone in mind to fill that position?
For 150 gold and a roof over my head, I'm yours. Well, to help around the house I mean.

plots: the player asked Helvius Cecia to give them Hand to Hand training
Helvius Cecia will not throw a single punch during the sparring match
the rules of the sparring match: 1) the player must not reach for a weapon, 2) Helvius Cecia will tell the player to stop if they hurt him or if the match goes on for too long

quest.title: Hand to Hand Training
quest.objective: prove Helvius Cecia that you deserve his training
tasks: have a sparring match with Helvius Cecia
prove Helvius Cecia that you deserve his training
quest.description:
Hand to Hand training, eh? The real question is, can you fight?
You know, throw a good punch? Can you? I'd like to find out if I'm going to spend time working with you. So are you up for a sparring match?
I'll make it easy on you. I won't throw a single punch. I just want to see what you've got, anyway. So, is it a deal?
If I see you reach for a weapon, I'm calling it off. And if you can actually hurt me, I'll tell you to stop. If this goes on for too long, and I get bored, I'll stop you.
Now show me what you've got!

kbs.name: Moss Rock Cavern
kbs.description: a cave just north of Malene's inn

plots: Malene has seen undead of all types walking in the dark woods near the entrance to Moss Rock Cavern

quest.title: The Gravefinder's Repose
quest.objective: help Malene deal with Raelynn the Gravefinder
tasks: Arrive at Moss Rock Cavern.
kill Raelynn the Gravefinder
help Malene deal with Raelynn the Gravefinder
quest.description:
Thank goodness someone that can help is here! I don't know how to make this request any simpler, but to put it bluntly, Raelynn the Gravefinder must die.
A few months ago, that witch of a Necromancer decided to inhabit Moss Rock Cavern just north of my inn. I don't know what she does in there; frankly, I don't want to know. However, I do know that after she arrived, the woods at night became unsafe.
I've seen undead of all types walking in the dark woods near the cave entrance. Now, this area's getting a bad reputation and my business has waned. Every day, it seems the number of undead increase.
If someone can get into the cave and kill Raelynn, maybe we can stem the tide. Her death pays a handsome bounty. I hope you'll take advantage of the opportunity. Raelynn will finally get what's coming to her.

kbs.name: Barthel Gernand
kbs.description: a settler, and a family man

plots: Barthel Gernand and his family ran into goblin war parties northwest of here while starting to build a new settlement

quest.title: Goblin Trouble
quest.objective: stop a goblin war so that Barthel Gernand and his family can finish building their new settlement
tasks: talk to Mirisa about the goblins
stop a goblin war so that Barthel Gernand and his family can finish building their new settlement
quest.description:
A word of advice! Watch for goblins if you're heading north. We ran into goblin war parties northwest of here, while starting to build a new settlement.
My family and I are still trying to figure out what to do. We spent everything we had to buy the land and supplies, so we can hardly go back.
Say, do you think you could help us? We need to get the goblins off our land so we can start building our new settlement. You should talk to Mirisa about the goblins. She's our guide and knows what needs to be done.
Take care, friend. Don't get yourself killed on our account.

plots: slaughterfish nearly took off Aelwin Merowald's leg
Aelwin Merowald could retire with the money he would get from the slaughterfish scales

quest.title: Go Fish
quest.objective: bring 12 slaughterfish scales to Aelwin Merowald
tasks: Make your way to Lake Rumare.
kill slaughterfish and collect their scales
bring 12 slaughterfish scales to Aelwin Merowald
quest.description:
You know, stranger, there comes a time in every man's life when he has to admit that he's lost the fight.
Well, I've fought and I've lost. Who did I lose to? Who is my great enemy? Well, don't laugh... it's a bunch of damn fish.
I'm a fisherman. Or at least, I was. Until one of those slaughterfish damn near took my leg off. I was collecting their scales, see. I had a contract with this young alchemist. You wouldn't believe what he was paying for those scales! Then last month, one of the bastards got ahold of my leg. Took me right out of the business. But this alchemist, he needs the scales right away. The alchemist was paying so much for the scales that I'm close to having enough saved so that I can retire. But now, I can't get out there to Lake Rumare -- not with this leg. I only needed twelve more scales! Can you believe it? I was so close!
I've picked up a few things in my travels. If you head out there and bring me back the twelve scales that I need, I can make it worth your time. Help an old fisherman out, won't you?

kbs.name: Hermaeus Mora
kbs.description: the demon of knowledge, one of the Daedric Princes

plots: the player has served other Daedric Princes
Hermaeus Mora's followers need souls: Hermaeus Mora gives the player a spell to trap souls

quest.title: Hermaeus Mora, the Collector of Souls
quest.objective: return to Hermaeus Mora with the souls of the ten sentient races of Tamriel
tasks: capture one soul from each of the ten sentient races of Tamriel
return to Hermaeus Mora with the souls of the ten sentient races of Tamriel
quest.description:
I see you have served my brethren, and now you come to serve me. I am Hermaeus Mora. Past, present, and future are as one to me.
My followers seek to perform a divination. For this, they need souls, one of each of the ten sentient races of Tamriel. You will provide these souls. I give you a spell to trap these souls. Return to me when you have finished. When you do, I will further your journey on your true path.
Do your service onto me and I give you this, the Oghma Infinium. Knowledge given by me to Xarxes is recorded within.

kbs.name: Varulae
kbs.description: a frustrated woman, and the owner of the Serpent's Wake

kbs.name: Serpent's Wake
kbs.description: a haunted ship right beside the player in Anvil

plots: Varulae sent the crew of Serpent's Wake to the Summerset Isle to retrieve Varulae's crystal ball: someone murdered the crew when they came back to Anvil
Varulae gives the player a key

quest.title: The Ghost Ship of Anvil
quest.objective: return the crystal ball to Varulae
tasks: Proceed to Serpent's Wake.
get Varulae's crystal ball from a chest in the Serpent's Wake's hold
return the crystal ball to Varulae
quest.description:
This is a travesty. A complete and utter travesty. The crystal ball is just sitting there in the hold, but I'll be damned if I'm going back onboard. And nobody will help me. Nobody! Not with those spirits roaming the decks. I don't suppose you'll help me? No, of course you won't...
Wait... Did you actually say you'd help me? I've been going out of my mind ever since my crew was murdered! This is my ship, you see. The Serpent's Wake. I hired the crew to sail to Summerset Isle to retrieve a family heirloom, my mother's crystal ball. They made the journey, and arrived back all right, but then... Someone murdered them! All of them! Now their spirits are haunting the ship!
The crystal ball is in a chest in the ship's hold, but I can't get to it. I made it as far as the captain's cabin, but the spirits nearly killed me! Get the crystal ball and return it to me here, and I'll make it worth your trouble. Here, you'll need this key. Thank you so much!
There will be a reward waiting for you! It's the captain's enchanted cutlass. I managed to grab it when I was in his cabin, before his spirit chased me out!

kbs.name: Burz gro-Khash
kbs.description: the player's superior in the Fighters Guild

plots: the Bravil city watch is useless: they can't catch the 4 escaped prison fugitives

quest.title: The Fugitives
quest.objective: find 4 escaped prison fugitives that have been causing trouble near Bravil
tasks: Arrive at Bravil.
ask people about the 4 escaped prison fugitives
find 4 escaped prison fugitives that have been causing trouble near Bravil
quest.description:
I've got something for you. Could be tough. There are some escaped fugitives for you to find, meat.
Some real hard cases got out of the Bravil prison. Been terrorizing the locals ever since. The Watch is useless, so we step in.
Apparently, there are three or four of them. Real nasty, from what I hear. You take care of them. Maybe you'll get lucky and they'll surrender.
The people of Bravil aren't talking, but you might try asking around, butter them up a bit.
Get to it.

kbs.name: Bawnwatch Camp
kbs.description: a camp on the shore of Niben Bay

kbs.name: Watchman
kbs.description: a harmless, sad ghost of a sailor

plots: the player asked Gilgondorin about the Watchman
Gilgondorin pinpoints where the Watchman appears on the player's map

quest.title: The Forlorn Watchman
quest.objective: lay the Watchman to rest
tasks: Find your way to Bawnwatch Camp.
go see the Watchman at 8 o'clock at night
lay the Watchman to rest
quest.description:
So you want to learn more about the ghostly Watchman?
The Watchman looks like he may have been a sailor. No one knows where he came from, or why he looks so sad. I don't like talking about the dead like they're some kind of tourist attraction, but that spirit has been making his ghostly journey for years now. We've learned to just accept that he's there.
Every night, sure as clockwork, he appears at Bawnwatch Camp at 8 on the shore of Niben Bay. He's never harmed anyone, but most people give him a wide berth. You seem curious enough, so I'll be glad to pinpoint where he appears on your map.

kbs.name: G.S.
kbs.description: a long-dead thief, giving quest via "Crumpled Note"

kbs.name: Pale Pass
kbs.description: a valley in the Jeralls with some ruins

plots: "Crumpled Note" is addressed to an old friend of G.S.
G.S. recounts how he stole a magical ring from a wizard and escaped from the owner of the ring until he ended up into Pale Pass

quest.title: The Forgotten Chests of Pale Pass
quest.objective: find the magical ring that G.S. hid inside some old barrels
tasks: Arrive at Pale Pass.
use a key to open a chest to find another key for an another chest until you find the ring
find the magical ring that G.S. hid inside some old barrels
quest.description:
Crumpled Note
by G.S.

I guess you found the message I told you about, old friend. We've traveled together for so long, and you're the only one I trust with the ring and my story.
I knew climbing into the window of that wizard's house was a mistake, but the bounty on the ring was just too enticing to pass up. They said it was worth thousands of drakes... enough to keep me comfortable for a while as I lay low. They also said the owner of the ring was out of town at some meeting of wizards or some such.
They were wrong on both counts. You'd think I'd be used to this by now, dealing with the unpredictable in our line of work. But after trying to fence the ring all over the realm, no one would touch it. Worse still, the wizard was pursuing me the entire time. I had to call in many favors to stay one step ahead of him.
I decided to strike north and make for the neighboring land. As I was crossing the Jeralls, he finally caught up to me. Two fireballs later, I found myself tumbling down a steep snowy slope into a valley. Don't know where I am, but there are ruins of some old fort here. Luckily, that fetcher didn't follow me down; I assume he gave me up for dead.
I think I'm going to stash the ring in this valley, cross the border north, and return later when I feel it's safe. I've used some old chests I found in the ruins to make sure nobody stumbles across the ring by mistake; you know, the old key to a key thing like we used to do. If I don't make it back here, and you're reading this message, then the ring is all yours, my friend. Use it well and remember me.
G.S.

kbs.name: Lucien Lachance
kbs.description: the player's superior in the Dark Brotherhood

kbs.name: Applewatch
kbs.description: the farm where the player killed Perennia Draconis

plots: Lucien Lachance has been framed as the traitor to the Dark Brotherhood: Fort Farragut is under watch by the Black Hand

quest.title: Following a Lead
quest.objective: uncover the true traitor's identity, and come see Lucien Lachance at Applewatch
tasks: go to your next dead drop, lie in wait, and confront whomever drops off the false contract
uncover the true traitor's identity, and come see Lucien Lachance at Applewatch
quest.description:
You and I have been deceived, dear friend. We must find out who is behind this betrayal! We haven't much time... I am hunted day and night by the Black Hand! They want me dead!
Here is what you must do. Go now to your next dead drop, lie in wait, and confront whomever drops off the false contract!
Uncover the true traitor's identity, and then come see me. I'll be in hiding. Fort Farragut is no longer secure. It's under watch by the Black Hand. I'll wait for you at Applewatch, the farm where you killed the old Draconis woman. It should be empty, and safe.
Now go! And may the god of death help us all!

kbs.name: Teekeeus
kbs.description: one of the leader of the Mages Guild

kbs.name: Earana
kbs.description: a female mage who has been kicked out of the Mages Guild

plots: the player asked a recommendation from Teekeeus
Earana and Teekeeus have an unpleasant history: Earana does not care for Mages Guild regulations, and believes Teekeus is mis-using his powers

quest.title: Teekeeus' Old Rival
quest.objective: find a way to get rid of Earana
tasks: determine what Earana is after
find a way to get rid of Earana
quest.description:
I'm afraid I can't just write one out of hand. That would be against protocols, you see. If perhaps you can clear up a small matter involving Earana, you can prove your loyalty to the guild and earn my recommendation.
Earana and I have an unpleasant history. She does not care for Guild regulations, and errantly believes I am mis-using my powers. I have seen that she is in town. Though she has not approached me, I know she wants something.
I would like you to find out what it is. Determine what Earana's after, and how we may be rid of her. I do not want her here, spreading her lies.

kbs.name: Lucien Lachance
kbs.description: the player's superior in the Dark Brotherhood, giving quest via "Dead Drop Orders #4"

kbs.name: Shaleez
kbs.description: a female Argonian hunter and murderer

plots: "Dead Drop Orders #4" has been addressed to the player: the player is a Silencer of the Dark Brotherhood
the player killed J'Ghasta for Lucien Lachance before
Shaleez was banished from her home village near Black Marsh/Morrowind border for a murder of a Dark Elven family: the Morag Tong can't reach Shaleez

quest.title: Final Justice
quest.objective: assassinate Shaleez
tasks: Arrive at Flooded Mine.
locate Shaleez
assassinate Shaleez
quest.description:
Dead Drop Orders #4
by Lucien Lachance

J'Ghasta is dead! Well done! I was right about you, Silencer. You are a useful tool indeed. Let's see if you can continue to impress me.
You must journey now to the Flooded Mine. There you will find Shaleez, an Argonian hunter who was banished from her village near the Black Marsh/Morrowind border for the brutal murder of a Dark Elven family. Relatives of the murdered family members have located Shaleez, and demand retribution. And, since the assignment is a bit far for Morrowind's Morag Tong to handle, the Dark Brotherhood has been commissioned to perform the elimination.
Be warned, Silencer! Shaleez is a skilled and deadly hunter, and will fight like the desperate fugitive she is.
After Shaleez has been eliminated, your reward and another contract will be waiting at the dead drop located in a coffin, just outside the ruins of Fort Redman.

kbs.name: Vilena Donton
kbs.description: the player's guildmaster in the Fighters Guild

plots: the player has stolen something from their fellow Fighters Guild members: this is the player's first offense

quest.title: Expelled from the Fighters Guild
quest.objective: bring 20 bear pelts to Vilena Donton
tasks: collect 20 bear pelts
bring 20 bear pelts to Vilena Donton
quest.description:
You would steal from your brothers? If you had a need for something, why would you not just ask?
I will give you a chance, though. As it is only your first offense, do not return until you have collected 20 bear pelts.
Use this time to reflect on your actions.

kbs.name: Ocheeva
kbs.description: the player's superior in the Dark Brotherhood

kbs.name: Fort Sutch
kbs.description: a fort far to the west, nestled in the mountains

plots: Roderick lies in eternal slumber, kept alive only by the daily administration of a powerful medicine

quest.title: Bad Medicine
quest.objective: assassinate Roderick without been seen by his company of loyal mercenaries
tasks: Arrive at Fort Sutch.
replace Roderick's medicine with a poisoned bottle Ocheeva gives you
assassinate Roderick without been seen by his company of loyal mercenaries
quest.description:
Far to the west there lives a fierce warlord and his company of loyal mercenaries. Your target is the warlord. Do you accept this contract?
Now listen closely. Nestled in the mountains to the west lies Fort Sutch. It is the home of the warlord Roderick and his mercenaries. Roderick has recently taken ill. He now lies in eternal slumber, kept alive only by the daily administration of a powerful medicine.
You must infiltrate Fort Sutch, find Roderick's medicine, and replace it with a poisoned bottle I will provide. But you must remain undetected! Whomever arranged this contract wants it to look like Roderick died from his illness, so discretion is essential. Attack no one! Be seen by no one! If you are detected, the poisoning will fail, and Roderick must be killed in some other manner. That will, of course, forfeit your bonus.
Roderick may lie near death, but dead he is not. Until his soul has passed, our client -- and the Grim Reaper himself -- will not be satisfied.

kbs.name: Modryn Oreyn
kbs.description: the player's superior in the Fighters Guild

kbs.name: Rellian, Vantus Prelius, Dubok gro-Shagk
kbs.description: 3 fellow members of the Fighters Guild who have never caused issues before

plots: the player's fellow members of the Fighters Guild have been causing issues at the tavern in Leyawiin

quest.title: Drunk and Disorderly
quest.objective: find out why several of your fellow members of the Fighters Guild are causing trouble in Leyawiin
tasks: Reach Leyawiin.
find out what is wrong with Rellian, Vantus Prelius, and Dubok gro-Shagk
find out why several of your fellow members of the Fighters Guild are causing trouble in Leyawiin
quest.description:
Back for more work, are you? Good. Some of our boys are causing trouble in Leyawiin. Looks bad for the guild.
Some of your brothers have been getting rowdy at the local tavern. I've got no problem with cutting loose, but I don't like it when we all look bad. You're looking for Rellian, Vantus Prelius, and Dubok gro-Shagk. I haven't had any trouble with them before, so find out what's going on.
I'll be waiting.

plots: the player asked Bralsa Andaren to teach the player Destruction spells

quest.title: Destruction Training
quest.objective: bring 20 bear pelts to Bralsa Andaren to prove that you have helped tear nature asunder
tasks: get 20 bear pelts
bring 20 bear pelts to Bralsa Andaren to prove that you have helped tear nature asunder
quest.description:
You seek training? If I were to aid you, you would first have to assist me.
I would strip the Creators of their works... you will help with this. Bring me 20 bear pelts, as proof that you have helped tear nature asunder.
Then we shall speak of spells and teaching.

kbs.name: Mehrunes Dagon
kbs.description: the male prince of destruction, one of the Daedric Princes

plots: Uriel Septim VII cannot go further
the player alone must stand against Mehrunes Dagon and his mortal servants: Mehrunes Dagon must not have the Amulet of Kings

quest.title: The Voice of the Emperor
quest.objective: find Uriel Septim VII's son and close shut the jaws of Oblivion
tasks: give the Amulet of Kings to Jauffre, and ask Jauffre about finding Uriel Septim VII's secret son
find Uriel Septim VII's son and close shut the jaws of Oblivion
quest.description:
I can go no further. You alone must stand against the Prince of Destruction and his mortal servants. He must not have the Amulet of Kings!
Take the Amulet. Give it to Jauffre. I have a secret son, and Jauffre alone knows where to find him.
Find my son, and close shut the jaws of Oblivion.

kbs.name: Kvatch
kbs.description: a city that was destroyed by Daedra

kbs.name: Countess
kbs.description: the noblewoman who rules over Bruma

kbs.name: Great Sigil Stones
kbs.description: rare items, the player needs one of these

plots: the player and Jauffre won't like Martin's plan to obtain a Great Sigil Stone
Great Sigil Stones are the anchors of Great Gates: the Mythic Dawn opened a Great Gate at Kvatch, and they want to open another one here to destroy Bruma
Martin was at Kvatch and saw the terrible power of the Daedric siege engine
the only way to recover the Amulet of Kings is to allow the Mythic Dawn to proceed with their plan to attack Bruma

quest.title: Defense of Bruma
quest.objective: have the Countess meet Martin in the Chapel of Talos for a council of war
tasks: Proceed to Bruma.
explain Martin's plan to the Countess
have the Countess meet Martin in the Chapel of Talos for a council of war
quest.description:
We need a Great Sigil Stone. You're not going to like it. Jauffre doesn't like it. The Countess of Bruma certainly isn't going to like it. Great Sigil Stones are the anchors of Great Gates. The kind of gate the Mythic Dawn opened at Kvatch. The kind of Gate the Mythic Dawn wants to open here to destroy Bruma.
The risk is great, I know. I was at Kvatch. I saw the terrible power of the Daedric siege engine. But we have no choice. The only way to recover the Amulet of Kings is to allow the Mythic Dawn to proceed with their plan to attack Bruma.
Please, my friend. I explain myself to you so you understand me. And so you can explain to the Countess. I'm afraid she may take a bit more convincing than you.
Have the Countess of Bruma meet me in the Chapel of Talos for a council of war. That seems a fitting place to make such desperate plans.

kbs.name: Lucien Lachance
kbs.description: the player's superior in the Dark Brotherhood, giving quest via "Dead Drop Orders #1"

kbs.name: Celedaen
kbs.description: an ancient necromancer, who is in the process of turning himself into a lich

kbs.name: "Dead Drop Orders #1"
kbs.description: the player's first dead drop note, on Hero Hill

plots: "Dead Drop Orders #1" is addressed to the player: the player is a Silencer of the Dark Brotherhood

quest.title: Affairs of a Wizard
quest.objective: assassinate Celedaen
tasks: Arrive at Leafrot Cave.
search for Celedaen's written records that may contain evidence of some kind of weakness of his
assassinate Celedaen
quest.description:
Dead Drop Orders #1
by Lucien Lachance

Silencer,
You are now reading your first dead drop note, here on Hero Hill, which proves to me you were well-appointed to the tasks that lie ahead.
Journey now to Leafrot Cave. There you will encounter an ancient necromancer who is attempting to escape death by transforming himself into a lich. This necromancer, Celedaen, has not yet completed his metamorphosis, but is still immensely powerful, possibly too powerful to destroy if confronted directly. Search Leafrot Cave. Necromancers are wizards after all, and wizards are prolific by nature. Celedaen surely has written records, and these records may contain evidence of some kind of weakness. Perhaps there is some other way to destroy Celedaen besides a direct confrontation. But destroy him you must!
When the necromancer lies dead, journey to the city of Chorrol for your next dead drop. At the foot of the Great Oak, hidden in the bushes, is an old sack. Inside you will find your reward for killing the necromancer, as well as information regarding your next contract.
Serve me well, Silencer, and there's no telling just how far you might advance.

kbs.name: Llevana Nedaren
relations: County Hall, in the Cheydinhal castle

kbs.name: County Hall, in the Cheydinhal castle
kbs.description: County Hall, in the Cheydinhal castle

kbs.name: Ulrich Leland
kbs.description: the corrupted male captain of the guard

kbs.name: Garrus Darelliun
kbs.description: the male second-in-command of the guard, who is not too happy about his captain Ulrich Leland

plots: Llevana Nedaren does not know the player
Ulrich Leland is fining the citizens of Cheydinhal enthusiastically

quest.title: Corruption and Conscience
quest.objective: do something about Ulrich Leland
tasks: Proceed to County Hall, in the Cheydinhal castle.
speak to Garrus Darelliun, the second-in-command of the guard, about Ulrich Leland
do something about Ulrich Leland
quest.description:
You seem far too nice to be one of Ulrich Leland's men. What can I do for you?
Don't even get me started about Ulrich. That madman won't be satisfied until everyone in town is dead broke...or in jail! What in Oblivion is Ulrich doing with all that money anyway? I'm sure he's lining his pockets with the gold of the good citizens of Cheydinhal.
There's only one man who seems to care: Garrus Darelliun, the second-in-command of the guard. I hear he isn't happy with Ulrich. I don't know what you can do for us in this situation. I mean, Ulrich Leland is the Captain after all.
Perhaps you could speak to Garrus. You can find him roaming the County Hall of the castle most of the time.

kbs.name: Olyn Seran
kbs.description: a worshiper of Molag Bal, and a master Conjurer

kbs.name: Molag Bal
kbs.description: the prince of domination, one of the Daedric Princes

plots: the player asked Olyn Seran to train them  in Conjuration

quest.title: Conjuration Training
quest.objective: prove Olyn Seran that you are worthy of his teachings
tasks: Go to a shrine to Molag Bal.
summon a Faded Wraith right here, before Olyn Seran
prove Olyn Seran that you are worthy of his teachings
quest.description:
You would seek Conjuration training from me? Well, then my request is small. Prove to me that you are capable of serving Molag Bal in your own way.
Summon a Faded Wraith right here, before me. When I have seen it with my own eyes, you shall be worthy of my teachings.

kbs.name: Traven
kbs.description: the player's guildleader in the Mages Guild

kbs.name: Mannimarco
kbs.description: the king of worms, the leader of the necromancers

plots: with Traven's gem in the player's possession, the player will be impervious to Mannimarco's attempt to enthrall them
Traven will die after giving the quest to the player

quest.title: Confront the King
quest.objective: defeat Mannimarco once and for all
tasks: get Traven's gem after speaking with Traven, and seek out Mannimarco
defeat Mannimarco once and for all
quest.description:
Hear me, and hear me well. Mannimarco will have what he seeks, but it will be his undoing at your hands.
With this gem in your possession, you will be impervious to his attempt to enthrall you. When he fails, that is when you shall strike. When we are done speaking, you will take this gem, you will then seek out Mannimarco, and destroy him. Get to him anyway you can. It is your only hope for defeating him. I have full confidence in you, and so I leave the guild in your care.
When I am gone, you will be recognized as Arch-Mage and leader of the Guild. Lead your fellow mages, and lead them well. The future rests on your shoulders.
Farewell, my friend.

plots: Umbacano has invited the player here to his house: the ancient Ayleid statue that the player recently sold cheap to an anonymous merchant is placed on a table

quest.title: The Collector
quest.objective: recover the complete set of 10 ancient statues for Umbacano
tasks: Travel to Ayleid Ruins.
find the 10 ancient statues
recover the complete set of 10 ancient statues for Umbacano
quest.description:
Thank you for coming.
You may recognize that statue over there on the table. The very one that you recently sold -- for less than its true worth.
As you may know, I am somewhat of an enthusiast for Ayleid antiquities. In my own modest way, I have amassed a rather considerable collection.
I have recently become interested in obtaining the complete set of these ancient statues. I believe that ten still exist within the various ancient Ayleid Ruins. No mere shopkeeper knows their true worth.
