If you bring them to me when you find them, I will pay you double for each one.

kbs.name: Jeanne Frasoric
kbs.description: the player's superior in the Mages Guild
relations: Bruma Mages Guild, one of the guild halls of the Mages Guild

kbs.name: Bruma Mages Guild, one of the guild halls of the Mages Guild
kbs.description: Bruma Mages Guild, one of the guild halls of the Mages Guild

kbs.name: Raminus
kbs.description: a male mage, and one of the leaders of the Mages Guild
relations: Bruma Mages Guild, one of the guild halls of the Mages Guild

kbs.name: J'skar
kbs.description: a mischievous male mage who has gone missing for real

kbs.name: Volanaro
kbs.description: a male mage, and J'skar's friend
relations: Bruma Mages Guild, one of the guild halls of the Mages Guild

plots: the player asked a recommendation to Raminus from Jeanne Frasoric: the player is an Associate of the Mages Guild
if someone from the Council were to visit Bruma Mages Guild, and find out that J'skar has vanished, it would look bad on Jeanne Frasoric
Volanaro thinks J'skar's spell backfired

quest.title: Magely Mischief
quest.objective: find J'skar, and make him re-appear
tasks: Reach Bruma Mages Guild, one of the guild halls of the Mages Guild.
talk to the mages about J'skar's disappearance
find J'skar, and make him re-appear
quest.description:
A recommendation, from me? Well, of course. Raminus would naturally want my opinion, wouldn't he?
This is a situation we can both benefit from, Associate. You do me a small favor, and I'll happily send along a glowing recommendation.
J'skar's disappeared. I mean he's really disappeared. No one here has seen him in days. Volanaro thinks maybe a spell backfired. If someone from the Council were to stop by, and find him gone, it'd look bad for me. I can't have that. Talk to the mages here, and see what you can find out.
If you can make J'skar re-appear, you'll have your recommendation.

kbs.name: Countess
kbs.description: the female noble who rules Bruma

kbs.name: Captain Burd
kbs.description: the male captain of the Bruma guard

plots: Jauffre has received a message from the Countess: an Oblivion Gate has opened outside the city, and the Mythic Dawn are putting their plan to attack Bruma into motion
Jauffre wants the player to show the Countess's guard how to close Oblivion Gates

quest.title: Bruma Gate
quest.objective: help the Bruma guard close an Oblivion Gate just outside Bruma
tasks: Head to outside the Bruma city gate.
meet up with Captain Burd and let him show you the Oblivion Gate
help the Bruma guard close an Oblivion Gate just outside Bruma
quest.description:
I've just received word from the Countess of Bruma that an Oblivion Gate has opened outside the city. It seems that the Mythic Dawn are putting their plan to attack Bruma into motion.
Since you've dealt with these Gates before, I'd like you to help the Countess's guard close this gate. Once they've seen how it's done, they should be able to handle any new gates on their own.
Captain Burd is waiting for you outside the Bruma city gate. He'll show you the Oblivion Gate. Although I doubt it will be hard to find.

kbs.name: Lucien Lachance
kbs.description: the player's superior in the Dark Brotherhood, giving quest via "Dead Drop Orders #3"

kbs.name: J'Ghasta
kbs.description: a Khajiit nobleman, and a skilled hand to hand fighter

plots: "Dead Drop Orders #3" has been addressed toward the player: the player is a Silencer of the Dark Brotherhood
J'Ghasta turned down the offer to marry a prominent Cyrodiil noble's daughter: the noble hired the Dark Brotherhood to kill J'Ghasta
J'Ghasta is aware someone may be trying to kill him, and has bribed the guards not to interfere if a fight should spill out into the Bruma streets

quest.title: Broken Vows
quest.objective: assassinate J'Ghasta
tasks: Arrive at J'Ghasta's house in Bruma.
find J'Ghasta
assassinate J'Ghasta
quest.description:
Dead Drop Orders #3
by Lucien Lachance

Are you ready to get your hands dirty, Silencer?
Your next target is a Khajiit nobleman by the name of J'Ghasta, who can be found at his home in the city of Bruma. J'Ghasta was recently offered the hand of a prominent Cyrodiil noble's daughter, but turned down the offer when he learned of the girl's rather negligible dowry. The girl's family is outraged, of course, and has hired the Dark Brotherhood to make J'Ghasta pay for his insolence.
Go to J'Ghasta's house in Bruma and end his miserable life. But be warned! The Khajiit is rich and bored, and spends most of his time honing his skills in unarmed combat. Any opponent who can kill with merely his hands is not to be trifled with, so tread carefully. Even worse, J'Ghasta is aware someone may be trying to kill him, and has bribed the guards not to interfere if a fight should spill out into the city streets.
When the target has been eliminated, you will find your next dead drop in a rotten box under the Old Bridge, just south of the Imperial City. The box will contain your reward for killing J'Ghasta, as well as information regarding your next contract.

plots: the player has volunteered to close the Oblivion Gate: Savlian Matius sent men in the Oblivion Gate to see if they could find a way to shut it

quest.title: Breaking the Siege of Kvatch
quest.objective: help defeat the Daedra invaders, and end the siege of Kvatch
tasks: close the Oblivion Gate
help defeat the Daedra invaders, and end the siege of Kvatch
quest.description:
You want to help? You're kidding, right? Hmm... if you're serious, maybe I can put you to use. It'll likely mean your death, though.
I don't know how to close this Gate, but it must be possible, because the enemy closed the ones they opened during the initial attack. You can see the marks on the ground where they were, with the Great Gate right in the middle. I sent men into the Gate, to see if they could find a way to shut it. They haven't come back. If you can get in there, find out what happened to them. If they're alive, help them finish the job. If not, see what you can do on your own.
The best I can say is, good luck. If you make it back alive, we'll be waiting for you. It's a brave thing you're doing.

kbs.name: Gray Fox
kbs.description: the player's guildleader in the Thieves Guild

kbs.name: Earl of Imbel, Jakben
kbs.description: a man , and the last known descendant of Springheel Jak

kbs.name: Savilla's Stone
kbs.description: a stone that reveals secrets to its fielder

plots: the Gray Fox has used Savilla's Stone, again, to find out that he needs another special item, the boots of Springheel Jak, to move forward with his plans
the Earl of Imbel is the last known descendant of Springheel Jak

quest.title: Boots of Springheel Jak
quest.objective: find out where Springheel Jak is buried, and retrieve his boots for the Gray Fox
tasks: Proceed to Imperial City.
search for clues in the Earl of Imbel's house
find out where Springheel Jak is buried, and retrieve his boots for the Gray Fox
quest.description:
Further use of Savilla's Stone has revealed that I need another special item to move forward with my plans. I need the boots of Springheel Jak. He is a famous thief that died some 300 years ago. Legend has it that he was buried with his boots on.
Find out where Springheel Jak is buried and bring me back those boots. Will you do this for me? It pays well.
The Earl of Imbel is the only descendant of Springheel Jak's line that I have been able to locate. His name is Jakben, and he lives somewhere in the Imperial City. There might be a clue in the Earl's house.

kbs.name: Kud-Ei
kbs.description: the player's superior in the Mages Guild

kbs.name: Ardaline
kbs.description: a female mage who is bullied by Varon Vamori

plots: the player asked a recommendation from Kud-Ei
Varon Vamori stole Ardaline's mage's staff
Kud-Ei gives the player a scroll with a powerful Illusion charm spell

quest.title: Mixed Feelings
quest.objective: recover Ardaline's mage's staff
tasks: charm Varon Vamori and make him tell you where Ardaline's mage's staff is
recover Ardaline's mage's staff
quest.description:
I'm afraid I haven't had time to prepare anything conventional for your recommendation. I'm very preoccupied with this situation concerning Ardaline.
Perhaps you can help with that, however. I can't directly get involved, for fear of embarrassing the poor girl. Varon Vamori's been bothering Ardaline every day for a while now. He even stole her Mages' Staff! Perhaps he thinks it's amusing; I don't know. But it needs to stop. It's making her miserable.
I'll need you to have a little chat with Varon Vamori to get Ardaline's staff back, and you can learn something about the power of Illusion in the process. Take this charm scroll. With it, you should find Varon more receptive to questioning.
Don't come back without that staff. I'll write you a recommendation for your help.

kbs.name: Bradon
kbs.description: Erline's husband, who was killed by Raynil Dralas

plots: Raynil Dralas killed Bradon in Bradon and Erline's home: the Bruma city watch found the body of a dead beggar in Bradon and Erline's's home afterwards
Raynil Dralas convinced Carius that Bradon was a vampire
no one has seen Bradon out in the daylight: Erline explains that Bradon works at night and sleeps on days
Erline has seen Raynil Dralas before

quest.title: A Brotherhood Betrayed
quest.objective: clear Bradon's name
tasks: find Raynil Dralas, and make him tell you the truth about Bradon's supposed vampirism
clear Bradon's name
quest.description:
I can't believe this is happening. Please... please. I need your help. My husband was no vampire! It's ridiculous! No one will listen to me! Forgive me. I loved my husband dearly, and to lose him this way makes no sense. Anything you can do to help would be wonderful. This is all happening so fast.
I came home only just a few hours ago. I found the door open, and my Bradon dead. Standing over him was a Dunmer. I screamed and ran out into the street. Some city watch were nearby and heard me I suppose, as they arrived quickly. I heard the Dunmer identify himself as Raynil Dralas. He said he was a vampire hunter and that Bradon was his mark. The guards seemed to know about Raynil, and after a search of the house, the body of some beggar was found stashed in our basement. The guards sent for Carius, who is an investigator for crimes here in Bruma. In minutes, Raynil convinced Carius that Bradon was a vampire.
Why would he stash a body in his own house? That's ridiculous! And another thing. The guards are making a big deal out of no one seeing Bradon out in the daylight. Well of course that's the case! He works at night, and has to sleep during the day. Why does that make him a vampire? It's all that Raynil character. I don't trust him. The thing that bothers me the most is that I swear I've seen him before. Of course he says he's never been here. Look, there isn't much more to say. Please... help me clear my husband's name.
Just find Raynil Dralas, and make him tell you the truth. I swear, he's a liar!

kbs.name: Boethia
kbs.description: the dark warrior, one of the Daedric Princes

kbs.name: one of Boethia's realms in Oblivion
kbs.description: one of Boethia's realms in Oblivion

kbs.name: Tournament of Ten Bloods
relations: one of Boethia's realms in Oblivion

plots: the player has summoned Boethia: the player is not a worshiper of Boethia
Boethia shall open a portal for the player to one of his realms in Oblivion
if the player fails the Tournament of Ten Bloods, the player's soul belongs to Boethia

quest.title: Boethia's Bloody Tournament
quest.objective: prove your worthiness to Boethia in the Tournament of Ten Bloods
tasks: Find your way to one of Boethia's realms in Oblivion.
survive the Tournament of Ten Bloods
prove your worthiness to Boethia in the Tournament of Ten Bloods
quest.description:
Why do you summon Boethia? You are not one of my faithful.
Do you hope to be counted among my Chosen? Then prove yourself to me, mortal. I shall open a portal for you to one of my realms in Oblivion. Go, and take your place in my Tournament of Ten Bloods.
Survive, and you will be rewarded with my glorious sword Goldbrand. Fail, and your soul belongs to me.

kbs.name: Arch-Mage Traven
kbs.description: the player's guildleader in the Mages Guild

kbs.name: Arcane University
kbs.description: the headquarters of the Mages Guild

kbs.name: Irlav Jarol
kbs.description: a male master wizard of the Mages Guild

kbs.name: Mannimarco
kbs.description: the male leader of the necromancers

kbs.name: Bloodworm Helm
kbs.description: a relic of the necromancers, a helmet

plots: Irlav Jarol and his group of mages want to use the Bloodworm Helm to fight Mannimarco
Arch-Mage Traven fears that necromancers might target Irlav Jarol

quest.title: The Bloodworm Helm
quest.objective: return the Bloodworm Helm to the Arcane University
tasks: Make your way to Fort Teleman.
find Irlav Jarol, his group of mages, and the Bloodworm Helm
return the Bloodworm Helm to the Arcane University
quest.description:
A group of mages led by Irlav Jarol took the Bloodworm Helm, and have retreated to Fort Teleman, in an effort to study it further.
They hope to learn enough from it to find some sort of way to fight Mannimarco. I tried to dissuade them, but it was no use.
I would like the helm to be returned, so that it may be kept safe here in the Arcane University. I fear Irlav has made himself a target for the Necromancers.

kbs.name: Jauffre
kbs.description: the male Grandmaster of the Blades

kbs.name: Tiber Septim
kbs.description: the legendary male Emperor who ascended to divinity

plots: Martin needs the blood of a Divine for the ritual to open the portal to Camoran's Paradise in addition to the first item, the blood of a Daedra

quest.title: Blood of the Divines
quest.objective: recover the blood of a Divine for Martin
tasks: talk to Jauffre about obtaining the blood of Tiber Septim
recover the blood of a Divine for Martin
quest.description:
I've figured out another item needed for the ritual to open the portal to Camoran's Paradise. The second item is the counterpart to the first: the blood of a Divine.
This was a terrible puzzle to me. Unlike the Daedra, the gods have no artifacts, and do not physically manifest themselves in our world.
How then to obtain the blood of a god? But Jauffre solved it. The blood of Tiber Septim himself, who became one of the Divines. This is a secret remembered only by the Blades, passed down from one Grandmaster to the next.
Jauffre should tell it to you himself.

kbs.name: Vicente Valtieri
kbs.description: the player's superior in the Dark Brotherhood

plots: On the second floor of Baenlin's house is a secreted door leading to a crawlspace containing the fastenings of a mounted head that hangs over Baenlin's favorite chair: if the player loosens the fastenings any night between 8:00 pm and 11:00 pm, the head will fall on Baenlin

quest.title: Accidents Happen
quest.objective: assassinate Baenlin by staging an accident
tasks: Make your way to Bruma.
enter Baenlin's house secretly and avoid Gromm
assassinate Baenlin by staging an accident
quest.description:
We need you to stage an... accident. Kill the target in the manner specified, and you'll receive a considerable bonus. The target is a Wood Elf named Baenlin. You will find him at his home in Bruma.
Enter secretly and avoid his manservant, Gromm. On the second floor is a secreted door leading to a crawlspace. Inside are the fastenings of a mounted head that hangs over Baenlin's favorite chair. Loosen the fastenings any night between 8:00 pm and 11:00 pm, and the head will surely fall on Baenlin as he relaxes in his chair, as is custom. If Baenlin is killed in any other manner, or if the manservant Gromm is killed, you will forfeit the bonus.
Now go, and may Death be with you.

kbs.name: Camoran's Paradise
kbs.description: the hideout of the player's enemy

kbs.name: Daedric
kbs.description: an adjective referring to the Daedra

plots: Martin has deciphered one of the four items needed for the ritual needed to open a portal to Camoran's Paradise with the Mysterium Xarxes: the blood of a Daedra Lord
"Modern Heretics" is the best introduction to Daedric cults: the library here has a copy
the Mysterium Xarxes ritual will consume the physical form of the Daedric artifact

quest.title: Blood of the Daedra
quest.objective: acquire a Daedric artifact for Martin
tasks: locate one of the Daedric cults
acquire a Daedric artifact for Martin
quest.description:
I've deciphered part of the ritual needed to open a portal to Camoran's Paradise.
The Mysterium Xarxes mentions four items needed for the ritual, but so far I have only deciphered one of them: the 'blood of a Daedra Lord'. In fact, Daedric artifacts are known to be formed from the essence of a Daedric Lord, from whence they derive their great power. Not an easy thing to come by, obviously, but we will need a Daedric artifact.
The only way to obtain a Daedric artifact is through the cults devoted to each of the Daedric Lords. The book "Modern Heretics" is the best introduction to Daedric cults. The library here has a copy if you need it.
Bring the artifact to me when you have acquired one. Remember, the Mysterium Xarxes ritual will consume the physical form of the artifact in order to release its Daedric power.

plots: the player asked Andragil to train the player in blocking

quest.title: Block Training
quest.objective: demonstrate your blocking skills to Andragil
tasks: block Andragil's attacks with your shield
demonstrate your blocking skills to Andragil
quest.description:
You want training, from me? Well, perhaps I can accommodate you. If you're worth the time and effort, that is. I think a little test is in order.
Thinking you know how to use a shield is one thing. Actually using one is quite another. So here's what we're going to do. We're going to find out whether or not you can hold up in combat. You put up your shield, and I hit you. If you're still standing when I'm done, you've earned the right to learn what I have to teach.
Shall we find out what you really know? Now, put up your guard, and let's begin. I'm losing interest in this.

plots: the player has asked training from Alix Lencolia: the player is not well known

quest.title: Blade Training
quest.objective: become known as a hero or a villain
tasks: increase your fame or infamy
become known as a hero or a villain
quest.description:
Training? From me? I'm sorry, friend, but I have no idea who you are. Never heard of you. I'm afraid I don't offer training to just anyone. If you were famous, perhaps... or infamous, I suppose... that might count for something. But, alas, you're not.
Until I hear your name spoken by others, don't expect any training from me. When you're known as a hero or a villain, I might change my mind.

plots: Thorley Aethelred built a fence around his sheep: it did not help with his bear problem

quest.title: Bear Season
quest.objective: bring the fangs of the 6 West Weald Bears as proof to Thorley Aethelred
tasks: kill 6 West Weald Bears to protect Thorley Aethelred's flock of sheep
bring the fangs of the 6 West Weald Bears as proof to Thorley Aethelred
quest.description:
It seems I'm having a bear problem and I just don't know what to do.
I've had attacks on my small flock of sheep lately. I was hoping that building a fence would solve the problem, but it hasn't helped at all. Then, one day when I was just about to step outside, I saw the culprits. A group of West Weald Bears was dragging away a sheep carcass. There's no way I can fight those ferocious beasts off on my own.
If you could thin the population a bit, they would probably leave the area. Kill six of the things, bring me their fangs as proof, and I'll reward you well.
Please, you're my only hope.

kbs.name: Azura
kbs.description: the queen of dawn and dusk, one of the Daedric Princes

plots: 5 followers of Azura slew Dratik and its vampire kin: the 5 followers of Azura were infected with vampirism and sealed themselves in the Gutted Mine

quest.title: Azura's Unfortunate Followers
quest.objective: perform a service to Azura
tasks: Proceed to Gutted Mine.
kill 5 followers of Azura
perform a service to Azura
quest.description:
Greetings, traveler. I am Azura, known as the Queen of Dawn and Dusk.
I have seen your name, traveler, and heard it whispered in twilight. I ask a service, which holds promise of fame and reward.
Many years ago, five followers of mine slew the vampire Dratik and its kin, but all were infected by the foul creature. Knowing their fate, they sealed themselves up in the vampire's lair. Their suffering weighs heavily on me. Five bright candles shall burn forever in memory of their sacrifice.
Travel to the Gutted Mine. The door will open to you. Bring the peace of death to my followers, and you shall earn my gratitude. For your service, you shall have my Star, that your deeds might be entered in the Book of Fate.

kbs.name: Hazadir
kbs.description: a famous man related to the history of smithing

plots: the player asked smithing training from Gin-Wulm

quest.title: Smithing Training
quest.objective: answer Gin-Wulm what the name Hazadir means, proving Gin-Wulm that you know about the history of smithing
tasks: Arrive at First Edition.
find a book about Hazadir to find the answer
answer Gin-Wulm what the name Hazadir means, proving Gin-Wulm that you know about the history of smithing
quest.description:
Mighty bold of you, asking for smithing training. What makes you think you're worth my time?
I bet you don't know the first thing about smithing. Have you read up on the history of the craft? I doubt it. You answer a simple question, and I'll think about training you.
So here it is: What does the name Hazadir mean to you? Few recognize the name anymore, even though he was famous.
Had a book written about him, in fact! I don't have a copy myself, but there was one in First Edition last time I was browsing there. At least some people take an interest in history.

kbs.name: Gray Fox
kbs.description: the player's guildmaster in the Thieves Guild

kbs.name: Malintus
kbs.description: a fellow member of the Thieves Guild

kbs.name: Savilla's Stone
kbs.description: a stone that reveals secrets to its fielder

plots: Savilla's Stone has revealed that the Gray Fox needs something special for his plans: the Arrow of Extrication
the player may kill Fathis Aren, but not in the castle of Bravil

quest.title: Arrow of Extrication
quest.objective: steal the Arrow of Extrication from Fathis Aren, and bring it to the Gray Fox
tasks: Reach Bravil.
talk to the beggars about locating the Arrow of Extrication
steal the Arrow of Extrication from Fathis Aren, and bring it to the Gray Fox
quest.description:
My work with Savilla's Stone has revealed that I need something special for my plans. It's a small item in the possession of a powerful court wizard. Will you do this for me? I will pay you well.
Bring me the Arrow of Extrication. It has a key shaped head. Bravil's court wizard, Fathis Aren, recently acquired this unique item. You may kill Fathis if necessary, but not in the castle. My spy network will tell me when you have it. Return here with the arrow when you do.
The beggars in Bravil will surely know where Aren keeps the Arrow. Now we should get out of Malintus' house before we wear out our welcome.

kbs.name: Modryn Oreyn
kbs.description: the player's superior in the Fighters Guild

kbs.name: Vitellus Donton
kbs.description: a fellow member of the Fighters Guild, a man

kbs.name: Vilena Donton
kbs.description: the female guildmaster of the Fighters Guild

plots: Modryn Oreyn has been investigating the Blackwood Company: they are a danger to the Fighters Guild
the Fighters Guild was contracted by Argoth to recover an artifact from Azani Blackheart: Modryn Oreyn went in there with twenty good men, and left with five
Vitellus Donton was not one of the survivors: he died while covering the Fighters Guild members' retreat
Argoth is dead and the artifact is gone after the Blackwood Company supposedly finished the contract instead of the Fighters Guild
Vilena Donton is not going to know about this mission: it's the player's choice to accept the mission

quest.title: Azani Blackheart
quest.objective: help Modryn Oreyn prove that the Blackwood Company lied about completing a contract for Argoth
tasks: Proceed to Leyawiin guild hall.
Reach Arpenia.
meet up with Modryn Oreyn
investigate Arpenia with Modryn Oreyn
help Modryn Oreyn prove that the Blackwood Company lied about completing a contract for Argoth
quest.description:
Good. You're here. We've got duties to attend to.
I've been looking into the Blackwood Company. Heard some disturbing things. We know they're a danger to us. And we know they're good at what they do.
I've heard stories, but nothing I can prove is true. Maybe they've got a mage working with them. Maybe they're just well trained. All I know for sure is that they'll accept any contract, and they'll do anything to complete it. And they don't care who gets in the way.
We were contracted by a wizard, Argoth, to recover an artifact from Azani Blackheart, a ruthless bandit leader. I went in there with twenty men. I left with five. Vitellus Donton wasn't one of them. He died covering our retreat. I snooped around. Apparently, the Blackwood Company completed that contract for us. I went in there with twenty good men. I can't believe that bunch finished the job. There's more. Argoth -- he's dead, the artifact gone. Sounds like a set-up. Maybe they made a deal with Blackheart. I don't know. But I'll find out.
Now we find out what really happened. And we let it be known. I want to show the people who the Blackwood Company really are. I can't order you do this with me. It's dangerous, and Vilena Donton isn't going to know about it. It's your choice.
If you accept this mission, we leave as soon as you're ready. I want to investigate Blackheart's stronghold at Arpenia. Meet me at the Leyawiin guild hall. We'll go from there.

kbs.name: Burz gro-Khash
kbs.description: the player's rude superior in the Fighters Guild

plots: Water's Edge is marked on the player's map

quest.title: Amelion's Contract
quest.objective: retrieve something from Biene Amelion's ancestral tomb for her
tasks: Travel to Water's Edge.
talk to Biene Amelion about her contract
retrieve something from Biene Amelion's ancestral tomb for her
quest.description:
I've got another contract for you, meat. I assume you won't embarrass yourself.
It's from Biene Amelion at the Water's Edge settlement. She needs something retrieved from her ancestral tomb. You'll find her at the Water's Edge settlement. It's marked on your map.
Try not to muck it up.

kbs.name: Tooth-in-the-Sea
relations: during the day, out under the waves in the bay

kbs.name: during the day, out under the waves in the bay
kbs.description: during the day, out under the waves in the bay

plots: the player told Tooth-in-the-Sea that they want to learn Alteration from him
the player must stay underwater with Tooth-in-the-Sea for three hours: the player must not wander off or they fail the test

quest.title: Alteration Training
quest.objective: prove Tooth-in-the-Sea that you are worthy of Alteration training
tasks: Make your way to during the day, out under the waves in the bay.
meet up with Tooth-in-the-Sea
prove Tooth-in-the-Sea that you are worthy of Alteration training
quest.description:
Would you learn from me? Then meet me during the day, out under the waves in the bay.
If you wish to learn what I know about Alteration, then you must stay there with me for a full three hours. How you manage to do this is up to you; do not wander off, or I shall consider this test of your ability failed.

kbs.name: Arch-Mage Traven
kbs.description: the player's guildmaster in the Mages Guild

kbs.name: Silorn
kbs.description: ruins in the south of Cyrodiil

kbs.name: King of Worms
kbs.description: the male master of the necromancers

plots: necromancers have been creating black soul gems for the King of Worms
Arch-Mage Traven believes that the Black Soul Gem may be instrumental in saving the Mages Guild

quest.title: Ambush
quest.objective: retrieve a unique Black Soul Gem from the necromancers, and return immediately to Arch-Mage Traven
tasks: Proceed to Silorn.
oversee a contingent of Battlemages in their fight with the necromancers
retrieve a unique Black Soul Gem from the necromancers, and return immediately to Arch-Mage Traven
quest.description:
Time is against us, and our enemies grow stronger. There is much to do, and little time in which to do it. Your next task is essential.
Word has been sent that the Necromancers have been quite busy, creating black soul gems for their master. In particular, a unique Black Soul Gem has been crafted in the south of Cyrodiil, in the ruins of Silorn.
This gem needs to be confiscated and brought here, before it can be delivered to the King of Worms and used against us. I have need of it. I believe the Black Soul Gem  may be instrumental in saving our guild. I will explain once you have returned with it. Until then, discussion is useless.
A contingent of Battlemages has been sent to the site. I would like you to oversee their actions on my behalf. The only thing that matters is that gem. Do you understand? Once you have it safely in your possession, return here immediately.
Know that you have my complete confidence. I would not entrust this job to you if I did not feel you were prepared for it. Now, go.

kbs.name: Carahil
kbs.description: the leader of one of the guild halls of Mages Guild

plots: the player asked a recommendation from Carahil: the player is new to the Mages Guild
the Council of Mages has entrusted Carahil to take care of an issue of merchant killings along the Gold Road
a rogue mage is suspected of the merchant killings: the only link between the victims is the Brina Cross Inn
battlemages have been sent to the Brina Cross Inn
the player can learn Restoration while facing a life and death situation

quest.title: Blood Money
quest.objective: investigate a number of merchants' deaths along the Gold Road
tasks: Reach Brina Cross Inn.
speak with Arielle Jurard about further instructions
investigate a number of merchants' deaths along the Gold Road
quest.description:
So you are here for your recommendation? Unlike some frivolous tasks you may be given at other guild halls, this is a serious matter, and has consequences. Are you prepared?
Allow me to explain the task. The Council of Mages has entrusted me with resolving a situation along the Gold Road. Several traveling merchants have been found dead along the Gold Road recently, with even more missing. The Council has asked that I put a stop to it. You are going to help me do so.
As you are new to the guild, you are less likely to be recognized as a member. This may give you an advantage in getting to the root of the problem. We believe the killings are the actions of a rogue mage. Battlemages have been sent to the Brina Cross Inn, the only common link between the victims.
You are to travel north to the Brina Cross Inn, and speak with Arielle Jurard. She will give you further instructions.
This is a harsh, dangerous task for you, I realize. Your unfamiliar face makes you most useful, however. And, what better way to learn the many uses of Restoration? Practical application is often the best educator. Even in life and death situations.

kbs.name: Sinderion
kbs.description: a wine enthusiast, and a master alchemist

plots: the player asked Sinderion to train them

quest.title: Alchemy Training
quest.objective: bring a bottle of each of the best wines from Skingrad to Sinderion
tasks: find a bottle of Tamika's, and Surilie Brothers vintages of year 399
bring a bottle of each of the best wines from Skingrad to Sinderion
quest.description:
Training? Oh, I'm afraid that's not my area of expertise. I'm very focused on wines right now, you see.
Wonderful thing, wine. It's all about the balance. The flavor, the bouquet, the consistency... just wonderful. I'm sorry, what? Training... right. I'll make you a deal: you fetch me a bottle of each of the best wines from Skingrad, and I'll think about it.
Both vineyards, Tamika's and Surilie Brothers. Vintage 399. Oh, what a good year that was...

kbs.name: Captain Burd
kbs.description: the male captain of the Bruma guard

plots: the player taught Captain Burd and his guardsmen how to close Oblivion Gates: however, they cannot defend Bruma alone from the innumerable Daedra of Oblivion

quest.title: Allies for Bruma
quest.objective: bring in reinforcements for Bruma from the other cities of Cyrodiil and the Elder Council before the Mythic Dawn opens a Great Oblivion Gate in Bruma
tasks: speak to the leaders of the other cities of Cyrodiil and the Elder Council and ask them to send help to Bruma
bring in reinforcements for Bruma from the other cities of Cyrodiil and the Elder Council before the Mythic Dawn opens a Great Oblivion Gate in Bruma
quest.description:
Good work. Captain Burd and his guardsmen should be able to handle any additional Gates, at least for now. But the Bruma Guard cannot defend the city indefinitely. The Daedra of Oblivion are innumerable; the guardsmen of Bruma are not.
We need to gather what allies we can before Bruma is hopelessly besieged. If the Mythic Dawn manages to open a Great Gate here, the city will need a stronger garrison for there to be any hope of defending it.
You should speak to the rulers of the other cities of Cyrodiil, as well as the Elder Council. Ask them to send aid to Bruma before it is too late.

kbs.name: Raminus Polus
kbs.description: the player's underling in the Mages Guild

kbs.name: Lustratorium
kbs.description: the alchemical center of the university of mages

kbs.name: Julienne Fanis
kbs.description: a female alchemist in the Mages Guild

kbs.name: Traven
kbs.description: a male mage, and the previous guild leader of the Mages Guild

plots: the player is the new Arch-Mage after Traven

quest.title: Alchemy Acquisitions
quest.objective: use the expertise of Julienne Fanis for your own benefit
tasks: Travel to Lustratorium.
talk to Julienne Fanis about her collecting alchemical ingredients for you
use the expertise of Julienne Fanis for your own benefit
quest.description:
As the Arch-Mage, you are entitled to certain privileges.
In addition to the full use of all Guild facilities, there is one service available to you. Julienne Fanis has long served Arch-Mage Traven in collecting alchemical ingredients for his personal research. As the new Arch-Mage, I'm sure she'll extend the service to you as well.
At your convenience, consult her at the Lustratorium.

kbs.name: an Ancestor Glade in Skyrim, in the pine forest
kbs.description: an Ancestor Glade in Skyrim, in the pine forest

kbs.name: "Blood"
kbs.description: an Elder Scroll which foreshadows the defiance of the gods with the blood of mortals

kbs.name: Elder Scrolls
kbs.description: mysterious scrolls which are fragments of creation from outside time and space
relations: an Ancestor Glade in Skyrim, in the pine forest

plots: the ritual of the Ancestor Moth: the player must remove the bark from a canticle tree with a draw knife to attract Ancestor Moths to them

quest.title: Unseen Visions
quest.objective: read "Blood"
tasks: Proceed to an Ancestor Glade in Skyrim, in the pine forest.
perform the ritual of the Ancestor Moth to gain the second sight needed to decipher the Elder Scrolls
read "Blood"
quest.description:
Scattered across Tamriel are secluded locations known only as Ancestor Glades. There's one in Skyrim, in the Pine Forest.
Performing the Ritual of the Ancestor Moth within the glade should provide the answers you seek. It involves carefully removing the bark from a Canticle Tree which will in turn attract Ancestor Moths to you.
In keeping with tradition, you must use a specific tool in the Ancestor Glade, an implement known as a Draw Knife. Every Moth Priest is taught this ritual, but few ever get the chance to perform it... you should consider yourself fortunate if it works for you.
Once enough of the moths are following, they'll provide you with the second sight needed to decipher the Elder Scrolls. From what I saw in the vision, the Elder Scroll which foreshadows the defiance of the gods with the blood of mortals is the key to the prophecy.

kbs.name: Cyrodiil
kbs.description: a province half a continent away from the player and Serana

kbs.name: Elder Scrolls
kbs.description: mysterious scrolls used in divining prophecies

plots: Serana has a large Elder Scroll on her back: Serana's Elder Scroll will have something that can help the player and Serana stop Serana's father
the moth priests of Cyrodiil are the only people who can read Elder Scrolls

quest.title: Prophet
quest.objective: find a way to read Serana's Elder Scroll
tasks: Go to College of Winterhold.
ask the wizards about reading Elder Scrolls
find a way to read Serana's Elder Scroll
quest.description:
So, in case you didn't notice the giant thing on my back, I have an Elder Scroll with me. Whatever it says, it will have something that can help us stop my father. But of course, neither of us can read it.
The Moth Priests are the only ones I've heard of who can do it. They spend years preparing before they start reading, though. Not that it helps us anyway, because they're all half a continent away in Cyrodiil.
The College of Winterhold was the first place I'd think to go for any kind of magic or historical thing. The wizards there know about all kinds of things that people probably shouldn't know about.

kbs.name: Moth Priest
kbs.description: a priest who has dedicated his whole life to reading and deciphering Elder Scrolls

kbs.name: Elder Scrolls
kbs.description: mysterious scrolls used in divining prophecies

plots: Lord Harkon is giving a speech to the player and their fellow vampires: the player and the other vampires will dominate over the sun itself, and forge a realm of eternal darkness
Lord Harkon has reclaimed one of his Elder Scrolls and needs a Moth Priest to read it

quest.title: Prophet of the Night
quest.objective: locate a Moth Priest for Lord Harkon
tasks: speak to innkeepers, carriage drivers and travelers about the rumors of a Moth Priest in Skyrim
locate a Moth Priest for Lord Harkon
quest.description:
Scions of the night! Hear my words! The prophesied time is at last upon us. Soon we will claim dominion over the sun itself, and forge a new realm of eternal darkness.
Now that I have reclaimed one of my Elder Scrolls, we must find a Moth Priest to read it. I have spread false rumors about the discovery of an Elder Scroll in Skyrim to lure a Moth Priest here. Now it is time to see if those efforts have borne fruit.
Go forth, and search the land for rumors of a Moth Priest within our borders. Look to the cities. Speak to innkeepers, carriage drivers, anyone who would meet a traveler.
Go now, and carry out this task. This is my command!

kbs.name: Isran
kbs.description: the player's leader in the Dawnguard
relations: Reach, trying to find dwarven ruins

kbs.name: Sorine Jurard
kbs.description: a smart Breton girl, who is good with tinkering and fascinated with the Dwemer and their weapons
relations: Reach, trying to find dwarven ruins

kbs.name: Reach, trying to find dwarven ruins
kbs.description: Reach, trying to find dwarven ruins

kbs.name: Gunmar
kbs.description: a big, brutish Nord man, who trains animals, especially trolls
relations: Reach, trying to find dwarven ruins

plots: the Dawnguard is fighting against powerful vampires, who have an Elder Scroll

quest.title: A New Order
quest.objective: recruit Isran's old allies for the Dawnguard
tasks: find Sorine Jurard and Gunmar, and recruit them for the Dawnguard
recruit Isran's old allies for the Dawnguard
quest.description:
We're up against powerful vampires, unlike anything we've seen before. And they have an Elder Scroll.
There are people I've met and worked with over the years. We need their skills, their talents, if we're going to survive this.
I think we'll want Sorine Jurard. Breton girl, whip-smart and good with tinkering. Fascination with the Dwemer. Weapons in particular. Last I knew, she was out in the Reach, convinced she was about to find the biggest dwarven ruins yet. You'll also want to find Gunmar. Big brute of a Nord, hates vampires almost as much as I do. Got it into his head years back that his experience with animals would help. Trolls in particular, from what I hear.
If you can find them, we might have a chance.

kbs.name: Isran
kbs.description: the player's leader in the Dawnguard

kbs.name: Brunwulf Free-Winter
kbs.description: a Jarl holding his court in Windhelm

plots: Brunwulf Free-Winter's guards are unaware of the threat, and will treat violence against the visiting advisor as a crime

quest.title: A Jarl's Justice
quest.objective: kill a vampire masquerading as a visiting advisor in Brunwulf Free-Winter's court
tasks: Go to Windhelm.
convince Brunwulf Free-Winter that the visiting advisor is a threat to him
kill a vampire masquerading as a visiting advisor in Brunwulf Free-Winter's court
quest.description:
Jarl Brunwulf Free-Winter is in danger. A vampire plays as a visiting "advisor" to the court of Windhelm. Destroy it before it's able to complete its foul business.
But be warned. The Jarl's guards are unaware of the threat, and will treat violence against this "advisor" as a crime. Convince the Jarl of the threat and he'll let you destroy the creature. If not, then do your best not to get caught.
Quickly now! The longer you delay, the more danger the Jarl is in.

kbs.name: "The Aetherium Wars"
kbs.description: a book written by Katria's male apprentice, contains Katria's research on the Aetherium Forge

plots: the player read "The Aetherium Wars"

quest.title: Lost to the Ages
quest.objective: search for the Aetherium Forge with Katria
tasks: find Katria's journal, which contains her notes about the Aetherium Forge
search for the Aetherium Forge with Katria
quest.description:
The name's Katria. I am - was - an adventurer. Raided ruins like this for nigh on twenty years. I was on the trail of something big. It led me here, and... I didn't make it.
Oh. You read the book, didn't you? "The Aetherium Wars"? It was my theory, you know. My research. My life's work. All of it, lost! Stolen by my own damn apprentice! That's how I ended up here. I can't rest. Not until I find the Aetherium Forge, until I can prove that it was my discovery. Mine, not his!
Hmm... well, you can pick up where I left off. My notes should still be in my journal, if you can read it. We still have to find the Forge itself. I had a lead on that, too.

kbs.name: Isran
kbs.description: the player's leader in the Dawnguard

kbs.name: Castle Volkihar
kbs.description: a castle belonging to Harkon in Tamriel

plots: Isran will address the player's fellow Dawnguard members before leaving for Castle Volkihar: the Dawnguard has gained the upper hand in the fight against the vampires

quest.title: Judgment
quest.objective: destroy Harkon
tasks: Head to Castle Volkihar.
meet up with Isran and the rest of your Dawnguard allies
destroy Harkon
quest.description:
The day hasn't been won while the vampire Harkon still walks Tamriel.
Let me address the Dawnguard, and then we'll be off. The men deserve to know that we've finally gained the upper hand. It's time we take the fight to their door.
Gather your things and rest well, my friend. We meet outside Castle Volkihar.

kbs.name: Harkon
kbs.description: Serana's father, and the lord of the vampires

plots: Serana thinks that the player can't trust Harkon after they spoke with Serana's mother in the Soul Cairn: the player can't bring the bow to Harkon

quest.title: Kindred Judgment
quest.objective: kill Harkon
tasks: face Harkon with Serana
kill Harkon
quest.description:
I think we both know... it's time to face my father Harkon. If we don't, he'll keep chasing us for the rest of our lives.
Well, before we spoke to my mother in the Soul Cairn, I would have said we bring the bow to my father. But after everything with her... I don't think we can trust him. No. He has to die. We have no choice.
Let's face him together.

kbs.name: Vingalmo
kbs.description: a fellow vampire, who speaks elegantly

plots: the player is married: it presents difficulties for vampires
vampirism is the greatest gift that vampires can bestow to their loved ones

quest.title: The Gift
quest.objective: turn your wife into a vampire
tasks: use vampiric seduction on your wife, embrace her and bite her neck
turn your wife into a vampire
quest.description:
It's come to my inescapable attention that you, my dear friend, are married. Marriage is a fine institution, however, one that does present certain difficulties for such as like ourselves.
May I strongly suggest that you make a visit to this spouse of yours and "invite" her to the family by offering her the Gift of Vampirism. Put her mind to rest, allay her fear through vampiric seduction and when she is in a pliant condition, embrace her and bite her on the neck.
It is the greatest token we can bestow upon those we love and wish to see protected.

kbs.name: Durnehviir
kbs.description: a dragon, and a reluctant servant of the Ideal Masters

kbs.name: Soul Cairn
kbs.description: a terrible dimension that imprisons souls

plots: the player fought against Durnehviir in the past: Durnehviir respects the player

quest.title: Durnehviir
quest.objective: learn a dragon shout from Durnehviir
tasks: Arrive at Tamriel.
summon Durnehviir by speaking his name to the heavens
learn a dragon shout from Durnehviir
quest.description:
My desire to speak with you was born from the result of our battle. I merely wish to respectfully ask a favor of you.
For countless years I've roamed the Soul Cairn, in unintended service to the Ideal Masters. Before this, I roamed the skies above Tamriel. I desire to return there.
I fear that my time here has taken its toll upon me. I share a bond with this dreaded place. If I ventured far from the Soul Cairn, my strength would begin to wane until I was no more.
I will place my name with you and grant you the right to call my name from Tamriel. Do me this simple honor and I will fight at your side as your Grah-Zeymahzin, your Ally, and teach you my Thu'um.
Simply speak my name to the heavens when you feel the time is right.

plots: the player is presenting an ancient Falmer tome to Urag gro-Shub and asking if Urag gro-Shub is interested in buying it

quest.title: Forgotten Books
quest.objective: bring ancient Falmer tomes to Urag gro-Shub
tasks: find more ancient Falmer tomes
bring ancient Falmer tomes to Urag gro-Shub
quest.description:
Well, well. I haven't seen one of these beauties in a long time. A rare find in the original Falmer language. You're damn right I'm interested. Question is, are you selling?
Well, considering no one else in Skyrim would buy something they couldn't possibly read, I'd say you don't have much of a choice. Tell you what, you bring me books like this, and I'll pay a thousand gold each. I'll even throw in a translated edition I have for free.
If you're holding out for more gold, it's never going to happen.

kbs.name: Fura Bloodmouth
relations: an abandoned fort in the Reach

kbs.name: an abandoned fort in the Reach
kbs.description: an abandoned fort in the Reach

plots: the Dawnguard will become even more of a nuisance now that Auriel's Bow has been recovered

quest.title: Destroying the Dawnguard
quest.objective: prevent the Dawnguard from becoming a serious threat against the vampires
tasks: Travel to an abandoned fort in the Reach.
kill the Dawnguard leaders
prevent the Dawnguard from becoming a serious threat against the vampires
quest.description:
The Dawnguard will, no doubt, soon become even more of a nuisance now that Auriel's Bow has been recovered.
We need to strike a crippling blow against them before they muster more men against us. They've holed up in an abandoned fort in the Reach. The Dawnguard are apparently focused on exterminating vampires, noble and brute alike. Not a serious threat, but we can't leave them completely unchecked or they may become one.
But their time has come to an end. And you will be the one that ends it. Killing their leaders should discourage them from an out and out war with us.

plots: the player entered the room where Melka has been imprisoned

quest.title: The Affairs of Hagravens
quest.objective: help Melka reclaim her tower by killing Petra
tasks: Go to Melka's tower.
let Melka out of the cage
help Melka reclaim her tower by killing Petra
quest.description:
Who enters? Will nobody save poor Melka?
You, meat! Come, come. Don't leave poor Melka to die. Pretty, pretty flesh. Let me out!
Petra! Evil Petra put me in a cage, stole my tower. Hate her, chew her bones! Let me out, kind, kind meat.
Ah, I have a pretty staff. Help me find Petra, wring her neck, pluck her eyes. Take my prize staff, I just want my tower back!

plots: Feran Sadri gives the player Dawnguard armor, and a note for framing the Dawnguard

quest.title: Deceiving the Herd
quest.objective: frame the Dawnguard for murder
tasks: Go to Whiterun.
murder someone influential in public while wearing Dawnguard armor and plant a note on the victim
frame the Dawnguard for murder
quest.description:
The Dawnguard have increased their operations and have been aggressively recruiting in Whiterun.
We need to put a damper on their efforts and give those trouble makers something to worry about other than harassing our interests.
You are to make a public show of murdering someone. Do it in the streets for all to see. The higher the profile the better. Someone attached to the court, a merchant, a bard, a priest, someone with stature. Make it seem you are a member of the Dawnguard, thus sowing confusion among the herd. Wear this armor and plant this note on the victim.
The people will put pressure on the Dawnguard who are apparently murdering their fellows without provocation. Their focus will be shifted from us, giving us one less nuisance to deal with.

plots: the Thalmor are also looking for Esbern

quest.title: A Cornered Rat
quest.objective: locate Esbern, and ask where he was on the 30th of Frostfall
tasks: Find your way to Riften.
talk to Brynjolf about finding Esbern
locate Esbern, and ask where he was on the 30th of Frostfall
quest.description:
We've got to find Esbern in Riften before the Thalmor do. He'll know how to stop the dragons if anybody does. You'd better get to Riften. Talk to Brynjolf. He's... well-connected. A good starting point at least.
Oh, and when you find Esbern... if you think I'm paranoid... you may have some trouble getting him to trust you. Just ask him where he was on the 30th of Frostfall. He'll know what it means.

kbs.name: Nikulas
kbs.description: Edla's son, strong and loyal, yet reckless and foolish

plots: Edla recently lost her husband: Nikulas is everything she has left

quest.title: The Lure of of the World
quest.objective: convince Nikulas to stay with his mother
tasks: counsel Nikulas on the perils of the world
convince Nikulas to stay with his mother
quest.description:
I'm Edla. I have a son. His name is Nikulas. He's a good lad, strong and loyal. I only wish he wasn't so eager to leave the village. I've tried to tell him that the world beyond our lands is dangerous and cruel, but he won't listen.
For now, I need Nikulas here. You see, his father, my husband, was recently lost to us. Nikulas is all that I have left in this world. I know it is selfish of me to say so, but I cannot lose him. Not while I still grieve. Also, I know his heart. Nikulas is reckless and foolish, like most young men. He cannot understand what awaits him in the wide world.
Could you talk to Nikulas? I know he would listen to you. You've been out there in the wide world. You know its perils.

kbs.name: Isran
kbs.description: the male leader of the Dawnguard

plots: vampires are becoming a larger threat

quest.title: Dawnguard
quest.objective: join the Dawnguard
tasks: Make your way to Fort Dawnguard.
speak with Isran about joining the Dawnguard
join the Dawnguard
quest.description:
I'm Durak of the Dawnguard.
We are vampire hunters. We search out and destroy those bloodsucking scum wherever we find them. We are looking for anyone willing to fight against the growing vampire menace.
Everybody says that they are not interested about joining, right up until they find their throat being ripped out by a pack of hungry vampires.
Want to sign up to the Dawnguard and kill vampires? Go talk to Isran, our leader, at Fort Dawnguard, southeast of Riften. He'll decide if you're Dawnguard material.

plots: the rings of blood magic increase the abilities of the player's vampiric powers: Molag Bal supposedly gave the rings to vampires

quest.title: Rings of Blood Magic
quest.objective: retrieve a set of ancient rings of blood magic for yourself
tasks: Reach Swindler's Den.
Travel to Cragwallow Slope.
retrieve the Ring of the Erudite
retrieve the Ring of the Beast
retrieve a set of ancient rings of blood magic for yourself
quest.description:
I've discovered the whereabouts of a set of ancient rings of Blood Magic: the Ring of the Erudite in Swindler's Den and the Ring of the Beast in Cragwallow Slope. They belong among our kind, not gathering mold in some vagabond's treasure pile.
The rings increase the abilities of your vampiric powers. Some say Molag Bal himself gave these rings to ancient powerful vampire lords. Some say that is just a myth.
You'll be able to keep the rings. I wouldn't be telling you where to find them if I desired them for myself.

kbs.name: Tolfdir
kbs.description: the player's teacher at the College of Winterhold

kbs.name: Staff of Magnus
kbs.description: a powerful staff that can breach magical shields according to the Psijics

plots: Tolfdir and the others can't crack Ancano's magical shield around the College of Winterhold
the player got the Staff of Magnus the Labyrinthian

quest.title: The Eye of Magnus
quest.objective: force Ancano stop exploiting the Eye of Magnus
tasks: get inside the College of Winterhold with the Staff of Magnus and reach Ancano
force Ancano stop exploiting the Eye of Magnus
quest.description:
Ancano has sealed himself inside the College! The Eye of Magnus is is growing his power. We can't crack whatever magic he's using to shield himself.
I hope your trip to Labyrinthian was worth it. You have the Staff of Magnus, then? Let's hope it's as powerful as the Psijics believe it to be.
You're the one with the staff, my child. If it can help us get inside the College, and reach Ancano, we'll have to hope that there's a way to stop all this.

plots: the player asked Neloth whether they could help with his research

quest.title: Experimental Subject
quest.objective: help Neloth by being a test subject in his experiment
tasks: stand still and let Neloth cast an experimental spell on you
help Neloth by being a test subject in his experiment
quest.description:
You want to help with my research? Are you willing to be an experimental subject?
Oh, it's nothing too dangerous. The experiment should provide an additional spectral tether from your own lifespark to the divine realm. You would experience it as a sort of... increased vigor. You would fight longer, feel stronger, that sort of thing. At least I think it will. Probably. Almost certainly. Of course, you never can tell.
Now stand still... it's my first time casting this spell, and I don't need any additional distractions.

kbs.name: Valdar
kbs.description: a ghostly guardian whose powers are fading

kbs.name: Hevnoraak
kbs.description: an evil man who has been dead for many generations

plots: Valdar has been holding Hevnoraak in his tomb
Hevnoraak's minions guard the three vessels

quest.title: Evil in Waiting
quest.objective: help Valdar defeat Hevnoraak before he awakens
tasks: Find your way to in the tomb below.
collect the three vessels needed to vanquish Hevnoraak, and bring them to Valdar
help Valdar defeat Hevnoraak before he awakens
quest.description:
Leave, stranger. Evil stirs in this place. I fear for the security of the very land if it should break free.
We stand at the tomb of Hevnoraak, who has been dead for many generations. I fear, however, that his return may be at hand. I have been holding him here. While he regains strength, however, I am fading. By now I can barely contain his power, much less defeat him if he awakens. But with the help of a living champion I may be able to succeed.
Three vessels in the tomb below hold the power to vanquish Hevnoraak. Before anything else, we need those. Bring them to me - but be careful, mortal. They are guarded by Hevnoraak's minions. They will stop at nothing to see their master return.

kbs.name: Mralki
kbs.description: Erik's father, an innkeeper in Rorikstead

plots: the player is an adventurer

quest.title: Erik the Adventurer
quest.objective: help Erik become an adventurer
tasks: convince Mralki buy armor for Erik
help Erik become an adventurer
quest.description:
You look like you've seen your share of adventure. I envy you that. In fact, maybe you can help me with something.
I want to be an adventurer like you, but my father says I can't. He says that he needs me to stay here and work the farm, and even if he did let me be an adventurer, we couldn't afford to buy armor. His name's Mralki, and he's the innkeeper here. I hope you can change my father's mind. He can be a little stubborn.
I can't stand the thought of being trapped in this village for the rest of my days.

plots: the player asked Farengar Secret-Fire to teach them how to enchant weapons and armor
learning an enchantment from an item destroys the item
Farengar Secret-Fire can sell the player everything they need

quest.title: The Joy of Enchanting
quest.objective: use an Arcane Enchanter and a filled soul gem to enchant something
tasks: take an enchanted weapon or piece of armor and use an Arcane Enchanter to learn its enchantment
use an Arcane Enchanter and a filled soul gem to enchant something
quest.description:
Ah, a student of the craft. You'll need to start by learning an enchantment.
Take an enchanted weapon or piece of armor, then use the Arcane Enchanter to learn its secrets. The item is destroyed in the process, so be wary. Once you know an enchantment, you'll need a filled soul gem, and something to enchant. You'll use the Arcane Enchanter for that, too.
Of course I have everything you need for sale, if you have the coin.

kbs.name: Sergius Turrianus
kbs.description: an enchanter at the College of Winterhold

plots: the player is a student at the College of Winterhold
Sergius Turrianus gives the player the name and the location of the client

quest.title: Enchanting Pick-Up
quest.objective: bring an item from a client to Sergius Turrianus
tasks: get the item from Sergius Turrianus' client
bring an item from a client to Sergius Turrianus
quest.description:
There's more enchanting to be done. You can acquire whatever it is and bring it back here, and I'll take care of it.
Be quick about it, will you? This is a good way for the College to bring in some money.
Here's the name and location of the client.

kbs.name: Elmus
kbs.description: a brewer from Thirsk Mead Hall

kbs.name: Ashfire Mead
kbs.description: a special brew made at Thirsk Mead Hall

plots: the player asked Elmus if they could help him

quest.title: Mead for Elmus
quest.objective: retrieve one bottle of Ashfire Mead for Elmus
tasks: Head to Thirsk Mead Hall.
grab a bottle of Ashfire Mead
retrieve one bottle of Ashfire Mead for Elmus
quest.description:
Actually, now that I think of it, I have been missing the Ashfire Mead. It's a special brew that we make at Thirsk.
If you could... somehow... get up there and grab a bottle, I'd be a long way towards forgetting how miserable it is down here.

plots: Talos worship is outlawed in the Empire: when they buried Torygg, Elisif the Fair made offerings to all the gods except Talos

quest.title: Elisif's Tribute
quest.objective: help Elisif the Fair make the offering to Talos to complete her husband's burial
tasks: Go to a hidden shrine to Talos.
take Torygg's war horn to the shrine
help Elisif the Fair make the offering to Talos to complete her husband's burial
quest.description:
There's something... personal... I was hoping you would do for me.
As you may know Talos worship is outlawed in the Empire. When we buried my husband I made offerings to all the gods... except Talos. My husband Torygg would want a proper burial.
I would like you to take an item of his, a war horn handed down from his father, and place it at a Shrine of Talos.
It would mean a lot to me.

plots: the player helped Elmus and the others reclaim the Thirsk Mead Hall from monsters

quest.title: Berries for Elmus
quest.objective: retrieve some juniper berries for Elmus
tasks: Reach Skyrim.
find juniper berries
retrieve some juniper berries for Elmus
quest.description:
We lost most of the mead batches we had brewing when... before those things were here. One is just ready to take its turn, though, and it's about time to add some of the flavorings.
You can't find them on Solstheim, but if you find yourself back in Skyrim, I wouldn't mind you bringing some juniper berries.
They add a different kind of sweetness. Tart. Makes the flavor more round.

kbs.name: Ebony Warrior
kbs.description: a man who has done all that can be done

plots: only the player can send the Ebony Warrior to Sovngarde

quest.title: The Ebony Warrior
quest.objective: fight the Ebony Warrior
tasks: locate the Ebony Warrior
fight the Ebony Warrior
quest.description:
I am the Ebony Warrior. I have come to challenge you to a fight.
I have done all that can be done. There is nothing left. No quests to be undertaken. No villains to be slain. No challenges to face.
Except for you. You are my last challenge. Only you can send me to Sovngarde with honor.
Make your preparations. When you are ready, come find me at my last vigil.

kbs.name: College of Winterhold
kbs.description: a school for mages in Skyrim

kbs.name: Elder Scroll
kbs.description: a scroll that can show the player the past

plots: the player asked Esbern what they need to learn Dragonrend

quest.title: Elder Knowledge
quest.objective: recover an Elder Scroll to learn Dragonrend
tasks: Arrive at College of Winterhold.
talk to the mages about finding an Elder Scroll
recover an Elder Scroll to learn Dragonrend
quest.description:
Ah, you need an Elder Scroll. There's a pretty puzzle. Not the kind of thing you'll find in your local bookshop. Let me think...
Perhaps the College of Winterhold. What learning there is in Skyrim is gathered there. One of the mages there may be able to put you on the trail of this Elder Scroll.
This Elder Scroll might be able to show you the past in some way, and let you learn the Dragonrend shout.

kbs.name: Igmund
kbs.description: the nobleman who rules over Markarth

plots: the player asked more work from Igmund
Igmund's father tried to negotiate with the Forsworn: they took his shield to Hagravens

quest.title: A Shield for Igmund
quest.objective: retrieve the shield for Igmund
tasks: Find your way to Hag's End.
get Igmund's father's shield back from Hagravens
retrieve the shield for Igmund
quest.description:
I do have more work for you. A personal matter. My father died trying to negotiate with the Forsworn, back when that was possible.
They took his shield to Hag's End, to those Hagraven beasts they consort with. I need you to bring it home where it belongs. I warn you, it's dangerous work. No man of mine has ever faced a Hagraven and lived. I'll understand if you decline.
Return my father's shield to me and I'll grant you permission to purchase property in my city.
Divines watch over you.

kbs.name: Herd
kbs.description: a male bandit in the bandit leader's gang, hates Brodir

kbs.name: Brodir
kbs.description: a male bandit in the bandit leader's gang, hates Herd

kbs.name: "Bandit Leader's Journal"
kbs.description: a journal written by the bandit leader

plots: the bandit leader thinks that his men are going to mutiny: Herd and Brodir are leading their own cliques within the bandits
the bandit leader is going to gather up gold and escape downriver to Dragon Bridge

quest.title: Robber's Stash
quest.objective: find the bandit leader's stash by the old tree stump
tasks: go to the island to the south and find the old tree stump
find the bandit leader's stash by the old tree stump
quest.description:
Bandit Leader's Journal

5th of First Seed, 4E 201
Idiots! Brodir and Herd were at each others' throats again today, and nearly came to blows. The whole camp is on edge. I've ordered an extra ration of mead, but unless this fighting stops, we'll tear ourselves apart.

11th of First Seed, 4E 201
Rumor is that Herd's gathering followers for a mutiny. Brodir's not stupid; he's probably doing the same, just for insurance. I'd kill them both myself, but the camp's split right down the middle. If I tried, there'd be a knife in my back within a week.
I can't take this anymore. I've begun skimming a little gold from the take, bringing it down here when I can. If I can scrape enough together, I'll make a run for it, head downriver to Dragon Bridge.

28th of First Seed, 4E 201
Brodir's getting suspicious -- I caught him poking around in the cove this afternoon. I don't think he found my stash, but it's not safe here. I took the boat out tonight and stowed it on the island to the south, by the old tree stump.
Had a good haul this week. Another caravan or two and I can finally get out of here, and not a moment too soon.

kbs.name: Ring of Pure Mixtures
kbs.description: a ring that boosts an alchemist's talents

plots: Frida's husband died while searching for the Ring of Pure Mixtures

quest.title: A Ring Worthy of Alchemists
quest.objective: retrieve the Ring of Pure Mixtures for Frida
tasks: Go to Shrouded Grove.
find the Ring of Pure Mixtures
retrieve the Ring of Pure Mixtures for Frida
quest.description:
I'm Frida, the oldest woman in Dawnstar.
I picked up the herb trade from my husband. We used to go out in the wilds and collect ingredients together. He used to call me his "pretty Juniper." It's quite romantic, if you're an alchemist. Frost took the old fool a few seasons back, while he was looking for the Ring of Pure Mixtures.
I found the ring's resting place, Shrouded Grove, after he died, but I'm far too old to go exploring some cave, now. I'd be happy to give you some alchemy training in exchange for the ring, if you bring it to me.

kbs.name: Runil
kbs.description: a priest of Arkay and old, regretful elf

kbs.name: Arkay
kbs.description: the god of life and death

plots: Runil became a priest of Arkay after the Great War: many died by Runil's magics
Kust and the people of Falkreath have come to accept Runil as one of their own

quest.title: A Journal of Regret
quest.objective: retrieve Runil's journal for him
tasks: Arrive at Darkshade Copse.
find Runil's journal
retrieve Runil's journal for him
quest.description:
I am Runil, a priest of Arkay. I came into Arkay's light after the Great War. So many died by my hands, my magics.
I'm fortunate that Kust and the people of Falkreath have come to accept me as one of their own.
Could you do an old elf a favor? I misplaced my journal in a cave I was exploring. I'll pay for its return.
Blessing of Arkay to you for your help.

kbs.name: Noster Eagle-Eye
kbs.description: a former scout of the Imperial Legion

plots: Noster Eagle-Eye tracked down all the places in the wilds that were causing people trouble: he lost his helmet in one of the old caves

quest.title: Noster's Lost Helmet
quest.objective: retrieve Noster Eagle-Eye's helmet for him
tasks: find Noster Eagle-Eye's helmet
retrieve Noster Eagle-Eye's helmet for him
quest.description:
I'm Noster Eagle-Eye. I was the finest scout in the Imperial Legion, once. Tracked down all the places in the wilds that were causing people trouble.
Lost my helmet in one of the old caves. My pretty, pretty helmet. Life just got worse after that. Kept losing things. So many things....
Oh, could you find that helmet for me? I sure would love to have it again. Could show you some of my old scouting tricks.

kbs.name: Lenne
kbs.description: a forefather of Roggi Knot-Beard who lost the Knot-Beard shield

plots: Roggi Knot-Beard's clan was one of the first to settle Kynesgrove: Lenne was the first to discover the mines

quest.title: Roggi's Family Shield
quest.objective: retrieve the Knot-Beard shield for Roggi Knot-Beard
tasks: Make your way to Ansilvund.
find the Knot-Beard shield
retrieve the Knot-Beard shield for Roggi Knot-Beard
quest.description:
I'm from from here. I've wandered a bit, but I always come back to Kynesgrove. My clan was one of the first to settle here.
Legend says that my forefather Lenne discovered the mines after he stumbled into a dark cave to relieve himself. Too much mead. Of course, there's another story of Lenne losing the family shield in a different cave, so it depends on who you believe.
According to my grandfather at least, the family shield should be in the cave. He swore that version of the legend was true, even found the cave old Lenne stumbled into: Ansilvund. Hey, if you find it, I could show you some of the clan's favorite fighting moves. They're all shield techniques.

kbs.name: High Queen Freydis
kbs.description: a queen who ruled over Windhelm in the Second Era, had a legendary sword

plots: the player asked Oengul War-Anvil whether he is the castle blacksmith
Oengul War-Anvil is working an a sword: the Jarl of Windhelm wants it to look like High Queen Freydis' sword

quest.title: The Queen's Sword
quest.objective: retrieve High Queen Freydis' sword for Oengul War-Anvil
tasks: Reach Cronvangr Cave.
find High Queen Freydis' sword
retrieve High Queen Freydis' sword for Oengul War-Anvil
quest.description:
Of course I am the castle blacksmith. What do I look like, a tavern wench? Ah, don't let my words cut you too deep. I've just been working the forge too hard. Trying to set this sword right.
Jarl wants it to look like an ancient blade. High Queen Freydis ruled over Windhelm in the Second Era, and her sword was legendary. Getting the real sword would be even better than making a copy, but no one wants to risk getting it from its resting place, Cronvangr Cave.
If you find that sword, traveler, I'd be grateful.

plots: Saffir doesn't like that Amren has been spending so much time looking for his father's old sword

quest.title: A Sharp Heirloom
quest.objective: retrieve Amren's father's sword for Amren
tasks: Make your way to Halted Stream Camp.
find Amren's father's sword
retrieve Amren's father's sword for Amren
quest.description:
I'm Amren, the husband of Saffir.
My Saffir doesn't like that I've been spending so much time looking for my father's old sword. He fed his entire family with the gold he made using that weapon. I'm not about to let it gather dust in some thief's trophy room.
I tracked it to a group of bandits nearby. The place is called Halted Stream Camp. But I'm no fool. I'd need the Whiterun guards or maybe hire some mercenaries to get it. I don't know why I'm saying this, but if you find it out in your travels, I'd be grateful to you.

plots: thieves stole Shahvee's sacred amulet of Zenithar as soon as she bought it

quest.title: Good Fortunes
quest.objective: retrieve Shahvee's amulet for her
tasks: find Shahvee's amulet
retrieve Shahvee's amulet for her
quest.description:
I'm Shahvee.
We Argonians have not fared well outside our native Black Marsh, but we're determined to make the best of things.
I began praying to Zenithar, the god of wealth, to bring us some fortune, but thieves made off with my sacred amulet almost as soon as I bought it.
If you found my Amulet, Shahvee would be in your debt, kind one.

kbs.name: Isabelle Rolaine
kbs.description: a young, beautiful woman, and Ranmir's lost love

kbs.name: Ranmir
kbs.description: a male drunk who used to be happy with Isabelle Rolaine

plots: Ranmir is sure that Isabelle Rolaine ran away with Vex

quest.title: Drowned Sorrows
quest.objective: find Isabelle Rolaine
tasks: Go to Riften.
talk to Vex about Isabelle Rolaine
find Isabelle Rolaine
quest.description:
I'm Dagur, an innkeeper.
I wondered if I could ask a favor of you. It's about Ranmir. Don't get me wrong, I don't have a problem with him being in my inn all the time. He mostly keeps to himself, and so far he's been able to pay. I just hate to see what's happened to him. He hasn't always been like this, you know. Drunk, I mean.
He was a different person. Happy, outgoing... Like anyone who's in love. See, Ranmir was involved with a pretty young woman named Isabelle Rolaine. The two of them were very happy together, I thought. One day, she just disappeared. Ranmir was convinced she'd run off with someone else, leaving him behind. He turned to drinking, and what's left of him is what you see here every day.
I hoped that maybe if she could be found, if he had some sort of explanation, that maybe he could put himself back together. I'm in no position to go searching for her, but perhaps you could. Ranmir seemed convinced that Isabelle'd run off to Riften with someone named Vex. That's all I remember.

kbs.name: Delvin Mallory
kbs.description: the player's superior in the Thieves Guild

plots: most businesses in Skyrim keep their transactions recorded within business ledgers

quest.title: The Numbers Job
quest.objective: make the shortfalls from Thieves Guild's other jobs look legit
tasks: Arrive at Bits and Pieces.
change the numbers in the business ledger
make the shortfalls from Thieves Guild's other jobs look legit
quest.description:
Most of the establishments in Skyrim keep their transactions recorded within business ledgers.
Your job would be to change the numbers in those books so the shortfalls from our other jobs look legit. In this case, we want to waylay a shipment on the way from this business without them even noticin' anything went missin'.
Feel like doing a bit of writin' in Bits and Pieces in Solitude?

kbs.name: Morrowind
kbs.description: a province where Neloth has made many enemies

plots: Neloth gives the player a ring: it will light up the source of the ash spawn attacks when the player gets close to it

quest.title: Old Friends
quest.objective: find the person who summoned ash spawns and made them attack Neloth
tasks: wear the ring Neloth gave you to find the source of the ash spawns
find the person who summoned ash spawns and made them attack Neloth
quest.description:
I'm under attack. There are too many coincidences. There must be someone behind all of my recent troubles.
I have enemies. Legions of them back in Morrowind. However, in this case I have reason to believe it is someone in Solstheim. First I need to identify the culprit. I've enchanted this ring to find the source of the attacks. Here, take it.
Just wear the ring I gave you. It will light up the source when you get close to it. I enchanted the ring with a bit of ash from the last ash spawn attack. It can follow the magical link back to its summoner.

kbs.name: Neloth
kbs.description: a pompous master wizard of Telvanni

plots: the player is the hero of Skyrim

quest.title: Reluctant Steward
quest.objective: tell Varona that Neloth wants apple cabbage stew with some canis root tea
tasks: find Varona
tell Varona that Neloth wants apple cabbage stew with some canis root tea
quest.description:
Where is that ash sucking steward of mine? Varona! Have you seen Varona? I'm hungry.
Find her. Tell her I want apple cabbage stew, with some canis root tea. After all, I don't make my own tea. I am a master wizard of the house Telvanni. Other people make tea for me.
You are not my servant? Obviously not, or you would have a cup of tea in your hands. I supposed you want to be asked nicely. Very well.
Please, oh hero of Skyrim. Please find Varona. I shall be ever so grateful.

kbs.name: Modyn Veleth
relations: not in the Bulwark, one of the abandoned houses on the outskirts of Raven Rock

kbs.name: not in the Bulwark, one of the abandoned houses on the outskirts of Raven Rock
kbs.description: not in the Bulwark, one of the abandoned houses on the outskirts of Raven Rock

kbs.name: Emberbrand Wine
kbs.description: a powerful and addicting alcohol drink

plots: Modyn Veleth's men have been stashing bottles of Emberbrand Wine: it distracts them from their tasks

quest.title: Recipe for Distraction
quest.objective: tell Modyn Veleth the location of a hidden stash of Emberbrand Wine
tasks: Head to not in the Bulwark, one of the abandoned houses on the outskirts of Raven Rock.
locate the hidden stash of Emberbrand Wine
tell Modyn Veleth the location of a hidden stash of Emberbrand Wine
quest.description:
Modyn Veleth, Captain of the Redoran Guard at your service. Looking for something to lend a hand with? We have problems aplenty in Raven Rock.
Commanding the Redoran Guard can be a difficult task. Even the most experienced warriors can fall prey to petty distractions. They usually didn't amount to much, but they make my job that much harder. Some of my own men have become quite accustomed to a spirit they called 'Emberbrand Wine.' Despise the stuff myself. It's powerful and tremendously addicting... I've seen men fail to finish even a single flask.
If I knew where they were stashing the bottles, I'd put an end to it myself. Could you track down the stash? That would be helpful. I just don't have time to do it myself right now.
They're too smart to have left it in the Bulwark. I'd search one of the abandoned houses on the outskirts of town.

kbs.name: Esbern
kbs.description: a male scholar, and a member of the Blades

plots: the Thalmor hunted the Blades down, but the Blades have a headquarters of a sort now: it's time to rebuild the Blades
being a Blade is a lifelong commitment

quest.title: Rebuilding the Blades
quest.objective: recruit new members for the Blades
tasks: find anyone who would make a good Blades recruit and bring them to Delphine
recruit new members for the Blades
quest.description:
The Thalmor hunted us down. It wasn't exactly great for recruitment. But we have a headquarters of a sort now. We'll rebuild the Blades.
If you find anyone you think would make a good recruit, I can certainly take a look at them. Remember, though, being a Blade is a lifelong commitment. Their loyalty has to be with us once they're in.
After you have recruited enough new Blades, ask Esbern about the dragon lairs he's been studying. We'll have the recruits do some dragon hunting with you.

kbs.name: Astrid
kbs.description: the player's guildleader in the Dark Brotherhood

kbs.name: Gourmet
kbs.description: a famous master chef, whose true identity is not known

kbs.name: Festus
kbs.description: a fellow Dark Brotherhood member, a man

plots: the Gourmet is the last target before he Dark Brotherhood strikes out at the emperor: the Gourmet is scheduled to cook for the emperor at a special dinner
Festus is close to uncovering the identity of the Gourmet

quest.title: Recipe for Disaster
quest.objective: kill the Gourmet, steal his writ of passage, and assume his identity
tasks: talk to Festus
kill the Gourmet, steal his writ of passage, and assume his identity
quest.description:
There's just one more target before we strike out at the Emperor.
Have you by chance heard of the "Gourmet"? Read his cookbook? It's become quite a phenomenon. The Gourmet is scheduled to cook for the Emperor at a special dinner.
