You'll kill him, steal his Writ of Passage, and assume the role of master chef. Festus has been spearheading this part of the assassination plan. He's close to uncovering the identity of the Gourmet.
You should report to him.

kbs.name: Gourmet
kbs.description: a famous master chef, whose true identity is not known

kbs.name: Astrid
kbs.description: the female guildmaster of the Dark Brotherhood

plots: Astrid told the player about killing the Gourmet and taking his identity
the player should hide the Gourmet's body if they can

quest.title: Recipe for Death
quest.objective: assassinate the Gourmet, a famous master chef, and get his Writ of Passage to assume his identity
tasks: Reach the keep in Markarth.
question Anton Virane to learn the true identity of the Gourmet, and kill Anton Virane
assassinate the Gourmet, a famous master chef, and get his Writ of Passage to assume his identity
quest.description:
Let's get down to business. Astrid told you about the Gourmet, I hope? That you need to kill him and take on his identity?
But first you'll need to learn who he is. Assuming, of course, that the Gourmet actually is a "he." Could be a woman for all we know. In my, um, investigations, I came upon this. It's a copy of the Gourmet's cookbook. Ah, but not just any copy. It's signed you see! Seems to be a message from the Gourmet to one Anton Virane. I've tracked Virane to the keep in Markarth. It would seem he's the cook.
You are to obtain that information from Virane - who the Gourmet really is, and where he can be found. Oh, and when you're done with Virane, kill him. Loose ends and all that.
As I was saying... You'll need to kill the Gourmet, of course. But what's more, you'll need to get his Writ of Passage, so you can take his place. Oh, and if you can, hide his body. The longer it takes for anyone else to determine his real identity, the better.
Now off with you!

plots: Quintus Navale has thought about repairing the White Phial
Nurelion was obsessed with the White Phial: his obsession consumed him

quest.title: Repairing the Phial
quest.objective: acquire the materials necessary to repair the White Phial
tasks: Go to Throat of the World.
Reach giant camps.
Make your way to Forsworn camps in the Reach.
get unmelting snow
get mammoth tusk powder
get a briar heart
acquire the materials necessary to repair the White Phial
quest.description:
I have some thoughts about repairing the White Phial. There are three crucial elements. Some may be easier to find than others.
On the top of the Throat of the World is a patch of unmelting snow. No heat can touch it. Then we need the tusk of a mammoth, ground to a fine powder as only the giants know how. The final step is tricky. It requires the briar heart from a Forsworn of the Reach.
If you can bring me these materials, the Phial can again be made whole. You can keep the White Phial after I have repaired it. I fear keeping the Phial would just remind me of Nurelion's obsession, and how it consumed him.

kbs.name: Laila Law-Giver
kbs.description: the lawful female ruler of Riften

plots: Laila Law-Giver gives the player the key to the warehouse

quest.title: The Raid
quest.objective: help Laila Law-Giver to uncover and stop the illegal Skooma trade in Riften
tasks: Travel to the warehouse within Riften.
convince Sarthis close down his Skooma operation permanently
help Laila Law-Giver to uncover and stop the illegal Skooma trade in Riften
quest.description:
We're aware of a Skooma dealer's presence in the warehouse within this city. Unfortunately, we're certain this Skooma dealer, Sarthis, has informants within the city guard. Every time we've made a move to arrest him, he's escaped.
However, if you'd take care of this discreetly, you might be able to surprise him without warning. Here, this is the key to the warehouse. See if you can drop in on this dealer of poison and convince him to close down his operation permanently.

plots: Rustleif runs the forge together with his wife Seren, who is a Redguard
Seren worries how she will pass along her traditions to Rustleif and her child

quest.title: A Cultured Gift
quest.objective: bring Rustleif "Night Falls on Sentinel"
tasks: find "Night Falls on Sentinel"
bring Rustleif "Night Falls on Sentinel"
quest.description:
My wife Seren and I run the forge together. She still smiths even though we found out she is with child.
Our son or daughter isn't going to get much Redguard culture here in Skyrim. I know my wife worries how she will pass along her traditions.
Hey, if you find a book called "Night Falls on Sentinel", could you bring it to me? It's a story from my wife's people. Be good to have.
Don't know what the Redguards see in books, but it would make my Seren happy. Let me show you some tricks around the forge, when you return with the book.

plots: Ma'dran would help Ysolda start her own business for a mammoth's tusk

quest.title: A Mammoth Powered Startup
quest.objective: bring Ysolda a mammoth's tusk
tasks: find a mammoth's tusk
bring Ysolda a mammoth's tusk
quest.description:
I'm Ysolda. Before my ma and da passed, I told them that one day, I'd become the best trader in Skyrim.
I met one of the caravan leaders, Ma'dran. He said he'd help get me started if I could bring him a mammoth's tusk. Easier said than done.
If you find one, I could teach you a thing or two about trading. Help you get a fair bargain in the future.

kbs.name: Captain Aldis
kbs.description: a captain of the Imperial Legion

plots: Captain Aldis trains recruits: he thought about asking some training books from the general

quest.title: Lessons on Defense
quest.objective: bring Captain Aldis a copy of "The Mirror"
tasks: find a copy of "The Mirror"
bring Captain Aldis a copy of "The Mirror"
quest.description:
I'm with the Imperial Legion. Train the recruits. Turn boys into men. That sort of thing.
Thinking of asking the General for some training books. Give the soldiers something to do while they're on rest. Something besides drinking. Ever seen a book called "The Mirror"? We used to hand it out to boys looking to learn basic shield work.
If you find a copy of "The Mirror", I'd be glad to have it. Then I'll see if I can get some copies made for the men.

kbs.name: Arkay
kbs.description: the god of life and death

plots: Tova is not handling the death of her and Torbjorn Shatter-Shield's daughter well

quest.title: A Comforting Amulet
quest.objective: bring Torbjorn Shatter-Shield an amulet of Arkay
tasks: find an amulet of Arkay
bring Torbjorn Shatter-Shield an amulet of Arkay
quest.description:
Please forgive my mood. I'm still coming to terms with my daughter's death. Our little girl died recently. I've been shouldering my days with strong mead, but nothing gives my Tova peace.
I've been looking for an Amulet of Arkay to remind my wife that our child is with the gods now, but I can't find one. Would you be willing to give me an Amulet of Arkay, should you find one?
I hope Arkay grants my wife some comfort.

kbs.name: Vilkas
kbs.description: a fellow member of the Companions

kbs.name: Jorrvaskr
kbs.description: the mead hall of the Companions

kbs.name: Driftshade Refuge
kbs.description: the headquarters of the Silver Hand

kbs.name: Kodlak
kbs.description: an old man, and the leader of the Companions

plots: the Silver Hand attacked the Companions in Jorrvaskr, killed Kodlak, and stole the fragments of Wuuthrad

quest.title: Purity of Revenge
quest.objective: avenge Kodlak
tasks: Head to Driftshade Refuge.
retrieve the fragments of Wuuthrad and wipe out the Silver Hand
avenge Kodlak
quest.description:
The Silver Hand attacked us. They finally found enough courage to attack Jorrvaskr. We fought them off, but... The old man... Kodlak... he's dead.
No one else got hurt, but they made off with all our fragments of Wuuthrad. But you and I are going to reclaim them. We will bring the battle to their chief camp, Driftshade Refuge. There will be none left living to tell their stories. Only songs of Jorrvaskr will be sung.
We will avenge Kodlak. And they will know terror before the end.

kbs.name: Brynjolf
kbs.description: a fellow member of the Thieves Guild

kbs.name: Riftweald Manor
kbs.description: Mercer Frey's home in Riften, a gift from the Black-Briars after they kicked the previous family out

kbs.name: Mercer Frey
kbs.description: a male guildmaster of the Thieves Guild who betrayed the Thieves Guild

plots: Mercer Frey never stays at Riftweald Manor: he hired Vald to guard Riftweald Manor
the player has the permission to kill anyone who stands in their way

quest.title: The Pursuit
quest.objective: search for clues about Mercer Frey's whereabouts
tasks: Reach Riftweald Manor.
break into Mercer Frey's house
search for clues about Mercer Frey's whereabouts
quest.description:
I have an important task for you. I need you to break into Mercer Frey's home and search for anything that could tell us where he's gone.
Mercer's house is in Riften. A gift from the Black-Briars after they kicked the previous family out... a place called Riftweald Manor. He never stays there, just pays for the upkeep on it. Hired some lout by the name of Vald to guard the place.
Be careful, kid. This is the last place in Skyrim I'd ever want to send you. Just find a way in, get the information and leave. And you have permission to kill anyone that stands in your way.

kbs.name: Frost
kbs.description: one of the finest breeding horses in the realm

kbs.name: Maven Black-Briar
kbs.description: Sibbi Black-Briar's mother, and a dangerous, powerful woman

plots: Sibbi Black-Briar agreed to sell Frost to Louis Letrush
Maven Black-Briar threw Sibbi Black-Briar in Riften Jail before he delivered Frost to Louis Letrush: Sibbi Black-Briar thinks that this exempts him from selling Frost to Louis Letrush

quest.title: Promises to Keep
quest.objective: help Louis Letrush get Frost and his lineage papers from Sibbi Black-Briar
tasks: Head to Riften Jail.
talk to Sibbi Black-Briar about Frost and the lineage papers
help Louis Letrush get Frost and his lineage papers from Sibbi Black-Briar
quest.description:
I'm Louis Letrush. Looking for work? I need someone to deliver a message to Sibbi Black-Briar.
I recently approached Sibbi Black-Briar about buying Frost, one of the finest breeding horses in the realm. He agreed to sell. I paid Sibbi half the cost of Frost up front, but before he could deliver, Maven had him locked up. Sibbi believes this exempts him from our deal. It does not.
Head to the Riften Jail and talk to Sibbi. Get him to tell you where Frost and his Lineage Papers are and bring them to me outside Riften. You'll be well paid for your time.

kbs.name: Skjor
kbs.description: the player's superior in the Companions

kbs.name: Farkas
kbs.description: a fellow member of the Companions, a man

plots: Farkas will answer the player's questions about the Companions

quest.title: Proving Honor
quest.objective: complete your trial of claiming a fragment of Wuuthrad
tasks: Go to Dustman's Cairn.
claim another fragment of Wuuthrad with Farkas
complete your trial of claiming a fragment of Wuuthrad
quest.description:
We have something special for you this time.
Last week a scholar came to us. He said he knew where we could find another fragment of Wuuthrad. He seemed a fool to me, but if he's right, the honor of the Companions demands that we seek it out in Dustman's Cairn.
This is a simple errand, but the time is right for it to be your Trial. Carry yourself with honor, and you'll become a true Companion. Farkas will be your Shield-Sibling on this venture, whelp. He'll answer any questions you have.
Try not to disappoint. Or to get Farkas killed.

kbs.name: Hall of the Dead
kbs.description: a hall where bodies are interred and cared for, in Whiterun

kbs.name: Arkay
kbs.description: the god of burials and funeral rites

plots: Alessandra did not want to become a Priest of Arkay like her father
Alessandra gives the player her ceremonial dagger

quest.title: Pilgrimage
quest.objective: help Alessandra make peace with her dead father
tasks: Travel to Hall of the Dead.
bring Alessandra's ceremonial dagger to Andurs so it can be interred with Alessandra's father's remains
help Alessandra make peace with her dead father
quest.description:
I am Alessandra, a priest of Arkay.
My father was a Priest of Arkay, as well. All my life was spent around the dead, being forced to learn the proper burial rituals and prayers. I never had any friends; who'd want to spend time with 'the little weird girl who hangs around dead people?' So I grew up with a miserable trade. This is all I know how to do... prepare and inter the deceased.
I'd like to make the journey to the Hall of the Dead in Whiterun and give my ceremonial dagger to Andurs, the caretaker. I believe once it's interred with my father's remains I'll be at peace with his memory.
A Priest of Arkay is entrusted with a ceremonial dagger once they've completed their training. It's usually given by the head priest who sanctified the ritual. In my case, the head priest happened to be my father. The thing is, I never wanted to follow in his footsteps... In some ways I still don't.
I'm entrusting you with the dagger. Bring it to Andurs and he'll take care of the rest.

kbs.name: Vilkas
kbs.description: a fellow member of the Companions, and a werewolf

kbs.name: Sovngarde
kbs.description: the storied underworld of honorable heroes

kbs.name: Tomb of Ysgramor
kbs.description: a tomb where lycanthropy can be cured

kbs.name: Kodlak
kbs.description: the dead male leader of the Companions

plots: Kodlak's final teaching: those with beastblood cannot enter Sovngarde
the player has a head of the Glenmoril that is needed to cure lycanthropy

quest.title: Purity
quest.objective: handle Vilkas' personal troubles
tasks: Make your way to Tomb of Ysgramor.
help Vilkas give up his beastblood
handle Vilkas' personal troubles
quest.description:
There is always work for the Companions. But there is more personal task before me.
Kodlak's final teaching is troubling me. I think he was right about beastblood and Sovngarde. I wish to cleanse myself that I might know glory in the afterlife.
Will you help me give up my beasthood? You still bear a head of the Glenmoril betrayers, yes? Then lead on, back to the Tomb of Ysgramor.
My soul is now prepared.

kbs.name: Farkas
kbs.description: a Nord werewolf, and a fellow member of the Companions

kbs.name: Sovngarde
kbs.description: the storied underworld of the Nords
relations: the place that is already known to the player

kbs.name: the place that is already known to the player
kbs.description: the place that is already known to the player

kbs.name: Kodlak
kbs.description: the dead male leader of the Companions, who was cured of lycanthropy

kbs.name: Aela
kbs.description: a female member of the Companions

plots: Kodlak said that werewolves can't be good Nords
Aela said a Hagraven's head is needed to cure lycanthropy

quest.title: Sanctity
quest.objective: cure Farkas' lycanthropy
tasks: Travel to the place that is already known to the player.
get a special Hagraven's head with Farkas
cure Farkas' lycanthropy
quest.description:
There is always work. My mind is someplace else, though.
I think that maybe Kodlak was right. As a werewolf, I can't be a good Nord. I want to be clean, like he was, and go to Sovngarde when I finally die.
Aela said we would need a Hagraven's head. I already have one of them, but she said it was a special kind. And that you knew where to get more.
Let's go find one!

kbs.name: Mehrunes Dagon
kbs.description: the evil god of the Mythic Dawn

plots: after the Oblivion crisis, a number of groups cropped up dedicated to wiping out the remnants of the Mythic Dawn: one of the groups found Mehrunes' Razor and split it into three fragments almost 150 years ago
the descendants of the group still have the fragments of Mehrunes' Razor: Silus Vesuius gives the player his notes on the owners

quest.title: Pieces of the Past
quest.objective: retrieve the scattered pieces of Mehrunes' Razor for Silus Vesuius
tasks: find Ghunzul, Drascua, and Jorgen, the owners of the pieces of Mehrunes' Razor
retrieve the scattered pieces of Mehrunes' Razor for Silus Vesuius
quest.description:
I have a job you look perfect for.
A little history, first. After the Oblivion Crisis, a number of groups cropped up dedicated to wiping out the remnants of the Mythic Dawn. One of these groups found Mehrunes' Razor, the artifact of Mehrunes Dagon. They split it into three fragments and pledged to keep them apart forever. That was almost 150 years ago, and the pieces are still being kept by the descendants of that group. And they're right here, in Skyrim.
At least two of the owners, Ghunzul and Drascua, are dangerous marauders. And the third owner, Jorgen, I only know he lives in Morthal.
Here are my notes about them. I'll gladly pay you for getting the pieces any way you can. No questions asked.

kbs.name: Skyrim
kbs.description: a province with many words of power

kbs.name: Dragonborn
kbs.description: a mortal blessed with the blood and soul of a dragon, masters of the Thu'um

plots: the player is the Dragonborn

quest.title: The Words of Power
quest.objective: find a lost word of power
tasks: Reach Skyrim.
get to the location marked on your map
find a lost word of power
quest.description:
You have learned so much already, Dragonborn. Growing your gift too quickly would be dangerous.
But there are many Words of Power in Skyrim, carved in the Dragon tongue. Even from here, we can feel the Thu'um resonate from them. Finding these lost Words would be a sufficient test, to temper your abilities with experience.
We have felt the whisper of a Word. Give me your map, and I will show you where its echo can be found.

kbs.name: Potema's Catacombs
kbs.description: catacombs filled with Potema's undead minions

kbs.name: Potema, the Wolf Queen
kbs.description: a former queen of Solitude, and one of the most dangerous necromancers in recorded history

kbs.name: Arkay
kbs.description: the god of life and death

plots: Potema was responsible for the Empire's near collapse almost five hundred years ago: Styrr has a book about Potema
one of Potema's servants busted through a wall into the Temple of Divines
the player was there when Potema was summoned in spirit form
Styrr helps the player with Potema's minions

quest.title: The Wolf Queen Awakened
quest.objective: stop Potema from returning to the living
tasks: Go to Potema's Catacombs.
find Potema's skeleton and remove it from the catacombs
bring Potema's skeleton back to be sanctified by Arkay
stop Potema from returning to the living
quest.description:
Ah Potema, the Wolf Queen. Former queen of Solitude and one of the most dangerous necromancers in recorded history. She was responsible for the Empire's near collapse almost five hundred years ago. I believe I have a book about her...
And now Potema has been summoned in spirit form. Summoned in spirit form is not raised from the dead. She'll need help before she can return to the living.
For the moment, the Wolf Queen has retreated to a place filled with dead eager to serve her. She has gone to her old Catacombs. A few days ago, one of her servants busted through a wall into the Temple of Divines. We'll need you to go into the Catacombs themselves.
You were there when Potema was summoned. Being at the summoning created a connection to Potema, you are the one to stop her from returning to the living. I can provide you with some help with her minions.
As to Potema herself, find what's left of her body, likely a skeleton. Remove it from the Catacombs and bring it back to be sanctified by Arkay.

kbs.name: Skuldafn
kbs.description: Alduin's door to Sovngarde, an ancient fane high in the eastern mountains filled with Alduin's remaining forces

kbs.name: Sovngarde
kbs.description: the storied underworld where the souls of mortal heroes end up in

kbs.name: Alduin, World-Eater
kbs.description: a male dragon, likes devouring the souls of mortals

plots: the player lured Odahviing to Dragonsreach and took him prisoner: the player distrust Odahviing

quest.title: The World-Eater's Eyrie
quest.objective: fly to Skuldafn on Odahviing and face Alduin
tasks: free Odahviing
fly to Skuldafn on Odahviing and face Alduin
quest.description:
It was you that lured me here and took me prisoner... I have done nothing to earn your distrust.
Wisdom sees the doorway. It would be wise to recognize when you only have one choice. You can trust me. I am not treacherous. Alduin has proven himself unworthy to rule. I go my own way now. He has traveled to Sovngarde to regain his strength, devouring the souls of the mortal dead. A privilege he jealously guards... His door to Sovngarde is at Skuldafn, one of his ancient fanes high in the eastern mountains. I surely do not need to warn you that all his remaining strength is marshaled there.
Free me, and I will carry you to Skuldafn so that you can face Alduin in battle. I warn you, once you've flown the skies, your envy of the dragons will only increase.

kbs.name: Astrid
kbs.description: the player's admirer, and a member of the Dark Brotherhood

kbs.name: Aventus Aretino
kbs.description: a young boy who wanted Grelod the Kind dead

kbs.name: Grelod the Kind
kbs.description: a cruel, old female orphanage headmistress, killed by the player

plots: Astrid woke the player up from their sleep
Aventus Aretino was looking for the Dark Brotherhood: Grelod the Kind was a Dark Brotherhood contract, and the player must pay for killing her

quest.title: With Friends Like These...
quest.objective: kill one of the kidnapped people for the Dark brotherhood
tasks: turn around, and select the person who shall not leave the room alive
kill one of the kidnapped people for the Dark brotherhood
quest.description:
Sleep well? Who I am really isn't as important as what I am. And what I am is an admirer. Of sorts.
You see, that little Aretino boy was looking for the Dark Brotherhood. For me, and my associates. Grelod the Kind was, by all rights, a Dark Brotherhood contract. A kill... that you stole. A kill you must repay.
If you turn around, you'll notice my guests. I've "collected" them from... well, that's not really important. The here and now. That's what matters. You see, there's a contract out on one of them, and that person can't leave this room alive. But... which one? Go on, see if you can figure it out.
Make your choice. Make your kill. I just want to observe... and admire.

kbs.name: Forsaken Cave
kbs.description: a long forsaken cave to the west of Windhelm

kbs.name: Curalmil
kbs.description: a crafty, long-dead alchemist, and the creator of the White Phial

kbs.name: White Phial
kbs.description: a legendary bottle that will replenish whatever fluid is placed inside of it

plots: Nurelion's assistant won't let Nurelion get the White Phial himself
Nurelion gives the player the alchemical mixture that is needed to reach Curalmil's resting place

quest.title: The White Phial
quest.objective: retrieve the White Phial for Nurelion
tasks: Go to Forsaken Cave.
reach Curalmil's resting place
retrieve the White Phial for Nurelion
quest.description:
I've finally derived the location of the White Phial, but my doting busybody of an assistant won't let me get it.
It's buried with its maker, Curalmil, in Forsaken Cave, a long forsaken cave to the west of here. Curalmil was a crafty one, even in death. You would need the skills of a master alchemist to reach his resting place.
Luckily for you, I've already made the required mixture. Here, take it. Please... don't dally. I've wasted enough time arguing with my useless assistant here.

kbs.name: Astrid
kbs.description: the player's leader in the Dark Brotherhood

kbs.name: Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary
relations: Night Mother's Chamber in the Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary

kbs.name: Night Mother's Chamber in the Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary
kbs.description: Night Mother's Chamber in the Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary

kbs.name: Cicero
kbs.description: an insane male member of the Dark Brotherhood, and the Night Mother's Keeper

kbs.name: Night Mother
kbs.description: the corpse of the spiritual female leader of the Dark Brotherhood

plots: Cicero has been concerning Astrid ever since he arrived at the Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary: Astrid thinks that Cicero is plotting to overtake the Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary and restore the Old Ways

quest.title: Whispers in the Dark
quest.objective: spy on Cicero and the person he is talking with
tasks: Arrive at Night Mother's Chamber in the Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary.
hide inside the Night Mother's coffin to eavesdrop on the meeting between Cicero and a mystery person
spy on Cicero and the person he is talking with
quest.description:
Cicero concerns me. Ever since he arrived, his behavior's been... Well, erratic would be an understatement. I do believe he is truly mad. But it's worse than that.
Cicero's taken to locking himself in the Night Mother's chamber, and talking. To someone. In hushed, but frantic tones. Who is he speaking with? What are they planning? I fear treachery. As the Night Mother's Keeper, he believes he's entitled to the rule of this Sanctuary. Cicero will cite our independence as the need to revert to the Old Ways. He'll claim we're undisciplined, unruly. Heretical, even. Ironically, the Night Mother could prove to be just as much a victim. The queen in a fool's twisted game of chess.
I need you to steal into that chamber, and eavesdrop on their meeting. It'll be no use clinging to the shadows. They'll see you for sure. No, you need a hiding place. Somewhere they'd never think to look. Like inside the Night Mother's coffin.

kbs.name: High Hrothgar
kbs.description: the secluded home of the Greybeards
relations: hight up the slopes of the Throat of the World

kbs.name: hight up the slopes of the Throat of the World
kbs.description: hight up the slopes of the Throat of the World

plots: the player killed a dragon for Balgruuf the Greater and absorbed some kind of power from it
the Greybeards think that the player is a Dragonborn: a Dragonborn is said to be uniquely gifted in the voice - the ability to focus the player's vital essence into a Thu'um, or shout

quest.title: The Way of the Voice
quest.objective: answer the summons of the Greybeards
tasks: Head to hight up the slopes of the Throat of the World.
reach High Hrothgar
answer the summons of the Greybeards
quest.description:
So when the dragon died, you absorbed some kind of power from it. So it's true. The Greybeards really were summoning you. They are masters of the Way of the Voice. They live in seclusion high on the slopes of the Throat of the World.
Whatever happened when you killed that dragon, it revealed something in you, and the Greybeards heard it. If they think you're Dragonborn, who are we to argue?
The Dragonborn is said to be uniquely gifted in the Voice - the ability to focus your vital essence into a Thu'um, or Shout. If you really are Dragonborn, they can teach you how to use your gift.
You'd better get up to High Hrothgar immediately. There's no refusing the summons of the Greybeards. It's a tremendous honor.

kbs.name: Nightcaller Temple
kbs.description: a temple hosting the root of the nightmare problem, a short walk away from Dawnstar

plots: Vaermina has an awful hunger for people's memories: in return, she leaves behind nightmares

quest.title: Waking Nightmare
quest.objective: relieve the people of Dawnstar from Vaermina's damaging nightmares
tasks: return to Nightcaller Temple with Erandur, and help him end the nightmares
relieve the people of Dawnstar from Vaermina's damaging nightmares
quest.description:
The entire town is being plagued by horrible nightmares. They're in serious danger but I'm afraid there's little I can do about it.
These dreams are manifestations created by Vaermina. She has an awful hunger for our memories. In return, she leaves behind nightmares, not unlike a cough marks a serious illness. I must end her terrible influence over these people before the damage becomes permanent.
I need to return to the source of the problem, to Nightcaller Temple. Perhaps you'd be willing to assist me in that regard? I've already said too much. If anyone overhears what we're saying, it could start a panic. I would simply ask that you trust me and help me end Dawnstar's nightmares.
Nightcaller Temple is only a short walk from Dawnstar. Come, we must hurry.

kbs.name: Black-Briar Meadery
kbs.description: a meadery in Riften that produces Black-Briar Mead

kbs.name: Indaryn
kbs.description: a male employee of the Black-Briar Meadery

plots: if the player bumps into Indaryn, they should not tell him anything about Romlyn Dreth's dealings

quest.title: Under the Table
quest.objective: make a delivery for Romlyn Dreth
tasks: Go to Vilemyr Inn.
smuggle a small Black-Briar Mead keg to Wilhelm
make a delivery for Romlyn Dreth
quest.description:
I'm not selling cheap mead. I'm selling good mead for cheap... Black-Briar Mead. I sell cases of it for half of what the inns and taverns pay through the Black-Briar Meadery.
If anyone saw me leave Riften, they'd get suspicious. I need someone to take this small keg of Black-Briar Mead to Wilhelm at the Vilemyr Inn in Ivarstead. Drop it off and he'll trade you something for the delivery. Keep it as payment for the legwork.
Oh, and if you bump into Indaryn from the meadery, keep your mouth shut. He'd rat us out in a second.

kbs.name: Vex
kbs.description: a fellow thief, and Vald's ex-lover

kbs.name: Vald
kbs.description: a male thug who only understands gold

kbs.name: Maven Black-Briar
kbs.description: a powerful woman with criminal connections

plots: the player asked Vex information about Vald

quest.title: Vald's Debt
quest.objective: ask Vald to betray Mercer Frey
tasks: talk to Maven Black-Briar about erasing Vald's debts
ask Vald to betray Mercer Frey
quest.description:
Vald? That pig? Oh, I have info on him. More than you care to know. Vald does not have a good side. The only thing he understands is gold. A man after my own heart.
You can try to buy him off, but he'll ask for a whole lot. I mean, you are asking him to betray Mercer Frey. Your best bet would be to erase his debt with Maven Black-Briar. If you talk to her, she might be able to give you the details.
Of course, you could just run him through and take what you need off of his corpse... I could care less.

kbs.name: Kolbjorn Barrow
kbs.description: an ancient tomb buried in ash in the northern ashlands of Solstheim

kbs.name: Mournhold
kbs.description: a large city on the mainland

plots: the ash storms fill up Kolbjorn Barrow faster than Ralis Sedarys can dig

quest.title: Unearthed
quest.objective: become Ralis Sedarys' business partner in his search for the Relics of Ahzidal in Kolbjorn Barrow
tasks: give 1,000 gold to Ralis Sedarys so that he can hire some diggers from Raven Rock to dig up Kolbjorn Barrow
become Ralis Sedarys' business partner in his search for the Relics of Ahzidal in Kolbjorn Barrow
quest.description:
The name's Ralis. Ralis Sedarys, out of Mournhold.
I've got a financier waiting for me back on the mainland. Sent me here in the interests of obtaining some rare antiquities. The 'Relics of Ahzidal.' But this whole thing became a disaster right quick, let me tell you.
You come out to the northern ashlands, you don't expect things to go easy, you know? But this was something outside my particular expertise. When I first got to Kolbjorn, you couldn't even see it. Buried in the ash, like most other things on this blasted island. Dug out a pile of the stuff taller than me just to find the barrow. Who knows how much to reach the door. Excavating isn't exactly my specialty. Even if it was, the ash storms fill it in faster than you can dig.
Could you become my business partner? We can sort out the details of our little arrangement later, but for now, I'll manage the dig if you can manage the coin.
When you have 1,000 gold for me, I'll head back to Raven Rock and round up some diggers. Once we've got something worth looking at, I'll send word to you.

kbs.name: Karliah
kbs.description: a fellow member of the Thieves Guild, and a Nightingale

plots: the binding terms of the oath with Nocturnal: the player will be required to defend the Twilight Sepulcher and everything within when the need arises, and upon the player's death, the player's spirit will be bound to the Twilight Sepulcher as one of its guardians

quest.title: Trinity Restored
quest.objective: transact the oath with Nocturnal and become one of the Nightingales
tasks: undergo the ceremony to become a Nightingale
transact the oath with Nocturnal and become one of the Nightingales
quest.description:
Are you ready to transact the Oath with Nocturnal?
By transacting the Oath with Nocturnal, you're entering into a business deal. You'll be provided all of the power and knowledge befitting a Nightingale. You're free to use those powers as you see fit to further your own goals or the goals of the Thieves Guild.
In return, you'll be required to defend the Twilight Sepulcher and everything within when the need arises. More importantly, upon your death, your spirit will be bound to the Twilight Sepulcher as one of its guardians.
Once the Oath has been struck, the terms are binding. Knowing this, are you ready to undergo the ceremony?

plots: the player and Ralof are making their escape together: the player is a Nord

quest.title: Unbound
quest.objective: escape Imperial custody with Ralof
tasks: jump through the roof of the inn on the other side and keep running
escape Imperial custody with Ralof
quest.description:
Hey, Nord. Get up! Come on, the gods won't give us another chance!
See the inn on the other side? Jump through the roof and keep going! Go! I'll follow when I can!

kbs.name: Arondil
kbs.description: an insane male wizard, and a necromancer performing unspeakable experiments on reanimation

kbs.name: volumes of Arondil's journals, necromantic ravings
kbs.description: volumes of Arondil's journals, necromantic ravings

plots: Arondil used to live in Dawnstar: his house was burned down when his necromantic experiments became public knowledge

quest.title: Toying With The Dead
quest.objective: retrieve the 4 volumes of Arondil's journals for Vekel the Man
tasks: Head to Yngvild.
find the 4 volumes of Arondil's journals
retrieve the 4 volumes of Arondil's journals for Vekel the Man
quest.description:
I have a buyer with a very odd taste in literature, looking for some particular books.
I'm told they're the ravings of a madman, a wizard named Arondil, and his peculiar cravings. It's said to be in four volumes and very hard to come by. My client is offering quite a reward for them, which I'd split with you.
Recently, a woman was found... naked and shivering along the road to Dawnstar. The only information the guard could get from her were tales of strange experiments and Arondil scribbling in his journals.
He used to have a home in Dawnstar until they burned it down. The people say he was doing unspeakable experiments on reanimation... rituals only a necromancer would perform. After he made for Yngvild, he was never heard from again.
In his later years, Arondil moved into some ice caves known as Yngvild. He preferred the solitude in which to perform his, um... experiments.

kbs.name: Aela the Huntress
kbs.description: a member of the Companions, and a werewolf

kbs.name: Skjor
kbs.description: a dead male member of the Companions

kbs.name: Kodlak
kbs.description: a dead male member of the Companions who wanted to cure his lycanthropy

plots: the player is the Harbinger of the Companions
Skjor and Kodlak talked about totems of Hircine: simple-looking objects that could channel the powers of the werewolf in new directions

quest.title: Totem of Hircine
quest.objective: find a totem of Hircine with Aela the Huntress
tasks: go with Aela the Huntress
find a totem of Hircine with Aela the Huntress
quest.description:
Harbinger, I'd be honored if you joined me in my search.
I had once heard Skjor and Kodlak talking about the totems of Hircine. Simple-looking objects that could channel the powers of the werewolf in new directions.
Once Kodlak began looking for his cure, I'd wager Skjor didn't bring it up again. But I was going through his things and found a book I had never seen before. All about the Totems. I've been talking to my sources around the holds, and think I may have heard where one of them lays.
Want to come along and help me find this totem of Hircine?

kbs.name: Astrid
kbs.description: the leader of the Dark Brotherhood

kbs.name: Commander Maro
kbs.description: the male officer in charge of Titus Mede II's security

kbs.name: Jarrin Root
kbs.description: a powerful poison that kills immediately after one bite

plots: the player killed the Gourmet for Astrid: the player is the Listener of the Dark Brotherhood
Astrid gives the player Jarrin Root
after assassination, escape through the upper door, and across the bridge: Astrid has "arranged" for it to be unguarded

quest.title: To Kill an Empire
quest.objective: assassinate Titus Mede II while disguised as the Gourmet
tasks: Find your way to Castle Dour.
present the Gourmet's writ of passage to Commander Maro to gain unrestricted access to the kitchens, and poison Titus Mede II's meal with Jarrin Root
assassinate Titus Mede II while disguised as the Gourmet
quest.description:
So it's done. You've killed the Gourmet. And now Titus Mede II is as good as dead.
I've decided you will have the honor of killing the Emperor. Go now to Castle Dour in Solitude. Present the Gourmet's Writ of Passage to the officer in charge, Commander Maro.
You'll gain unrestricted access to the kitchens, and then the Emperor. You're posing as a chef, so you'll be able to poison his meal rather easily. Here, take this - it's called jarrin root. All it takes is one taste, and the effects are quite immediate. The Emperor will be serving Sithis before he even knows he's dead. Once Mede has been killed, escape through the upper door, and across the bridge. I've "arranged" for it to be unguarded once the alarm is sounded.
Now go, my friend. Go, and fulfill your destiny as Listener.

kbs.name: Dovahkiin
kbs.description: a mortal with the soul of a dragon

plots: the player is meeting Paarthurnax for the first time: the player is the Dovahkiin

quest.title: The Throat of the World
quest.objective: receive a lesson from Paarthurnax
tasks: hear Paarthurnax's shout, and match it with your own
receive a lesson from Paarthurnax
quest.description:
Greetings, traveler. I am Paarthurnax. Who are you? What brings you to my mountain? Forgive me. I gave in to the temptation to prolong our speech. I know you are Dovahkiin.
You have come here to learn from me. Patience. There are formalities that must be observed, at the first meeting of two of the dragons. By long tradition, the elder speaks first. Hear my shout! Feel it in your bones.
Match it, if you are Dovahkiin!

kbs.name: Revyn Sadri
kbs.description: a merchant dealing in used goods

kbs.name: Viola Giordano
kbs.description: a woman who fancies herself a criminal investigator

plots: the player asked Revyn Sadri whether something in his store is stolen

quest.title: That Was Always There
quest.objective: return Viola Giordano's gold ring to her without her knowing
tasks: Arrive at Viola Giordano's house.
sneak inside the house and place Viola Giordano's gold ring in a dresser
return Viola Giordano's gold ring to her without her knowing
quest.description:
Of course nothing in here is stolen. Only a careless, shameful, idiotic fetcher would do something as stupid as to buy pilfered goods....
Oh by Azura, I've made a terrible mistake. I bought a gold ring, and Viola Giordano has been missing a ring that looks just like it.
Could you return the ring to her? It's not that easy. She'd go to the guard if she knew I was even remotely involved. You have to get it to her some other way.
Look, it's dangerous, but if you sneak the ring into her house. Put it in a dresser or something. I will make it worth your while.

kbs.name: Tonilia
kbs.description: a fence, and a fellow member of the Thieves Guild

kbs.name: Ri'saad
kbs.description: the male leader of the caravans that travel across the realm

plots: the caravans are notorious for transporting illegal substances

quest.title: Deal Like A Steal
quest.objective: secure a merchandise transportation deal for the Thieves Guild
tasks: deliver a satchel of Moon Sugar to Ri'saad to secure the deal
secure a merchandise transportation deal for the Thieves Guild
quest.description:
Before we get down to business, I've got something I need you to do.
Well, as you know, the Guild's growing and things are looking up around here. The only thing we're lacking is a reliable way to transport our merchandise across the land.
I'm not sure if you've noticed, but there are several caravans that travel across the realm. They're shrewd traders and don't mind getting their hands dirty.
I've bartered with their leader, Ri'saad, on more than one occasion. I want you to bring him something. You see, the caravans are notorious for transporting illegal substances.
Present Ri'saad with this satchel of Moon Sugar, and I bet my last coin he'll make a deal.

kbs.name: Storn
kbs.description: the shaman of the Skaal, and Frea's father

plots: something has taken control of most of the people of Solstheim, including the Skaal: it makes them work on horrible creations that corrupt the stones
Storn says that Miraak has returned to Solstheim, but that is impossible

quest.title: The Temple of Miraak
quest.objective: uncover what lies beneath the Temple of Miraak
tasks: Proceed to Temple of Miraak.
find a way into the Temple of Miraak with Frea
uncover what lies beneath the Temple of Miraak
quest.description:
I am Frea of the Skaal. I am here to either save my people, or avenge them.
Something has taken control of most of the people of Solstheim. It makes them forget themselves, and work on these horrible creations that corrupt the Stones, the very land itself. My father Storn, our shaman, says Miraak has returned to Solstheim, but that is impossible.
If you want to know what lies beneath the Temple of Miraak, then let us go together. First, we need to find a way into the Temple of Miraak.

kbs.name: Vilkas
kbs.description: a male member of the Companions

plots: the player told Kodlak Whitemane that they want to join the Companions

quest.title: Take Up Arms
quest.objective: prove that you are worthy of joining the Companions
tasks: go with Vilkas out to the yard, and let him see what you can do
prove that you are worthy of joining the Companions
quest.description:
You would like to join the Companions? Would you now? Here, let me have a look at you. Hm. Yes, perhaps. A certain strength of spirit.
How are you in a battle, child? Don't feel like you need to show off for our sake. Vilkas, here, will be the one testing your mettle.
Let Vilkas take you out to the yard and see what you can do.

kbs.name: Viarmo
kbs.description: the welcoming headmaster of the Bards College

kbs.name: King Olaf's Verse
kbs.description: a part of the Poetic Edda, the living history of Skyrim, a poem dealing with King Olaf

plots: Jarl Elisif has forbidden the burning of King Olaf, a festival put on by the Bards College: to convince Jarl Elisif change her mind, Viarmo wants to read King Olaf's Verse

quest.title: Tending the Flames
quest.objective: become a member of the Bards College
tasks: Find your way to Dead Men's Respite.
retrieve King Olaf's Verse
become a member of the Bards College
quest.description:
Welcome to the Bards College. I am Viarmo, the headmaster here.
Always a pleasure to meet a prospective bard. You should be aware that many apply but we accept very few people. When possible, we ask applicants to perform tasks the college needs completed. In this case, I do have a task befitting an aspiring bard...
Jarl Elisif has forbidden the Burning of King Olaf, a Festival put on by the Bards College. We need to change her mind. To convince her I want to read King Olaf's Verse. A part of the Poetic Edda, the living history of Skyrim. Unfortunately the poem was lost long ago.
According to our histories keeper, the portion of the Edda dealing with King Olaf might still exist in Dead Men's Respite. I need you to retrieve the poem.

plots: the player is torturing their prisoner
the player's prisoner has hidden her inheritance

quest.title: The Inheritance
quest.objective: find the hidden treasure for yourself
tasks: Head to the marsh south of Solitude.
get your prisoner's treasure from a hollowed-out tree stump
find the hidden treasure for yourself
quest.description:
Why are you people doing this? Is it information you want?
This... this is about the inheritance, isn't it? All right! I'll tell you where I've hidden it. It's in a hollowed-out tree stump. In the marsh, south of Solitude. Now please, you'll let me go now. Right?
Why don't you be a dear and let me go now. All right? I won't say a word to anyone. Our little secret. I promise.

plots: the player is hurting their prisoner

quest.title: No More Pain
quest.objective: find your prisoner's treasure for yourself
tasks: Proceed to just north of Windhelm.
get your prisoner's hidden things from a hollowed-out rock
find your prisoner's treasure for yourself
quest.description:
I'll tell you anything. Anything! Just please stop... hurting me... I just... can't take the pain. Not a second longer.
I'll give you money. Treasure. I have some things hidden away. Take them all. They're yours. Just please... stop. Just north of Windhelm. There's a hollowed-out rock. I have some things hidden in there. Take them! They're yours.
I've told you everything I can. I don't know what else you could want...

kbs.name: Whiterun
relations: the tundra a bit west of Whiterun

kbs.name: the tundra a bit west of Whiterun
kbs.description: the tundra a bit west of Whiterun

plots: the player is torturing their prisoner: the prisoner wants to die

quest.title: Kill Me and Be Done with It...
quest.objective: find your prisoner's hidden treasure for yourself
tasks: Find your way to the tundra a bit west of Whiterun.
get your prisoner's treasure from a hollowed-out rock
find your prisoner's hidden treasure for yourself
quest.description:
Please... What is it you want?
Just... just stop. And I'll tell you where I've hidden my treasure. It's... in a hollowed-out rock. In the tundra. A bit west of Whiterun. Now please... please stop.
Oh gods, you've taken everything I have. Just kill me and be done with it...

plots: the player is torturing their prisoner: the prisoner's father hid her dowry

quest.title: Canceled Wedding
quest.objective: find the hidden dowry for yourself
tasks: Make your way to just outside Riften.
get your prisoner's dowry from a hollowed-out tree stump
find the hidden dowry for yourself
quest.description:
You... you can't do this to me. Do you have any idea who I am? When my father hears about this, he will gut you.
Ah, now I understand. This is about my father's hidden cache, isn't it? The dowry for my wedding? Ha! Well it's safely hidden away, in a hollowed-out tree stump. Just outside Riften, tucked away nice and secure. You'll never find it.
Damn it. I gave it away, didn't I?

kbs.name: Brynjolf
kbs.description: a member of the Thieves Guild

kbs.name: Keerava
kbs.description: a woman who has not paid her debts to the Thieves Guild

kbs.name: Bersi Honey-Hand
kbs.description: a man who has not paid her debts to the Thieves Guild

kbs.name: Haelga
kbs.description: a woman who has not paid her debts to the Thieves Guild

plots: the player and Brynjolf did a little thievery at the market

quest.title: Taking Care of Business
quest.objective: send a message that the Thieves Guild is not to be ignored
tasks: collect some debts from Keerava, Bersi Honey-Hand, and Haelga without killing them
send a message that the Thieves Guild is not to be ignored
quest.description:
Well, well... Color me impressed kid. I wasn't certain I'd ever see you again!
So... now that I've whetted your appetite with our little scheme at the market, how about handling a few deadbeats for me? They are Keerava, Bersi Honey-Hand and Haelga.
They owe our organization some serious coin and they've decided not to pay. I want you to explain to them the error of their ways. Do this right, and I can promise you a permanent place in our organization.
Honestly, the debt is secondary here. What's more important is that you get the message across that we aren't to be ignored. A word of warning though... I don't want any of them killed. Bad for business.

plots: Eola assumes that the player is a cannibal
Eola has been eating the dead people of Markarth

quest.title: The Taste of Death
quest.objective: find your place as a follower of Namira
tasks: Find your way to Reachcliff Cave.
meet Eola and fight your way through the undead with her
find your place as a follower of Namira
quest.description:
You were young when you first tasted human flesh, weren't you? A brother or sister had died? An accident, of course.
Then the hunger set in. Curiosity. What's the harm in just one bite? It's okay, now. You've found a friend who understands you. You can let go of your guilt.
A lot of our kind block out the memory of their first meal. The shame is too much. But you don't need to hide anymore. Namira, the Lady of Decay, accepts you for what you are.
She has a place for us, where we can sate our appetites without judgment. It's inside Reachcliff Cave. But the dead have stirred from their slumber recently, and I was forced here. Meet me there. We will fight our way to Namira's embrace together.
Until then, tell the people of Markarth that their dead won't be disturbed, anymore. We have bigger plans ahead.

kbs.name: Laila Law-Giver
kbs.description: the noblewoman who rules over Riften

plots: the player raided Sarthis' warehouse and killed him for Laila Law-Giver: the player knows where the source of the Skooma is

quest.title: Supply and Demand
quest.objective: destroy the source of Skooma and report back to Laila Law-Giver
tasks: go to the source of Skooma
destroy the source of Skooma and report back to Laila Law-Giver
quest.description:
It's nice to receive good news for a change. Did you recover anything else from the warehouse worth mentioning?
If you have discovered the source of Skooma, then there's no time to lose. It won't take long for Sarthis's associates to learn of his death. The source of the poison must be destroyed once and for all, otherwise another dealer will simply take his place.
Do this task for me and you'll be well on your way to a title in Riften. Report back to me when your task is complete.

kbs.name: Fjotli
kbs.description: Torsten Cruel-Sea's daughter, who liked wearing a lot of jewelry

kbs.name: Niranye
kbs.description: a woman affiliated with the Summerset Shadows

plots: the player is a member of the Thieves Guild
Fjotli was robbed and murdered: Torsten Cruel-Sea tracked down the murderer, a member of the Summerset Shadows, and killed him

quest.title: Summerset Shadows
quest.objective: remove the Summerset Shadows from the picture, and return Torsten Cruel-Sea's silver locket to him
tasks: Arrive at Niranye's house in Windhelm.
find information about the Summerset Shadows
remove the Summerset Shadows from the picture, and return Torsten Cruel-Sea's silver locket to him
quest.description:
My daughter Fjotli... she was murdered a few months ago. Left her laying on the ground in a pool of her own blood. I assume they were after her valuables... she always wore far too much jewelry in public. When I told her it'd be the death of her, I never thought...
No need to explain, I'm well aware of your Guild's methods do not include killing. It took me weeks, but I finally tracked down the killer. A bloody Altmer at that. Can you imagine? Let's just say I'm a firm believer in an eye for an eye and leave it at that.
The killer fancied himself a thief in some sort of a new Guild forming around here. Gave me some valuable information before... well, you know. Well, I think we can help each other. You recover what I'm looking for and take out a rival Guild in the process. One of the pieces stolen from Fjotli was a silver locket, a Cruel-Sea family heirloom. I want it back.
The only name I have is Niranye. Has a house right here in Windhelm. That's where you should begin looking.

kbs.name: fire salts, strange minerals that burns as hot as lava
kbs.description: fire salts, strange minerals that burns as hot as lava

plots: Balimund's forge consumes fire salts

quest.title: Stoking the Flames
quest.objective: bring 10 fire salts to restore Balimund's forge
tasks: find 10 fire salts
bring 10 fire salts to restore Balimund's forge
quest.description:
Come to see Balimund perform miracles with steel, eh? Smithing's been in my blood for generations.
I owe my success to my forefathers and their recipe for flame. The secret is my forge. It consumes fire salts, a strange mineral that burns as hot as lava.
Sadly, this forge is dying and I've used the last of my fire salts. If I can't feed it soon, it may grow cold. Ten pinches of fire salts should give me all I need to bring this forge back to life.
Could you get the fire salts for me? I know that they are hard to come by, but they would save my business and warm an old smith's heart.

plots: keep away from the keep and the city guards: they won't accept the missives

quest.title: Spread the Love
quest.objective: distribute all religious missives to the citizens of Riften
tasks: Reach Riften.
speak to the citizens
distribute all religious missives to the citizens of Riften
quest.description:
Riften is drowning in a sea of sin and wickedness and it's my personal mission to let everyone know that the warmth of Mara can see them through.
All I need is a messenger to bring Her words to these poor souls by distributing these missives. Lady Mara would be so pleased, if you could distribute the missives! Let me give you the missives. Here you are. Now make sure you give out every single one, we can't afford to let even one lost soul stray from Her warmth.
Almost anyone in Riften is in dire need of those missives. Speak to them, child. You will know who will listen and who will sin. A word of advice, keep away from the Keep and the city guards. They follow their own path and have already forsaken Her.
Allow me to give you Mara's gift as a reward... a true blessing to aid you in times of need. Despair not, her warmth will protect you always!

plots: Shadr thinks that Sapphire cheated him: Shadr ordered a shipment from the Whiterun stables, it never came

quest.title: Stabilized
quest.objective: help Shadr clear his debt with Sapphire
tasks: talk with Sapphire about Shadr's debt
help Shadr clear his debt with Sapphire
quest.description:
I owe a great deal of money to someone and I think they cheated me. I don't know what to do.
I was able to work out a deal with the stables in Whiterun to sell me some of their tack and harnesses. I borrowed some gold from Sapphire to pay for the shipment, but it got robbed before it even arrived. Now Sapphire wants her money back, and if I don't pay her, I think she's going to kill me.
Can you help me pay off my debt? You should go talk with Sapphire about it.

kbs.name: Sylgja
kbs.description: an injured woman, and a good daughter

kbs.name: Darkwater Crossing
kbs.description: a village where Sylgja's parents live

plots: Sylgja assumes that Verner have something for her

quest.title: A Mail Delivery
quest.objective: make a delivery for Sylgja to her parents
tasks: Proceed to Darkwater Crossing.
deliver a satchel of letters to Verner
make a delivery for Sylgja to her parents
quest.description:
Would you happen to be headed towards Darkwater Crossing?
My parents live there. I usually make the journey to bring them gifts and to just say hello, but I haven't been well lately.
I've written some letters and placed them in a satchel. Perhaps you wouldn't mind delivering it to them on my behalf? I would insist on rewarding you for your time.
Here, take my satchel and give it to my father, Verner. He'll likely have something for you to bring back.

plots: Bolli sells his catch across Skyrim

quest.title: Special Delivery
quest.objective: help Bolli sell his fish to an untapped market
tasks: Head to The Silver Blood Inn.
deliver a purchase agreement to Kleppr
help Bolli sell his fish to an untapped market
quest.description:
I'm Bolli, a fisherman.
I sell my catch across a good portion of Skyrim... it's worth its weight in gold to me. The only untapped market left is Markarth. However, I just got word that Kleppr at The Silver Blood Inn might be interested.
If you're headed that way, I would appreciate you delivering a purchase agreement for me. You'd be paid, of course. Kleppr will pay you as soon as you arrive with the letter. Here you are.

kbs.name: Mirabelle Ervine
kbs.description: the player's teacher in magic at the College of Winterhold

kbs.name: College of Winterhold
kbs.description: a school for mages in Skyrim

kbs.name: Savos Aren
kbs.description: the male Arch-Mage of the College of Winterhold

kbs.name: Staff of Magnus
kbs.description: a mage's staff that can absorb a tremendous amount of power

plots: the player needs the Staff of Magnus to break through Ancano's dangerous magic

the player knows that the Staff of Magnus is in Labyrinthian: Savos Aren gave Mirabelle Ervine something from Labyrinthian before he died, Mirabelle Ervine gives the player this item and Savos Aren's amulet

quest.title: The Staff of Magnus
quest.objective: bring the Staff of Magnus to the College of Winterhold
tasks: Arrive at Labyrinthian.
find the Staff of Magnus
bring the Staff of Magnus to the College of Winterhold
quest.description:
You need to get your hands on the Staff of Magnus. Now.
I've got to stay here, to see if we can get to Ancano and stop this. I need someone I can trust to do it. If the stories about the staff are true, if it really can absorb a tremendous amount of power, maybe we can break through Ancano's magic.
You know that the staff is in Labyrinthian? Are you... Are you sure? The staff is there? That can't be a coincidence. The Arch-Mage. Before... before he died. He... He gave me something just a little while ago. He told me it was from Labyrinthian, and that I would know what to do with it when the time came. I think... I think he meant this for you, then. I'm not sure why, but there was something very personal about it for him. Also, I think you should take this amulet. It belonged to Savos, but I think would do you the most good now. Take it, and get out of here.
Bring back that staff before Ancano brings the whole College down around us. If we can't stop this, what happens to the rest of Skyrim?

kbs.name: Temple of Dibella
kbs.description: a temple whose priests are exclusively women

plots: Degaine doesn't want the Thieves Guild to find out about his plans

quest.title: Lusting After Gold
quest.objective: steal a child-sized gold statue for Degaine
tasks: Head to Temple of Dibella.
sneak inside the temple and find the gold statue
steal a child-sized gold statue for Degaine
quest.description:
You see that Temple? Way up there. All them women, keeping to themselves.
Won't let poor Degaine in, no. Not even for a look. But they've got a treasure in there. Gold statue, size of a child. Who knows what they use it for, but I know what I'll use it for.
Stealing it and selling it for profit. Well let's not put it like that. Wouldn't want the Thieves Guild catching wind of us, eh? Nah, just creep in and have a go at taking it out. I'll be here, and pay you half of what my man in Riften promised for it.
You'll be helping out an old beggar, and the gods smile on that sort of thing.

kbs.name: Tsun
kbs.description: Shor's shield-thane, and the guardian of the Whalebone Bridge

kbs.name: Sovngarde
kbs.description: the storied underworld of heroic souls

kbs.name: Alduin, World Eater
kbs.description: a dragon who is eating the souls of Sovngarde

plots: Tsun judges which heroic souls are allowed to go to the Hall of Valor
the player pursues Alduin: Shor did not let the heroic, angry souls of Sovngarde to attack Alduin

quest.title: Sovngarde
quest.objective: go over the Whalebone Bridge to the Hall of Valor
tasks: complete Tsun's warrior's test
go over the Whalebone Bridge to the Hall of Valor
quest.description:
I am Tsun, shield-thane to Shor. The Whalebone Bridge he bade me guard and winnow all those souls whose heroic end sent them here, to Shor's lofty hall where welcome, well earned, awaits those I judge fit to join that fellowship of honor.
You pursue Alduin, the World Eater. A fateful errand. No few have chafed to face the Worm since first he set his soul-snare here at Sovngarde's threshold. But Shor restrained our wrathful onslaught - perhaps, deep counseled, your doom he foresaw.
Living or dead, by decree of Shor, none may pass this perilous bridge 'till I judge them worthy by the warrior's test.

kbs.name: Mercer Frey
kbs.description: the player's guildmaster in the Thieves Guild

kbs.name: Karliah
kbs.description: an intelligent female thief, on the run from the Thieves Guild

plots: the player agreed to meet Mercer Frey outside Snow Veil Sanctum
Mercer Frey found Karliah's horse and killed it

quest.title: Speaking With Silence
quest.objective: catch Karliah
tasks: Head to Snow Veil Sanctum.
find Karliah with Mercer Frey
catch Karliah
quest.description:
Good, you're finally here. I've scouted the ruins and I'm certain Karliah is still inside.
I did not find her in flesh. No, I found her horse. Don't worry, I've taken care of it... she won't be using it to escape. Let's get moving, I want to catch her inside while she's distracted. Take the lead.
Just make certain you keep your eyes open. Karliah is as sharp as a blade. The last thing I need is you blundering into a trap and warning her that we're here.

kbs.name: Malur Seloth
kbs.description: the sly, lazy steward of the Jarl of Winterhold

kbs.name: College of Winterhold
kbs.description: a college for mages in Winterhold

kbs.name: Jarl of Winterhold
kbs.description: the nobleman who rules over Winterhold

plots: the Jarl of Winterhold thinks that Malur Seloth has some connection with the College of Winterhold: he goes easy on Malur Seloth

quest.title: Keeping Up the Appearances
quest.objective: give Nelacar's mage's staff to Malur Seloth
tasks: Proceed to Frozen Hearth.
steal Nelacar's mage's staff from his room
give Nelacar's mage's staff to Malur Seloth
quest.description:
I do nothing around here. And I hope to keep it that way. The Jarl is convinced I have some connection with the College, so he goes easy on me.
Maybe you'd like to help me keep up appearances? Old Nelacar has a mage's staff in his room in the Frozen Hearth. It'd be good to have that staff in case the Jarl starts wondering if I actually have a real connection to the College.
Pinch that staff for me. I'll be waiting for it. Once I have it, I'll show you a few tricks I've learned about buttering up royalty.

kbs.name: Dengeir of Stuhn
kbs.description: a paranoid man who hates the Empire

kbs.name: Skyrim
kbs.description: a province of the Empire that might break out of the Empire

kbs.name: Solitude
kbs.description: the capital city of Skyrim, under Imperial rule

plots: Dengeir of Stuhn thinks that Lod wrote a letter to General Tullius

quest.title: Imperial Spy?
quest.objective: give Lod's letter to Dengeir of Stuhn
tasks: Reach Lod's house in Falkreath.
steal Lod's letter
give Lod's letter to Dengeir of Stuhn
quest.description:
There's a plot. Not against me. Against all of Falkreath. Those Imperial bastards are spying on every one of us.
Last night I saw Lod the blacksmith writing a letter. Probably sending word to Solitude and General Tullius. Are you loyal to Skyrim? Break into Lod's house and get that letter.
The Empire is probably making Lod smith up more swords and armor for them.

kbs.name: Soljund's Sinkhole
kbs.description: a mine connected to an old Nordic crypt

plots: Perth warns the player to stay out of Soljund's Sinkhole

quest.title: Soljund's Sinkhole
quest.objective: make Soljund's Sinkhole safe again
tasks: Proceed to Soljund's Sinkhole.
clear out draugr
make Soljund's Sinkhole safe again
quest.description:
Whoa, there. I don't know where you're going, but stay out of that mine. It isn't safe.
We tunneled into an old Nordic crypt. The whole place is crawling with draugr. We're not mining up any ore with those undead around, so I wouldn't go down there if I were you.
You want to clear out the draugr? You're joking, right? Those bone-walkers will tear you limb from limb. But if you want to get yourself killed, go ahead.
I hear talk about a regiment coming to clear the crypt out. We'll see if that happens.

plots: Avrusa Sarethi is keeping a a tight rein on Aduri

quest.title: Smooth Jazbay
quest.objective: collect 20 Jazbay Grapes for  Avrusa Sarethi so that she can cultivate her supply of Nirnroot
tasks: find 20 Jazbay Grapes
collect 20 Jazbay Grapes for  Avrusa Sarethi so that she can cultivate her supply of Nirnroot
quest.description:
Sigh. I've got my hands full here. Between the farm chores, cultivating my supply of Nirnroot and keeping a tight rein on my sister Aduri, there's little time for rest.
Could you help me? One of the ingredients I need to cultivate Nirnroot are Jazbay Grapes... the acidic content of the juice is perfect for the soil. I need twenty of them for my current crop.
I'll give you something for your efforts... finding all of them might not be easy... or cheap.

kbs.name: Ghorza gra-Bagol
kbs.description: an Orc Blacksmith who used to work for the Imperial Legion

kbs.name: Tacitus
kbs.description: a young Imperial man, and Ghorza gra-Bagol's apprentice

plots: Tacitus is not learning smithing by example: Ghorza gra-Bagol thinks that 'The Last Scabbard of Akrash' could help him learn

quest.title: Skilled Apprenticeship
quest.objective: bring 'The Last Scabbard of Akrash' to Ghorza gra-Bagol
tasks: find a copy of 'The Last Scabbard of Akrash'
bring 'The Last Scabbard of Akrash' to Ghorza gra-Bagol
quest.description:
You'd think an apprentice could forge a few hinges. Not Tacitus. I keep showing him how to treat the iron, but he never gets it.
In the Legion, the Imperial smiths used to read books when they couldn't set their hammers straight. Wisdom of the old, I guess. If you find a book called 'The Last Scabbard of Akrash', could you bring it to me? Tacitus sure isn't learning by example.
Books. Don't know why the Imperials like them so much. It should help the boy, though, Malacath willing. Bring the book, and I'll show you how an Orc learns to smith.

kbs.name: Morwen
kbs.description: a Skaal woman born in Skyrim

plots: Bera left the Skaal village to return to Skyrim with her love: Morwen's father, a sailor from Skyrim
Morwen thinks that Bera would like her necklace be placed upon her grave in Falkreath

quest.title: Last Goodbyes
quest.objective: take Bera's necklace to Runil, and return to Morwen
tasks: Find your way to Falkreath.
give Bera's necklace to Runil and tell him that Morwen sent you
take Bera's necklace to Runil, and return to Morwen
quest.description:
My mother, Bera, was Skaal, but she left the village and I was born in Skyrim. A trade ship from Skyrim struck ice off the coast near the village, and the Skaal took in the surviving sailors. My mother fell in love with one of the sailors - my father - and eventually returned with him to Skyrim.
I came across a few of my mother's old things not long ago. Among them was a necklace that my father gave to her when they were married. I believe she would want it placed upon her tombstone in Falkreath, as a symbol of her undying love and the great sacrifice she made for it.
If you find yourself in Falkreath, please give this amulet to the priest Runil and tell him that I sent you. He will understand. I don't have much to give in reward, but return to me when the task is done and I'll do what I can. Thank you, Skaal-friend.

kbs.name: Pinewatch
kbs.description: a small cottage, and a bandit hideout

plots: the player is a member of the Thieves Guild
Endon ordered a silver mold from Valenwood: it was stolen by a group of bandits led by Rigel Strong-Arm
the authorities told Endon that their resources were spread too thin right now

quest.title: Silver Lining
quest.objective: recover Endon's stolen silver mold for him
tasks: Arrive at Pinewatch.
find Endon's stolen silver mold
recover Endon's stolen silver mold for him
quest.description:
Several months ago I ordered a special silver mold from some artisans in Valenwood. Well, it never arrived. Later I found out that it was robbed by a group of bandits led by someone named Rigel Strong-Arm.
Look, I talked to everyone with an ounce of authority... everyone. They all told me their resources were spread too thin right now. Word on the street says that the Thieves Guild is coming back into its own in Markarth so I figured... ...to send a thief to steal back what was stolen.
Look, this mold is irreplaceable. I'll pay you well for its return and I can also prove to be quite a valuable ally to the Thieves Guild.  The only thing I can tell you is that the mold was taken to the bandit's hideout... a small cottage called Pinewatch.
I'm not sure how many men they have inside, but I trust that won't be an issue for you. Good luck.

kbs.name: Heddic Volunnar
kbs.description: a scholar, giving quest via "Heddic's Volunruud Notes"

kbs.name: Tongue Chieftain Kvenel
kbs.description: an ancient warrior, and a forefather of Heddic Volunnar

kbs.name: "Heddic's Volunruud Notes"
kbs.description: notes on Heddic Volunnar's research on Volunruud

kbs.name: Okin and Eduj
kbs.description: favored weapons when Tongue Chieftain Kvenel went into battle

plots: Heddic Volunnar is scouting out Volunruud: the relief not far from the entrance hides Tongue Chieftain Kvenel's tomb
the two hidden keys to Tongue Chieftain Kvenel's tomb are ceremonial replicas of Okin and Eduj

quest.title: Silenced Tongues
quest.objective: unlock the burial chamber of Tongue Chieftain Kvenel
tasks: find the two hidden keys
unlock the burial chamber of Tongue Chieftain Kvenel
quest.description:
Heddic's Volunruud Notes
by Heddic Volunnar

I was skeptical, but it's obvious now. The old hymns had truth to them! The relief wasn't far from the entrance, just as they said. I've no doubt now that it hides the entrance to Kvenel's tomb.
The two keys must be hidden somewhere nearby - ceremonial replicas of Okin and Eduj, favored weapons when Kvenel went into battle. I don't dare explore further without hiring bodyguards to accompany me, however. To think - The Tongue Chieftain Kvenel could be entombed behind just a few feet of stone! The ancestor we scarcely believed was real.
Twice damned for planning this foolish scouting trip. I should have hired those sellswords in the first place. Perhaps there's no need. This place is just a tomb, after all, and there are no obvious signs of habitation. It isn't as though the thousand-year dead will mind if I have a look around.

kbs.name: Captain Valmir
kbs.description: an officer of the Imperial Legion

kbs.name: Forelhost
kbs.description: the last great bastion of the Dragon Cult

plots: the general sent Captain Valmir to obtain a powerful weapon for the war effort
dragons granted terrible power to the Dragon Cult for their bloody sacrifices: they were swept out during the dragon war because of their cruelty

quest.title: Siege on the Dragon Cult
quest.objective: recover the Dragon Cult leader's mask for Captain Valmir
tasks: find the Dragon Cult leader's mask
recover the Dragon Cult leader's mask for Captain Valmir
quest.description:
You there! As an officer of the Imperial Legion, I require your assistance to complete my mission.
The General has sent me to obtain a powerful weapon for the war effort. This was the last great bastion of the Dragon Cult, and their leader's mask was reported to be quite powerful.
They were among the first men to arrive from Atmora and they worshiped certain animals as avatars of the Gods; Dragons being foremost. And for their bloody sacrifices, the Dragons gifted their priests with terrible power. But their cruelty was too great for men to bear, and they rose up in what would be called the Dragon War and the Cult swept from the land.
I'll pay for the Dragon Cult leader's mask. Get in there, find the mask, return it to me, and earn your pay.

kbs.name: Black Sacrament
kbs.description: a dark ritual to obtain the services of the Dark Brotherhood

plots: the player, a member of the Dark Brotherhood, came to see Amaund Motierre after he had performed the Black Sacrament
Amaund Motierre wants to arrange several assassination contracts with the Dark Brotherhood, leading to the assassination of the emperor
Amaund Motierre gives the player two items: a sealed letter that will explain everything that needs to be done, and a valuable amulet - the player can use it to pay for any and all expenses

quest.title: The Silence Has Been Broken
quest.objective: accept Amaund Motierre's assassination contract
tasks: take the sealed letter and the valuable amulet to your superior in the Dark Brotherhood
accept Amaund Motierre's assassination contract
quest.description:
By the almighty Divines. You've come. You've actually come. This dreadful Black Sacrament thing... it worked.
Well, I won't waste your time. I would like to arrange a contract. Several, actually. I daresay, the work I'm offering has more significance than anything your organization has experienced in, well, centuries.
As I said, I want you to kill several people. You'll find the targets, as well as their manners of elimination, quite varied. I'm sure someone of your disposition will probably even find it enjoyable. But you should know that these killings are but a means to an end. For they pave the way to the most important target. The real reason I'm speaking with a cutthroat in the bowels of this detestable crypt. For I seek the assassination of... ...the Emperor.
What I ask is no small thing, of course. But you represent the Dark Brotherhood. This is... what you do? No? You must understand. So much has led to this day. So much planning, and maneuvering. Now, it's as if the very stars have finally aligned. But I digress. Here, take these two items. They need to be delivered to your, um... superior. The sealed letter will explain everything that needs to be done. The amulet is quite valuable - you can use it to pay for any and all expenses.

kbs.name: Skooma
kbs.description: a drug made from moon sugar

plots: the player told Grisvar the Unlucky that they want protection

quest.title: Shiv
quest.objective: obtain a shiv from Grisvar the Unlucky
tasks: bring Duach's bottle of Skooma to Grisvar the Unlucky
obtain a shiv from Grisvar the Unlucky
quest.description:
Ah, you want protection? I can get you what you need. Maybe you can do something for me, first?
Duach has a bottle of Skooma. Finest distilled Moon Sugar. I'm shaking just thinking about it.
Get that bottle of Skooma, and I'll have a shiv ready for you. Promise you won't ever use it on me, okay?

kbs.name: Vex
kbs.description: the player's superior in the Thieves Guild

kbs.name: Carlotta Valentia
kbs.description: a woman who pissed off the wrong person

plots: the Thieves Guild gets rid of people without killing them, unlike the Dark Brotherhood

quest.title: The Shill Job
quest.objective: frame Carlotta Valentia to get her out of the way
tasks: place an item as evidence inside Carlotta Valentia's home
frame Carlotta Valentia to get her out of the way
quest.description:
When a client needs us to eliminate another, we don't operate like the Dark Brotherhood. We find alternate means to get them out of the way.
We send you to plant some phony evidence in the mark's house, and then tip off the town guard... the rest takes care of itself. Sound like you can handle it?
Go place an item as evidence inside Carlotta Valentia's home. She must have ticked-off our client badly. The client's impatient and keeps asking if the job's done. Can you get him off my back?

kbs.name: Urag gro-Shub
kbs.description: a librarian who can translate the writings of Shalidor

kbs.name: Shalidor
kbs.description: a immensely powerful male mage in the first era

plots: Shalidor holed himself up in Labyrinthian, and devoted all of his time to research and study

quest.title: Shalidor's Insights
quest.objective: bring the writings of Shalidor to Urag gro-Shub
tasks: Travel to Skyrim.
discover the writings of Shalidor
bring the writings of Shalidor to Urag gro-Shub
quest.description:
Have you ever heard of Shalidor? Immensely powerful mage, back in the First Era. Had an understanding of magic few have ever matched. He holed himself up in Labyrinthian, and devoted all of his time to research and study. Wrote more than you would imagine possible.
Since then, his writings have been scattered all over Skyrim, but are little use to anyone who can't translate them. I'm one of the few who can. I'm always trying to find more of Shalidor's writings.
I've heard whispers of more of his work having turned up. If you can track it down, it may prove useful to all of us.

kbs.name: Talos
kbs.description: a mortal man who ascended to godhood

kbs.name: Jarl
kbs.description: the nobleman who rules over Markarth

plots: the player asked Ondolemar what he is doing in Markarth
Ondolemar knows that Ogmund the Skald worships Talos in his home: the Jarl of Markarth refuses to arrest Ogmund the Skald

quest.title: Search and Seizure
quest.objective: find evidence of Ogmund the Skald's Talos worship for Ondolemar
tasks: break into Ogmund the Skald's home
find evidence of Ogmund the Skald's Talos worship for Ondolemar
quest.description:
I was sent here to lead the Thalmor's interests in this corner of the world. It's my mission to root out all Talos worship in this city.
You're awfully inquisitive, aren't you? I like that. Perhaps you'd care to solve a little problem I'm having? Ogmund the Skald. He's old, respected, and I know for a fact that he worships Talos in his home. But the Jarl has been hesitant to call for his arrest. I want you to break in to his home and find evidence.

kbs.name: Adril Arano
kbs.description: the second councilor of Raven Rock, and a loyal underling of Councilor Morvayn

kbs.name: Councilor Morvayn
kbs.description: the nobleman who rules over Raven Rock, a member of House Redoran

plots: the player has helped Raven Rock before
the Ulen Family has placed a deathmark on Councilor Morvayn's head

quest.title: Served Cold
quest.objective: search Raven Rock and root out traitors who want to assassinate Councilor Morvayn
tasks: Make your way to Retching Netch Cornerclub.
talk to Geldis Sadri and check out any leads he provides you
search Raven Rock and root out traitors who want to assassinate Councilor Morvayn
quest.description:
After everything you've already done for Raven Rock, I hate to ask for more but I can't risk Councilor Morvayn being killed.
The Ulen Family of House Hlaalu, a rival Great House, has placed a deathmark on the Councilor's head. I need you to start out by being my eyes and ears... search Raven Rock and see if you can root out these traitors.
The best place to start would be Geldis Sadri over at the Retching Netch Cornerclub. If he provides you any leads, check them out before bringing them to my attention. I can't afford to make any mistakes.

kbs.name: Vokun
kbs.description: a powerful old male priest who was buried long ago

kbs.name: Ysgramor
