kbs.description: a famous male hero of old

plots: Anska's family legend states that they are descendants of Ysgramor

quest.title: A Scroll For Anska
quest.objective: help Anska find a scroll about her family legend
tasks: Make your way to Vokun's crypt.
defeat Vokun, a powerful old priest buried here, with Anska
help Anska find a scroll about her family legend
quest.description:
I'm Anska. Are you here to help?
I've finally located Vokun's crypt! The scroll I'm looking for just has to be here. Maybe you could help find it, I just know it's in here.
Vokun is some old priest buried here long ago. I've been searching for his tomb for a few years now. If Vokun is as powerful as I think, I may need a little help um... dealing with him. With the two of us this should be easy.
You can have anything except the scroll of course. It's probably meaningless to you, but according to family legend it links our bloodline back to Ysgramor himself.

kbs.name: Talen-Jei
kbs.description: an Argonian man who wants to marry Keerava

plots: in Black Marsh, tradition dictates Argonians present a potential mate a unique wedding ring to represent their future bond: Talen-Jei already has a gold band for Keerava's wedding ring

quest.title: Sealing the Deal
quest.objective: help Talen-Jei complete Keerava's wedding ring
tasks: find three flawless amethysts for Keerava's wedding ring
help Talen-Jei complete Keerava's wedding ring
quest.description:
I met Keerava when I wandered into Riften a few years ago. Been smitten with her ever since. In fact, I'm thinking of asking her to marry me.
In Black Marsh, tradition dictates we present a potential mate a unique wedding ring to represent our future bond. I already have the gold band, but all I need are three flawless amethysts to complete the setting.

kbs.name: Idolaf Battle-Born
kbs.description: a man, giving quest via "Letter from Idolaf Battle-Born"

kbs.name: "Letter from Idolaf Battle-Born"
kbs.description: a letter to the player from Idolaf Battle-Born

plots: Idolaf Battle-Born saw the player assault Nazeem

quest.title: Scare My Enemy
quest.objective: assault someone for Idolaf Battle-Born
tasks: talk to Idolaf Battle-Born
assault someone for Idolaf Battle-Born
quest.description:
Letter from Idolaf Battle-Born
by Idolaf Battle-Born

Dragonborn,
I'm aware of your recent assault on Nazeem. Rest assured I have no interest in that particular matter. I do, however, have an interest in your willingness to employ force when the need arises.
If you are able to assist me, I will gladly pay you for your troubles.
Next time you are visiting Whiterun, please call on me.
Sincerely, Idolaf Battle-Born

kbs.name: Southfringe Sanctum
kbs.description: the home of Bashnag's dangerous coven

plots: the player saved Selveni Nethri from a spiders' web
Selveni Nethri was a member of Bashnag's coven, but they chased her out and left her for dead

quest.title: The Savior of Selveni Nethri
quest.objective: help Selveni Nethri escape from Southfringe Sanctum
tasks: escort Selveni Nethri outside
help Selveni Nethri escape from Southfringe Sanctum
quest.description:
Thanks for getting me out of that. Bashnag's coven chased me out and left me for dead down here. Nobody lasts too long with the spiders.
Please, will you help me get out of here? If the coast is clear, I'll make a break for it. We - well 'they', Bashnag's circle of mages, live here. They made it pretty clear that I'm no longer welcome. These are no dainty college mages. Bashnag has the skill of a magister and the mind of a warlord.
This is a dangerous bunch. They're good company if you want to study necromancy in peace, though.

kbs.name: Balgruuf the Greater
kbs.description: the nobleman who rules over Whiterun

kbs.name: High Hrothgar
kbs.description: the secluded home of the Greybeards, and neutral territory to both sides of the war

kbs.name: Ulfric
kbs.description: the man leading one side of the war

kbs.name: General Tullius
kbs.description: the man leading the other side of the war

plots: the player asked Balgruuf the Greater to help the player trap a dragon in Whiterun: Ulfric and General Tullius want to capture Whiterun
getting both sides of war to agree to a truce will be difficult at this point

quest.title: Season Unending
quest.objective: negotiate a truce between Ulfric and General Tullius
tasks: Reach High Hrothgar.
ask the Greybeards hold a peace council
negotiate a truce between Ulfric and General Tullius
quest.description:
I want to help you, Dragonborn. And I will. But I need your help first.
Ulfric and General Tullius are both just waiting for me to make a wrong move. Do you think they will sit idle while a dragon is slaughtering my men and burning my city? No. I can't risk weakening the city while we are under the threat of enemy attack. I'm sorry.
If only you could negotiate a truce between Ulfric and General Tullius. Then I would be glad to help you with your mad dragon-trapping scheme. But getting both sides to agree to a truce will be difficult at this point. The bitterness has gone too deep. Maybe... hmm... what of the Greybeards? They are respected by everyone. High Hrothgar is neutral territory. If the Greybeards were willing to host a peace council... then maybe Ulfric and Tullius would have to listen.

kbs.name: Mercer Frey
kbs.description: the player's guildleader in the Thieves Guild

kbs.name: Goldenglow Estate
kbs.description: an estate that used to send protection money to the Thieves Guild

kbs.name: Gulum-Ei
kbs.description: a male Thieves Guild informant within the East Empire Company

kbs.name: Brynjolf
kbs.description: a male member of the Thieves Guild

plots: Gulum-Ei acted as a go-between for the sale of Goldenglow Estate: he can finger the buyer
the player should talk to Brynjolf before they leave if they have any questions

quest.title: Scoundrel's Folly
quest.objective: squeeze Gulum-Ei for information
tasks: Proceed to East Empire Company.
find Gulum-Ei
squeeze Gulum-Ei for information
quest.description:
Ah, there you are. I have a job for you.
Gulum-Ei is our inside man at the East Empire Company in Solitude. I'm betting he acted as a go-between for the sale of Goldenglow Estate and that he can finger our buyer.
Get out there, shake him down and see what you come up with. Talk to Brynjolf before you leave if you have any questions.

kbs.name: Ainethach
kbs.description: the owner of the Sanuarach Mine in Karthwasten

plots: the Silver-Bloods are trying to get hold of Sanuarach Mine
sellswords showed up after Forsworn attacked Sanuarach Mine: sellswords won't let anyone work until Ainethach sells it off

quest.title: Sanuarach Mine
quest.objective: help Ainethach keep Sanuarach Mine
tasks: convince sellswords to leave
help Ainethach keep Sanuarach Mine
quest.description:
The Silver-Bloods are trying to muscle in on my land. Forsworn attack the mines, and suddenly all these sellswords show up in Karthwasten to 'help.' They won't let anyone work until I sell it off.
You can try to convince them to leave, but I'd keep your sword-arm ready if things get ugly.

plots: Captain Wayfinder's mother ran the Sea Squall as strictly as she ran the house
Captain Wayfinder's sailors lost their last trade, Fine-Cut Void Salts from the College of Winterhold, after getting drunk

quest.title: Salty Sea-Dogs
quest.objective: bring Fine-Cut Void Salts back to Captain Wayfinder
tasks: Find your way to some cave.
find the Fine-Cut Void Salts
bring Fine-Cut Void Salts back to Captain Wayfinder
quest.description:
I am a sea captain by inheritance, as my men are fond of saying. Can't blame them, my mother ran the Sea Squall as strictly as she ran the house.
I've been trying to find new areas of business, trying to win the sailors' respect, but I keep having problems. Take the last trade we did. Some Fine-Cut Void Salts from the College of Winterhold. Plenty of coin if you know who to sell it to.
What happened to the Salts? Sailors are what happened to them. They got drunk and ended up losing the merchandise in some cave. If you're not afraid of little exploring, I'll pay good gold to get those Salts.

kbs.name: Astrid
kbs.description: the player's guildmaster in the Dark Brotherhood

kbs.name: Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary
kbs.description: the headquarters of the Dark Brotherhood
relations: in the southwest reaches of the realm, in the pine forest

kbs.name: in the southwest reaches of the realm, in the pine forest
kbs.description: in the southwest reaches of the realm, in the pine forest

kbs.name: "Silence, my brother."
kbs.description: the passphrase to the Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary

plots: Astrid officially welcomes the player to the Dark Brotherhood

quest.title: Sanctuary
quest.objective: begin your new life as a member of the Dark Brotherhood, and see Astrid
tasks: Arrive at in the southwest reaches of the realm, in the pine forest.
find the entrance to the Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary, and answer "Silence, my brother." when questioned by the black door
begin your new life as a member of the Dark Brotherhood, and see Astrid
quest.description:
I would like to officially extend to you an invitation to join my Family: the Dark Brotherhood.
In the southwest reaches of the realm, in the Pine Forest, you'll find the entrance to our Sanctuary. It's just beneath the road, hidden from view. When questioned by the Black Door, answer with the correct passphrase: "Silence, my brother." Then you're in. And your new life begins.
I'll see you at home.

plots: the player asked Farengar Secret-Fire whether he is the only wizard in Whiterun: Farengar Secret-Fire is the only wizard, but Whiterun is also home to a priest, a priestess, and alchemist, and others

quest.title: Salt for Arcadia
quest.objective: deliver some frost salts for Farengar Secret-Fire
tasks: give the frost salts to Arcadia, the local alchemist
deliver some frost salts for Farengar Secret-Fire
quest.description:
I believe I am, yes. Technically speaking, of course. The city is also home to a priest, a priestess, an alchemist, and I'm sure others who practice. Ah, that reminds me. Speaking of alchemists, I have some frost salts for Arcadia. She asked me to obtain them for one of her potions.
Would you be so kind as to deliver the frost salts for me? I'm sure Arcadia will provide some form of recompense…

kbs.name: Rogatus Salvius
kbs.description: a farmer who does not think highly of Leontius

kbs.name: Old Hroldan Inn
kbs.description: and old inn to the south

plots: Rogatus Salvius does no think highly of his son

quest.title: Rogatus's Letter
quest.objective: deliver a letter to Leontius
tasks: Head to Old Hroldan Inn.
find Leontius
deliver a letter to Leontius
quest.description:
My boy Leontius lives in Old Hroldan. Old inn to the south.
Damn drunk. The oaf doesn't even bother to visit these days. What am I supposed to do if the dragons burn down the farm?
You're a traveler, right? I have this letter for him. Let him know how much of a failure he is. You make sure the lug tips you when he gets it.

kbs.name: Falion
kbs.description: a great mage who knows many things

kbs.name: Agni
kbs.description: a young girl, and Falion's ward

plots: the player is a vampire
Falion has considered becoming a vampire himself, but that would endanger Agni

quest.title: Rising at Dawn
quest.objective: return to Falion with a filled black soul gem, and he will perform a vampirism cure ritual
tasks: get a black soul gem, and fill it by killing someone
return to Falion with a filled black soul gem, and he will perform a vampirism cure ritual
quest.description:
I know many things. I have studied things beyond the reach of most humans, traveled the other planes, seen things one should not see.
I have met gods and long-dead races of people and everything in between and I know enough to see a vampire where others would see a man. I met several of your kind during my studies of life-extending magics. I even considered becoming a vampire myself. In the end, vampirism would endanger my ward Agni which would defeat the intended purpose.
It is possible to cure vampirism. I know of a ritual but I've never performed it. It requires a filled black soul gem. You will need to kill someone. When you have a gem and have filled it return to me and I will perform the ritual. I will bring life to your dead body, vampire.

plots: Madesi is one of the few traditional Saxhleel jewelers that remain in Tamriel

quest.title: Ringmaker
quest.objective: gather jewelry materials for Madesi
tasks: get two flawless sapphires, a mammoth tusk and a chunk of gold ore
gather jewelry materials for Madesi
quest.description:
I make my own jewelry. Sadly, I'm one of the few traditional Saxhleel jewelers that remains in Tamriel; it's becoming a lost art. Only trouble is gathering materials has become hazardous. The roads to the mines and to the other cities are thick with bandits... and worse.
Would you be interested in gathering some materials for me? I'd certainly be happy to compensate you. I'm seeking a small list of items to complete my next creation: two flawless sapphires, a mammoth tusk and a chunk of gold ore.

kbs.name: Giraud Gemane
kbs.description: a bard of the Bards College, and a former soldier

kbs.name: Rjorn
kbs.description: the most famous battle drummer of the second age, a man

plots: Rjorn entered Halldir's Cairn in secret, and presumably died there

quest.title: Rjorn's Drum
quest.objective: retrieve the Rjorn' drum for  Giraud Gemane
tasks: Proceed to Halldir's Cairn.
find the drum
retrieve the Rjorn' drum for  Giraud Gemane
quest.description:
They found it! They actually found Rjorn's drum!
You don't know who Rjorn is? You're joking, right? Rjorn? Only the most famous battle drummer of the second age. Well, famous among bards at least. That drum has been in half a dozen famous battles. It's a priceless artifact.
Nobody knows where he died, and therefore where his drum might be. Halldir was the missing link. Rjorn was always looking for new stories to tell. It seems he was writing a lay about Halldir when he vanished. Rjorn entered Halldir's Cairn in secret, and presumably died there.
Now all I need to do is find someone to get it. Wait. You. You could do it. I need you to get me that drum. The college treasury is a bit thin right now. But I can show you some tricks I learned from my days with the army.

kbs.name: Orthus Endario
kbs.description: an employee of the East Empire Company
relations: East Empire Company's rundown offices in Windhelm

kbs.name: East Empire Company's rundown offices in Windhelm
kbs.description: East Empire Company's rundown offices in Windhelm

kbs.name: Suvaris Atheron
kbs.description: a female dark elf, and the meticulous overseer of the Shatter-Shields' shipping operation

plots: pirates have been raiding all along the coast, from Hammerfell to Vvardenfell: the East Empire Company's security forces are limited, and all the mercenaries are tied up in the war

quest.title: Rise in the East
quest.objective: help Orthus Endario prove that the Shatter-Shields are in league with pirates
tasks: Find your way to Windhelm.
steal Suvaris Atheron's logbook and bring it to Orthus Endario
help Orthus Endario prove that the Shatter-Shields are in league with pirates
quest.description:
Sad, isn't it? We can't afford to keep the place running since these attacks started. Pirates, you see. Raiding all along the coast, from Hammerfell to Vvardenfell.
Our own security forces are limited, and all the mercenaries are tied up in this ridiculous war. We don't even know their base of operations, and attacking single ships won't really solve the problem.
Only the Shatter-Shields appear safe. They are a very powerful family here in Windhelm. They run a private shipping operation, and would love to have the docks to themselves. Wouldn't surprise me if they were in league with the pirates, somehow.
Not yet, no. But perhaps an intrepid person such as yourself could help with that. They have a dark elf who oversees their operations. Suvaris Atheron. She's meticulous to a fault, and keeps a logbook with every transaction she makes.
If you get me the logbook, I'll have proof of Shatter-Shield's treachery.

plots: Roggvir died: Svari's mother took his death hard

quest.title: Return to Grace
quest.objective: convince Svari's mother to go to temple
tasks: talk to Svari's mother
convince Svari's mother to go to temple
quest.description:
Mum doesn't say much since Uncle Roggvir died. She doesn't even go to temple anymore. I wish she would. At least that way she'd have people to talk to.
Maybe you could convince her. You should go do it right now.

plots: the Synod seemed convinced the Staff of Magnus was somewhere in Skyrim: the Synod will not be cooperative

quest.title: Revealing the Unseen
quest.objective: learn the location of the Staff of Magnus
tasks: Head to Mzulft.
find the members of the Synod
learn the location of the Staff of Magnus
quest.description:
The Synod seemed convinced the Staff of Magnus was somewhere in Skyrim. They inquired about the ruins of Mzulft, but that's all I remember.
It sounded like they were heading there, though they were rather secretive about why. I suppose if you're intent on looking for the staff, there's a chance they might be in Mzulft yet. Just don't expect them to be cooperative.

kbs.name: Colette Marence
kbs.description: a fellow member of the College of Winterhold

kbs.name: Augur
kbs.description: a powerful male mage gifted in restoration

plots: the player is a devoted student of restoration: most mages of the College of Winterhold look down on restoration magic

quest.title: Restoration Ritual
quest.objective: learn more about restoration magic from the Augur
tasks: talk with the Augur, who's expecting you
learn more about restoration magic from the Augur
quest.description:
Look at you. Such a devoted student of Restoration. It's comforting to see that not everyone has dismissed it as entirely as most members of the College. Truly comforting.
It looks like you're ready to speak with the Augur. He was a brilliant mage. Truly inspired. Mastered spells others could barely comprehend. He was especially gifted when it came to Restoration.
The Augur's... Well, he's very particular about who shares the knowledge. So you'll need his approval first. Go on, go talk to him. I'm sure he's been paying attention, and will be expecting you.

kbs.name: Bujold the Unworthy
kbs.description: the leader of the warriors of Thirsk Mead Hall

kbs.name: Thirsk Mead Hall
kbs.description: a mead hall, the home of Bujold the Unworthy and his warriors, up there on the hill

kbs.name: Rieklings
kbs.description: [Enemy] tenacious creatures that attack people in large packs

plots: the player asked Bujold the Unworthy what is going on here

quest.title: Retaking Thirsk
quest.objective: help Bujold the Unworthy and his warriors retake Thirsk Mead Hall
tasks: Arrive at Thirsk Mead Hall.
fight Rieklings with Bujold the Unworthy and his warriors
help Bujold the Unworthy and his warriors retake Thirsk Mead Hall
quest.description:
What's going on here is that we've been kicked out of our home. The Thirsk Mead Hall, up there on the hill. We were... some Rieklings have taken it over.
Rieklings overcame us with tenacity and numbers. Didn't help that we'd grown a little too comfortable up there. Too much mead. Too many stories. Too few battles.
Are you... offering to help? Some new blood should be enough to rouse these layabouts to actually fight again.

kbs.name: Illia
kbs.description: a repenting mage who has never killed an innocent person

kbs.name: Darklight Tower
kbs.description: a tower filled with witches and Hagravens, and Illia's former home

plots: Illia just killed a female witch in front of the player
Illia and the witch were supposed to find a human sacrifice: the witch attacked Illia because Illia could not do it

quest.title: Repentance
quest.objective: help Illia prevent her mother from transforming into a Hagraven
tasks: Go to Darklight Tower.
follow Illia to the top of the tower
help Illia prevent her mother from transforming into a Hagraven
quest.description:
By the gods! I know this looks bad. Let me explain...
I called Darklight Tower home, now I know that was a mistake. I am, or was part of a coven serving the Hagravens that live there. So was she.
We were supposed to find a sacrifice. Human sacrifice. I told her I couldn't do it and she attacked me. I've done horrible things living here, but never taken an innocent life. I couldn't just find some person for them to kill. We needed a sacrifice for the Initiation. My mother is going to become one of those things, Hagravens. I can't be a part of that. Gods, I can't run away from this.
I'm going up there to stop her. This cycle must end. I don't know what brought you here, but I could use your help, if you're willing. Follow me. We have to fight our way up the Tower. I don't think anyone else here is about to have a change of heart.

plots: Larina stole Pantea's flute and sold it to a necromancer

quest.title: Pantea's Flute
quest.objective: recover Pantea's flute for her
tasks: Head to Hob's Fall Cave.
find the flute
recover Pantea's flute for her
quest.description:
That damn fool! I should wring Larina's neck! That fool student of mine stole my flute and sold it to some necromancer in Hob's Fall Cave.
Apparently Larina told him some story about the flute being able to make the dead dance. It's just a flute. A really old and valuable flute, but just a flute. I just got a ransom note for it. That flute has been handed down for seventeen generations!
Well don't just stand there. Go get my flute! I don't have any money to give you. but I can show you a few tricks I learned playing for wizards.

kbs.name: Fethis Alor
kbs.description: a merchant who used to sell East Empire Pendants

kbs.name: Solstheim
kbs.description: an island with old East Empire Company mines

kbs.name: East Empire Pendants
kbs.description: popular amulets that were made exclusively for the East Empire Company, a popular collectible

plots: the player asked Fethis Alor whether he sells special mining gear: he does not

quest.title: Pain in the Necklace
quest.objective: bring East Empire Pendants to Fethis Alor
tasks: Proceed to Solstheim.
find East Empire Pendants
bring East Empire Pendants to Fethis Alor
quest.description:
Mining gear? No. However, I used to sell East Empire Pendants until I ran out of them. Popular little item.
It's an amulet that was made exclusively for the East Empire Company. They gave them to their workers as an incentive at one point... a kind of reward for extra effort. They're no longer being made, so they've become collectible. I'd love to get my hands on a few of them.
They could be anywhere on the island. The mines might be a good place to start. If you find any while you're exploring Solstheim, bring them here and I'll pay you for them.

kbs.name: Eisa Blackthorn
kbs.description: a bandit from Kyr's gang, giving quest via "Eisa's Journal"

kbs.name: Frostmere Crypt
kbs.description: a crypt that contains a whole forest with a big old monument out in the center

kbs.name: Pale Lady
kbs.description: a swamp lady who abducts children at night

plots: Kyr's bandit gang dug up Frostmere Crypt: Kyr took the Pale Blade from the monument within
Ra'jirr keeps muttering about a Pale Lady, who is going to kill all of Kyr's bandits if they do not return the Pale Blade

quest.title: The Pale Lady
quest.objective: Find out what happened in Frostmere Crypt
tasks: go deeper into Frostmere Crypt
Find out what happened in Frostmere Crypt
quest.description:
Eisa's Journal
by Eisa Blackthorn

Night shift woke me to say they'd hit something big. Kyr, Ra'jirr, and I went down to take a look. It's huge, like a whole forest was just swallowed up by the earth, with a big old monument out in the center. Kyr took a sword from the monument as a trophy and dubbed it the "Pale Blade", proof his whole plan was finally paying off. For once, he might be right.

Ra'jirr's been having nightmares over the past few days. He keeps muttering about a "Pale Lady" - one of those swamp women who steal children away at night, I think. To think some fool story could turn the toughest bandit I know into a cowering kitten, frightened of his own shadow. I'm just glad none of the others see him like this.

It's getting worse. Ra'jirr can barely sleep at all now, and whenever he dozes off, he wakes up screaming - woke the whole place last night. He says the "Pale Lady" is coming for us - she's down in the forest, we have to return the sword or she'll kill us all. Not a chance - the boss clings to that thing like he was born with it. I've told everyone Ra'jirr just has a fever, but this can't go on. I've pulled a few things together. I'll slip out tonight and never look back.

kbs.name: Glover Mallory
kbs.description: a Breton man, and a fellow member of the Thieves Guild

plots: Esmond Tyne stole Glover Mallory's bonemold formula
Esmond Tyne talked about trying to fence goods to the Rieklings at Castle Karstaag

quest.title: Paid in Full
quest.objective: recover the bonemold formula for Glover Mallory
tasks: Arrive at Castle Karstaag.
find the bonemold formula
recover the bonemold formula for Glover Mallory
quest.description:
Eager to make some coin, eh? That's the spirit. I'll tell you what. The Guild's got a problem out here that I've been trying to deal with for years, but haven't been able to handle.
A fellow Breton who went by the name Esmond Tyne showed up on my doorstep about a fortnight ago. He stole something from me: my own formula for improved bonemold. Took me years to perfect.
Before he ran off, he was talking some nonsense about trying to fence goods to the Rieklings at Castle Karstaag. I told him he was crazy to even think about talking to those vicious little buggers, but he wouldn't listen. I'd bet a fat purse of coin that he's either dead or hiding out up there.

plots: the Dwemer discovered the Black Book that is connected with Miraak
Neloth found the Dwemer's "reading room" in Nchardak: Neloth was not able to open the protective case where the Black Book is sealed

quest.title: The Path of Knowledge
quest.objective: find the Black Book
tasks: Find your way to Nchardak.
go to Nchardak with Neloth
find the Black Book
quest.description:
I know where to find the Black Book connected with Miraak. I haven't been able to get it, though. But maybe together we can unlock the secrets the Dwemer left behind.
Forbidden knowledge was somewhat a specialty of the ancient Dwemer. It seems they discovered this book and took it to study. I have found their "reading room" in the ruins of Nchardak. The book is there, but it's sealed in a protective case which I wasn't able to open.
But perhaps the two of us together will be able to get the book. To Nchardak, then. Follow me.

kbs.name: Paarthurnax
kbs.description: the leader of the Greybeards, who is actually a dragon

plots: Paarthurnax was the right hand of Alduin, and responsible for many atrocities during the ancient dragon war

quest.title: Blood to the Blades!
quest.objective: kill Paarthurnax
tasks: go to Paarthurnax
kill Paarthurnax
quest.description:
I'm afraid there's a problem. A serious one. I've discovered who the Greybeards' leader really is.
He's a dragon. Not just any dragon, but the right hand of Alduin, responsible for many atrocities during the ancient Dragon War. It's true that his crimes are long in the past, but justice does not count the passage of years.
Justice demands that he, Paarthurnax, dies for his crimes. Until he is dead, I'm afraid my oath as a Blade prevents me from offering you aid and comfort.

plots: the College of Winterhold has gone to great lengths to purify and enhance the natural energies of the world

quest.title: Out of Balance
quest.objective: remove pollution from the various points of focus for magic energies with specially enchanted gloves, and return the gloves to Drevis Neloren afterwards
tasks: Find your way to around the College of Winterhold.
find the focus points for magical energy
remove pollution from the various points of focus for magic energies with specially enchanted gloves, and return the gloves to Drevis Neloren afterwards
quest.description:
There may be a matter in which your... skills... could be useful. The various points of focus for magic energies around the College have become polluted, and need cleansing.
As you may be aware, the College has gone to great lengths to purify and enhance the natural energies of the world. This both enhances our connection to the realm of magic, and eliminates possible interference from outside sources. These energies, on occasion, become... polluted. Effort must be made to see that they are kept pure, clean.
These specially enchanted gloves will allow you to delve directly into the focal points for these energies. Go to each focal point and remove whatever impurities you may find there. Return the gloves to me when you have finished. Please exercise caution. This is not a procedure without possible... consequences.

plots: Onmund traded Enthir his amulet, but now Onmund wants his amulet back

quest.title: Onmund's Request
quest.objective: help Onmund get his amulet from Enthir
tasks: talk to Enthir about Onmund's amulet
help Onmund get his amulet from Enthir
quest.description:
I need your help with something. Something private.
I may have entered into an... agreement with Enthir. He had something I needed, so I traded him something of mine.
It was a mistake, and now I want back what I gave him. It's an amulet that belonged to my family, and I never should've given it to Enthir. But he won't deal with me. Talk to him; see what it'll take to get my amulet back.

kbs.name: Vex
kbs.description: a fellow member of the Thieves Guild

kbs.name: Stone of Barenziah, Stones of Barenziah
kbs.description: gem stones that were pried off of Barenziah's ceremonial crown by a thief in order to cover his tracks

plots: the player showed a Stone of Barenziah to Vex for appraisal

quest.title: No Stone Unturned
quest.objective: talk to Vex after collecting the 24 Stones of Barenziah
tasks: Make your way to Skyrim.
find the 24 Stones of Barenziah
talk to Vex after collecting the 24 Stones of Barenziah
quest.description:
Been a while since I've seen one of those. What you've got there is a Stone of Barenziah. The stone was pried off of Barenziah's ceremonial crown by a thief in order to cover his tracks.
I think there were twenty-four in all; supposedly, all of them are in Skyrim. Most people keep them as a curiosity. Some of the Guild members have tried to locate them over the years, but they haven't been successful... well, until now.
I only buy things I can turn around quickly for a profit. And no one wants those stones unless they have the whole set. Tell you what, if you find the rest of them, talk to me again. Otherwise, keep it and maybe it'll bring you luck.

kbs.name: Captain Aldis
kbs.description: a male officer of the Imperial army

plots: Fura was assigned to Whiterun after she joined the Imperial army

quest.title: No News Is Good News
quest.objective: find out information about Fura from Captain Aldis
tasks: talk to Captain Aldis
find out information about Fura from Captain Aldis
quest.description:
You're a traveler, correct? Have you been to Whiterun?
My daughter, Fura, was assigned to Whiterun after she joined the Imperial Army. I was hoping you might have met her. I haven't heard from her lately. I've tried talking to Captain Aldis but he hasn't been any help.
It would be very sweet of you to get more information about my daughter. Anything you can find out from Captain Aldis would be welcome news.

kbs.name: Calcelmo
kbs.description: a stressful man, and the most recognized scholar on the Dwemer in all of Tamriel

plots: the player asked Calcelmo to let the player inside his Dwemer museum: the Dwemer museum is a private place where Calcelmo can catalog his research

quest.title: Nimhe, the Poisoned One
quest.objective: kill Nimhe
tasks: Travel to Nchuand-Zel.
locate Nimhe
kill Nimhe
quest.description:
You idiot. Do you even know who I am? The most recognized scholar on the Dwemer in all of Tamriel, and you people keep bothering me!
I... I'm sorry I... I got too excited. I'm in the middle of some very... stressful work, and I shouldn't have yelled. How can I help you?
You want to access my Dwemer museum? It's a private place where I can catalog my research. Occasionally, the nobles will come in and have questions, but that's thankfully rare.
I'll let you in if you agree to something for me. There's a giant spider in Nchuand-Zel, my excavation site. My workers call her 'Nimhe', the Poisoned One. If you deal with Nimhe, I'll let you into both the excavation site and my Dwemer Museum. What do you say?

kbs.name: Peryite
kbs.description: the god of infection and pestilence

plots: the player asked Kesh the Clean about speaking with Peryite
deathbell grow in the frozen tundra
the player might find the ruby and silver in a mine
vampire dust comes from vampires

quest.title: An Ill Meeting
quest.objective: make incense with Kesh the Clean
tasks: gather a deathbell flower, one silver ingot, a flawless ruby, and some vampire dust for making the incense
make incense with Kesh the Clean
quest.description:
Not everyone has the stomach required to entreat my Lord. He is the pus in the wound. Oh, proper ones curl their noses, but it's pus that drinks foul humors and restores the blood. But Kesh likes you, friend.
There is a way Peryite may speak to us who will take Him in. If you wish to commune with Him, we'll need the incense. Fetch for me a deathbell flower, one silver ingot, a flawless ruby, and some vampire dust. Then I will show you how.
How to gather the ingredients? This one would try a shop. You might prefer the direct route, hm? Deathbell grow in the frozen tundra. You might nip into a mine for the ruby and silver. Vampire Dust is tricky. Vampires, you know.

kbs.name: Peryite
kbs.description: the god of infection and pestilence

plots: Orchendor was sent to gather Afflicted to Bthardamz: Orchendor betrayed Peryite afterwards

quest.title: The Only Cure
quest.objective: kill Orchendor, and return to Peryite
tasks: Reach Bthardamz.
find Orchendor
kill Orchendor, and return to Peryite
quest.description:
I have watched you for some time, you know. The decisions you've made intrigue me, and I wonder if you are the proper agent for a task of mine.
I sent a blessing to the world, a wasting plague that infected a scattering of Breton villages. One of my monks, the elf Orchendor, was sent to gather these Afflicted. He shepherded them into Bthardamz for me, but has since lost his way.
I will not stand for betrayal. I want you to go to Bthardamz and kill Orchendor, in my name. I can grant you a powerful token for this task. An escutcheon of dwarven make, capable of shielding you from both the spell and sword. Return when the elf lies dead and it will be yours.

kbs.name: Dibella
kbs.description: the goddess of love and compassion

plots: Senna wakes the player up: the player does not remember anything about coming to the Temple of Dibella, blathering about marriage or a goat, and throwing trash all over the Temple of Dibella

quest.title: A Night to Remember
quest.objective: find Sam as you recover from a bad hangover
tasks: clean up the mess that you made, and apologize to Senna
find Sam as you recover from a bad hangover
quest.description:
Wake up! That's right, it's time to wake up, you drunken blasphemer!
Of course! You don't remember getting here. I'm guessing you also don't remember coming in here and blathering incoherently about marriage or a goat. Which means you don't remember losing your temper and throwing trash all over the temple.
You want to know where your friend Sam has gone? Dibella teaches love and compassion, but that doesn't mean we're just going to tell you what you want to know and let you walk away from this. Pick up your mess, then apologize, and if we think you're sincere we'll consider lending you aid.

kbs.name: Madanach
kbs.description: a Forsworn man, and a prisoner who tried to have the player killed in the past

kbs.name: Braig
kbs.description: a man who has been in Cidhna Mine the longest beside Madanach

plots: the player has been imprisoned in Cidhna Mine without any reason

quest.title: No One Escapes Cidhna Mine
quest.objective: discover how widespread the injustice of Markarth is
tasks: talk to Braig: tell him that Madanach sent you, and ask him why he is in Cidhna Mine
discover how widespread the injustice of Markarth is
quest.description:
Well, well. Look at you. The authorities of Markarth have turned you into an animal. A wild beast caged up and left to go mad.
So, my fellow beast, what do you want? Answers about the Forsworn? Revenge for trying to have you killed? You're one of us now, you see? A slave. The boot of the false, unjust law stepping on your throat. Maybe if you understood that, I could help you.
There's a man named Braig inside these mines. Besides me, he's been here the longest. Tell him I sent you. Ask him why he's here. I want you to know how widespread the injustice of Markarth is. Then, we might discuss about an early pardon.

kbs.name: Drovas Relvi
kbs.description: a man the player recruited for Neloth, and thus became untouchable

plots: Drovas Relvi owes Mogrul 1,000 septims: Mogrul thinks that the player should pay Drovas Relvi's debt

quest.title: A New Debt
quest.objective: help Drovas Relvi with his debt to Mogrul
tasks: pay Drovas Relvi's debt
help Drovas Relvi with his debt to Mogrul
quest.description:
It seems you've inherited a problem. Drovas Relvi owes me 1,000 septims. At least he did until you set him up with that powerful wizard. Now he's untouchable. The way I figure it, it's your fault he can't pay me. So I guess I'm going to have to collect it from you.
And if you don't pay me? Nothing for now. But watch your back. I'll be sending collectors to find you. They won't ask so nicely. One way or the other, I'll get my money.
When you are tired of looking over your shoulder, you'll pay me.

kbs.name: Astrid
kbs.description: the player's guildleader in the Dark Brotherhood

kbs.name: Black Sacrament
kbs.description: a ritual to employ the services of the Dark Brotherhood

plots: Muiri has performed the Black Sacrament
do whatever Muiri wishes, be professional, represent the Dark Brotherhood well, and get the job done

quest.title: Mourning Never Comes
quest.objective: assassinate an ex-lover for Muiri
tasks: Reach The Hag's Cure.
speak with Muiri, set up the contract with her, and fulfill it
assassinate an ex-lover for Muiri
quest.description:
Ah, there you are. We've got some business to discuss.
You must go to the city of Markarth, and speak with the apothecary's assistant. You'll probably find her in the shop, The Hag's Cure. The girl's been running her mouth, wants an ex-lover killed. She's apparently performed the Black Sacrament. Her name is Muiri. I need you to talk to her, set up the contract, and carry it out.
Just do whatever the contact wishes. Be professional, represent us well, and get the job done. Since it's your first contract, I'll let you keep whatever Muiri pays. She'll be generous, I'm sure. They always are.

kbs.name: Ari
kbs.description: Valdr's dead hunter friend, a woman

kbs.name: Niels
kbs.description: Valdr's dead hunter friend, a man

plots: Valdr, Ari and Niels tracked a bear to Moss Mother Cavern: Spriggans appeared and killed Ari and Niels

quest.title: Moss Mother Cavern
quest.objective: help Valdr avenge his fallen friends
tasks: Head to Moss Mother Cavern.
kill 3 Spriggans with Valdr
help Valdr avenge his fallen friends
quest.description:
Name's Valdr. I hunt out of Falkreath.
We tracked a bear to this den, Moss Mother Cavern. Good coin for those pelts. We had the big sow cornered when they showed up. Three of them, out of nowhere. Spriggans.
Niels went down before we even knew to run. Ari died just inside. I never even thought the things were real. But now what? I can't just walk away. Not with my friends' bodies in there, being torn apart by those beasts.
You would help me clear out the Spriggans? You'd do that for a stranger? I don't know what to say. Lead on, I suppose.

kbs.name: Deor Woodcutter
kbs.description: a Skaal man in a bad mood

kbs.name: Baldor Iron-Shaper
kbs.description: a Skaal man, the only blacksmith in the Skaal village

plots: Baldor Iron-Shaper is the keeper of an ancient tradition, the forging of Stalhrim
Deor Woodcutter saw two elves in the far distance, dragging something behind them in the woods on the day Baldor Iron-Shaper disappeared: the elves went south and west

quest.title: A New Source of Stalhrim
quest.objective: find Baldor Iron-Shaper
tasks: search for any sign of Baldor
find Baldor Iron-Shaper
quest.description:
I am in no mood to talk, outsider. One of the Skaal has gone missing. It is Baldor Iron-Shaper. As our only smith, Baldor is very important to the village.
Baldor is the keeper of an ancient tradition, the forging of Stalhrim. It is an art we Skaal hold sacred. If someone wanted to make such weapons, they would have to get that knowledge from Baldor.
I did see something in the woods on the day he disappeared. I saw two elves in the far distance, dragging something behind them. Hunters often visit our lands, so I thought little of it.
The elves went south and west. If your road takes you that way, perhaps you could search for any sign of Baldor. The Skaal would be grateful.

kbs.name: Mistwatch
kbs.description: a tower hosting a bandit hideout

plots: the player stumbled upon Christer while exploring Mistwatch
Christer heard that bandits in Mistwatch ransom captives and thinks that Fjola might be one of them: he managed to sneak in and look for Fjola, but he is not a warrior
Christer gives the player a key that will come in handy

quest.title: Mistwatch
quest.objective: help Christer locate Fjola
tasks: look for Fjola
help Christer locate Fjola
quest.description:
Please, stranger! I need your help! Divine mercy - you aren't one of the bandits. Please, you've got to help me!
It's my wife, Fjola! I think she's being held in this tower. Let me explain. Fjola, my wife, left the farm on errands and never came back. It's been months, and I've been searching for her since. I heard a rumor that these bandits were ransoming captives, so I thought she may be here. I managed to sneak past the guards and get this far, but... I don't think I can go on. I'm no warrior! Please, can you look for her?
I don't have much, but I can give you some coin for the trouble. One of the guards dropped this key while I hid. I wager it will come in handy for you. Please hurry!

plots: the spiders of Redbelly Mine almost killed Grogmar and Filnjar

quest.title: Mine or Yours
quest.objective: help Filnjar by clearing out spiders from the Redbelly Mine
tasks: Arrive at Redbelly Mine.
kill the spiders
help Filnjar by clearing out spiders from the Redbelly Mine
quest.description:
Sorry, the Redbelly Mine's dry right now. What's wrong with the mine, you might ask. It's full of spiders, that's what's wrong with it!
Almost killed Grogmar and me when they showed up. I'm worried that they'll come out of the mine looking for food soon... then we're in even bigger trouble.
You'd  clear them out for us? Tell you what. Keep to your word, and I'll line your pockets with as much as I can scrape up.

plots: Fralia Gray-Mane was told that Thorald was killed in the war against the Empire, but she knows that Thorald is alive: the Battle-Borns know that too

quest.title: Missing In Action
quest.objective: find Thorald
tasks: Arrive at Fralia Gray-Mane's home.
talk to Fralia Gray-Mane privately about the Battle-Borns and their lies
find Thorald
quest.description:
All I can think about is my son, my Thorald... they say that he was killed, but I know better. I know my son is alive! Those Battle-Borns... they're in with the Imperials. They know it too, and yet they lie to my very face!
It's not wise to discuss how I know about their lies here. Please, if you truly wish to help, meet me at my home. I'll tell you the whole story.

kbs.name: Ulfric
kbs.description: the player's leader in the Stormcloaks, a man

kbs.name: Balgruuf the Greater
kbs.description: the Jarl of Whiterun, a man who has stayed neutral in the war between the Stormcloaks and the Empire

plots: if Balgruuf the Greater keeps the axe, Ulfric will bide his time
if Balgruuf the Greater returns the axe to the player, it means war

quest.title: Message to Whiterun
quest.objective: make a delivery for Ulfric
tasks: Reach Whiterun.
deliver an axe to Balgruuf the Greater
make a delivery for Ulfric
quest.description:
I'm glad you're here. I have a message I need delivered to the Jarl of Whiterun. Deliver this axe to Balgruuf the Greater.
Men who understand each other often have no need for words. There are but a few simple truths behind one warrior giving another his axe. Balgruuf will know my meaning.
Give the man my axe. If he keeps it, I will bide my time. If he returns it to you, it means war.

kbs.name: Dervenin
kbs.description: a man who has been abandoned by his master

kbs.name: Pelagius Wing
kbs.description: a forbidden wing of the Blue Palace

kbs.name: Blue Palace
kbs.description: the large palace of the local ruler

plots: Dervenin's master says that Dervenin is interrupting his vacation
without Dervenin's master's guidance, Dervenin's homeland is falling apart
Dervenin's master went into the Pelagius Wing to talk with an old friend
Dervenin gives the player a hip bone: the player can't enter Pelagius Wing without it

quest.title: The Mind of Madness
quest.objective: gain access to the Pelagius Wing, and find Dervenin's master
tasks: Arrive at Blue Palace.
talk to Una or Erdi about entering the Pelagius Wing
gain access to the Pelagius Wing, and find Dervenin's master
quest.description:
My master has abandoned me! Abandoned his people. And nothing I say can change his mind. Now he refuses to even see me. He says I interrupt his vacation! It's been so many years... Won't you please help?
Without his guidance, our homeland is falling apart. North wages war against the south! We need his return. Oh, but... I'm sure he'll repay you when he comes to his senses! His favor is a powerful, powerful thing. And so very worth any... inconveniences.
Last I saw him, he was visiting a friend in the Blue Palace. But no one as mundane as the local ruler. No, no... such people are below him. No, he went into the forbidden wing of the palace, to speak with an old friend. Said it had been ages since they had last had tea. Oh and you'll need the hip bone... it's very important. No entering Pelagius Wing without that.
The doors to the Pelagius Wing are locked. But I hear the maids, Una and Erdi, know how to enter it for cleaning. Surely they can help for such an important matter?

kbs.name: General Tullius
kbs.description: the player's leader in the Imperial Legion

kbs.name: Jarl Baalgruf
kbs.description: the nobleman who rules over Whiterun

kbs.name: Ulfric
kbs.description: the male leader of the Stormcloaks

plots: Ulfric has raised enough men to attack Whiterun, but Jarl Baalgruf refuses the Imperial Legion's support: the message should convince Jarl Baalgruf

quest.title: A Decisive Message
quest.objective: deliver a sensitive intelligence message for General Tullius
tasks: Make your way to Whiterun.
deliver the message to Jarl Baalgruf
deliver a sensitive intelligence message for General Tullius
quest.description:
I need someone I can trust to deliver a message of great import to Jarl Baalgruf of Whiterun.
We have it on good authority that Ulfric has raised enough men to attack the city of Whiterun. The Jarl, however, refuses the Legion's support. This missive should convince him.
Be aware soldier, these documents contain sensitive intelligence for the Jarl's eyes only.

kbs.name: Brynjolf
kbs.description: the player's superior in the Thieves Guild

kbs.name: The Ragged Flagon
kbs.description: a bar that is actually a front to the Thieves Guild

kbs.name: Delvin Mallory, Vex
kbs.description: fellow members of the Thieves Guild who can give the player extra jobs

kbs.name: Tonilia
kbs.description: a female member of the Thieves Guild

plots: the player just joined the Thieves Guild: the player should do as they're told and keep their blade clean to get their share of the loot

quest.title: Meet the Family
quest.objective: speak with some fellow members of the Thieves Guild and pick up your new armor
tasks: talk with Delvin Mallory and Vex and Tonilia for your armor
speak with some fellow members of the Thieves Guild and pick up your new armor
quest.description:
Welcome to the family, kid. I'm expecting you to make us a lot of coin, so don't disappoint me.
This is how you get your cut of the spoils. Do as you're told and keep your blade clean. We can't turn a profit by killing.
You should talk with Delvin Mallory and Vex. They know their way around this place and they'll be able to kick some extra jobs your way.
Oh, and talk to Tonilia in the Flagon... she'll set you up with your new armor.

kbs.name: Wolfskull Cave
kbs.description: a cave that is said to be haunted because of Potema the Wolf Queen's necromantic rituals some 500 years ago

plots: Falk Firebeard thinks that checking out the Wolfskull Cave is not worth his time with the war going on

quest.title: The Man Who Cried Wolf
quest.objective: investigate the reports of strange happenings near Wolfskull Cave
tasks: Go to Wolfskull Cave.
clear out the Wolfskull Cave
investigate the reports of strange happenings near Wolfskull Cave
quest.description:
There have been reports of weird happenings near Wolfskull Cave. Travelers disappearing, odd lights. I suspect wild animals or perhaps bandits.
The cave has a bad history. Long ago, Potema the Wolf Queen used it for necromantic rituals. That's where it got the name. That was over 500 years ago. Nothing much down there now - but everyone's always convinced the cave is haunted.
I don't think it's worth our time with the war going on, but if you want to clear out the cave, I'll make sure you're repaid for your work.

kbs.name: Captain Veleth
kbs.description: the commander of the Redoran Guard

kbs.name: Raven Rock
kbs.description: a town ruled by the Redoran

plots: the player saved Captain Veleth's life: his guardsman was killed by an ash spawn though
the ash spawn have been coming from this direction to Raven Rock

quest.title: March of the Dead
quest.objective: stop the ash spawn attacks on Raven Rock
tasks: search for clues about where the ash spawn come from
stop the ash spawn attacks on Raven Rock
quest.description:
Thanks... I wasn't sure I'd make it off this farm alive. I wish I could have said the same for my man here.
Some of the Redoran Guard have taken to calling them "ash spawn". Me? I don't care what they're called... all I know is they're a danger to Raven Rock and they need to be stopped.
I was going to search for clues that might lead me to wherever they're coming from. I know it isn't the best place to start, but we know they've been coming from this direction.
Could you lend me a hand? We were searching the farm when the ash spawn ambushed us. Have a look around and see if you can turn up anything useful.

kbs.name: Sibbi Black-Briar
kbs.description: a pompous, womanizing nobleman, one of the Black-Briars

kbs.name: Svidi
kbs.description: a buxom young woman with long flowing black hair and beautiful singing voice, Sibbi Black-Briar's former fiancée

plots: Svidi found out that Sibbi Black-Briar had an affair and told Wulfur about it
Wulfur attacked Sibbi Black-Briar: Sibbi Black-Briar killed Wulfur and was arrested for Wulfur's murder
Sibbi Black-Briar has to stay in jail for 8 months

quest.title: The Lover's Requital
quest.objective: help Sibbi Black-Briar in his plans to kill Svidi
tasks: find Svidi
help Sibbi Black-Briar in his plans to kill Svidi
quest.description:
Look, we all have our flaws; mine is that women can't get enough of me. So I had this little affair going on while I was betrothed to a beautiful girl named Svidi. Well, she finds out and she tells her brother, Wulfur. Then her brother attacks me with a knife... I mean, I had to defend myself!
So I got arrested for his murder. And now I have to stare at these bars for eight months. Can you believe it? I was about to let that wench Svidi marry into the richest family in Riften, and this is how she repays me. I'd do anything to have that whore's head on a platter. All I need to know is where she is.
Find her and I promise you'll be well compensated. Svidi was a young woman... buxom, with long flowing black hair. She used to sing the most lovely songs to me when we were courting. I've never heard a voice so beautiful.
All that talent will go to waste when I'm finished with her.

kbs.name: Brynjolf
kbs.description: the player's superior in the Thieves Guild

kbs.name: Aringoth
kbs.description: an arrogant wood elf man who owns the Goldenglow Estate

kbs.name: Maven
kbs.description: a powerful woman with criminal connections

kbs.name: Mercer
kbs.description: the man who leads the Thieves Guild

plots: the Thieves Guild had an arrangement with Maven: the Thieves Guild kept an eye on Goldenglow Estate to make sure the honey kept flowing, and Maven allowed the Thieves Guild to extort Aringoth and bring in a huge payout
Aringoth stopped sending the Thieves Guild extortion money: Mercer was angry
the player may kill Aringoth, but Maven would prefer him alive

quest.title: Loud and Clear
quest.objective: teach Aringoth a lesson
tasks: Make your way to Goldenglow Estate.
burn down three bee hives without burning the whole Goldenglow Estate down, and clear out the safe in the main house of the Goldenglow Estate
teach Aringoth a lesson
quest.description:
Goldenglow Estate is a bee farm; they raise the wretched little things for honey. It's owned by some smart-mouth wood elf named Aringoth.
We had an arrangement with Maven. We kept an eye on Goldenglow Estate to make sure the honey kept flowing. In return, Maven allowed us to extort Aringoth and bring in a huge payout.
Goldenglow Estate brought in a mountain of gold for the Guild. You could almost call it our sweetest deal. Then out of the clear blue, Aringoth stops sending us our cut. Mercer was... well, angry to put it kindly.
We need you to teach Aringoth a lesson by burning down three of the estate's hives and clearing out the safe in the main house. The catch is that you can't burn the whole place to the ground. Maven would be furious if you did. She also prefers that Aringoth remains alive, but if he tries to stop you from getting the job done, kill him.
The Guild has a lot riding on this. Don't make me look foolish by mucking it up.

plots: the aspiring wizard wants to join the College of Winterhold

quest.title: Magic Student
quest.objective: help an aspiring wizard learn warding spells
tasks: raise your own warding spell and allow the aspiring wizard to cast a spell at it
help an aspiring wizard learn warding spells
quest.description:
I've finally found you! I want to join the College of Winterhold. But I need help with my wards. Can you teach me?
So, first, you raise your ward and I'll throw a little spell at it. That way I can see the 'right' way to do things.

kbs.name: Solstheim
kbs.description: an island that is covered with ancient ruins

plots: the passage to Vahlok's Tomb must have been opened by an earthquake that accompanied one of the Red Mountain's eruptions

quest.title: Lost Legacy
quest.objective: protect Tharstan while he researches an old tomb
tasks: Go to outside Vahlok's Tomb.
meet Tharstan
protect Tharstan while he researches an old tomb
quest.description:
Yes, I think you're just the adventurous sort I need. I have a job offer for you.
As a scholar of history, I've always found Solstheim to be most intriguing. I've made many forays into the ancient ruins that cover the island. I've come to know those ruins so well, I could draw you a map from memory. That's why I noticed the new passage the moment I laid eyes on it.
it leads to an old tomb, I think. It must have been opened by an earthquake that accompanied one of the Red Mountain's eruptions. I'd love to have a closer look, but those old ruins can be dangerous and I'm no adventurer. I'll pay you to watch my back down there.
I'll be heading back there soon. If you're interested, meet me at the ruins and we'll see what we can find. Now I'm off to pack for the expedition!

kbs.name: Xarxes
kbs.description: the god of secrets and hidden knowledge

kbs.name: Hermaeus Mora
kbs.description: the devious demon of forbidden knowledge

kbs.name: Black Books
kbs.description: books created by Hermaeus Mora, each containing forbidden knowledge

plots: the player asked Neloth if he has found more Black Books
the Black Book might contain the final secrets of Xarxes

quest.title: Lost Knowledge
quest.objective: retrieve a Black Book so that Neloth can make a copy of it
tasks: Reach Benkongerike.
find the Black Book
retrieve a Black Book so that Neloth can make a copy of it
quest.description:
Yes. Hermaeus Mora is devious, but then so am I. Now, it's only a rumor of a whisper of a conjecture. But I think this is the place. Benkongerike. One of the Books is hidden there.
Now, hurry and find that Black Book. That Book might contain the final secrets of Xarxes, for all we know. I'll just make a copy for myself. It's far too dangerous to carry the real Black Book around.
Of course, I'm sure you can handle yourself. Of course you can. You can keep the original Black Book.

kbs.name: Deeja
kbs.description: Jaree-Ra's sister, a female treasure hunter

plots: Jaree-Ra and Deeja collect things nobody misses
with the war, many more ships come through Solitude Docks loaded with weapons and pay, but few people

quest.title: Lights Out!
quest.objective: help run the Icerunner aground
tasks: Travel to Solitude Lighthouse.
put out the lighthouse fire
meet Jaree-Ra
help run the Icerunner aground
quest.description:
It's easy to find things to sell. Things nobody will miss. Things from underground, or just left lying around in someone's house. I bet the two of us, we're very alike. So why not take the next step? We can help each other.
My sister Deeja and I are treasure hunters. You could be too. We like to collect things. We are not thieves. We just take what will not be missed. What no one needs anymore. Maybe we take some weapons and stop a few deaths. Who would call that thievery?
With the war, many more ships come through these docks. Loaded with weapons and pay, but few people. And they pass through dangerous waters. We have an interest in one of those boats, the Icerunner. The Solitude Lighthouse will be guiding it in... but if its fire were to go out, the Icerunner would run aground.
If someone were to put out the lighthouse fire and then meet me on the docks afterwards... I could certainly direct them to that loot. That someone could be you.

kbs.name: Shroud Hearth Barrow
kbs.description: a haunted barrow on the east side of Ivarstead

plots: Wyndelius went into Shroud Hearth Barrow two years ago: Wilhelm warned him not to go in there
Wyndelius was never seen again

quest.title: Lifting the Shroud
quest.objective: investigate Shroud Hearth Barrow
tasks: Proceed to Shroud Hearth Barrow.
go to the barrow
investigate Shroud Hearth Barrow
quest.description:
If I were you, I'd keep away from the barrow on the east side of town...
There ain't much more to tell... it's haunted and you should stay away. Look, I've seen one of the spirits with my very own eyes. When it glared at me, I swear it burned right through my soul.
Fortunately, the spirits seem to be sticking to the barrow. I think they're guarding it. Certainly isn't helping my business any; who'd want to rent a room anywhere near a haunted barrow?
If you think there's anything you can do, be my guest. About a year or two ago, some fella named Wyndelius came through; said he was some kind of a treasure hunter. I warned him not to go in there, just like I warned you. The very next night we heard screams from the barrow, and that was it. We never saw him again.

kbs.name: Hag's End
kbs.description: a ruin far to the northeast of Deepwood Redoubt

plots: the player came to Olava the Feeble for a reading

quest.title: Locate the Assassin of Old
quest.objective: go on an adventure
tasks: Travel to Hag's End.
find the final resting place of the assassin of old
go on an adventure
quest.description:
Come to Olava for a reading, did you? Hmph. Yes. Yes, I surely can give you a reading.
It's not something I do lightly, mind you, and it's not as specific as you might want. But yes. I will do this for you. Please, relax. Free your mind. Yes, that's it...
A potential for adventure, and wealth. It is a ruin, ripe for the plunder. Deepwood Redoubt. Far to the northwest... Through there is... Hag's End. The last resting place of an assassin of old. A dark brother, who bequeaths his ancient earthly possessions... to you.
No... no, that is all. Now... now please. I find myself very weary all of sudden.

kbs.name: Kyne
kbs.description: the ancient goddess of humankind and beasts, who teaches us to respect the beasts

kbs.name: Kyne's Sacred Trials
kbs.description: an ancient tradition, and a test to prove yourself to Kyne

plots: Froki thinks that the Divines are impostor gods
Froki gives the player the symbol of the wolf, the crab and the skeever: this will compel the guardian to appear when the player reaches the guardian's lair

quest.title: Kyne's Sacred Trials
quest.objective: participate in Kyne's Sacred Trials by hunting the guardian beasts blessed by Kyne
tasks: defeat the guardian wolf, crab and skeever and return to Froki
participate in Kyne's Sacred Trials by hunting the guardian beasts blessed by Kyne
quest.description:
The Divines are stolen idols! Impostor gods, sold by silver tongues. No thank you. Froki will not forget Kyne, or her Sacred Trials.
Kyne's Sacred Trials is an old tradition, a test to prove your worth in the eyes of Kyne. Show that you're a hunter and no simple butcher. Kyne teaches us to respect the beasts and blesses the hunter who will face their champions. True hunters are those who survive the Trials.
Do you think you're strong enough for Kyne's blessing? I would be glad to pass this tradition down. You must defeat guardian beasts, blessed by Kyne. I'll anoint you with the symbol of the wolf, the crab and the skeever. This will compel the guardian to appear when you reach his lair.
Return when you've defeated the guardian wolf, crab and skeever.

kbs.name: Skald the Elder
kbs.description: the nobleman who rules over the Pale

kbs.name: Dawnstar
kbs.description: the capital city of the Pale

plots: the Empire demanded Skald the Elder to leave giants be, but the Imperial authority does not apply here anymore

quest.title: Kill the Giant
quest.objective: slay a giant
tasks: Go to Pale.
find a giant
slay a giant
quest.description:
Giants are a common problem in the Pale. The Empire always demanded I leave them be, but the Empire isn't here now.
Go and slay one of the beasts. It should let them know that Dawnstar is not to be trifled with. I'm counting on you.

kbs.name: Idgrod Ravencrone
kbs.description: the noblewoman who rules over Morthal

kbs.name: Hroggar
kbs.description: a man who lusts after Alva

plots: Hroggar's wife and daughter died in the fire: Hroggar blames his wife for starting the fire because she spilled bear fat in the fireplace
rumors say that Hroggar started the fire himself so that he could get together with Alva

quest.title: Laid to Rest
quest.objective: investigate Hroggar's house fire
tasks: Make your way to Hroggar's house in Morthal.
find clues among the ashes
investigate Hroggar's house fire
quest.description:
I want you to look into Hroggar's house fire. He lost his wife and daughter in the blaze. My people believe the house to be cursed now. Who am I to gainsay them?
How the fire started? Hroggar blames his wife for spilling bear fat in the fire. Many folk think he set the fire himself. Lust can make a man do the unthinkable. The ashes were still warm when he pledged himself to to a woman named Alva.
I can't arrest Hroggar on rumor and gossip. But you, a stranger, might find the truth for us. Sift through the ashes at Hroggar's house that others are too fearful to touch. See what they tell you.
Should you prove him guilty or innocent, I will reward you.

kbs.name: Siddgeir
kbs.description: a corrupt nobleman who rules over Falkreath

plots: the player has proven themselves to Siddgeir

quest.title: Kill the Bandits
quest.objective: slay bandits for Siddgeir
tasks: Travel to Embershard Mine.
find all bandits, and kill them
slay bandits for Siddgeir
quest.description:
You've proven reliable. There's a group of bandits in my hold that I... may have had a few discreet dealings with.
The cut they were giving me was good at first, but now it's time to clean things up. Go to Embershard Mine and take care of them. Teach them to stop paying me. Execute every last bandit. Spare no one.

kbs.name: Red Wave
kbs.description: Safia's ship, in the Solitude docks

kbs.name: Safia
kbs.description: a ruthless female pirate captain who is deadly with a blade

plots: this is Nazir's final, most challenging assassination contract
Safia's crew is loyal and bloodthirsty

quest.title: Painting the Seas Red
quest.objective: assassinate Safia
tasks: Proceed to Red Wave.
find Safia
assassinate Safia
quest.description:
I have an assassination contract for you: Safia, a pirate captain. She can be found aboard her ship, the Red Wave. It's currently docked at the Solitude docks.
Safia is a ruthless she-devil, by all accounts. Deadly with a blade. And let's not forget her crew - loyal and bloodthirsty, the lot of them.
This is my final contract, and certainly the most challenging. Be careful with this one, my friend. If you are capable of pulling through this, you've not only earned your payment, but my respect as well. And believe me, friend - that does not come easily.

kbs.name: Maluril
kbs.description: a dangerous, rogue male Dark Elf mage who studies dwarwen artifacts

plots: the player has done assassination contracts for Nazir before

quest.title: Deadly Research
quest.objective: assassinate Maluril
tasks: Make your way to Mzinchaleft.
find Maluril
assassinate Maluril
quest.description:
I have another assassination contract for you: Maluril. He's dangerous. Very dangerous. A rogue Dark Elf mage doing research into dwarven artifacts should be both respected... and feared. Just not by you.
Maluril is doing his research in Mzinchaleft. A Dwarven ruin... what an exotic place for a kill. I hope the elf doesn't give you too much trouble. I once got set on fire by a sorcerer. Nasty business, that. But I digress.

kbs.name: Half-Moon Mill
kbs.description: a mill ran by Hern and Hert

kbs.name: Hern
kbs.description: a male vampire who has blended into the human society

plots: Hert is always near Hern

quest.title: Undead to Plain Dead
quest.objective: assassinate Hern
tasks: Find your way to Half-Moon Mill.
find Hern
assassinate Hern
quest.description:
You are going to assassinate Hern. He's a vampire, and has blended into human society for years. He's never far from his female companion, Hert. Also a vampire.
The contract is for the male, Hern. But you'll probably have to contend with the female, too. They both live in Half-Moon Mill. So for Sithis' sake, watch yourself.
Face a vampire, and live to tell the tale!

kbs.name: Hela's Folly
kbs.description: a small waterlogged shipwreck northeast of Dawnstar

kbs.name: Deekus
kbs.description: a male Argonian layabout, and a shipwreck scavenger

plots: Argonians are unpredictable opponents, especially near water

quest.title: Swim for Your Life
quest.objective: assassinate Deekus
tasks: Head to Hela's Folly.
locate Deekus
assassinate Deekus
quest.description:
There's an assassination contract for you. You are to kill Deekus.
He is an Argonian layabout, likes to scavenge shipwrecks. My guess is he'll run if threatened. Or swim, if given the chance.
Personally, I've always found Argonians to be incredibly unpredictable opponents. Especially near water. Unfortunately, Deekus is at Hela's Folly, a small waterlogged shipwreck northeast of Dawnstar. Making him stay out of water will be difficult.

kbs.name: Beitild
kbs.description: an angry and desperate female mine owner

plots: Beitild and her ex-husband run competing mining operations in Dawnstar

quest.title: Lethal Competition
quest.objective: assassinate Beitild
tasks: Proceed to Dawnstar.
find Beitild
assassinate Beitild
quest.description:
Someone has contracted us to kill Beitild. She separated from her husband several months ago. Now the two run competing mining operations in Dawnstar. I hear the mining business is extremely cutthroat. And those hours... they're murder.
Beitild's angry and desperate. A fighter.

kbs.name: Legate Rikke
kbs.description: a female leader in the Imperial Legion

kbs.name: Fort Hraggstad
kbs.description: a bandit fortress to be turned into an Imperial garrison

plots: the ancients built many of the fortresses that dot the landscape of Skyrim: most have fallen into disrepair and overrun with bandits

quest.title: Serving the Empire
quest.objective: prove yourself worthy of joining the Imperial Legion
tasks: Proceed to Fort Hraggstad.
wipe out bandits
prove yourself worthy of joining the Imperial Legion
quest.description:
I've got a good feeling about you. And I don't often get good feelings about anything. A warrior knows to trust her gut... I'm not going to go through the normal process with you. I've got a little test lined up. Pass that, and we'll talk about you joining the Legion.
The ancients built many of the fortresses that dot the landscape of Skyrim. Sadly, most have fallen into disrepair. And nearly all have been overrun with bandits or other vagabonds. Fort Hraggstad is one of the few that remains mostly intact. We're going to install a garrison there, but first, you're going to clean out the bandits that have moved in.
Then, it's time for you to officially join the Legion.

kbs.name: Galmar Stone-Fist
kbs.description: the player's commanding officer in the Stormcloaks

kbs.name: Ulfric
kbs.description: the man who leads the Stormcloaks, and who has declared himself the High King

kbs.name: Jagged Crown
kbs.description: a crown made from the bones and teeth of ancient dragons that symbolizes the power and might of a High King

plots: the High King always wore the Jagged Crown: the Jagged Crown is said to contain a portion of the power of every king who has worn it

quest.title: The Jagged Crown
quest.objective: find the Jagged Crown for Ulfric
tasks: Make your way to outside Korvanjund.
meet Galmar Stone-Fist and your fellow Stormcloaks
find the Jagged Crown for Ulfric
quest.description:
I've found the final resting place of the Jagged Crown. Can you believe it? Well, I'm almost certain.
The High King always wore the Jagged Crown. It was the symbol of his might and power. The crown is made from the bones and teeth of ancient dragons, and it is said to contain a portion of the power of every king who has worn it. True or not, who would dare deny Ulfric's claim, when the legendary Jagged Crown sits upon his brow?
We're headed to Korvanjund. But, if old King Borgas is indeed buried there, we're bound to run into trouble of some kind. Your fellow Stormcloaks are already assembling outside the tomb. I'll meet you there as soon as I'm finished up here.

kbs.name: J'zargo
kbs.description: a fellow mage student who is working hard on new spells

plots: J'zargo gives the player plenty of flame cloak scrolls

quest.title: J'zargo's Experiment
quest.objective: help J'zargo test his new spells
tasks: use J'zargo's flame cloak scrolls against undead, and report back to J'zargo whether they work
help J'zargo test his new spells
quest.description:
Can you... can you possibly help J'zargo? You must be very skilled with magic, yes? J'zargo is working hard, but cannot do it alone.
J'zargo has worked hard on learning new spells, trying new things. This will make J'zargo stand out as a mage. But J'zargo works so hard, there is no time to test these new spells.
If you help with the testing, this will make learning easier. J'zargo will give you scrolls, you will use them and report the results. This is a good plan, no? Let's see... this one, I think. J'zargo has designed it to be an excellent flame cloak, with a twist. It is especially potent against the undead, and should burn them to a crisp in no time. J'zargo gives you plenty of these scrolls, so you try them and return when you can say whether they work.

kbs.name: Grelod the Kind
kbs.description: an evil, cruel woman, and the headmistress of Honorhall Orphanage

kbs.name: Black Sacrament
kbs.description: a dark ritual used to employ the services of the Dark Brotherhood

plots: Aventus Aretino did the Black Sacrament: he thinks that the player is an assassin from the Dark Brotherhood
Aventus Aretino was sent to Honorhall Orphanage after his mother died: he ran away back to Aretino Residence

quest.title: Innocence Lost
quest.objective: do an assassination contract for Aventus Aretino
tasks: Arrive at Honorhall Orphanage.
kill Grelod the Kind, the evil, cruel woman who works as the headmistress
do an assassination contract for Aventus Aretino
quest.description:
I did the Black Sacrament, over and over. And then you came! An assassin from the Dark Brotherhood!
It took so long. So very long. But now that you're here, you can accept my contract. My mother, she... she died. I... I'm all alone now. So they sent me to that terrible orphanage in Riften. Honorhall. The headmistress is an evil, cruel woman. They call her Grelod the Kind. But she's not kind. She's terrible. To all of us. So I ran away, and came home. And performed the Black Sacrament.
And you can kill Grelod the Kind! I have a family heirloom you can have. Supposed to be sort of valuable. I hope that's all right.

kbs.name: Stalleo
kbs.description: a man who is expecting reinforcements

kbs.name: Treva's Watch
kbs.description: Stalleo's home fortress, overrun by bandits

kbs.name: Brurid
kbs.description: a man who has been at odds with Stalleo since the king's death

plots: Stalleo and his men left to help with the war: meanwhile Brurid and his bandits seized Treva's Watch and kidnapped Stalleo's family

quest.title: Infiltration
quest.objective: help Stalleo to take back Treva's Watch from bandits
tasks: Go to Treva's Watch.
use the mine entrance behind Stalleo and his men, and open the front gate
help Stalleo to take back Treva's Watch from bandits
quest.description:
Are you here to help? Finally, reinforcements have arrived. I was expecting more though, you'd better be good.
We left to help with the war and these filth bags swooped in and seized the place. I suspect Brurid planned this, there's been bad blood between us since the king's death. But to invade my home, kidnap my family...
The front gate is locked so you'll need to use the mine entrance behind us. Open the front gate and we'll try and give you some support. My family is everything to me. Clear the fort and on top of the posted reward you can have whatever items you'd like.

kbs.name: Whiterun
relations: the Jarl's or Steward's chambers in Dragonsreach

kbs.name: the Jarl's or Steward's chambers in Dragonsreach
kbs.description: the Jarl's or Steward's chambers in Dragonsreach

kbs.name: Arn
kbs.description: an old male warrior, and a close friend of Olfrid Battle-Born

plots: the player is a member of the Thieves Guild: the player was sent to do a job for Olfrid Battle-Born
Arn fled from Solitude to Whiterun, but was arrested for drunken behavior
the letter and the prison registry are inside : visitors are not allowed to enter them
Olfrid Battle-Born can't help the player if the player gets caught

quest.title: Imitation Amnesty
quest.objective: help Olfrid Battle-Born save Arn from getting executed for a serious crime in Solitude
tasks: Arrive at the Jarl's or Steward's chambers in Dragonsreach.
Reach the Jarl's or Steward's chambers in Dragonsreach.
steal a letter that was sent from Solitude warning the Whiterun guard to be on the lookout for Arn
change Arn's name in the prison registry to his new identity
help Olfrid Battle-Born save Arn from getting executed for a serious crime in Solitude
quest.description:
You're here! And not a moment too soon. If anything should happen to Arn, there'll be hell to pay.
Arn's a close friend of mine. We fought together on the battlefield for many years until old age got the better of us. Now it's up to me to save him one more time... this time from the executioner's block in Solitude.
The city guard in Solitude is seeking Arn for a serious crime. When he fled here, he was arrested for drunken behavior. Can you imagine? Fortunately, his identity isn't known to the authorities in Whiterun, so there's still a chance to save him.
The job is two-fold. First, steal a letter that was sent from Solitude warning Whiterun's guard to be on the lookout for Arn. The second is to change Arn's name in the prison registry to his new identity.
The job is relatively difficult. If it was easy, I would have hired a local thug instead of a professional from the Thieves Guild. You see both of these items are kept inside Dragonsreach, and they don't allow visitors inside the Jarl's or the Steward's chambers.
One more thing. If you get caught, I can't afford to be connected to you. Remember that before you do anything stupid.

kbs.name: Drevis Neloren
kbs.description: the player's teacher in Illusion magic

kbs.name: books, which contain powerful Illusion spells
kbs.description: books, which contain powerful Illusion spells

plots: Drevis Neloren has taught the player all he knows about Illusion magic

quest.title: In Plain Sight
quest.objective: bring 4 books to Drevis Neloren
tasks: use the spell that Drevis Neloren teaches you to locate the 4 books
bring 4 books to Drevis Neloren
quest.description:
You have gone beyond my teachings, which is quite a feat. I did not think it possible. But there is always more to learn. I believe you are ready for the next step. Knowledge of truly powerful Illusion spells is here at the College, but it is hidden from those who might misuse it.
I shall teach you a spell to discern things hidden from others. With it, you will be able to acquire the texts you need. Bring all four to me, and I shall use them to inscribe the spells for you.

plots: the player asked Marise Aravel how she keeps the food she sells so fresh

quest.title: Ice Cold
quest.objective: bring five ice wraith teeth to Marise Aravel
tasks: Travel to Ancient's Ascent.
find five ice wraith teeth
bring five ice wraith teeth to Marise Aravel
quest.description:
I picked up a trick from a master butcher. He showed me a way to grind up ice wraith teeth and use it as a preservative. Keeps everything cold and fresh, but only for a limited time.
I'm always looking to replenish my supply, so if you ever come across five of them, I'd be more than happy to take them off your hands. The last traveler that traded me some said he found them at a place called Ancient's Ascent.
Careful though, rumor has it a dragon makes its home there.

kbs.name: Hircine, Lord of the Hunt
kbs.description: the god of hunting and monsters

kbs.name: Ring of Hircine
kbs.description: a ring that is supposed to control a werewolf's transformations, a relic of Hircine
