plots: Sinding killed a little girl, because he lost control of his transformations
Hircine cursed the Ring of Hircine when Sinding obtained it: it transforms him at the worst of times
Sinding will escape from the prison after giving the quest

quest.title: Ill Met by Moonlight
quest.objective: take the Ring of Hircine back to Hircine
tasks: Find your way to these woods.
hunt down the beast to draw out Hircine
take the Ring of Hircine back to Hircine
quest.description:
Come to gawk at the monster?
A little girl is dead because of me. Believe me, it wasn't anything I ever intended to do. I just... lost control. I tried to tell them, but none of them believe me.
It's all on account of this blasted ring. This is the Ring of Hircine. I was told it could let me control my transformations. Perhaps it used to. But I'll never know. Hircine didn't care for my taking it, and threw a curse on it. I put it on... and the changes just came to me. I could never guess when. It would be at the worst times. Like... with the little girl.
I don't suppose there's a point in keeping the secret if I'm going to die in here anyway. I'm sure you've heard of men who shift to beasts under the influence of the moons. I am one of them. A werewolf. It's my secret, and my shame. That's why I wanted the ring... it was said to give men like me control. Now I may look like a man, but I still feel the animal inside of me, as strong as ever.
You would take the ring back to Hircine? Oh my. You would do this for me? Here, take it. I don't want anything to do with this wretched thing anymore. Seek out the beast. He wanders these woods. Bring him down and... well, the Lord of the Hunt should smile on you and appear before you.
I wish you luck, but should leave here while I still have my skin. Should our paths cross again, I will remember your kindness. Farewell.

kbs.name: Tyranus
kbs.description: a member of the Vigil of Stendarr

kbs.name: Abandoned House
kbs.description: a house in Markarth that might have been used for Daedra worship

plots: no one has seen anyone enter or leave the Abandoned House

quest.title: The House of Horrors
quest.objective: investigate the Abandoned House with Tyranus
tasks: Arrive at Abandoned House.
follow Tyranus inside the Abandoned House
investigate the Abandoned House with Tyranus
quest.description:
Excuse me, but do you know anything about this house? Seen anyone enter or leave? Seems no one in this city has.
I'm with the Vigil of Stendarr. We believe this house might have been used for Daedra worship. Evil rites and so forth. I was actually just about to head on inside. Be good to have someone watch my back.
Follow me, and keep your eyes open. Daedra are powerful creatures and tricksters. Never know what you'll find.

kbs.name: Boethiah
kbs.description: the goddess of destruction, Molag Bal's rival

plots: the player tried to take the mace on Molag Bal's shrine: Molag Bal imprisoned the player with sharp spikes

quest.title: Dominion and Humiliation
quest.objective: help Molag Bal take revenge upon a priest of Boethiah who desecrated Molag Bal's shrine
tasks: save the priest of Boethiah from imprisonment
help Molag Bal take revenge upon a priest of Boethiah who desecrated Molag Bal's shrine
quest.description:
Fool! Did you think Molag Bal, the Lord of Domination, would so easily reward you? What do you see from that little cage? Speak.
You definitely see the spikes of your cage. Sharp, aren't they? This was the last thing many saw before they were sacrificed in my name. But even a god has his enemies, and my rival Boethiah had her priest desecrate it. So long since it's tasted blood. Until you came.
I want submission. I want the priest who did this to bend his knee and give me his soul. He comes by to perform Boethiah's insulting rites at my altar, but he's been missing. Captured and bound. Left to rot.
You'll get the freedom your kind enjoys so much. Save the priest. Let him perform his rite one more time. And when he does, we will be waiting for him.
Then you will be finally rewarded. The Mace of Molag Bal! I give you its true power, mortal. When your enemies lie broken and bloody before you, know that I will be watching.

plots: this is the player's last trial

quest.title: The Horn of Jurgen Windcaller
quest.objective: retrieve the horn of Jurgen Windcaller
tasks: Arrive at Ustengrav.
find the horn of Jurgen Windcaller in his tomb
retrieve the horn of Jurgen Windcaller
quest.description:
You are now ready for your last trial. Retrieve the Horn of Jurgen Windcaller, our founder, from his tomb in the ancient fane of Ustengrav.
Remain true to the Way of the Voice, and you will return. Then it is time for us to recognize you formally as Dragonborn.

kbs.name: Orthorn
kbs.description: an ex-student of the College of Winterhold

plots: Orthorn stole books from Urag gro-Shub and left to join the summoners at Fellglow Keep

quest.title: Hitting the Books
quest.objective: find the books needed to identify the artifact you found
tasks: Proceed to Fellglow Keep.
talk to Orthorn
find the books needed to identify the artifact you found
quest.description:
I know what you want. Word travels fast around here. Discovered some big mystery, huh? Well you don't even need to ask. No, I don't have anything for you. Not anymore, anyway.
Orthorn stole a number of books when he ran off to Fellglow Keep to join those Summoners. Some kind of peace offering. I think one of those volumes may have had some relevant information. If you want them, you'll have to talk to Orthorn.

plots: Rieklings had invaded the Thirsk Mead Hall, but the player helped Hilund and her friends to drive them out: Hilund wants to ring the whole Thirsk Mead Hall with Riekling spears to remember that moment of weakness

quest.title: A Reminder
quest.objective: bring a bunch of Rieklings' spears to Hilund
tasks: find Rieklings' spears
bring a bunch of Rieklings' spears to Hilund
quest.description:
To tell you the truth, I've been a little distracted. I've got this... idea.
I want to ring the whole hall with Rieklings' little spears. Mocking us, from the past. Making us work harder. Fight better. The only problem is, I'm going to need a lot of spears. A lot. So, if you could find a bunch of them for me, that would make it easier on me.

kbs.name: Wujeeta
kbs.description: a worker at the Riften Fishery, and a Skooma addict

kbs.name: Bolli
kbs.description: the man who owns the Riften Fishery

plots: Bolli will fire Wujeeta if she shows up for work under the influence of Skooma

quest.title: Helping Hand
quest.objective: help Wujeeta cure her Skooma addiction
tasks: give Wujeeta a healing potion
help Wujeeta cure her Skooma addiction
quest.description:
My job at the Riften Fishery is in danger. The owner, Bolli, said that if I show up for work in this condition one more time, then I'm out.
I don't mean to do this to myself, but I can't help it. I tried some Skooma a year ago, and ever since then, I can't stop! If you could give me a healing potion, I could cleanse this poison from my body and get back to my life.

plots: every time the Red Mountain belches, more of Heart Stones land on Solstheim: the player may need to pick away at stone to pry the Heart Stone

quest.title: Heart Stones
quest.objective: bring a Heart Stone to Neloth
tasks: find a Heart Stone
bring a Heart Stone to Neloth
quest.description:
I'm running low on Heart Stones. If you have any with you, I'll buy one. Otherwise, I can tell you where you might find one.
Every time the Red Mountain belches, more of them land here on Solstheim. Look around for impact craters, exposed rock, that sort of thing. You may need to pick away at it to pry the heart stone itself loose, but you look... strong.
Good luck.

kbs.name: Karthwasten
kbs.description: a small village pressed against the stone, to the north

kbs.name: Sybil
kbs.description: a mortal woman who proclaims the will of Dibella

kbs.name: Dibella
kbs.description: the goddess of love and passion

kbs.name: Exalted Protocol of the Dibellan Sybil
kbs.description: a secret ceremony known to the priestesses of Dibella, which is used to find a new Sybil after the death of the previous one

plots: the player breached the inner sanctum of the Temple of Dibella and interrupted the Exalted Protocol of the Dibellan Sybil

quest.title: The Heart of Dibella
quest.objective: find a new Sybil for the Temple of Dibella
tasks: Reach Karthwasten.
retrieve the new Sybil, a young girl
find a new Sybil for the Temple of Dibella
quest.description:
You have committed a breach, and must pay the penalty. Normally, a quick death would be required. Luckily for you, there are more pressing matters.
The ceremony you so rudely interrupted was the Exalted Protocol of the Dibellan Sybil. I don't expect you to know what that means. Suffice to say that our Sybil was recently lost to us. Through the ceremony, we have seen the home of the next Sybil, to the north, in a small village pressed against the stone.
If you can travel there, and retrieve our young Sybil, your transgression will be forgiven. We believe the place in our vision to be Karthwasten. Now move quickly. The girl must be brought to the temple as soon as possible.
You, my dear, can earn the blessing of Dibella as your reward.

plots: the player drove Rieklings away from Halbarn Iron-Fur's forge

quest.title: Materials for Smithing
quest.objective: bring Stalhrim or Ebony to Halbarn Iron-Fur
tasks: find Stalhrim or Ebony
bring Stalhrim or Ebony to Halbarn Iron-Fur
quest.description:
Cleaning out the forge was the easy part. But those blasted Rieklings made off with most of my materials. And I can't forge air.
You tend to wander around, don't you? If you come across any Stalhrim or Ebony in your travels, bring them back to old Halbarn. Help each other out.

kbs.name: Amaund Motierre
kbs.description: a man who has contracted the Dark Brotherhood to kill Titus Mede II

kbs.name: Katariah
kbs.description: Titus Mede II's ship, moored offshore in the Solitude inlet

plots: the player is a member of the Dark Brotherhood
Titus Mede II will be surrounded by elite bodyguards, but they might be more lax than usual because everyone assumes that the Dark Brotherhood has been destroyed

quest.title: Hail Sithis!
quest.objective: assassinate Titus Mede II
tasks: Reach Katariah.
get onboard
assassinate Titus Mede II
quest.description:
The Emperor is still in Skyrim, but not for long. He's onboard his ship, the Katariah, moored offshore in the Solitude inlet. But you must hurry!
If you can get onboard that ship. Kill Titus Mede II, as contracted... I will reveal the location of the dead drop that holds your payment.
This is the true Emperor, not some half-penny lookalike. He'll be surrounded by elite bodyguards, I'm sure. You'll have your work cut out for you. Still... everyone assumes the Dark Brotherhood has been completely destroyed. They may be a bit more lax than usual.

kbs.name: Quaranir
kbs.description: a member of the Psijic Order

kbs.name: Eye of Magnus
kbs.description: a dangerous object that radiates power, in the College of Winterhold

plots: Quaranir stopped time around the player for speaking privately: the player is a student at the College of Winterhold
the Psijic Order has tried to contact the player previously with visions to warn the player about the Eye of Magnus

quest.title: Good Intentions
quest.objective: deal with the Eye of Magnus
tasks: seek out the Augur of Dunlain
deal with the Eye of Magnus
quest.description:
I've given us a chance to speak privately, but I'm afraid I can't do this for long. We must be brief.
The situation here at your College is of dire importance, and attempts to contact you as we have previously have failed. I believe it is due to the very source of our concern. This object... The Eye of Magnus as your people have taken to calling it. The energy coming from it has prevented us from reaching you with the visions you have already seen. The longer it remains here, the more dangerous the situation becomes. And so I have come here personally to tell you it must be dealt with.
I fear I have already overstepped the bounds of my Order, but I will offer this: seek out the Augur of Dunlain here in your College. His perception may be more coherent than ours.

kbs.name: Lucan Valerius
relations: Lucan Valerius's shop in the town

kbs.name: Lucan Valerius's shop in the town
kbs.description: Lucan Valerius's shop in the town

plots: the golden dragon claw was stolen from Lucan Valerius' shop

quest.title: The Golden Claw
quest.objective: retrieve a golden dragon claw for Lucan Valerius
tasks: Make your way to Bleak Falls Barrow.
find the golden dragon claw
retrieve a golden dragon claw for Lucan Valerius
quest.description:
We did have a bit of a... break-in. But we still have plenty to sell. Robbers were only after one thing. An ornament, solid gold. In the shape of a dragon's claw.
I've got some coin coming in from my last shipment. It's yours if you bring my claw back. If you're going after those thieves, you should head to Bleak Falls Barrow, northeast of town.

plots: the player came for their free armor
the player only gets one free outfit

quest.title: Get Outfitted
quest.objective: get a free set of armor
tasks: select light, medium, or heavy armor
get a free set of armor
quest.description:
I have just one question for you. Light, medium, or heavy?
Light armor for scouting detail, heavy armor for full on combat, or something in between?
Now, that'll be it. One free outfit per soldier. You lose that, or get it banged up, you'll need to pay like everyone else.

kbs.name: Ghost of Old Hroldan
kbs.description: an ancient ghost of a soldier

kbs.name: Hjalti
kbs.description: Ghost of Old Hroldan's long-dead brother-in-arms

plots: the Ghost of Old Hroldan thinks that the player is Hjalti

quest.title: The Ghost of Old Hroldan
quest.objective: put the Ghost of Old Hroldan to rest
tasks: find Hjalti's sword ,and give it to the Ghost of Old Hroldan
put the Ghost of Old Hroldan to rest
quest.description:
You don't remember me, Hjalti? Two campaigns we served together. You saved my life time and time again. You promised me, Hjalti. You promised that when we sacked Hroldan, you would make me your sworn brother.
And I've waited. Even after the enemies' arrows dug into my chest and their hammers crushed my bones. I've waited.
Give me your sword, Hjalti. That we may become brothers as you promised.

plots: Talvas Fathryon conjured an Ash Guardian without Neloth's approval: the Ash Guardian is not under Talvas Fathryon's control

quest.title: From the Ashes
quest.objective: help Talvas Fathryon by killing an Ash Guardian
tasks: kill the Ash Guardian
help Talvas Fathryon by killing an Ash Guardian
quest.description:
You've got to help me! I conjured an Ash Guardian and now it's running amok in Tel Mithryn.
Master Neloth refused to teach me the Ash Guardian spell. So I read his spell book on my own and learned it. Something went wrong when I cast it. The creature is attacking everything in sight.
I need to keep Master Neloth distracted so he doesn't find out what I did. There is no telling what he would do to me. While you are taking care of the creature, I'll try to figure out what went wrong.
I don't have any gold to pay you with, but I can give you this staff.

kbs.name: Habd
kbs.description: a retired sailor, giving quest via "Habd's Journal"

kbs.name: Frostflow Lighthouse
kbs.description: an old lighthouse on an icy coast

kbs.name: Sudi
kbs.description: a woman, Ramati and Habd's daughter

kbs.name: Mani
kbs.description: a man, Ramati and Habd's son

plots: Habd and Ramati sailed for years from Hammerfell to Solstheim and back: Habd and Ramati bought Frostflow Lighthouse to settle down with Mani and Sudi
things went missing from the cellar and strange noises came from there as well

Habd went away from Frostflow Lighthouse to buy some traps: after returning home, he found out that Ramati was killed by a bug-like creature; Habd killed the creature and went into the cellar to save his family, locking the door behind him

quest.title: A Tragedy at Frostflow
quest.objective: uncover the tragic events inside Frostflow Lighthouse
tasks: Head to Frostflow Lighthouse.
investigate the cellar
uncover the tragic events inside Frostflow Lighthouse
quest.description:
Habd's Journal
by Habd

After years of sailing from Hammerfell to Solstheim and back, Ramati and I have finally saved enough money to buy that old light house we spotted on the coast and we are moving in next month.
These northerners really know how to live. It may be cold, but you can't beat the tranquility of the watching icebergs to live out your silver years. Ramati loves the place too, despite the occasional leaky ceiling. Mani and Sudi, unfortunately, seem miserable here; I know the kids are old enough to strike out on their own, but I hope they'll grow to love the peace and quiet here as I have.
Mani and Sudi continue to bicker and harass each other and they seem to have started in on their mother as well. Ramati keeps finding things missing from the cellar. Sudi said she heard a noise down there but Mani just thinks their mother is going mad from isolation. The very thought of it is ridiculous, she's always wanted to retire here!
Sudi keeps saying that she hears scratching coming from the cellar at night. I think she's just trying to get her mother's goat, but I'd better head into town to get a few traps just in case it's rats. Should only take a couple days. I just hope those two go easy on Ramati while I'm gone.
Oh gods. Oh gods why? I returned home to find my beautiful Ramati killed and this thing, this horrible bug-like creature ransacking our home. I managed to kill the damned thing, I think it might be a demon! I've never seen anything like it! Oh gods poor Ramati. It must have come out of the cellar. I'm going down there and locking the door behind me to make sure they don't escape. I don't know if I'll make it out, but I have to save my family!

kbs.name: Anonymous
kbs.description: an investigator from the College of Winterhold, giving quest via "Midden Incident Report"

kbs.name: Midden
kbs.description: a sewer system underneath the College of Winterhold

kbs.name: Arcanaeum
kbs.description: the library in the College of Winterhold

kbs.name: Deadric Relic
kbs.description: a large, segmented sculpture of a gauntlet, with the Daedric sigil 'O' emblazoned upon the palm

plots: Anonymous found the missing students of the College of Winterhold dead in the Midden: they were attempting a summoning ritual well beyond their capabilities
the Deadric Relic in the Midden is related to the students' death: Anonymous pried 4 rings from the Deadric Relic

quest.title: Forgotten Names
quest.objective: complete a summoning ritual in the Midden
tasks: Head to Arcanaeum.
find the 4 rings needed in the ritual
complete a summoning ritual in the Midden
quest.description:
Midden Incident Report
by Anonymous

The missing students were found in the Midden this morning. Dead, as expected. None of us bothered keeping a detect life charm for the search at this point.
The bodies were found together, each suffering the same deformities; peeled and bubbling skin on the arms and face. Conjurer's burn, as it's commonly referred to around the College. There's little doubt they were attempting a summoning ritual well beyond their capabilities.
The relic nearby put any doubt in this theory to rest. I admit that I've never seen one like it - a large, segmented sculpture of a gauntlet, the Daedric sigil 'O' emblazoned upon the palm. Attempts to move it were in vain. I must show it to the Archmage during his upcoming visit. Perhaps he will know more.
While we couldn't move the relic, I was able to pry four "rings" from it. I'm sure there's a connection between them and the ritual the students were attempting.
I'll store these in the Arcanaeum until we can consult with a conjuration master to learn more.

plots: the player is not an Orc or blood-kin to the Orcs: the player is not welcome at the Orc stronghold by the code of Malacath

quest.title: The Forgemaster's Fingers
quest.objective: bring the Forgemaster's Fingers, an enchanted pair on gauntlets, to the chief of the Orcs
tasks: Go to Stony Creek Cave.
find the Forgemaster's Fingers
bring the Forgemaster's Fingers, an enchanted pair on gauntlets, to the chief of the Orcs
quest.description:
Halt, outlander. By the Code of Malacath, this stronghold belongs to the Orcs. Your kind are unwelcome. You're not an Orc, or Blood-Kin, so stay out. We only help our own.
Hmm... there is a way to become Blood-Kin, if you truly insist on entering our stronghold. We've heard whispers of an enchanted pair of gauntlets, hidden and protected by dangerous men, beasts, or worse.
They are called the Forgemaster's Fingers. Find them at Stony Creek Cave. Bring them to our chief, and he will decide if you're worthy to be Blood-Kin to the Orcs.

kbs.name: Idgrod
kbs.description: the noblewoman who rules over Morthal, and a seer

plots: Idgrod gets lost in her visions

quest.title: For the Good of Morthal
quest.objective: help Gorm to address his worries about Idgrod's leadership
tasks: Head to Solitude.
deliver Gorm's letter to Captain Aldis
help Gorm to address his worries about Idgrod's leadership
quest.description:
My mind weighs heavy enough. Idgrod's so lost in her visions, and it's only getting worse. I've looked after her safety for so long... If she can't tell what's real and what's not, how will she continue to lead Morthal?
There is a letter, one I have had for some time now. I think it is time it gets delivered. I cannot leave Idgrod's side, so I must stay here. Could you see that it reaches Captain Aldis in Solitude?
Please, do not open it. It is... private.

kbs.name: Broken Helm Hollow
kbs.description: a camp east towards the border of Morrowind

plots: Liefnarr went to trade some grain with people at Broken Helm Hollow: he never came back

quest.title: Flight or Fight
quest.objective: tell Liefnarr that he is not welcome home
tasks: Arrive at Broken Helm Hollow.
find Liefnarr
tell Liefnarr that he is not welcome home
quest.description:
My husband Liefnarr said he was going east towards the border of Morrowind to trade some of our grain to some folks at Broken Helm Hollow.
I waited and waited, and he never came back. Probably shacked up with some elven whore. Good riddance to him I say. If I only knew where he was, I'd sure give him a piece of my mind.
If you see him, tell him Grosta said he can go straight to hell... he's not welcome here any more.

kbs.name: Daynas Valen
kbs.description: a historian, giving quest via "Daynas Valen's Notes"

kbs.name: Folgunthur
kbs.description: the ancient barrows at the foot of Solitude

kbs.name: Archmage Gauldur
kbs.description: a man revered throughout the north for his wisdom, wealth, honor, and power, who lived during the first era

kbs.name: Mikrul
kbs.description: the youngest of Archmage Gauldur's three sons

kbs.name: Jyrik
kbs.description: the oldest of Archmage Gauldur's three sons

kbs.name: Sigdis
kbs.description: the middle child of Archmage Gauldur's three sons

plots: the Gauldur name wiped out from the annals of history
Mikrul, Jyrik, and Sigdis lusted after Archmage Gauldur's power and prestige: they discovered Archmage Gauldur's source of power, the Gauldur Amulet
Archmage Gauldur was murdered by his sons Mikrul, Jyrik, and Sigdis: they split the Gauldur Amulet between them
Mikrul, Jyrik, and Sigdis laid waste to surrounding villages: the high king sent Archmage Geirmund and his battlemages after Mikrul, Jyrik, and Sigdis

quest.title: Forbidden Legend
quest.objective: investigate the forgotten legend of Gauldur, and find the 3 pieces of the Gauldur Amulet
tasks: Go to Folgunthur.
Reach Saarthal.
Proceed to Geirmund's Hall.
find Mikrul's amulet piece
find Jyrik's amulet piece
find Sigdis' amulet piece
investigate the forgotten legend of Gauldur, and find the 3 pieces of the Gauldur Amulet
quest.description:
Daynas Valen's Notes
by Daynas Valen

How to summarize a lifetime of research? So little of what I have learned matters now - the petty politics of ancient times, the age-long campaign to wipe out all mention of the Gauldur name.
In the opening days of the First Era, the Archmage Gauldur was revered throughout the north. Wisdom, wealth, honor, and power were his, and even the legendary heros' heirs sought his counsel.
Smothered by his shadow, Gauldur's three sons grew cruel and resentful. They lusted after their father's power and prestige, and eventually Jyrik, the eldest, discovered its source: a mysterious amulet, from which he never parted. Together, they conspired to murder their father in his sleep and divide his amulet between them. And so it was done.
Consumed by their newfound power, the brothers laid waste to the surrounding villages. So great was the carnage that the High King himself intervened, sending a company of battlemages led by the Archmage Geirmund to subdue the brothers. And after a devastating battle, the three fled the field.
Mikrul, the youngest, was run to ground in Folgunthur, the ancient barrows at the foot of Solitude. Geirmund pursued Jyrik to the shattered crypts of Saarthal, half-buried even then. And at last, Sigdis was cornered in the southernmost reaches of land and later entombed in Geirmund's Hall.

plots: the player told Taarie that the player is going to the Blue Palace

quest.title: Fit for a Jarl
quest.objective: promote the Radiant Raiment to Jarl Elisif
tasks: Reach Blue Palace.
wear one of the Radiant Raiment's outfits, and speak to Elisif about it
promote the Radiant Raiment to Jarl Elisif
quest.description:
You're really going to the Blue Palace? That presents an opportunity.
If you were willing to wear one of Radiant Raiment's outfits and speak to the Jarl I would not only pay you but let you keep the outfit.
Here's the outfit. Try to get Jarl Elisif's opinion on it and if she likes it mention it's from Radiant Raiment.

plots: thieves broke into the Bards College and made off with a lot of valuable things: Finn's Lute included
Finn invented the eight course lute that is commonplace today

quest.title: Finn's Lute
quest.objective: return Finn's Lute to Inge Six Fingers
tasks: Arrive at Stony Creek Cave.
find Finn's Lute
return Finn's Lute to Inge Six Fingers
quest.description:
Hmm? Oh, sorry. My mind wanders sometimes. I was just thinking about Finn's Lute.
Over a year ago, thieves broke into the College and made off with a lot of valuable things. Mostly gold and silver. But they also stole Finn's Lute. We just learned where the bandits fled to, and I very much want that lute back. They are at Stony Creek Cave.
Finn was the bard who invented the eight course lute that is commonplace today. Until he found a way to string the extra courses, bards only had six course lutes. The lute they stole is Finn's original eight course lute. I doubt they even realize its true value.
There is no way I can pay you what this Lute is worth. But I can teach you a few tricks I've learned over the years.

kbs.name: Morrowind
kbs.description: a land inhabited by the Dunmer
relations: around the main gate of Windhelm

kbs.name: around the main gate of Windhelm
kbs.description: around the main gate of Windhelm

kbs.name: Khajiit
relations: around the main gate of Windhelm

plots: the player saved Malborn from the Thalmor in the past
Malborn could not leave Windhelm for Morrowind because of the Khajiit

quest.title: Assassin at Large
quest.objective: kill the Khajiit who wants to assassinate Malborn
tasks: Travel to around the main gate of Windhelm.
find the Khajiit
kill the Khajiit who wants to assassinate Malborn
quest.description:
Oh, it's you. I didn't expect to see you again.
I'm trying to stay alive. I think time's running out though. I'm pretty sure the Thalmor know where I am. Maybe you can help me.
I was trying to get to Morrowind. The Dunmer don't care much for the Thalmor and I figured I'd be safe there. As safe as anywhere, that is. But there's a Khajiit hanging around the main gate. I didn't like the way he was looking at me. I'm sure he's Thalmor. Just waiting for me to leave Windhelm so he can follow me and kill me in a lonely place.
You'd be saving my life. Again. I know I probably seemed ungrateful... I've just been so scared. Expecting a knife at my throat any minute.

kbs.name: First Edition
kbs.description: a famous bookshop far away from Solstheim

kbs.name: Strident Squall
kbs.description: a ship that sank off the coast of Solstheim, and turned into a reaver den

plots: Cindiri Arano sent the Folio to the First Edition to be rebound: they sent it back on the Strident Squall

quest.title: First Edition
quest.objective: locate a Folio for Cindiri Arano
tasks: Go to Strident Squall.
find the Folio
locate a Folio for Cindiri Arano
quest.description:
A few months ago, I had sent an important Folio to the First Edition to be rebound. They sent it back to me recently, but it never arrived.
The Folio was aboard the "Strident Squall" or something like that. The damn thing sunk right off the coast of Solstheim. Can you imagine? One of the sailors survived. Poor thing crawled all the way to Raven Rock on his hands and knees. Before he died, he told the guard about the wreck and warned us that it was going to be crawling with reavers.
Could you find the Folio for me? You have no idea how much it hurts losing such a precious item!

kbs.name: Wulf Wild-Blood
kbs.description: a hunter, and a worried brother

kbs.name: Torkild
kbs.description: Wulf Wild-Blood's brother, a wild man and a fearsome warrior

plots: Torkild may have become a werebear: a bear-like cursed creature

quest.title: Filial Bonds
quest.objective: find Torkild
tasks: see if Torkild is with the werebears of the glacier
find Torkild
quest.description:
In days past, my brother Torkild and I would share the hunt, but that was... long ago.
Torkild had a wild gleam in his eye, more than most. In my darkest times, I fear he fell in among the werebears of the glacier.
Werebears are twisted, cursed beasts. True bears are noble and great creatures of the wild. I've heard tell of men who, by curse or by heart's desire, become transformed into one of those vile things. It is a pitiable fate. And one that I fear has fallen to my brother.
If you happen to cross his path, be wary. He was a fierce warrior as a man. If he fell prey to his more bestial side, he could be deadly.

kbs.name: Raven Rock Mine
kbs.description: a worthless and tainted mine in Raven Rock

kbs.name: Gratian Caerellius
kbs.description: the great-grandfather of Crescius Caerellius, who worked for the East Empire Company

plots: the East Empire Company swept something big under the rug two centuries ago: it killed Gratian Caerellius and ruined the Raven Rock Mine
Crescius Caerellius and his wife found Gratian Caerellius' things in their home: an unsent letter to the East Empire Company, and a key to the locked off section of the Raven Rock Mine

quest.title: The Final Descent
quest.objective: find out what happened to Gratian Caerellius
tasks: find and unlock the locked off section of the mine
find out what happened to Gratian Caerellius
quest.description:
Who in the blazes are you?! Can't you see I'm busy? Or, perhaps you could help me. Hmph, maybe. Been difficult trusting people lately, they think I'm crazy.
Mark my words, these mines hold a secret that could put Raven Rock back on the map. A secret the East Empire Company swept under the rug two centuries ago. It killed my great-grandfather, Gratian Caerellius, and left Raven Rock with a worthless and tainted mine.
East Empire Company called it "a terrible accident", claiming that he was lost in a rockfall, but I know better. My wife and I were cleaning out our home, and we came across some of my great-grandfather's things locked in an old chest. I found an unsent letter he'd written to the East Empire Company, and a key.
The letter describes a discovery that was made in the mine by some of the diggers. They wanted Gratian to take a closer look. The East Empire Company must have felt it was of great value, as they locked that section of the mine off from everyone else. I assume the key unlocks that section of the mine. I haven't been able to find the entrance.
I'm telling you... there's something big down there, something that the East Empire Company wanted to hide from everyone.

plots: Urag gro-Shub gives the player a note that tells the player the location of the book

quest.title: Fetch Me That Book!
quest.objective: find a book for Urag gro-Shub
tasks: read the note
find a book for Urag gro-Shub
quest.description:
If you're feeling adventurous, I'm always looking for someone to procure valuable books from some more... dangerous locations.
Here, I scribbled down the last place I'd heard about. Check it out, but be careful.

kbs.name: Farkas
kbs.description: a fellow member of the Companions

plots: Farkas knows where the player might find the dragon

quest.title: Dragon Seekers
quest.objective: kill a dragon with Farkas
tasks: lead Farkas to the dragon
kill a dragon with Farkas
quest.description:
Travelers have been coming to Whiterun. They tell stories about dragons. I've heard of them, but didn't think they were real.
Rumors also claim that you have defeated dragons before. You are a very brave person worthy of being a Companion. But I already knew that.
Let's go kill a dragon together. That's one way to find out if they're real. I even know where we might find one. Lead on!

kbs.name: Dragonborn
kbs.description: the only person who can defeat dragons for good

plots: the player is Dragonborn

quest.title: Dragon Hunting
quest.objective: kill a dragon with the Blades
tasks: ask Esbern to send the Blades to the dragon
kill a dragon with the Blades
quest.description:
The Blades of the old hunted down many dragons in their day, and they have records of where the beasts lived.
Only you can truly defeat these monsters, Dragonborn, but you do not have to do so alone. The Blades can help you.
Just ask whenever you're ready to take on a dragon. We will send the Blades to help you fulfill your destiny. The dragon's soul should make you stronger.

kbs.name: Brand-Shei
kbs.description: an orphaned dark elf who was raised by Argonians in the Black Marsh

kbs.name: Morrowind
kbs.description: the land of the dark elves

plots: when Brand-Shei was found by his Argonian father, Brand-Shei was wrapped in a blanket bearing the symbol of House Telvanni

quest.title: Distant Memories
quest.objective: help Brand-Shei uncover his past
tasks: find clues about Brand-Shei's past
help Brand-Shei uncover his past
quest.description:
I may be dark elf by birth, but I was raised Argonian. Through reasons I'm still trying to discover, I ended up orphaned then taken in by a kindly Argonian family in Black Marsh. I hope one day to find out what happened to me... how I ended up like that.
I know when I was found by my Argonian father, I was wrapped in a blanket bearing the symbol of House Telvanni. It was one of the great houses in Morrowind long ago. Whether that means I was one of them or not, I'm uncertain.
If you come across anything in your travels that might provide me with the answers I'm looking for, I'd be grateful.

kbs.name: Faralda
kbs.description: the player's teacher in Destruction magic

kbs.name: "Power of the Elements"
kbs.description: a book that contains clues about powerful Destruction magics

plots: Faralda has taught the player everything she can about Destruction magic

quest.title: Mastering Destruction
quest.objective: learn powerful Destruction magics lost to the ages
tasks: read the "Power of the Elements" that Faralda gives you
learn powerful Destruction magics lost to the ages
quest.description:
I daresay you've learned all I can teach you about Destruction magic. But... That doesn't mean there isn't more out there.
Over the years I've heard things. Powerful magics lost to the ages, incredible spells that only the most skilled mages can master. This book, "Power of the Elements", is the only thing I've ever found. I think it's better off in your hands.

kbs.name: Commander Maro
kbs.description: an army officer who has tracked the movements of the Dark Brotherhood

kbs.name: Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary, the hideout of the Dark Brotherhood
kbs.description: Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary, the hideout of the Dark Brotherhood

kbs.name: Astrid
kbs.description: the female leader of the Dark Brotherhood
relations: Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary, the hideout of the Dark Brotherhood

kbs.name: the passphrase to the Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary: "Silence, my brother."
kbs.description: the passphrase to the Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary: "Silence, my brother."
relations: Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary, the hideout of the Dark Brotherhood

plots: the player told Commander Maro that the player killed Astrid

quest.title: Destroy the Dark Brotherhood!
quest.objective: destroy the Dark Brotherhood
tasks: Make your way to Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary, the hideout of the Dark Brotherhood.
use "Silence, my brother." to enter the Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary
destroy the Dark Brotherhood
quest.description:
The leader of the Dark Brotherhood? You mean that woman Astrid? Dead? And this is no jest? Ha! This is a stroke of good fortune. Long have I watched the Dark Brotherhood's movements... waiting for the time to strike. That time is now!
My agents have recently acquired the passphrase to their Sanctuary. It is, "Silence, my brother." Every assassin in that hole must be put down! You, my friend. You've slain their leader. This honor should be yours. Do this, and you will be rewarded most handsomely!

plots: the player looks at the Dwemer lockbox with Septimus Signus
Dwemer blood can unlock the Dwemer lockbox: the blood of Altmer, Bosmer, Dunmer, Falmer, and Orsimer, can be used instead

quest.title: Discerning the Transmundane
quest.objective: uncover the secrets of the mysterious Dwemer lockbox with Septimus Signus
tasks: gather the blood of Altmer, Bosmer, Dunmer, Falmer, and Orsimer with an extractor Septimus Signus gives you
uncover the secrets of the mysterious Dwemer lockbox with Septimus Signus
quest.description:
You see this masterwork of the Dwemer. Deep inside their greatest knowings. Septimus is clever among men, but he is but an idiot child compared to the dullest of the Dwemer.
To harness it is to know. The fundaments. The Dwemer lockbox hides it from me. I see it now. The sealing structure interlocks in the tiniest fractals. Dwemer blood can loose the hooks, but none alive remain to bear it. A panoply of their brethren could gather to form a facsimile. A trick. Something they didn't anticipate, no, not even them.
The blood of Altmer, Bosmer, Dunmer, Falmer, and Orsimer. The elves still living provide the key. Bear you hence this extractor. It will drink the fresh blood of elves. Come when its set is complete.

kbs.name: Jarl Elisif the Fair
kbs.description: the noblewoman who rules over Solitude, who recently lost her husband, the king

kbs.name: Falk Firebeard
kbs.description: Jarl Elisif the Fair's male steward

plots: the player asked Sorex Vinius who is in charge of Solitude

quest.title: Sating the Steward's Thirst
quest.objective: deliver a bottle of Stros M'Kai Rum to Falk Firebeard
tasks: Make your way to Blue Palace.
find Falk Firebeard
deliver a bottle of Stros M'Kai Rum to Falk Firebeard
quest.description:
Jarl Elisif the Fair is in charge of solitude. Poor woman. Losing her husband and king like that. It was a dark day for us all.
Damn, that reminds me, I have a delivery to make to her steward, Falk Firebeard. He ordered a special bottle of Stros M'Kai Rum.
You could deliver it for me. Save me a lot of trouble. Here. Take it to the Blue Palace.

kbs.name: Delphine
kbs.description: a paranoid member of the Blades

kbs.name: Malborn
kbs.description: a male wood elf who is Delphine's trusty contact inside the Thalmor Embassy

plots: Elenwen regularly throws parties: while the player is talking with Malborn, Delphine gets the player an invitation to one of Elenwen's parties

quest.title: Diplomatic Immunity
quest.objective: infiltrate the party at the Thalmor Embassy, and find Elenwen's secret files
tasks: Proceed to The Winking Skeever.
Make your way to Solitude stables.
talk to Malborn
meet Delphine
infiltrate the party at the Thalmor Embassy, and find Elenwen's secret files
quest.description:
The Thalmor ambassador, Elenwen, regularly throws parties where the rich and connected cozy up to the Thalmor.
I can get you into one of those parties. Once you're inside the Embassy, you get away and find Elenwen's secret files. I have a contact inside the Embassy. He's not up for this kind of high-risk mission, but he can help you. His name's Malborn. Wood elf, plenty of reason to hate the Thalmor. You can trust him.
I'll get word for him to meet you in Solitude, at the Winking Skeever -- you know it? While you're doing that, I'll work on getting you an invitation to Elenwen's little party.
Meet me at the Solitude stables after you've arranged things with Malborn.

kbs.name: Hollyfrost Farm
kbs.description: a farm owned by Hillevi Cruel-Sea's family

plots: Hillevi Cruel-Sea's goods are grown at Hollyfrost Farm

quest.title: Who to Poison?
quest.objective: deliver a bottle of Nightshade extract to Wuunferth
tasks: find Wuunferth
deliver a bottle of Nightshade extract to Wuunferth
quest.description:
Everything you see is grown at my family's own Hollyfrost Farm. Fresh and filling.
I also do a little herb growing. The court wizard, Wuunferth, pays us to plant a little Nightshade. Who knows what he uses it for? A poison like that?
Hey, could you deliver this bottle of Nightshade extract to Wuunferth?

kbs.name: Sondas Drenim
relations: a mine whose tunnels are getting deep into the rock

kbs.name: a mine whose tunnels are getting deep into the rock
kbs.description: a mine whose tunnels are getting deep into the rock

plots: the miners need medicines to combat the ore dust

quest.title: A Bad Cough
quest.objective: deliver a message about medicines for miners to Quintus
tasks: Reach White Phial.
find Quintus
deliver a message about medicines for miners to Quintus
quest.description:
This mine is only a few years old, but I've been digging up ore for over a century.
We're getting to the point where the tunnels are getting deep into the rock. People complain of bad coughs and foul air. I've seen this before. We need some medicines to combat the ore dust. I was about to send a message to Windhelm for aid.
Could you deliver that message on my behalf? Take it to Quintus, in the White Phial.

kbs.name: Astrid
kbs.description: the player's dying leader in the Dark Brotherhood

kbs.name: Maro
kbs.description: the man who leads the Penitus Oculatus

plots: Astrid betrayed the player by giving the player to the Penitus Oculatus: the Penitus Oculatus destroyed the Dark Brotherhood
Astrid opposed the old ways that guided the Dark Brotherhood for centuries unlike the player and the Night Mother

quest.title: Death Incarnate
quest.objective: fulfill Astrid's contract
tasks: kill Astrid
fulfill Astrid's contract
quest.description:
Alive.... You're alive... Thank Sithis...
Ssshhh.... Please. There is much... I have to say. And... not much time... I'm sorry. So very sorry. The Penitus Oculatus... Maro... He said that by giving you to them, he would leave the Dark Brotherhood alone. Forever. By Sithis, I was such a fool. All of this... it's all my fault. You are the best of us, and I nearly killed you... as I've killed everyone else...
I'm saying you were right. The Night Mother was right. The old ways... they guided the Dark Brotherhood for centuries. I was a fool to oppose them. And to prove my... sincerity, I have prayed for a contract. You lead this Family now. I give you the Blade of Woe, so that you can see it through.
You must kill... Me.

plots: there is an open grave in Falkreath graveyard: Vighar broke free from the grave
Dengeir of Stuhn's family is entrusted with keeping Vighar buried: somebody stole the wardstone that kept Vighar in the grave

quest.title: Dark Ancestor
quest.objective: destroy Vighar
tasks: Proceed to Bloodlet Throne.
find Vighar
destroy Vighar
quest.description:
You may have seen the open grave in our graveyard. Most of the townsfolk think it's the work of a corpse thief. The truth is less pleasant. It is...was, the grave of Vighar, my own ancestor, dead for centuries now.
Vighar is a vampire. My family is entrusted with keeping him buried, but recently someone stole the wardstone that sealed him in the grave, and Vighar escaped. It's too late for the wardstone. Vighar must be destroyed. If this gets out, my family will suffer great shame.
See that Vighar is destroyed. He will have fled to gather others of his kind at Bloodlet Throne.

kbs.name: Delvin
kbs.description: the player's male superior in the Thieves Guild

kbs.name: Sabine Nyette
kbs.description: the female first mate of the Red Wave

plots: Delvin sent the player to Erikur
Captain Volf neglected to honor a trade agreement between him and Erikur

quest.title: The Dainty Sload
quest.objective: frame Captain Volf by planting some contraband
tasks: Find your way to down by the docks.
Arrive at Dainty Sload.
get some Balmora Blue from Sabine Nyette
plant the Balmora Blue in Captain Volf's footlocker
frame Captain Volf by planting some contraband
quest.description:
It's about time you got here. I'm not accustomed to dealing with people who are unreliable. That's why I asked Delvin to send me his best.
Nothing raises my ire more than having an agreement broken. It's bad for business and it wastes time. Captain Volf of the Dainty Sload has decided to test my patience on this matter by neglecting to honor a trade agreement we had established.
I need you to help me show him the error of his ways by sneaking on board the Sload and planting some contraband. You'll need to get your hands on some Balmora Blue from Sabine Nyette down by the docks. She's the first mate on another ship, the Red Wave.
Once you get your hands on it, I want you to plant it in Captain Volf's footlocker. I'll take care of the rest. Captain Volf is ashore right now and I want the authorities waiting for him when he gets back.
Now get going... I don't want to see your face until the job's done.

kbs.name: Nightingale Sentinel
kbs.description: a ghost who is dying, trapped in this chamber

kbs.name: Pilgrim's Path
kbs.description: a dangerous path to the Ebonmere

kbs.name: Ebonmere
kbs.description: a portal held open by the Skeleton Key

plots: the player is a member of the Thieves Guild
the player has the Skeleton Key: the player has done the Thieves Guild a great deed

quest.title: Darkness Returns
quest.objective: walk the Pilgrim's Path, and return the Skeleton Key to the Ebonmere
tasks: find and read the journal of the man who died attempting to walk the Pilgrim's Path
walk the Pilgrim's Path, and return the Skeleton Key to the Ebonmere
quest.description:
The Key! You have the Skeleton Key! I never thought I'd see it again.
You've done the Guild a great deed. And although they may not show it, I'm certain they appreciate your sacrifices. My only regret is that you had to undertake this task alone.
Nothing would bring me more pride than to return the Key, but I'm afraid it's impossible. From the moment I arrived here, I've felt myself... well... dying.
I'm afraid you have return the Key alone. I'm weakening, and I can feel myself slipping away. The years without restoration of my power have taken their toll. Whatever damage has been caused can only be corrected by following the Pilgrim's Path to the Ebonmere and replacing the Key.
The only possible help I've come across are the remains of some poor fellow who was trying to follow in your footsteps. Perhaps his journal can help?

kbs.name: Atub
kbs.description: the wisewoman of the orc clan

kbs.name: Yamarz
kbs.description: the male chief of the orc clan, who was a strong and proud warrior

plots: Yamarz became weak: the giants sense Yamarz's weakness, and intrude on the orc clan's territory
Atub must petition Malacath for relief: the ritual must be done at the walled orc camp

quest.title: The Cursed Tribe
quest.objective: Help lift the curse placed on Yamarz
tasks: bring Troll Fat and a Daedra Heart to Atub
Help lift the curse placed on Yamarz
quest.description:
Please, our tribe suffers and we need help.
Our Chief, Yamarz, was once a strong and proud warrior. Now he is stricken, cursed. He is weak, and so our tribe is weak. The giants sense this, and intrude on our territory. Now they assault our very home.
Yamarz refuses help, but I sense that you may be just what we need. He has demanded we stay inside the walls. We cannot leave. I must petition Malacath for relief. This curse must be lifted. But I cannot travel to Malacath's shrine. The ritual must be done here, and I do not have the materials I need.
I beg of you, can you bring me Troll Fat and a Daedra Heart? I have no wish to depend on a stranger, but I have no choice.

kbs.name: Astrid
kbs.description: the player's guildmaster in the Dark Brotherhood

kbs.name: Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary, the hideout of the Dark Brotherhood
kbs.description: Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary, the hideout of the Dark Brotherhood

kbs.name: Cicero
kbs.description: a fellow member of the Dark Brotherhood, a dangerous madman

kbs.name: Night Mother
kbs.description: the spiritual female leader of the Dark Brotherhood

kbs.name: Veezara
kbs.description: a fellow member of the Dark Brotherhood, a man

kbs.name: Arnbjorn
kbs.description: a fellow member of the Dark Brotherhood, a man

plots: the player is the Listener of the Dark Brotherhood
Cicero went berserk because he overheard Astrid complain about the Night Mother and the player being the listener: Cicero wounded Veezara and tried to kill Astrid before fleeing

quest.title: The Cure for Madness
quest.objective: confront Cicero and kill him
tasks: Reach the wilderness.
Make your way to Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary, the hideout of the Dark Brotherhood.
find Arnbjorn and make sure he is alright
search Cicero's room for clues about where he has gone and let Astrid know about your findings
confront Cicero and kill him
quest.description:
The fool Cicero went absolutely berserk! He wounded Veezara, tried to kill me, and then he fled. I knew that lunatic couldn't be trusted.
Nothing set Cicero off. At least nothing I'm aware of. Well... If I'm being honest, I haven't exactly been discreet lately in expressing my frustration with this whole situation. Obeying the Night Mother. You being the Listener. It's ridiculous. No offense. Cicero may have overheard me talking to one of the others about the Night Mother. It's possible I was... not entirely respectful. But to go this far. To attempt to murder the leader of a Sanctuary. Cicero must pay with his life. There is no other option.
I want you to find that miserable little fool and end his life! But first... find my husband. Make sure he's all right. After the attack, Arnbjorn flew into a rage. When Cicero left... Arnbjorn went after him. They disappeared into the wild. Take my horse, Shadowmere. You'll find him outside, by the pool, when you go find Arnbjorn. Search Cicero's room here. Maybe there's something in there that sheds some light on where he might have gone.
Let me know the minute you find something. I've got to see to Veezara, and calm everyone down.

kbs.name: Phinis Gestor
kbs.description: the player's teacher in conjuration magic
relations: the top of the Hall of Attainment

kbs.name: the top of the Hall of Attainment
kbs.description: the top of the Hall of Attainment

kbs.name: Dremora
kbs.description: a humanoid creature from the planes of Oblivion
relations: the top of the Hall of Attainment

plots: the player has advanced quickly in their conjuration studies
Phinis Gestor will teach the player the spell to summon the Dremora, but it will only work in a place properly prepared for the event

quest.title: Your Will Be Done
quest.objective: learn powerful, new conjuration spells
tasks: Arrive at the top of the Hall of Attainment.
summon an unbound Dremora, prove that you are in control, and order the Dremora bring you a sigil stone from an Oblivion gate
learn powerful, new conjuration spells
quest.description:
How quickly you've advanced. Most impressive. There are spells yet to be learned, powerful spells that can more closely and more permanently bind creatures to your will. These spells are difficult, even for one as skilled as I. To even begin to inscribe them, I need something very special. A sigil stone from an Oblivion gate.
I do not have one in my possession. Nor do you, I'm sure. So we require a Dremora to retrieve one for us. You will summon one, and order it to bring a sigil stone to you. I will then inscribe the spells for you.
But there are risks. There are always risks. You must summon and command an unbound Dremora. Summoning an Unbound Dremora is not like other Conjuration spells. It will not simply do your bidding. You must first prove you are in control.
I will teach you the spell to summon the Dremora, but know that it will only work in a place properly prepared for the event. Here is the spell you need. Go to the top of the Hall of Attainment; I have prepared a place for you there.

kbs.name: Barbas
kbs.description: Clavicus Vile's dog who was kicked out by Clavicus Vile

kbs.name: Haemar's Shame
kbs.description: a den of cultists worshiping Clavicus Vile

kbs.name: Clavicus Vile
kbs.description: the prince of wishes, a Daedra

plots: Clavicus Vile is weak, since he banished Barbas: Clavicus Vile can only manifest at his shrines

quest.title: A Daedra's Best Friend
quest.objective: settle the disagreement between Barbas and Clavicus Vile
tasks: Proceed to Haemar's Shame.
talk to Clavicus Vile at his shrine
settle the disagreement between Barbas and Clavicus Vile
quest.description:
You are exactly what I was looking for. You see, my name is Barbas. And I have a problem I think you can help sort out.
My master and I had a bit of a falling out. We got into an argument and it got rather... heated. He's kicked me out until I find someone who can settle our disagreement. That's where you come in.
My master is Clavicus Vile, the prince of wishes. As you can imagine, he's quite the important person.  Now, since he banished me, Vile's been rather weak. He can't manifest very far from one of his shrines. I know there's a cult that worships him at Haemar's Shame. We should be able to talk to him there.
If this works out, I'll make sure you're rewarded. Just don't trust any offer he makes you... okay?

kbs.name: Galmar Stone-Fist
kbs.description: the player's commanding officer in the Stormcloaks

kbs.name: Raerek
kbs.description: the Jarl's male steward, and a secret Talos worshiper

kbs.name: Talos
kbs.description: the hero-god of humans, whose worship has been banned in the Empire

plots: Raerek is not a true son of Skyrim, as he still supports the Empire
the Jarl's men will arrest the player if they find the player in Raerek's quarters

quest.title: Pushing Beliefs
quest.objective: blackmail Raerek into helping the Stormcloaks
tasks: Find your way to Markarth.
find proofs of Raerek's Talos worship in his quarters, and use them to blackmail Raerek
blackmail Raerek into helping the Stormcloaks
quest.description:
Get over to Markarth. Rumor has it the Jarl's Steward, Raerek, is a faithful Talos worshiper, if not a true son of Skyrim - he still supports the Empire, after all.
But, if confronted with proof of his belief, you might be able to 'persuade' him to aid our cause, indirectly of course. Wouldn't want to sully his reputation, would we?
You'll need to be careful with this one. The Jarl's men won't look kindly on you rummaging through the steward's quarters.

kbs.name: Legate Rikke
kbs.description: the player's commanding officer in the Imperial Legion

kbs.name: Anuriel
kbs.description: the Jarl's corrupt female steward who has secret arrangements with the Thieves Guild

plots: the Jarl's men will arrest the player if they find the player in Anuriel's private quarters

quest.title: Compelling Tribute
quest.objective: use Anuriel to gain intelligence on the Stormcloaks
tasks: Head to Riften.
find evidence about Anuriel's corrupt activities in her private quarters, and use it to blackmail her
use Anuriel to gain intelligence on the Stormcloaks
quest.description:
You're going to Riften. My spies report the Jarl's Steward, Anuriel, has arrangements with the Thieves Guild that would be rather embarrassing if made public.
I need you to find evidence of her corrupt activities, and use it to gain a measure of her "cooperation."
This will require stealth and discretion. The Jarl's guards won't take kindly to anyone rummaging through the steward's private quarters.

kbs.name: Elder Othreloth
relations: an Ancestral Tomb beneath the Temple

kbs.name: Ancestral Tombs
kbs.description: tombs where dark elves inter their dead

kbs.name: an Ancestral Tomb beneath the Temple
kbs.description: an Ancestral Tomb beneath the Temple

plots: Elder Othreloth gives the player a key that opens the door to the Ancestral Tomb

quest.title: Clean Sweep
quest.objective: cleanse the Ancestral Tomb
tasks: Make your way to an Ancestral Tomb beneath the Temple.
kill the ash spawn that defile the Ancestral Tomb
cleanse the Ancestral Tomb
quest.description:
The Ancestral Tombs are where we inter our dead. They are sacred places, meant to honor their passing. Sadly, we've been unable to use the Ancestral Tomb beneath the Temple as of late, and have resorted to other locations to scatter the remains.
Those foul vermin... the abominations we call ash spawn have risen from the ashes of our own ancestors. They're befouling the memories of our forefathers by defiling their remains.
Could you cleanse the tomb for us, wanderer? That would be most kind. Here, this key should open the door to the tomb.

plots: Brynjolf will cause a distraction

quest.title: A Chance Arrangement
quest.objective: put Brand-Shei out of the business permanently
tasks: tell Brynjolf when you are ready, steal Madesi's silver ring from a strongbox under his stand, and place Madesi's silver ring in Brand-Shei's pocket without him noticing
put Brand-Shei out of the business permanently
quest.description:
I've got a bit of an errand to perform, but I need an extra pair of hands. And in my line of work, extra hands are well-paid.
It's simple... I'm going to cause a distraction and you're going to steal Madesi's silver ring from a strongbox under his stand. Once you have it, I want you to place it in Brand-Shei's pocket without him noticing.
There's someone that wants to see Brand-Shei put out of business permanently. That's all you need to know. Now, you tell me when you're ready and we'll get started.

kbs.name: Haelga
kbs.description: a devout female worshiper of Dibella

kbs.name: Dibella
kbs.description: the goddess of love and passion

kbs.name: Bolli, Hofgrir, Indaryn
kbs.description: the three men Haelga slept with

kbs.name: Mark of Dibella, Marks of Dibella

plots: when Haelga sleeps with a man, Haelga gives the man a Mark of Dibella

quest.title: Caught Red Handed
quest.objective: help Svana Far-Shield embarrass Haelga
tasks: gather 3 Marks of Dibella from Bolli, Hofgrir and Indaryn, and confront Haelga with the Marks of Dibella
help Svana Far-Shield embarrass Haelga
quest.description:
I hate Haelga! It's everything about her. She's disgusting. I think she takes her worship of Dibella a bit too seriously.
Do you know she's slept with three different men in the last month alone? What kind of a woman would do such a thing? Just for once, I'd like to see her squirm... to rub her nose in it.
Actually, there is a way to do this, but I don't think I could get away with doing it. She'd kill me if she found out. You see, I happen to know after she makes love, she gives her partner a token of her affection called a Mark of Dibella. If you confront her with three of the Marks of Dibella, she'd be so embarrassed... well, I don't know what she'd do!
Oh, this is going to be great! You need to get the Marks of Dibella from Bolli, Hofgrir and Indaryn. Not sure how you're going to do that, but try your best. Then just confront Haelga with them and the rest works itself out.

kbs.name: Calcelmo
kbs.description: a scholar researching the Dwemer, giving quest via "Letter from Calcelmo"

plots: "Letter from Calcelmo" is addressed toward the player

quest.title: An Offer
quest.objective: help Calcelmo with his research
tasks: Reach Markarth.
bring the Dwemer sword you bough from Warmaiden's to Calcelmo
help Calcelmo with his research
quest.description:
Letter from Calcelmo
by Calcelmo

Dragonborn,
It has come to my attention you may have recently acquired a certain Dwemer sword from Warmaiden's.
I'm not sure how such an object came to find itself resting there... but I've been trying to obtain one for my research.
If you still have it, or if not, find another one, I would be most appreciative if you were to bring it to me here in Markarth. I will pay handsomely.

Sincerely,
Calcelmo

kbs.name: Vex
kbs.description: a fellow member of the Thieves Guild

plots: the player can't kill anyone who lives in the house or they forfeit the payment

quest.title: The Burglary Job
quest.objective: commit a burglary
tasks: break into a house, and steal a specific item
commit a burglary
quest.description:
I have a little job for you. Pretty simple. Break into a house, grab a specific item and get out before they realize what's going on.
The catch is you can't kill anyone who lives there or you forfeit the payment. You ready for some good old-fashioned burglary?

kbs.name: Neloth
relations: the hills on the western edge of Skyrim

kbs.name: the hills on the western edge of Skyrim
kbs.description: the hills on the western edge of Skyrim

plots: Briarhearts remove their own hearts, and replace them with large briar seeds, putting their lifesparks in direct connection to the natural forces

quest.title: Briarheart Necropsy
quest.objective: examine a Briarheart for Neloth so that he can improve his heart stone experiments
tasks: Travel to the hills on the western edge of Skyrim.
find a Briarheart
examine a Briarheart for Neloth so that he can improve his heart stone experiments
quest.description:
I've been having difficulties with my heart stone experiments.
Have you heard of the Briarhearts? They are fierce warriors of the Forsworn tribes. They actually remove their own hearts, and replace them with large briar seeds. It puts their lifesparks in direct connection to the natural forces.
Well, I'm hoping to do something similar... if I could connect a living being to the forces of nature... well... that would be formidable. I've done some experiments in this area, but, well, my test subjects are far too fragile. I'm hoping to learn some of the Briarheart techniques, their methods.
I need you to examine one of them. Just investigate as much as you can. The Forsworn live in the hills on the western edge of Skyrim. From there, you're on your own. I'm given to understand that they are not difficult to find, if you gather my inference.

kbs.name: Gabriella
kbs.description: a fellow member of the Dark Brotherhood

kbs.name: Astrid
kbs.description: the player's female guildleader in the Dark Brotherhood

kbs.name: Gaius Maro
kbs.description: the son of Commander Maro, a member of the Penitus Oculatus

kbs.name: Olava the Feeble
kbs.description: Gabriella's old female friend, and a powerful seer

kbs.name: Commander Maro
kbs.description: the man who leads the Penitus Oculatus, and handles the Emperor's security

plots: Astrid sent the player to Gabriella
the Emperor will arrive in Skyrim: the Penitus Oculatus will need to begin its preparations immediately
Astrid and Gabriella have devised a plan to break Commander Maro and cripple the Emperor's protection
Gaius Maro is set to leave the Penitus Oculatus outpost at Dragon Bridge, and inspect the security of each city in Skyrim
Olava's token is to be given to Olava the Feeble for a reading of the player's future

quest.title: Breaching Security
quest.objective: assassinate Gaius Maro, and implicate him in a plot to kill the Emperor
tasks: go to Dragon Bridge, observe Gaius Maro's departure, follow him, waylay him in one of the major cities, kill him, and plant the false evidence on his body
assassinate Gaius Maro, and implicate him in a plot to kill the Emperor
quest.description:
Dear sibling. I've been waiting for you. Your next contract awaits, as I'm sure Astrid indicated.
With the Emperor's arrival in Skyrim now a certainty, his security service, the Penitus Oculatus, will need to begin its preparations immediately. Security is being handled by a Commander Maro. Astrid and I have devised a plan to break the man, and in doing so, cripple the Emperor's protection.
You are to slay the commander's son, Gaius Maro, and once he is dead, plant false evidence on his body implicating him in a plot to kill the Emperor. He is set to leave the Penitus Oculatus outpost at Dragon Bridge, and inspect the security of each city in Skyrim. Go there now. Observe Gaius Maro's departure, and follow him. Waylay him in one of the cities, and send his soul to Sithis. Once he's dead, plant the incriminating letter on his body, and let fate take care of the rest. Oh, and one final thing...
To earn your bonus, do not kill Gaius Maro in Dragon Bridge, or on the road. Kill him in one of the other major cities he'll be visiting. There, the body will be discovered quickly, as will the letter implicating Gaius Maro in the plot to assassinate the Emperor. Do that, and Astrid has authorized me to grant you a rather unique bonus. It is a special token, to be given to Olava the Feeble, in Whiterun. Olava is an old and dear friend, and a powerful seer. The token entitles you to a reading of your future. It's an opportunity one should not pass up.

kbs.name: Astrid
kbs.description: the player's guildleader in the Dark Brotherhood

kbs.name: Vittoria Vici
kbs.description: the overseer of the the East Empire Company's business holdings in Solitude, and the first cousin of the Emperor

kbs.name: Night Mother
kbs.description: the female spirit who guides the Dark Brotherhood

plots: the Night Mother spoke to the player

Vittoria Vici has Imperial connections, and her husband has ties to the Stormcloaks: their marriage is a step toward reconciliation between the Empire and the Stormcloaks, but a murder at the wedding will stall the peace process and send shockwaves throughout the entire Empire

quest.title: Bound Until Death
quest.objective: lure Titus Mede II to Skyrim so that the Dark Brotherhood can assassinate him
tasks: Find your way to Temple of the Divines.
assassinate Vittoria Vici at her own wedding
lure Titus Mede II to Skyrim so that the Dark Brotherhood can assassinate him
quest.description:
Splendid. We're ready to begin. Or, more specifically, you're ready to begin. After all, you're the one the Night Mother spoke to.
Now then. I hope you have something nice to wear. Because you're going to a wedding. Well, more like the public reception. It should be a lovely affair. You'll mingle with the guests, eat some cake... stab the bride.
Oh yes. You've got to kill the bride. At her wedding. And they say romance is dead. Your target's name is Vittoria Vici. She oversees the East Empire Company's business holdings in Solitude. The wedding is being held in that city, at the Temple of the Divines. Her death will cause an uproar, which is exactly what we want.
Vittoria Vici is the first cousin to our dear Emperor, Titus Mede II. Vici has obvious Imperial connections. Her husband has ties to the Stormcloaks. Their union is a step toward reconciliation. So if there's a murder at the wedding... Not only will it stall the peace process - it will send shockwaves throughout the entire Empire. The Emperor's hand will be forced. He'll have to travel to Skyrim to deal with the aftermath... and he'll find the Dark Brotherhood waiting.
Vici is likely to address her guests frequently, as is the wedding custom. Kill her when she does that, and I promise you a significant bonus.
Now go. And give the city of Solitude a celebration they're not likely to forget.

plots: the player told Maramal that the player wants to get married
these are difficult times

quest.title: The Bonds of Matrimony
quest.objective: get married
tasks: attend your wedding tomorrow, from dawn until dusk
get married
quest.description:
Mara is the Goddess of Love. The temple spreads her gifts by tending to the sick, the poor, and the lost. We also perform wedding ceremonies for all the loving couples.
You wish to be married to your future spouse? It's good to see love blossoming, even during these difficult times. Your wedding will be held tomorrow, from dawn until dusk, in the Temple of Mara.

kbs.name: Hofgrir Horse-Crusher
kbs.description: the man with the the strongest arms in all of Skyrim

plots: rules for the fistfight: no weapons, no tricks, no magic

quest.title: Bloody Nose
quest.objective: win the wager against Hofgrir Horse-Crusher
tasks: match Hofgrir Horse-Crusher's bet, and beat him in a fistfight
win the wager against Hofgrir Horse-Crusher
quest.description:
Bah, I'm not afraid of anything out here. Walls are just a weakling's hiding spot. Now me, I'm no weakling. In fact, I bet I've got the strongest arms in all of Skyrim.
You bet against me? Oh! Sounds like I've got a challenger. Tell you what. How about a friendly wager, just between us. I bet you my entire purse of septims I can beat you in a fistfight. You match the bet and we fight until one of us gives in.
All right, remember... this is a clean fight. No weapons, no tricks. And none of those fancy magic spells, either. Here we go!

kbs.name: Kodlak Whitemane
kbs.description: the player's guildleader in the Companions, and a Nord who wants to end up in Sovngarde

kbs.name: Sovngarde
kbs.description: the storied afterlife of heroic Nords

kbs.name: Hunting Grounds
kbs.description: Hircine's realm, a place where the player can hunt forever

kbs.name: Hircine
kbs.description: the god of the werewolves, claims dead werewolves in the Hunting Grounds

plots: the Companions are nearly five thousand years old: the Companions became werewolves a few hundred years ago when the Glenmoril witches promised to grant the Companions great power in exchange for hunting their lord Hircine
the Companions were deceived: lycanthropy affects not just the Companions' bodies, but the Companions' spirits as well

quest.title: Blood's Honor
quest.objective: claim the head of a Glenmoril Witch so that Kodlak Whitemane can cure the Companions' lycanthropy
tasks: Find your way to Glenmoril coven in the wilderness.
seek out the Glenmoril witches, kill them, and collect their heads
claim the head of a Glenmoril Witch so that Kodlak Whitemane can cure the Companions' lycanthropy
quest.description:
Have you heard the story of how we came to be werewolves?
The Companions are nearly five thousand years old. This matter of beastblood has only troubled us for a few hundred. One of my predecessors was a good, but short-sighted man. He made a bargain with the witches of Glenmoril Coven. If the Companions would hunt in the name of their lord, Hircine, we would be granted great power.
The Companions of old became werewolves. They did not believe the change would be permanent. The witches offered payment, like anyone else. But we had been deceived. The disease, you see, affects not just our bodies. It seeps into the spirit. Upon death, werewolves are claimed by Hircine for his Hunting Grounds. For some, this is a paradise. They want nothing more than to chase prey with their master for eternity. And that is their choice. But I am still a true Nord. And I wish for Sovngarde as my spirit home.
I've spent my twilight years trying to find a cure myself. And now I've found the answer. The witches' magic ensnared us, and only their magic can release us. They won't give it willingly, but we can extract their foul powers by force. I want you to seek them out. Go to their coven in the wilderness. Strike them down as a true warrior of the wild. And bring me their heads. The seat of their abilities. From there, we may begin to undo centuries of impurity.

kbs.name: Gildergreen
kbs.description: the big holy tree of Kynareth that died

kbs.name: Eldergleam
kbs.description: the ancient parent tree of the Gildergreen

kbs.name: Nettlebane
kbs.description: a weapon that can cut the Eldergleam

plots: disciples of Kynareth used to travel far to hear the winds of Kynareth in the Gildergreen's branches

quest.title: The Blessings of Nature
quest.objective: restore the Gildergreen with the sap of the Eldergleam
tasks: Make your way to Orphan Rock.
get Nettlebane
restore the Gildergreen with the sap of the Eldergleam
quest.description:
This is the Gildergreen. It was planted as a seedling in the early years of Whiterun. Disciples of Kynareth could sense something holy in it, and traveled far to hear the winds of the goddess in its branches. Of course, not as many pilgrims these days. A big dead tree isn't very inspiring if you're coming to worship the divine of wind and rains. Kynareth gives life, and we need a living tree to be her symbol.
I've thought about restoring the Gildergreen... Trees like this never really die. They only slumber. I think if we had some of the sap from the parent tree, Eldergleam, we could wake up its child. But even if you could get to the Eldergleam, you couldn't tap it. Not with any normal metal. If you want to help, you'll need something to cut into it first.
Eldergleam is older than metal, from a time before men or elves. To even affect it, you have to tap into the old magic. You'll have to deal with the Hagravens. I've heard about a weapon they've made for sacrificing Kynareth's creations. It's called "Nettlebane." The hags terrify me, or I would have gone after it myself. It's held in a Hagraven nest called Orphan Rock

plots: the Blades killed the dragons off centuries ago

quest.title: A Blade in the Dark
quest.objective: help Delphine stop dragons from coming back to life
tasks: Go to Kynesgrove.
go to an ancient dragon burial with Delphine, and kill a dragon
help Delphine stop dragons from coming back to life
quest.description:
Dragons aren't just coming back, they're coming back to life. They weren't gone somewhere for all these years. They were dead, killed off centuries ago by my predecessors. Now something's happening to bring them back to life. And I need you to help me stop it.
I've visited their ancient burial mounds and found them empty. And I've figured out where the next one will come back to life. We're going to go there, and you're going to kill that dragon. If we succeed, I'll tell you anything you want to know.
We are going to Kynesgrove. There's an ancient dragon burial near there. If we can get there before the dragon comes back, maybe we'll learn how to stop it.

kbs.name: Hall of the Dead
kbs.description: a temple where the dead are prepared for burial

kbs.name: Helgird
kbs.description: a bit crazy woman who knows her dead bodies

kbs.name: Susanna
kbs.description: a barmaid from Candlehearth Hall, and the victim at the murder scene

plots: Susanna and other two girls were killed the same way: stabbed and cut apart with a blade
there's a war: no one has time to spend on murder investigations

quest.title: Blood on the Ice
quest.objective: investigate the brutal murders of women
tasks: Head to the murder scene.
Travel to Hall of the Dead.
check out a trail of blood leading away from the murder scene
talk with Helgird
investigate the brutal murders of women
quest.description:
Another girl killed. The victim is Susanna, from Candlehearth Hall. Served me a drink just a few nights ago... but I can't say I knew her.
She was killed the same way as the other two girls. Looks like she was stabbed, and then cut apart. It's like an animal got to her, but these are the wounds of a blade.
You could help us with the investigation. We're stretched thin as it is with the war. Nobody has the time to spend on this. Not pleasant, but it's the truth.
Here are some starting points for you. I noticed a trail of blood leading away from here. Helgird's taken Susanna's body into the Hall of the Dead to prepare for burial. She's a little crazy, but if she knows anything, it's dead bodies.

kbs.name: Aranea Ienith
relations: Azura's shrine, up the steps to the altar

kbs.name: Azura's shrine, up the steps to the altar
kbs.description: Azura's shrine, up the steps to the altar

kbs.name: Winterhold
kbs.description: a fortress, endangered by water, yet untouched by it

kbs.name: Azura
kbs.description: the queen of the night sky, a goddess
relations: Azura's shrine, up the steps to the altar

plots: Azura has given Aranea Ienith the gift of foresight

quest.title: The Black Star
quest.objective: become the champion of Azura
tasks: Go to Winterhold.
ask around about an elven mage who can turn the brightest star as black as night
become the champion of Azura
quest.description:
Azura has seen your coming, traveler. It was not curiosity, but fate, that has led you here.
Azura has given me the gift of foresight. I had a vision of you walking up the steps to this altar long before you were born. You have been chosen to be her champion. I know it is unexpected, but do not worry. It will all unfold as she has predicted.
You must go to a fortress, endangered by water, yet untouched by it. Inside, you will find an elven mage who can turn the brightest star as black as night. It is cryptic, I know, but Azura's signs are never wrong. I believe the fortress may refer to Winterhold. Ask if they know this elven enchanter.

kbs.name: Alvor
kbs.description: a man who saw a dragon flying down from the south

kbs.name: Helgen
kbs.description: a village that was destroyed by a dragon

plots: the player told Alvor that there was a dragon in Helgen

quest.title: Before the Storm
quest.objective: inform Balgruuf about the dragon in Helgen
tasks: Arrive at Whiterun.
find Balgruuf
inform Balgruuf about the dragon in Helgen
quest.description:
What? A dragon? In Helgen? That explains what I saw earlier... a dragon flying down from the south... I was hoping I was wrong about what I thought it was... Didn't want to believe my own eyes, is all.
The Jarl needs to know if there's a dragon on the loose. Riverwood is defenseless... We need to get word to Jarl Balgruuf in Whiterun to send whatever soldiers he can. If you'll do that for me, I'll be in your debt.

kbs.name: General Tullius
kbs.description: the player's leader in the Imperial Legion

kbs.name: Ulfric
kbs.description: the man who leads the Stormcloaks

plots: General Tullius is addressing the player and the player's fellow legionnaires: the best and the brightest warriors in Tamriel

quest.title: Extinguishing the Flames of Rebellion
quest.objective: put an end to the Stormcloak rebellion
tasks: Make your way to Windhelm.
fight your way in Ulric's castle, and make Ulfric face justice
put an end to the Stormcloak rebellion
quest.description:
All right. It's time to deliver the final blow to the Stormcloak rebellion. You all have fought bravely, and sacrificed much to bring us to this point.
